title: Room for Improvement
text: The hotel was fine for a single person stay, but the rooms were tiny. My room had several issues with the A/C unit and I ended up just having to keep the window open most of the time. There was black mold and yellow something above the shower and toilet areas that is pictured. The location was ok but a good walk from the subway. Fine for a solo trip, but this property needs some improvements for sure

title: Great value for money
text: Just returned from a week here with friends. Room were a little dated and tired in areas but were clean and comfortable. Great central location and overall with breakfast great value. We would reccomend a stay here.

title: 10/10 value for money and perfect stay
text: 10/10 ! Staff are lovely, process of checking in was super easy. Our room was upgraded and AMAZING - hot tub outside and comfy beds. Lovely stay and storing bags after we checked out was easy and once again staff so helpful.  Easy to get to Times Square and the metro. Quiet when inside hotel !!

title: Stay elsewhere!
text:
Arrived to a bad vibe, 3 men surrounding a pedastal all on mobiles chatting with no acknowledgement so proceded to the self check in - not welcoming at all. 
While in the lift to our room another couple were speaking between themselves & I heard one say to the other ‘I cant even take my shoes off in my room its dirty’ … not a good thing to hear  when I havent seen our room yet! 
Once in our room I cried! I’m no snob & I know things can get old but there is no excuse for grime. We had friends in another room that was the same.
As it was a holiday of a lifetime for us we thought lets just go out & get on with it.
Came back that evening and when we pulled the sheets back they were stained  - we slept fully dressed like sardines with socks over our trousers as it was gross! 
When I got up for a shower the next morning there was mould all in the shower head & surrounding area - as my friends room was the same we new it wasnt just our room so we checked out, we paid again and moved to a hotel which was a million times better, they would’ve been the same price had we chosen that to begin with yet different end of the scales.
Although we were out of pocket there was no way I could stay, I felt dirty! No excuse for grime! 
The sink was dirty & badly stained, there were hairs on the side, badly stained sides, dirty grime on the bedsides that looked like a build up over a long time, filthy headboard, mould in shower head & in shower, broken floor in bathroom, blinds were filthy, dusty, broken tv surround, stained shower tray, missing curtain to the ‘bathroom’ area, hairs, broken & ripped bed frame, filthy carpet, stained pillow cases - just typing about it makes my skin crawl. The reception was so unwelcoming and unaccomadating (as other reviews have stated). They act like its the customers fault! 
I’m genuinely not a fussy person - I dont expect 5* , I dont even care if things are old - I just like a clean room to get your head down & this is not the place! No excuse for filth. The poctures are so disceiving on their website! Avoid!!

title: Worst hotel stay
text:
AVOID. DO NOT STAY HERE IF YOU LIKE HOSPITALITY AS THERE IS NONE TO BE FOUND HERE. The least hospitable hotel I've ever stayed in. I thought I would contact you before I write a review but we have had the worst experience at Yotel. Upon trying to check in at the kiosk there was no reservation found. We then waited 20 minutes in line to check in with the desk. When we tried to check in the front desk worker said there was a $301.20 additional fee that needed to be paid. I told him that I already paid all the taxes and fees in full when I book the room. He asked to see the reservation and confirmation. I should him it on my phone to which he proceeded to tell me I hadn’t paid it and still owed. I then called the credit card company I booked through as my confirmation showed I paid the fee. The front desk worker made me rudely told me to leave the front desk. The credit card company then said it also showed that on their end that I paid all fees and shouldn’t have to pay anything additional and that if I wanted to pay it they would reimburse the fee as there must be an issue between them and the hotel. After being on the phone with them for an hour while sitting in the lobby, I went back up to the front desk to pay. The front desk employee was once again extremely rude and mocking about us finally paying the fee.  I explained to him what the credit card company said so stated that I was going to pay it because they would reimburse me as a travel credit. He said they shouldn’t reimburse and that he knows we didn’t pay the fee. I paid the fee anyways so I don’t know why it effects him if they reimburse me or not or why he felt the need to mock me and speak so rudely to me. The experience was so horrible and the fact that the front desk worker was still rude and mocking after we paid the fee anyways says a lot about this hotel.
Then to top it off the room was dirty and small. Location's alright for NYC, but that's about the only perk. Staff here are so rude and unhelpful. Dirty stains everywhere on the floor, and my and blanket on the bed.
Managers generic reply only addressing the facility fees and not about how rude employees are to guests or dirty rooms clearly shows that they don't care about the guests.

title: Clean but noisy
text: It's a sleek hotel that exudes continental coolness, but it's getting rough around the edges with age. Don't bother staying here if you're a light sleeper. The loud bathroom doors and plumbing will wake you up, even from other rooms. Consider another place if you value you privacy while showering or on the toilet. The frosted glass is revealing.

title: Beautiful hotel / concierge just ok
text: Let's overlook the resort fee unexpectedly charged to my bill upon arrival at the hotel, which was cunningly concealed in the booking, leading me to believe I would pay a specific amount that turned out not to be the case. The hotel itself is absolutely impeccable, the rooms are brand new and meticulously maintained. Room service is excellent; although the concierge could be a bit more cheerful and polite, if I must offer a minor critique. Additionally, I would note it's somewhat greedy to charge customers for luggage storage for a couple of hours after check-out, especially when cash is demanded (in 2024??!) forcing guests to seek out an ATM solely for this purpose. The policy should be revised to allow credit card payments for luggage deposit or make it complimentary, as is the case in any other hotel.

title: Filthy dirty don’t stay there
text:
Moved out, rooms filthy, mouldy pillows, ripped bed, hairs in bed and all around sink, dirtiest filthy hotel i have ever stayed in AVOID
The sink was filthy, the shower head was mouldy, the carpets were stained

title: Total disappointment...worst hotel in the chain!
text: The hotel sells itself as Times Square but it's on 10th - to get to 7th you have to walk for almost 1km, in winter/rain it's not that close... the surroundings have changed a lot in the last 2 years, at night it gets really weird ... the smell of mac**n*ha is permeated everywhere, I found more smoke shops than McDonalds in the neighborhood. The atmosphere of the hotel is a bit of a party, so the problem with the street goes inside, we even saw fights inside the hotel on more than 2 occasions, I didn't feel safe or comfortable during our stay, we complained about the smell of cigarettes and mac**n*ha in the room and I was simply ignored.. check in was confusing and the staff was not friendly at all. Although they charge a "resort fee", don't be fooled, the hotel is very simple, and the apartments are old and poorly maintained, my bed was sunken, and the furniture was worn without maintenance... the toilet in the room also had no door. it's terrible. The wi fi barely works...I think we were very unlucky in this stay, I don't recommend it for families, couples, or elderly people...and it's not a cheap hotel...I don't recommend it.

title: The hotel is ok.
text: The hotel was ok I expected a cleaner room for the price.. there was a significant amount of hairs in the room when we checked in. The room also had mould and a broken shower door. The staff were nice overall though and check in and out were very efficient.

title: Worst Yotel Experience
text: The worst customer service I've experienced at a hotel. I booked a stay as a long time Yotel member, and the website says members can cancel with no penalty up until the day of booking. I canceled more than 24 hours in advance and the hotel refuses to offer a refund or any resolutions at all. I have tried contacting them multiple times with no luck and they have been extremely rude each time. Stay away from this location.

title: Bring Ear Plugs
text:
I visited Yotel after an airBnB booking turned into a bit of a disaster. Yotel came recommended from a friend who stayed the week prior and had availability for my very last minute damsel-in-distress moment.

An alarming start was walking into a room where the TV unit was not a fixed to the wall and was one walk-by of slamming to the ground. Thankfully "mission control" resolved it straight away.

My main takeaway from the hotel was noise. And no, not the city noise; I was fully aware that staying in NYC was going to be noisy and honestly it wasn't that bad! Unfortunately the noise I experience was from slamming doors and noisy "cabin crew". The doors aren't heavy-duty and therefore the slightest outside noise travels into the cabins. In addition, the hinge mechanism allows them to slam with some volatility. A lot of guests were cognisant of this and during the late-hours there was little noise from doors. Sadly, the cabin crew were not. Upon their start of room servicing, door slamming from cabins and laundry storage areas was a frequent occurrence. Not only would that wake you, but the impending vibration through the exterior wall would rattle any fixtures.

title: Save your money, time & sanity.
text: I have visited and stayed in this hotel more times than I can count over the years. In my recent trip, however, I now know that I will never come back here again. The hotel feel rundown and low in budget for repairs on every level. The room I was given had a leak and the shower was COVERED in mold in the corners, It just felt rundown. Many of the hotel decor and amenities looked equally rundown and ... just sad. I was never given any follow up for my room and they couldn't move me as the oetl was booked but a free coffee or breakfast woulda been a bone to throw at the very least. Nothing. What a gut punch... hence I had to share this. Save your money, go somewhere else... newer.

title: My Yotel Experience
text: Yotel is conveniently located near Times Square. It was easy to check in with friendly staff. The hotel could use a bit of updating and there are no typical amenities, such as a microwave and coffee machine, or a mini fridge in the rooms. The room was very small but the bed was comfortable and adjustable, which was nice. The shower and toilet are in the room and not separated for privacy with a door. Which I didn't mind because it was just me but be aware of that. The towel warmer was inoperable and catching the shower water hot was tricky to time. The outlet at the desk was coming out of the wall and I had a difficult time keeping my laptop charged. The room was clean but was definitely a bit warn out. You could see the hotel was really nice in it's day but is lacking some upkeep. I've seen comments on the fees but I paid for my room in full upfront, so I knew what I was paying for and there were no additional fees. If you are in NY for a business trip or short stay, it suits your needs This would not be ideal for someone on vacation.

title: Value for money
text: Good location.  Bunk bed is perfect for a family of 4.  The room is spacious.  The shower is hot and strong enough.  Cleanliness can be improved.  Furniture has wear and tear but it doesn't affect our stay, just not looking good.

title: Great location, great looking rooms
text: I stayed in the NYC Yotel for the second time, this time in a full bed cabin.  The room was small but well equipped.  I love the showers in this hotel!  The only issue I had was that the mattress was very lumpy and uncomfortable.  Last time I stayed in a King Suite, and the bed seemed much more comfortable, and the extra outdoor space was very nice.  Overall I really like this hotel for the location and price.  It would be 5 stars if the bed was a little more comfortable!

title: Look elsewhere
text:
Unhelpful staff, dirty rooms. Can find a much nicer hotel room for less or comparable $$$. 
Mold growing on the walls/curtains, drywall peeling off the ceiling, save yourself the money and look for a different place to stay.

title: Needs an update
text: The room was quite literally falling apart. Nothing worked. Pieces were falling off of the cabin. Walls and floor looked dirty. All surfaces were worn and old. Wires all over the place. Thought it would be cool. It was not.

title: Fatal
text: Everything is dirty, they don't change the sheets or towels until you ask them many times and they finally deign to do it. We had to force them to give us towels in hand or we would not leave the reception since we had been using the same towels for 4 days and that is not hygienic. With what we pay for the hotel room we deserve more cleaning than what they provide. I do not recommend this hotel. The only good thing is the location and nothing more.

title: Need help from customer service
text:
The overall hotel was clean, convenient location away from noise, and safe in a residential, eating block. 
I wished to give this review to customer service but there was no way to contact them here. Therefore, here is my honest experience that took away from my stay. One of the hotel staff cleaning opened my door multiple times throughout the stay when I had my “do not disturb” sign on the door clearly marked. 

I was very frustrated and annoyed with how the cleaning staff seemed pushy and adamant about cleaning the room in the early hours 8-9am of the morning.  These occurrences resembled itself by  speaking loudly in the hallway and knocking on every single door- even ones with the sign! I noticed this with other rooms, for example the room next to mine also received the constant “knocking” and interruption to their stay as I hear them get frustrated with them too. “No we do not need a towel. It is 8am and I am staying for multiple nights. Please go away.” 

On my side I pretended to be asleep to avoid any awkward confrontation, but  then it seemed that they were just waiting for me to get out of bed to pounce on the room. I noticed there was a motion sensor within the room. so these actions should have been completely avoided. Perhaps there is a way for the staff to not feel so pressured to clean each room every single day. For a multiple day stay, I don’t actually expect my room to be turned over every day, and would rather see the staff be able to save their energy for the rooms that DO need cleaning. I would have probably asked for one cleaning but felt uncomfortably chased every day of my stay. 

Is there any way customer service could acknowledge this? If so I would be happy to come back to your hotel, as it is my 13th trip in the past two years.

title: Great location!
text:
Stayed at the Yotel for 4 nights. Staff were very friendly and helpful. Rooms were cleaned unless you didn’t want them to be and views were excellent. I lost my key card within 10 minutes of having it (long flight!) but this was no bother for the staff at all. 

Expected the $43 fee so wasn’t surprised, although I’m unsure of the benefits of this unless what you wanted to do is on their discount list.

Rooms could do with some paint but other than that were cosy and comfy. Would stay here again!

Felt safe as a female solo traveler as there was security every night and they were very friendly.

title: Budget hotel
text: Good value for money. We stayed for 3 nights and it was very easy to check in / out. Leaving luggage if you need to check out is very easy and efficient and we paid $6 to leave 2 suitcases. The rooms are small (but manageable) and there is no seperate bathroom it is just portioned off the sleeping area. I wish there was a curtain or something to separate as I shared with my sister so was quite awkward! The toilet door also did not stay closed. Room was quiet on a night, not much street noise. We would use this hotel again and great way to go to NYC on a budget.

title: Compact and efficient
text:
This international chain is all about compact efficiency and mostly delivers. Check-in is entirely via touch-screen or would have been had the system been working as intended, but it was agonizingly slow the day I arrived and the bell staff eventually sent me to real people at a desk, who thankfully are still onsite and very courteous. (Same thing happened at checkout.)

Once I got in my standard room things were fine, about as I expected: retractable bed and shower stall and toilet enclosure in lieu of a bathroom. Outside it was pretty noisy--it's Manhattan--but inside it was pretty quiet. I enjoyed the morning coffee and continental breakfast bar (a la carte) and the convenience of the location to Times Square, Broadway, and the seemingly infinite dining resources of Hell's Kitchen. The Yotel was a more than adequate home base to explore the city.

title: Not worth the money
text: The room quality was not worth the money and the random bunk bed was definitely not enjoyable. The room was nasty and the shower was not at all what I expected and there was supposedly supposed to be a smart control but there was none of that in the room.

title: Want to Make Your Own Bed?"
text: I ended up in the smallest room in the hotel. I didn't know that when I booked it. The bed wasn't made & when I went to the desk to complain, I was told the maid can't do it. Well, this isn't a hostel. So, if I'm expected to do your work, where's the discount? You can stay nearby in a better place for a little more money.

title: Great Location at a Great Price!
text: The staff was amazing, the check-in was easy. My check-in via iPad went awry, but a wonderful staff member took over and sent me to the desk, which took a little bit longer, but again the staff was cheerful, friendly and helpful. I wish there was a coffeemaker in the room, but Target down the street had an electric kettle, instant coffee and a mug, so I made do. Other customers seemed to relish the fact that marijuana is legal in NY, but I'm not sure what the hotel could do about it. All in all, as the headline says, a great location at a great price!

title: A+
text:
After reading mixed reviews, I was not sure what to expect. However, we had a great experience. 
Check in was smooth, staff was very helpful with accommodating our needs. We had 3 rooms - VIP, terrace and queen room- all different but clean and comfy.
I got help with my bags- got them brought to my room. 
Everyone was helpful, we had a nice birthday celebration.

title: Efficient and convenient
text: If you are looking for a convenient, relatively clean, and efficient property for your stay- definitely recommend! Good value and very cool concept. Love the Yotel luggage robot- definitely a cool touch.

title: Flooding
text: We came to NYC for the first time ever on a couples holiday for 5 nights, first off when booking the hotel we were not informed about any fees when arrival, we got to the hotel to find no staff only security guards which were helpful enough, then the shock of the fee $172 !! We were charged for literally no reason at all we had all our activities pre booked so we didn’t need the “discount”. We then got to our hotel room it was a standard room pretty basic but we weren’t expecting anything fancy the bed has buttons to make it move which is a nice touch. We realised we didn’t have the purple LED lights that the Yotel are known for which was kinda upseting as I want to get a few pictures. There also was a brown stain on my pillow like a spill of coffee or something I left it slide and I didn’t wanna cause a fuss. On day 3 we were woken at 7-7:30 to security shouting and banging on neighbours doors obviously we were then woken to that noise and looked out the door to see our hole floor was flooded, I’m still unsure how it happened, we left the hotel to go out as we planned and when we came back later that night there was big loud fans and mechanics sucking up the water that were left in the hall way all night at around 10:30-11pm we called reception to move room as we couldn’t sleep with the noise of the fans they transferred us to another line at the hotel we waiting 1 hour on the phone to get no answer from anyone we ended up going down to the lobby in our pjs to move room we got our new room packed all our bags up and moved to a diffrent floor/room it was honestly a disgrace. Other then that if your looking for a hotel close to everything this is the hotel to go to.

title: modern hotel
text:
I would like to give it one more star just because of the employees.
I am eternally grateful to the manager Jenny who solved a problem with some poorly made reservations from the agency where I hired the hotel.
I thank each of the front desk and reception employees for their cordiality and willingness to deal with any difficulty or request, and due to my limited English they have even made it easier for me to understand using a translate.
So the hotel employees a 10.
My 3 stars are due more to the buildings.
Although it is a modern and technological hotel, I think it lacks maintenance. I was on the 18th and 20th floors.
I also got the feeling that the rooms were poorly categorized in my opinion because the premium queen with a view was excessively small.
And the first class, although the view is spectacular, did not fully meet my expectations.
The location is correct, we went up and down 42nd and you had everything.
I also want to highlight the rest (Social Drink and Food), especially two very cordial waiters who served us at one of the dinners, unfortunately I don't know their names but one of them was Argentine and the other Colombian. Very friendly and cordial, always available, especially with the language, without hiding their Latin side.
In short it is a good hotel. That it needs some structural maintenance but that it has people on staff who lend its shoulder to the firm.

title: Great stay
text: I recommend this hotel because it is well located close to Times Square and still quiet metro stations close too, the comfort of the rooms and the wifi are great on my next trip to New York I will return to this hotel

title: Hotel somewhat different, for the price they offer little. They try to do something different but it doesn't work right. I am not coming back
text: A somewhat different hotel, aimed more at an "alternative" audience - which is fine in that regard - but they want to modernize something so simple that sometimes doesn't work properly. For example, there were robots to check in, but none of them worked, so finding the counter with someone to assist you was in a corner that was out of the way. Instead of investing in somewhat useless things, they could increase the size of the rooms.

title: Great location and interesting concept!
text:
I arrived at the hotel in a rental car, stopped at a loading bay and ran inside, told the staff in the reception area and they said I could leave it there while I checked in and took my luggage up to my room. They have automated check in kiosks, but I opted for the human touch! It wasn't a long queue and the staff took some time to find my reservation, but when they did, it was a smooth process.

The hotel is quite unique. It has a futuristic automated theme. Well, there are 2 lifts (elevators for the US readers!); the first to the dining area and then a second lift to the rooms. I had booked a single room, so it was quite a small space, but we're in New York. What do you expect? My room had a very comfortable bed with an electric control to recline from a sofa style to a full lay flat bed! I liked it. It made good use of the limited space! The bathroom was small but manageable. It's kind of open plan if that makes sense, so not for the shy ones out there. As I was solo, it was fine!

I booked a package which included breakfast. Well, the service was good. The staff were very nice, albeit, very busy. The selection is not great, but it was manageable. Scrambled eggs were always in the tray so I was happy. Along with that, they also served noodles and more substantial 'daytime' food! The hotel seems to have a deal with a few Asian airlines, so their crew were usually there. I think some of the breakfast dishes catered to them, which was fine by me. Nothing like a hearty breakfast!

Of course, the location of the hotel means you are never in the room for long, except to sleep. If you are, you are wasting your trip and money! The hotel is perfectly placed to enjoy Times Square and to also walk around and enjoy everything that New York City has to offer. 

My only negative comment is that on the final day, my flight was at night, so I would have liked to leave my luggage and venture out a little before catching my ride to the airport, but they have this policy where I would have had to pay (not a small amount) to leave my things. As I had a few items, it added up and didn't make sense, so I just stayed in the hotel, working and killing time. It's a shame, but I couldn't justify spending that much to leave my things for a few hours.

Other than that, it was a nice stay. Would I stay here again? If I had an earlier departing flight or less luggage; Yes.

title: Spoilt by money grabbing employees
text:
Over all the room was clean and apart from from a kettle had everything you need ( we took our own). The bed was very comfortable and housekeeping did a fantastic job daily. 
 I wish I could be as positive about the lobby staff. On top of the city tax the hotel makes you pay a compulsory service charge where they say that its for use of their amenities which includes use of their storage luggage robot and discounts on attractions. You get better deals online for attractions and when we came to use the robot it was conveniently full and we were charged $3 per item for the lobby staff to put it in a room. They even wanted $3 for a coat! I asked them to wave the fee as we had already paid for storage and they said 'we should have checked out earlier and If I want to complain then go elsewhere.' Funnily enough someone got the robot working and one of the staff went running over asking who had touched it? It was self service and quite clearly the staff had stopped people using it to cash in. 
It's such a shame that the money grabbing unhelpful attitude of the lobby staff spoil the hotels reputation which is actually a good concept. I would of recommended the hotel if it wasn't for them. I think Yotel need to seriously consider employing staff that are out to service themselves and not their customers.

title: No hot water in Yotel Times Sq
text: YOTEL had no hot water the first night and none the following am. We asked for a refund for the second night as we checked out a day early  for this reason. We did not get a refund and was told that my reservation was made by a 3rd party (expedia). I made my reservation on what I thought was the YOTEL website. Watch out for such crap. Staff completely unhelpful in this situation. As a matter of fact, they knew there was a problem with the hot water when we arrived, but didn’t tell us. I will  never go back

title: Perfect stay on a budget
text:
Stayed for 3 nights early Feb room 2306 - perfect room for the 2 of us. Bed was extremely comfortable, shower was lovely. 

Toilet and shower arrangement isn’t great if you aren’t VERY comfortable with the person you are sharing a room with so keep that in mind when booking (basically a tall glass screen with huge gaps both underneath and at the top), but wasn’t a problem for us as a couple. Perhaps would be less suitable for friends or family members sharing.. 

Staff very helpful - couldn’t fit cases into the robot storage room on our final day so staff swiftly took care of our luggage for a small fee and looked after it all day for us. 

Didn’t visit the bar or other amenities on site as we were too busy but they looked very welcoming. 

Superb location - couple of blocks away from Times Square, subway stations and amazing restaurants. 

If you’re on a budget but looking for something suitable for a comfortable nights sleep and close to TS, don’t hesitate to book this hotel.

title: Not worth it
text: Staff was very friendly and helpful when checking in and finding my room. The room was dirty when I got there. Tried to take a hot shower but when I turned it to the warm setting the water just stopped coming out. Tried again in the morning, this time the water came out but it was ice cold even after letting it run for 20 mins.

title: Shocking customer service
text:
My family have just checked into this hotel on arrival
The guy on reception was rude and unhelpful .they asked could they have a double bunk bed as the room was not suitable , the receptionist was rude and said no . Unless you want to pay for another room .  Refused to let them speak with a manager and basically told them to like it or lump it . Typical American attitude.

title: Amazing
text: I really enjoyed my stay. The room was always clean, the service was amazing. Everyone was nice. 10/10 I would absolutely recommend it to anyone who’d like to stay in manhattan and have a beautiful view with reasonable prices!

title: Jordyn Allen
text: Absolutely deceiving pictures. Tv did not work. Dirty room. View was nice but had nothing else to offer. Could not change LED lights. Was very disappointing. There was no refrigerator in a room I paid 388$ for. Chipped paint everywhere. Just wish I had a better experience. Would not recommend.

title: Really great hotel as a base for exploring
text: I was very worried about staying here after reading a lot of recent negative reviews. Anyway I need not have worried- our room was great, exactly as described, we knew it would be smallish but it was plenty big enough for us for a 4 night stay with big suitcases. The room was clean and comfortable. We took our own travel kettle as we knew there wasn’t one, and it was a godsend for our morning and bedtime cups of tea. We felt it a safe, secure hotel and it was situated perfectly. A short walk to the subway, and great for a stroll into times square. We discovered lots of lovely bars and restaurants in Hell’s Kitchen. Scallywags is a great Irish bar, with lovely food. A huge recommendation for seafood lovers is Aquaboil in Hells Kitchen, really reasonably priced and the most amazing quality, very friendly service, check it out on tik tok, the cajun sauce bags are amazing.

title: Dinner experience in NYC
text: A little disappointed in the room's overall cleanliness, and attention to items we expected to be provided ---  no courtesy curtain for the bathroom, and no towels.  Overall, the staff at check-in, and concierge was great.

title: Small, tidy but would book a nicer place next time.
text: We were a 10 minute walk to Times Square from YOTEL. The room was very small, has a near see through shower and open bathroom. Our shower was leaking and looked like it had mould coming out of it. It was alright for the price.

title: Good place to stay near Times Square
text: Room was clean.  Staff was nice and friendly.  The issue was the shower.  Every morning, we did not have hot water.  Some mornings was just warm, some were just cold.  I am assuming this is because of too many people using the shower in the morning and the hotel not having enough capacity of hot water at all times.  Most mornings we waited until night time or sometime throughout the day to take a shower.  Room service took care of us everyday with changing out the towels and the bed. Also, it is a few blocks to walk to times square.  We took the bus right by Yotel, and go to the center of Times Square on 42nd st., and rode the Subway to wherever we needed to go from there.  There is no Subway right by Yotel.  You will have to walk, take the bus, uber/taxi.  It is not bad though you get use to it.  Subway & Bus transit is a lot cheaper than taxi/uber.

title: YOTEL
text: The venue was fantastic, especially with the LED lighting adding a cool vibe, and the staff were welcoming. However, the issue arose when we discovered blood stains on one of our sheets, which was quite unsettling. It left me wondering why they didn't replace the stained sheets instead of layering new ones on top.

title: Needs a Renovation
text: Yotel is a great brand. This is an exception to how great their hotels can be. Weed smell 24/7 inside each floor. I tried 3 different floors and only on my forth try found a working ice and water machine. The wifi is early 2000s quality. Maybe 100 up and down.

title: Family get together
text: Stayed with family members for the weekend- this hotel was fabulous- location, service, and facilities perfect. Maintenance of rooms needs work- specific equipment such as heating system & deep cleaning.I would recommend

title: Très bonne adresse
text: Localisation incroyable en plein centre, excellent petit déjeuner la chambre très confortable avec une vue très agréable. Tout est fait pour faciliter le séjour grâce à une technologie moderne et adaptée à notre époque ! Tout est simplifié

title: Not Worth It
text: Staff never helped with any problems we ever had and you will get price gouged for everything. It really felt like a waste of money when there are so many other great places you could stay and spend your money at where you can actually get what you're paying for, AND have a helpful staff.

title: stay was good and comfortable
text: the room was good and so was the check in process, the location was not bad either and there was many stores around the area that the hotel was located at, i would recommend staying here for your next stay

title: The room was the perfect size ideal for solo or two people! Views were absolutely amazing I was facing the water!
text: Room was great views were nice disappointed in customer service from Sonia very irresponsible in getting back to me about certain request and left me on read several times. I had sent a view complaints

title: Poor Customer Service Experience
text:
To Whom It May Concern,
I am writing to express my deep dissatisfaction with the level of service provided by several members of your staff during my recent stay at Yotel in New York. Specifically, my interaction with Jj, Chris, and Renee Gomez was nothing short of disappointing and unacceptable.
Upon departure from the hotel, my friend (two tiny girls) and I requested assistance with our luggage and the use of a luggage trolley. 

However, we were informed by Jj, Chris, and Renee Gomez that there were no luggage trolleys available, and if we desired assistance, it would come at an additional charge of $20, payable only in cash. This policy is not only unreasonable but also reflects poorly on the hotel's commitment to guest satisfaction.
Rather than wait for assistance that should have been provided as a standard service, we opted to transport our luggage ourselves. 

This involved navigating multiple elevators across different floors, a task made significantly more difficult without the aid of a luggage trolley. Despite witnessing our struggle, Jj, Chris, and Renee Gomez made no attempt to offer assistance, instead choosing to stand idly by and watch as we struggled with our belongings.
When we reached the ground floor, we once again requested assistance, only to be met with dismissive remarks. Jj, Chris, and Renee Gomez insinuated that we should have pre-booked a service if we wanted assistance and went on to suggest that they were under no obligation to assist us, citing their gender as a reason for their refusal to help.

This level of unprofessionalism and disregard for customer satisfaction is completely unacceptable. As paying guests of your establishment, we expected to be treated with respect and courtesy, not met with rudeness and indifference. It is clear that Jj, Chris, and Renee Gomez failed to uphold the standards of customer service expected of them, and their behavior reflects poorly on the reputation of Yotel.

I urge you to address this matter promptly and take appropriate action to ensure that such incidents do not recur in the future. Guests should feel valued and supported during their stay, and it is imperative that all staff members understand and adhere to this principle.

I trust that you will investigate this complaint thoroughly and provide a satisfactory resolution. Thank you for your attention to this matter.

Sincerely,
Nadezhda Kuleshova

title: Excellent stay in your hotel.
text:
Your hotel is easy to use via self-checking system.
Security is good when I use elevator.
Sufficient amenities.
room status is very clean bed and support daily clean my room.
Purple LED sign is good, so I like.

title: Great place to stay!
text:
We loved our stay at the Yotel. It was a great location for Foxy’s Leotards fashion at Chez Josephine which was right around the corner! 
The rooms were clean, the restaurant was great, and I would definitely stay there again.

title: Rude staff
text: Lots of issues with the VIP penthouse suite if you’re going in the winter get a less expensive room because the hot tub is not in service. At check out be careful about storing your belongings because the staff are not very helpful. They are very condescending and rude.

title: Girls city break
text:
Hotel very good location only about 5 mins walk to a subway station and onto Time Square, we were on an arranged 4 day break through a travel agent so we had resort taxes and breakfast included , they did charge for resort taxes but we were refunded once they had double checked and also at breakfast they explained the fees but once we said our room number it was included, the breakfast was the same offerings the whole time but you got a choice or bread basket with toast and a croissant, fruit platter and another item then help your self to pancakes , scrambled eggs, bacon and something else , coffee / tea and juice were brought to you my staff, I found it good quality. The rooms are small but bed goes down but shower / loo in like a glass square in corner of room and sink outwith , but the room was comfy not as noisy as I thought it might have been and I found the bed & pillows comfy so slept not to bad !

We had drinks in the hotel bar a few nights - staff expect tips even for just bringing you your drinks.

The hotel was only 30mins from Newark Airport so I thought for location for a city break it was good and would happily stay again , I found the staff helpful and friendly , the receptionist rang our transfer company for us to arrange pick up time.

You leave your luggage in a robot system until you leave we had issue with one of our larger cases so security guard said they could store luggage for $2 a case so it worked out ok for two cases , the other two went into robot hold.

A few people have mentioned smell of weed etc but tbh we smelt that all throughout the city , it was prominent wherever we went - stank !!

Location wise I would definitely staff here again as was straightforward getting around the city from this base.

title: Stank of Weed Everywhere!
text:
Good things:-
-Staff are polite and helpful 
-Cute little breakfast kiosk on 4th floor 
-Comfy bed
-Good shower and shampoo etc. 
-Great location for sightseeing 

Bad things:-
-Our floor stank of weed/marjuana and it came into our room from next door when we were sleeping with the window open.its meant to be a non smoking hotel!! Made me feel really nauseous. 
-Room was very cramped. Nowhere to put more than one big suitcase and could not fully unpack as barely any wardrobe space so one case was in the floor in the way of everything. 
-Air con only went down to 20C - hence needing window open. 

Not my cup of tea really but this is what my travel agent booked for us. I will be letting them know.

title: Excellent spot for a short stay in NYC
text: We loved this hotel with its clean, modern, trendy rooms, fun bar area with yummy food, and friendly and helpful staff.   Checking in and out and the robot luggage store are easy to navigate.  Although it's on W10th, it's really not far to walk to Times Square or even Central Park.  The rooms are comfortable,  the bed especially so.  In my view, better for solo travellers or couples rather than friends because the bathroom area is fairly exposed in the room generally.

title: Not impressed
text:
I was always eager to stay at a Yotel and was throughly disappointed. We tried to check in early but weren’t able without an adtl fee, no bother we’d just check our bags, but the men in the lobby wanted $3 a bag including our backpacks! What! Never has a hotel charged me for luggage storage, it’s part of the service of the hotel! We begrudgingly stored our bags with the men, they were very rude and would only take cash, we don’t usually carry cash and ask them to charge to the room, turns out they are a third party. I asked to pay them when we picked up the bags but that was declined. Only after the men had taken our money they let me know the front desk was hidden around the corner, I thought they were the front desk!! 

When we finally checked in at check in time, the room is very worn, and in need of an update, the white toilet had turned yellow! The only nice thing about the room was the view, we were only staying a night so my plan was to talk to the front desk when we checked out. I did try and request a late check out through the SMS system but failed, I tried to call on the room phone and also failed. The location is right by the LincolnTunnel and not very comfortable walking around, the closest subway is a couple of long blocks over (aves not sts), there is a bus round the corner but it never came when we waited for it. 

Upon check out, I requested a discount due to the disappointment we had at the hotel and were informed as nothing was recorded on file they wouldn’t do anything, me complaining in the morning was the record!! 

The hotel had no relaxing areas to chill in as a micro hotel usually there are communal comfort areas to relax in, they had none apart from the bar and restaurant. They had space for it but it wasn’t being used.

title: Hôtel jeune et design
text:
L’hôtel est design, très bien pour une clientèle jeune. Quelque peu éloigné de Times Square : il faut marcher minimum 10/15min pour arriver au métro le plus proche.
Certains éléments des chambres sont à revoir, mais l’accueil est agréable et l’hôtel offre des chambres avec une vue toujours très sympa !

title: Great location
text: Hotel is in great location to TS etc only few mins walk. Room was small not much moving space but u are only sleeping in it. Could do with more space for hanging clothes. There was an iron and ironing board. But would of preferred kettle&cups over an iron to be honest. Didnt have breakfast so cant comment on that.. Bar prices not bad sat in it one night for a night cap 😊security guys very welcoming and friendly any questions or hints&tips we asked they were happy to help. Check in was quite quick we didnt use digital kiosk we just went straight to reception desk. Cant complain for the price we paid. Would probably stay again.

title: Clean Air Policy is not in full effect
text: The room appeared clean enough. But there were cigarette burns in the sink and the room smelled of cigarettes and cannabis. It smelled like someone was smoking all night; I could smell it through my sleep. When I got home, my clothes reeked of smoke. And neither of us smoke! I don't think I'll stay at this property again.

title: Great Hotel
text: Great location. Friendly staff very accommodating. They had adjoining rooms for myself and friend one room was a corner room quite spacious for NY. Service and drinks great and concierge very obliging. Room modern great views of Hudson and comfortable bed. Brilliant vacation.

title: Comfy and Cozy
text: I’m a frequent visitor to Green Room 42 for Broadway Sessions so for this weekend getaway I figured I might as well finally stay at the actual hotel!! Glad I did!! The room I had was just enough for the time I was there but if I was with another person or staying longer I’d have booked something larger!!

title: Nice
text: Good hotel. Creative room with the bed extending and retracting. The location is very good. It looks modern and new. The room service is good as well. They have a car service to and from the airport. They have a storage for your luggage as well.

title: Cleanliness
text: The overall room was okay except for the fact it smelt like someone smoked a pack of cigarettes in the room prior to our arrival. The front desk was made aware of this and supposedly marked the account.

title: Great hotel and location
text:
Please check out our other reviews to see we always leave an honest opinion. 
Daughter booked trip to nyc for my 50th and we stayed at yotel. 
It’s based just by Hell’s Kitchen few mins walk to Times Square. Check in was automated but really simple and there were staff on hand to assist.,
We had a high floor which gave us a partial city view and was great. Room was small but had everything we needed and although the bed looked small, it was an extending bed ? Press a button and it extended into the room making it bigger so no issues there. Great sleep and shower was lovely and hot. Had shampoo conditioner body wash etc so all good. Only down side was really a lack of space / storage for clothes but wee managed. 
Didn’t book breakfast but you could have it on site. Ice machines on floor so a bonus. On last day we left our luggage at hotel and booked taxi through them which was really easy and simple. Would definitely stay here again

title: Suited us very well
text:
Decent room with great wifi, a TV, good shower, included cleaning products and moisturiser. Broken window latch was main issue as this let in more noise than if it closed tightly, but we coped. Was just missing a kettle & tea/coffee.
The eco-warrior in me was disappointed there's no flow control on the shower. The amount of water it threw out was phenomenal. Great if you want a good drenching, but not so good for the environment!

title: Modern, cool and super well set up
text: Absolutely love Yotel NY.  The rooms might be on the small side but have everything you need laid out in a genius and effiecient manner.  Interesting views no matter the room and all the amenities and anything you need right within reach.  Love it!

title: I liked it!
text: Good quality room for cheap enough price in a great location, staff at the hotel were helpful. Wish subway was a bit of a closer walk from here, though. Be patient with the revolving door out front. :)

title: Good location, standard room ok.
text: My wife and I stayed for a long weekend in one of the VIP King Suites, with a room booked on the app Dayuse at the end of our stay due to a late flight. The VIP King Suite was a very nice, expansive room, but some of the furnishings were worn and it did not have all of the amenities as advertised on the website (no rainfall showerhead, no SONOS sound system) and the Peleton bike which was prominently displayed didn't work. We didn't spend a huge amount of time in the room, as we spent most of our days exploring NYC. The basic room we had booked through Dayuse, however, was smaller and somewhat cramped, but had a much more comfortable bed and was an adequate amount of space for the two of us. Bottom line: the hotel is in a prime location just 2 blocks from Times Square and public transit, and the smaller, more basic rooms provide more value for the cost. I'd recommend avoiding booking the more premium rooms for limited return on investment.

title: Book Confidently with YOTEL
text:
I was extremely skeptical when I initially saw such a low price for staying in a hotel in the middle of Manhattan, but YOTEL offers incredible value at an affordable price for anyone travelling on a budget. The YOBOT was easy to use when we arrived prior to our check-in time, and the staff was incredibly kind and accommodating. I can and will definitely be staying at the YOTEL in the near future. I highly recommend giving this hotel a chance. 

I do want to note that the room (or cabin) that I rented was quite small, but it is perfect for a solo stay or for an intimate couple. I believe there are bigger options for full families too.

title: Perfect for all kind of activities- close to the „Hot Spots“
text:
Would recommend this hotel. Cozy rooms, very comfortable bed and close to all important sights. 
Small bar available, small gym as well. Check-In/Out was also smooth with a tablet in the lobby. Would book again!

title: Disappointed
text: Very disappointed with our stay. Our cabin was dirty and needed a lot of work. The cabin was very small which was expected however I’d always expect it to be clean! Very large charge on arrival, we had trouble with key cards not working several times, our bed covers had dirty marks on (not stains as we cleaned them off ourself!!). Charging port came out the wall as we unplugged chargers. Only positive was that the bed was comfy however it didn’t make up for the reality of sleeping surrounded by filth. Definitely won’t be returning or recommending.

title: GreenRoom42
text: Went to an awesome show at GreenRoom42. Wellness check w/ John Hill! Easy driving in & parking. Just feet away from Chez Josephine where we ate a tasty dinner. It was a perfect anniversary weekend for two.

title: Highly disappointing stay at Yotel
text:
From the moment of my arrival until my last night (of 3 nights), the experience was pretty poor. I arrived very early after an overnight flight, and before that, upon booking my reservation, I had requested early check-in. When I arrived, quite tired from no sleep during travel, I was informed that I could check in early - at an additional cost (of almost one night's stay) - none of this had been explained before in the reservation process. Because I desperately needed to rest, I paid the additional fee, and was sent to a cabin with HVAC issues - the vent rattled so loudly that sleep was impossible. I requested a change of cabin, and was sent to one where the bed was made with dirty sheets - including what looked like a *drop of blood* on the linens. I immediately requested new sheets. It took a while for security to arrive, to remove the soiled sheets with gloves. It then took over an hour for a new set of sheets to arrive -- and one of those was dirty, too! I made up the bed and tried to sleep, which was difficult with a sunken mattress and no duvet/ comforter (we're talking about NYC in January, and the temperature was about 25F/ -3.8C outside. I then waited another hour for a duvet/ comforter to arrive, which ALSO had dirty patches.

Additionally, the cabin had the following issues:
- broken bedside lights (on hinges installed in the wall, which wouldn't hold up/ had to rest on the headboard for support) / need rewiring
- electrical outlet panel above desk was not anchored into wall/ came out upon removal of plugs. Not all outlets actually function.
- broken sink faucet/ handle (the handle actually comes off when one tries to turn on the faucet)
- sliding shower door would not stay shut when showering (an issue because of water spillage and NYC winter temperatures)
- shower drain was slow to drain/ basin would quickly fill
- toilet smelled like it had not been cleaned or sanitized

There were communication breakdowns among the staff across every issue, on the phone and in person - including sending people to my room without notice or warning, which would have been appreciated from a customer standpoint. One of those staff members, the building engineer, gave me an unwarranted attitude. 

It became clear to me that the hotel runs their staff using an app, which sounds like it lacks personalization or communication. They also need some instruction in customer service. Furthermore, when I notified a day manager of the lack of cleanliness, hygiene, and sanitation, and requested a refund of the early check-in fee (because I checked into and paid for a dirty room), I was punted to email another manager, rather than having my issue resolved on the spot.

 I've stayed at Yotel several times over the last 10 years, because its location is convenient to business needs at Javitz Convention Center, but after this visit, which lacked in professionalism, courtesy, and cleanliness, I will not be back.

title: Great Hotel 10 minutes walk from Times Square
text: Lovely hotel lots of negative posts but not sure why we are checking out today after spending 4 nights here room clean and was cleaned each day best shower I have ever used in a hotel. We stayed in room 903 very quiet and comfy although small had everything you needed I would have no hesitation staying at a YOTEL again

title: Séjour de 4 j a NY en janvier 2024
text:
Hotel bien situé a 10 min a pied du Métro de Port Authority sur la 42eme rue. a 15 min max de Times square a pied. 
Personnel très à l'écoute en particulier a la réception et ceux qui s'occupent des bagages. Chambre bien assez grand pour NY. Ascenseurs sécurisés avec carte. 
TRES bon rapport qualité prix

title: Good hotel but set your expectations
text: Good value for money.  The rooms  are dated and some of the items don’t work. The towel heater does not work.  The water from the sink drains vet slow. The main sink leaked.  The rest of the service and facility was good.  TV and local areas are easy to get to.

title: Bon hôtel, très bien situé
text: Chambres petites mais optimisées. Ca manque de rangement car il faut laisser les affaires dans les valises mais on ne passe généralement pas énormément de temps dans les chambre à New York. Peu d'intimité car les cloisons douches et toilettes sont vitrées (cloisons opacifiantes). Le personnel est très accueillant et l'hôtel est très bien placé (15 mn max de marche pour Time square).

title: Horrible stay
text: Hotel has bed bugs. Sheets were dirty, sink leaked and smelled horrible like vomit, the hotel moved my room but that wasn’t enough. I should have been refunded for the part of my stay when i was bitten by bed bugs. I’d never stay again

title: Good clean hotel.
text: Great hotel.. comfortable beds..well heated as was the shower.. small compact rooms but were totally suitable for our trip.. staff were very helpful and polite. Hotel is in a good location to reach all the attractions either on foot or by subway.

title: Awesome
text:
Great place to stay! I will definitely be back and stay here again. 

The only downside was the cleanliness of the room, I felt as if it could’ve been a litte more well kept. Other than that I had a nice experience

title: Posizione comoda, il resto é da rivedere
text:
1) pulizia mediocre 2) bagno unito alla camera (no privacy) 3) nessun sistema di aspirazione, quindi tanta umidità vi ritroverete una cascata di acqua tutte le mattine da asciugare 4) l'acqua calda nella doccia non sempre disponibile 5) asciugamani corpo minuscoli e nessuna altra dotazione 6) riscaldamento mal funzionante e decisamente rumoroso
Uniche note positive la posizione, veramente comoda e centrale, il distributore di acqua e ghiaccio gratuito

title: Lovely place to stay
text: Just got back from a week in the hotel. On arrival, check in was easy but had to pay a fee which was about 300 dollars and couldn’t pay by cash which was annoying. The fee was annoying when we had already spent $900 dollars to stay at the hotel. ☹️ but anyway, we was supposed to stay on the 12th floor but he upgraded us to the 26th floor (top floor) which was great, the view was amazing!! The room is small but what do you expect for being in New York, and tbh we was never in the room we was always out! Very clean, house keepers are always asking if we needed anything or if we wanted our room done. The only bad thing about the hotel was we had breakfast twice, first time the glass had all lipstick over and the second time the fork still had someone’s food on it so obviously they need to upgrade their dish washer but that was the only down fall. Other than that the place was perfect! Close to Times Square and very comfy bed. Please bare in mind the toilet is literally in the same room, it’s not in a separate room which was odd haha but got used to it. Will definitely be back 😁

title: banheiro sem parede e porta
text:
Quartos pequenos, parece cabine de navio , mas o pior é o que chamam de banheiro, mas na verdade é um box de vidro com chuveiro e o vaso sanitário,,,,, exatamente, sem parede e portas e o box nem fecha direito e nem tinha a cortina que aparece na foto .
minha filha adolescente ficou extremamente envergonhada de usar o banheiro.
E quando tomamos banho, fica tudo abafado...sensação de estar dormindo num banheiro 
O café da manhã não é bom, pois  temos que escolher : Café OU suco  e pão OU  fruta . Triste

title: Bad customer service
text: The hotel in itself is well situated and not too expensive but the service was terrible. Got charged 9$ on top of 140$ service fees to leave 3 bags for a few hours and then when we complained about it during checking got attitude and excuses... really started our stay badly.. never saw a service like that anywhere before. Disappointed.

title: Overall I had a pleasant stay but  I'm not sure I would return
text:
Just returned home from staying at this hotel for 4 nights. I was pleasantly surprised when I arrived after reading the reviews. 
I stayed in room 9091, it was slightly tired looking in some areas but everything worked and the room was spotless throughout our stay. The bed was very comfortable and an added bonus that you could press a button to turn it into a sofa. 
They supply, body wash, shampoo & conditioner so no need to bring your own. 
Hair Dryer, iron and safe are all included with your room. 
The room was quiet from the surrounding area too. 
Tip... bring your own kettle if you like a hot drink in the morning before you function. 
The location is great, most attractions are within walking distance. 

My only negative would be the resort fee. It says on here about receiving savings etc but no information was given to me when checking in regarding any discounts. Also no information was given about the Restaurant or Bar that was situated on the fourth floor or the Broadway entertainment which I have read since returning home. 
So 172 dollars for 4 nights in my opinion was a bit much when other hotels are offering free breakfast ect. 
And also you have to pay 3 dollars for each item stored after checkout which should be included in the price

title: Good choice for a short NYC tour (mine was 3 days)
text:
Pros: Located on West 42th St, it is close to everything you want: attractions like Times Square and Empire State Building, restaurants, convenient stores, buses and subways. It also has a view of Hudson River. The flexible bed is an interesting offering; you can use it as sofa, and you can lift your head by angle of your like while sleeping.
Cons: I was on the 21st floor, so it's quiet enough, but if you stay on lower floors, sounds of klaxons will be quite noticable. No toothpaste or toothbrush provided.

title: Hôtel correct
text:
Pour : bien situé près de Times Square… 5 mins à pied, Check on et out avec des bornes électroniques donc pas de file d’attente, magasin vin et spiritueux juste à côté avec plage horaire grande, lit électrique donc plusieurs positions possibles, propre en général, hôtel plutôt sécuritaire car 2 ascenseurs pour avoir accès à votre chambre et cela prend la carte pour prendre l’une d’elle donc ça évite les gens pas rapport. 

Contre : hôtel maximisant l’espace pour le plus de chambres possibles donc c petit petit comme chambre, eau douche tiède, pas de papier mouchoir ds la chambre, un peu de moisissure ds la douche plafond, pas de frigidaire ds la chambre, interdiction de fumer en théorie mais non respecté (weed) ca sent très souvent ds les couloirs et non ds la chambre au moins… 

Bien lire car les frais additionnels sont de 45$ us par nuit … certains hôtels de Manhattan c zéro, d autres 20$-25-30 mais eux c exhorbitant… à tenir compte lorsque vs réservez et comparez les prix entre hôtels!!

title: Proche de Times square mais nous aurions préféré loger ailleurs pour ce prix
text: Hôtel proche de Times Square et personnel à l’entrée de l’hôtel sympathique, mis à part cela rien n’allait dans cet hôtel. Le rooftop était fermé alors que nous avions du beau temps, la chambre était sale à notre arrivée, les meubles sont abîmés ainsi que la literie.

title: Good stay over Christmas
text: Stayed from the 22nd till the 29th of Dec , couldn’t ask for more room ok size but only there to sleep cleaned every day. Good shower hot water . Comfortable bed . Good area not far from Times Square and restaurants easy walk to subway . All staff good and helpful booked taxi back to airport . Would definitely stay again .

title: Da NON tornarci!
text:
Sono stato in questo hotel per il viaggio di nozze. Che dire, esperienza pessima per i seguenti motivi:

- Il primo e il secondo giorno abbiamo trovato dell'immondizia nel corridoio. 
- Non esisteva un areatore nel bagno e mancava la tenda per separare il letto dal bagno ( praticamente data la grandezza ridotta della camera il lavandino era praticamente affianco al letto)
- La notte c'era un fastidioso rumore che proveniva dal mini-bar (mi svegliavo puntualmente)
- L'acqua calda della doccia funzionava solo di sera, ergo le mattine solo docce fredde.

Abbiamo chiesto di cambiare camera e l'hanno fatto, ma senza risolvere i problemi sopracitati ( solo il rumore del frigo è stato risolto semplicemente dandoci una camera SENZA frigo XD).

La posizione è ottima, per il resto non ci tornerei.

Ps ho chiesto un transfer per l'areoporto e l'autista ha preteso la mancia (dopo avergli dato circa 98 dollari per 20 minuti di tragitto) dicendo di non avere il resto... Sono io a decidere se dare la mancia e quanto e una cosa del genere NON è accettabile in un hotel a 4*.

title: Good value, but not well executed
text: This hotel is convenient to Times Square and Broadway. It isn't far from the bus terminal and near the entrance to the tunnel. Good: price and cleanliness. The room was small, with no coffee maker or other accessory. It has a '70s vibe that is fun. It was a little worn down, with several places where the paint was worn off. The hotel is part of a small chain around the world. It assumes you have their app for things like ordering service or finding out what is where in the hotel. No free breakfast, but this is NYC.

title: Room 401
text:
Not the best room for a good nights rest! Acess door was next to this room and I could hear the door banging all night ! Too close
To the kitchen and dinning area constant movement . I could hear conversation and steps all night . Maybe the walls are also thin but after a long day of work all a person  wants is a decent night of rest . Not this floor for me ever again ! Overall the experience was ok .

title: Christmas trip with family
text:
We had 3 rooms all on the 15th floor. Rooms are compact but ideal unless you want to spend a lot of time in there.  We slept showered and went out. 
We were late arriving after having flight issues but check in was quick and easy. 
All staff friendly and helpful.  Paid for breakfast on the first morning I wasn’t a fan but others were.  The snack bar on the 4th floor was useful and drinks snacks etc good. 
We stayed for 5 nights and have no complaints. 
Location was spot on for us we walked absolutely everywhere and found it far enough out but close enough to get about.   
There is a CVS across the road and is ideal for snacks / drinks and in our case cold and flu medication 🤣 once you get in it’s massive and sells pretty much everything. 
Hotel transfer we used prems luxury on Facebook highly recommend. 
Used city mapper app and google maps to get about. 
Had the city pass which saved lots on admissions.
Booked Rockettes tickets day before at the box office , amazing and if there at Christmas def go and see it. 
We walked miles saw everything we wanted too unless hidden by the fog 🤣 
If I was to return I  would stay here again it was perfect for what we wanted.

title: Just terrible - we didn’t stay!
text:
I booked this hotel on booking.com where is has a 4* rating, it was for my wife’s 40 birthday. We went in between Christmas and New Year. We were given room 1126, the room was dirty and extremely tired, the floor was filthy and what looks like a very modern, high tec hotel on the website is far from what we found. The room also smelt terribly of cannabis, and whilst I know this legal in New York the hotel has a no smoking policy.

We requested a room change which was denied, we also requested a refund which was also denied. We did no stay at this hotel, we booked another and left a couple of hours after checking in as it was so bad! Please do not go to this hotel you will be disappointed.

If management would like to get in contact me to discuss the matter and to come to a resolution it would be appreciated, otherwise I will be taking the matter further, as I did not receive the accommodation that was advertised on the website.

title: Excellent Stay
text: From check in to check out the staff were excellent. Nothing was to much trouble and as a first time visitor to NYC I had a few questions. The room was excellent and the bed was one of the best if not the best hotel bed I had ever slept in.

title: Christmas stay
text: Can’t fault this hotel at all - great stay from start to finish. Upgraded on arrival by lovely reception staff, great clean massive room with a terrace and city view and fantastic shower and toiletries. Restaurant served excellent food and were friendly but it was the guys on the lobby who provided us the best service and really helped us out on the last day. Location is excellent nice quiet area (quiet as can be for NYC) but easy walking distance to subway and attractions etc. would return to this hotel for sure and recommend to family and friends. Husband and I were located on the 8th floor whilst other members of our party had rooms on the 17th. No one had any issues with their rooms. Thanks for a lovely stay x

title: Dissappointed
text:
Looks good on website, nice lobby area & staff very friendly. 
HOWEVER once you're past the 4th floor & onto accommodation area's, it looses its glamour & you realise that it needs money spending on it.  😞

title: Great Hotel, Great Location, Great stay
text: I would recommend this hotel as a base for a stay in New York.  The location was close enough to Times Square to be in a good position to get to all places, but not too close that it was noisy.  The rooms were clean and compact and had everything we needed for our trip. Staff were helpful and friendly.

title: Worst hotel ever…
text:
Literally the worst hotel I’ve ever stayed in…. The staff are so incredibly rude, me and my friend did not feel welcome at all. We were so disappointed as this was our first Christmas away from our families. 

The rooms were so tired and run down. You’re basically sleeping in a bathroom! The only good thing was the bed was quite comfy. We also had wafts of weed coming through our vents at night. Now I’m aware that New York smells like this but I did not expect it in my room. Feel quite miss sold as the room was nothing like the picture on the website! 

Another point to make is that I saw on their website that you could book the roof top bar, so we did. They took 6USD to reserve it. We went to our reservation to be told that the roof top is not ope(fine) ,but proceeded to say they will not refund my money back…! (I know it’s only 6USD but out of principle) just very annoying! The staff were not caring at all. The girl on the desk just looked me up and down and made out I was lying about the websites information. They also charge you per suitcase to store your luggage for the day, I’ve never ever paid this whilst being a paying guest at a hotel. So strange. 

Just avoid at all costs, not worth the money at all.

title: Compact but very good central hotel in New York
text: Really compact clean rooms and toiletries were provided. Shower was great and the rooms were made up every day. Staff were very helpful. No tea/coffee making facilities and it would have been nice to have some info about what the hotel provided in relation to food/drink etc. Otherwise a lovely hotel to stay in as they managed to give us rooms that had a private door to both rooms as we took our children.

title: Great location but very basic hotel
text: Great location. About 15 minutes walk to Times Square. However as soon as you arrive they make you pay over USD 40 per night facility charge for nothing. There are no facilities save for an overpriced restaurant and bar serving a limited menu. The room is also tiny and cold. My room was supposed to have a view of the Empire State Building but it didn’t. It is ok to stay a night or 2 but not for anything longer.

title: Shocking stoage system
text:
Upon checking out at Yotel Times Square room, I attempted to utilise the hotel's advertised luggage storage facility. However, upon arrival at the designated area, I was informed by staff that the electronic storage system was malfunctioning and unavailable. Despite this, I was then charged a fee of $3 per luggage storage, totalling to $6, which is unacceptable under these circumstances.
This deliberate misrepresentation of service availability constitutes a fraudulent action on behalf of Yotel Times Square.

title: Very comfortable stay
text: We had a really nice stay at this hotel. Rooms are a bit small but are very comfortable. Free safe and our view from hotel was lovely!  I thought the hotel fee was a bit too much $43 per night per room but was to be expected. Overall we had a really nice stay and staff were friendly and helpful.

title: Great technology
text: This hotel has great technology, the check in can be digital when you get there. Also, you can leave your luggage if you get early and walk around. It is closed to a lot of places. I strongly recommend it.

title: Great location. Filthy accommodations.
text: I was so excited to stay here. It looks awesome online. My son is 13, so he thought it was so cool. I lived in NYC so when rooms are super small, it doesn't phase me. But I can't take dirty beds, a non working TV, a broken bathroom door and a shower that looked like a cross between a dirty youth hostel and a prison. Crumbs in bed, stains everywhere - including huge splashes in blinds. Just a mess. The only saving grace was the bed was comfy. But who can sleep when you're scared of the filth you're surrounding yourself in!

title: Tired hotel that needs a refresh
text: Location ok but I would not recommend. Hotel needs to be upgraded to todays standards. Needs more outlets for charging electronics. Breakfast food just ok. All staff was very nice but seemed overworked.

title: Great hotel
text:
Great hotel Really comfortable room with great views. We were on the 27th floor.
Rooms are compact but designed really well great feature is the smart bed really comfortable bed that reclines.
Great Wi-Fi in room which is rare.
Excellent powerful shower big rainfall head.
Room spotless & gets cleaned every day to a good standard.
Hotel is in a great location less than 10min walk to Times Square & just round the corner from port authority subway station if you’re using the subway a lot like we did.
Slight downside you can hear doors closing from other rooms we were tucked away in the corner so this didn’t really affect us & we slept really well but I suspect if you’re room was in the middle of the floor this could get annoying.
They Also charge a facilities fee of $43 a night this is actually advertised on there website which I didn’t know prior to arrival. Apart from there great Wi-Fi not sure what benefits we received from paying this so factor that in budget before booking.
Overall I would definitely recommend staying here.

title: 4 night stay from The UK
text:
We stayed here for 4 nights from the 17th December.  We arrived quite late after a long wait getting through security at JFK.  We tried to check in on the screens but it would not allow us to do this.  We then had to  check in at the desk which tool around 10-15mins as there was a very angry man complaining that the hotel never had his booking.  Upon checking we had been up graded which was a nice touch.

The room was very spacious, with nice city line views.  We stayed in room 1137.  The room was a little tired but very clean and had everything we needed.  The room was cleaned everyday and to a good standard.  

The location was amazing, we only used the subway on one day.  We never used the bar or any other facilities but they looked nice enough.  

The staff were very helpful in organising a taxi back to the airport and storing our bags.  All in all we had a great stay and would book again if we ever return.

title: Will be coming to stay here again
text: Second time ever in the City and first time seeing the Christmas tree and lights. Location was amazing, Staff was amazing, the heated towel rack was the cherry on top! The window view couldn’t have gotten better

title: Excelente localização
text:
A grande mais-valia é a Excelente localização. Por outro lado, tem quartos pequenos e pouco confortáveis. Algum ruído nocturno. Pessoal por vezes pouco eficiente.
Ideal para quem pretende andar a pé por NYC e que não valorize o conforto e o requinte dum hotel

title: The best of New York
text: Samae was amazing, from a rather cumbersome check-in (totes my fault, the drama of desired upgrades + limited funds) to a *very* delayed checkout (beating cancer + bathroom chronicles) she was a beam of light & direction. Thank you!!! Until we meet again, “tomorrow” 4 that Penthouse w/terrace….

title: Great location
text: Very close to Times Square, small compact room, bathroom within the bedroom, very clean, good value for money, good view of the Empire State Building, close to eating and drinking places and an off licence.

title: Great location, clean rooms and super helpful staff
text:
What a great hotel . All you need with great service . Thanks a lot Yousef, you’ve been amazing 

Great location on time square and central to all major attractions.

Very clean and nice vibe. Yobot is a must try for storing your luggage. 
Self check in and check out makes it hassle free

title: Convenient location, cleanliness needs work
text: The hotel looks really cool.  The robot thing wasn't working my entire time there, so I had to check bags with staff and that cost money, even though the robot thing was supposed to be free.  Room was very musty and stale smelling.  Had to open the window.  Also air vents were very dusty and shower was not fully cleaned.  Bed is very comfy and my stay was quiet.  Perfect location for me, but cleanliness needs work.

title: Dirty. Peeling paint. Your basically sleeping in a bathroom
text:
Disgusting. The housekeeper told me that I got the worst room in the hotel. She said she hates cleaning it. Don’t stay there. Paint is peeling, shower is very strange, when you walk into the solo room the toilet is immediately there - it’s like you’re staying in a bathroom. The sink is right by the bed. It stunk. I know I could have complained but I was on a work trip and extremely busy. I did not get the room automatically assigned, the front desk guy gave it to me. Why treat your customers so poorly? Just fix the room.

The hotel staff talk extremely loud outside my door about their internal policy about finding money and when they can end up keeping it.

Get professional training guys. You’re all super disrespectful. When I told the house keeper if I could switch rooms she said there is no way they would do it and that no one should have given me room 2539.

title: Disappointment
text: Overpriced hostel with no cable service and small room. We were disappointed. Luckily we didn’t stay in our room much. We were told to call back and seek some money back because they couldn’t help me at the desk because we booked through a third party.

title: Localizacao perfeita
text:
Estive no YOTEL Nova York no inicio de Dezembro, estive com um grupo de amigos, e adoramos.
Check-in muito simples no kiosk, quarto estava muito limpo.
Adoramos a localizacao, esta muito perto das atraccoes que queriamos visitar, mas longe da confusao, a zona de Hells Kitchen, e muito simpatica com muitos restaurantes e bares.
Muito simpaticos todos os funcionarios que tivemos contacto.
Vamos voltar.

title: Vista do quarto e simpatia dos empregados, alem da localizacao.
text:
Estive em NY para uma visita de Natal com amigos e escolhemos o YOTEL, pela localizacao, e pela oferta que vimos no site do hotel para estadias de 3 dias.
Adoramos.
A localizacao e fantastica, esta perto de tudo, mas ao mesmo longe da confusao de Times Square.
Quartos muito limpos, tem tudo o que precisa para uma edtadia curta em NY.
Tudo muito moderno, as pessoas todas muito simpaticas, sempre que precisamos estavam sempre dispostos e disponíveis para ajudar.
Usamos os beneficios do Facility Fee, verifiiquem que vale a pena, poupei uns 100 dolares por dia, comprei todas as atracções atraves da aplicacao, valeu a pena.
Reservem o quarto Corner Queen, vista maravilhosa.

Ja e a seguunda vez que fico neste hotel, sempre uma maravilha.

title: Not what was expected
text: My experience was not the greatest. The hotel seemed like a cool place to stay at. Upon arrival it was quickly noticed that the hotel was in desperate need of better maintenance. Our cabin had water damage, mildew growth and the glass door for the washroom was coming off the rail. “Mission Control” was kind in helping us get the door fixed. Based on the price I was displeased with the value and condition of the hotel.

title: Hotel has significantly declined
text: The hotel is very worn, dirty and charges fees for amenities that do not exist. The elevators are a long wait and make scary sounds that make you uncomfortable to board them. We used to stay here and loved the diversity of the guests and the vibe. It is now more like a hostel charging hotel prices that they have no business charging based on how dirty and worn it is and everything being self-service and vending machines.

title: Pleasantly suprised
text:
I was a bit worried after booking I the hotel after looking at the reviews as I had booked a surprise trip to New York for my boyfriend’s 30th birthday and I didn’t want anything to spoil it. Location was fabulous just what we needed it is a 15 minute walk to Times Square, probably 15/20 minute walk to Empire State Building and Rockefeller as well we walked to easily, Madison square garden was about 10 minute walk the only things we needed to get the subway for was Central Park, Brooklyn and the natural history museum so I really do think you pay for the location here. Rooms were fine a little small but I expected that from New York they were clean and had a good TV (we had a few early nights from all the busy sight seeing in the day. The hotel bar was more expensive than I thought it would have been but was also was a nice place to relax after a busy day sight seeing.
