The best thing about this room though was the view, we were on the 27th floor and it was just fantastic I will miss this view a lot. 

We are from the UK so we didn’t realise city tax would be $170 dollars as everywhere in Europe it’s about 2 euros a day! So one thing to be mindful of but I expect this is every hotel.

title: Great Stay
text: I liked the location and the rooms were great. Service was excellent and self check in and check out was really easy and efficient. The building itself inside was futuristic looking and it was easy to find your rooms. Loved that it was also 24 hours and there was a room to store your luggage while you explore the city! Definitely we recommend to stay here and there was a great view from the city from out room!

title: Ideal
text:
Comfy beds. Clean room. Friendly staff. Location good. 
Hot showers . Small but suffices room.Restaurant serves nice food . Communal areas require updating.  Otherwise good enough hotel for short stays

title: Tired rooms with some features not working
text: Hotel is in a good location slightly off the centre but this makes it less in the melee. Very easy access to Lincoln tunnel and Newark airport plus midtown. Rooms are tired with some non working features and we had a water stained mattress. Liked the access to fresh air but windows are at floor height so no you’d for kids

title: Nico was great!
text: Very comfortable bed and nice ambiance.  The location was perfectly located in Times Square.  More importantly, the service was great.  Nico made my stay a wonderful experience.  I would highly recommend this location for one or two guests.

title: Amazing! Highly recommend
text: I cannot recommend this hotel enough! Lobby is stunningly decorated for Xmas, the rooms are amazing with city view for us… spotless & compact! Bed was so comfortable. Unfortunately I lost my passport whilst in New York & the staff were amazing, so helpful. They really did make us few welcome whilst trying to sort it out- we got emergency passport enabling us to catch our original flight. Thank you so much 🙏🏼

title: I enjoyed my stay!
text:
I really enjoyed my stay here! It is a small boutique-ish place but very clean, comfortable, and my room was quiet.

There could have been a little more counter space but I guess that is the trade-off for the size of room.

The phone was broken but that didn't matter to me and I reported it do that they could fix it for the next guest.

The location was spectacular, as I was in town for a convention at the Javits  Center which was a rather quick walk from the hotel.

The breakfast buffet was simple but very satisfying and the wait/host staff were as nice as they could be! (Especially Sebastian!)

Speaking of the staff, Rochelle welcomed me on my first night and each subsequent time I saw her, she was so kind  and took very good care of me!

When I checked out,  Jennette and Samae were very kind as well.

My housekeeper Yankee was kind enough to supply me with extra towels as I didn't require any real housekeeping during my 3-night stay, with all my show paraphernalia set up in my room.

All in all, I had a very nice experience and I wouldn't mind staying here again!!!!

title: Don’t think it was worth the price
text: Bed was suppose to be a smart bed didn’t even work, sink was clogged. Peeling on shower ceiling. Hot room. I booked last minute but I feel like it wasn’t worth the price I paid at all. Staff was very helpful, the rooms just need to be worked on.

title: YOTEL NYC- Not for me!
text: My girlfriend and I stay at YOTEL very often. We will never return to YOTEL NYC ever again. It was GROSS. We had to switch rooms because the first one was so bad and the second was not much better. Stains EVERYWHERE (bed, towels, walls) dust bellowing out of vents, no lights in the room, no colored lights, bed didn't adjust. Could barely move in the room because the bed did not adjust. Outdated, our rooms looked nothing like how they do online. Customer service was not great, staff could have cared less to ask us about our stay, in fact they didn't ask. No valet parking, but the garage is close/conneted. $160 for two days of parking, no help with bags?? $900+ for this two night stay and we will never return. Not worth it at all. As a frequent yotel guest, we are so disappointed. I wish I could upload the pictures I took of how truly dirty it was.

title: Yotel Times Square volvería a repetir
text: Buen hotel y buena ubicación. Esta en el mismo Times Square, esta cerca de lo mas principal te limpian la habitación si lo pides y son pequeñas pero tienen de todo no les falta un detalle. La cama es enorme. Lo recomendaría sin dudarlo

title: Ok for a short trip
text: We have just come back from New York. We stayed 5 nights and out of those 5, 3 nights we were woken up by a loud constant banging. Was 2am & 5am on those mornings. We complained to reception and they weren’t too bothered and basically said it wasn’t their problem as it was from the building site next door. This noise was so loud it felt like it was in the building so we didn’t believe this. We did also record the sound to show reception but again just said it was because of the way our room was. However, for someone to sleep (when it’s quiet) this hotel isn’t bad, good location, rooms could do with updating but when you’re not in them much that doesn’t matter as much.

title: Be cautious of "Fees"
text:
Hotel is in a great convenient location. Room was very clean but very worn . Bed was amazing. 

My issue was with being told by employees that there were "Fees" associated with storing bags when in fact there is a sign in another location in the lobby that provides a recommended gratuity for a free service. I am more than happy to tip for good service but it's unacceptable to be lied to about bogus fees.

The main thing in my opinion is that the staff make or in this case break the hotel experience.

title: Cozy stay in Times Square
text:
Comfortable room. You don't really need 500sf to sleep 200m from Times Square.
Very friendly staff and good view. 
Easy to check in at the ciosk. I suggest to speak to the reception for an easy transfer to any airport.

title: Short stay in December
text:
Visited for 3 nights - booked last January in the sale and got an excellent price ! 
This hotel was a perfect place to get your head down ! Comfortable beds, room is contemporary and extremely clean and just the right size for two of us ! 
Only 15 mins walk into Times Square and subway, which is really easy to navigate !! 
I would 100% stay here again - hairdryer is good, shampoo, conditioner and body wash available (however I like my own so brought it with us ) 
We had access to a water and ice fountain and filled up on water every day which was really handy to stay hydrated ! 
Thank you Yotel

title: Not amazing rooms but comfortable & great location
text: We stayed at the Yotel during our 4 day trip to New York. Staff were helpful & friendly. Hotel was is a great location for all the main sightseeing spots. Room & landings were a bit tired looking but beds were comfy.

title: Great stay and hotel
text:
Just spent 4 nights here after travelling from England, booked through BA package in January great deal. 

As expected rooms were small but not too crowded for 2 of us especially when the bed was in the seating position, we booked a premium queen room with city view. View overlooked the west side of the city which was nice. Check in was super easy and fast as you do it on an ipad, I wish it was like this for all hotels. The yobot storage was really helpful for checking out.

Room was tidy and clean, bed super comfy. Only disappointment was the mood lightening wasn't in our room and the TV didn't fill the space showing our room was in need of a refurb. Everything else was fine we stayed in room 1605. We were barely in the room tbh so its a great place to rest. 
10 minute walk to nearest Sub station which is port authority and 15 minutes to main times square so location is quite good. Just be prepared to do alot of walking. Taxi from JFK was flat rate 70, 100 altogether with tip. 

Overall I would definitely stay here and with yotel again :)

title: Terrible
text: No hot drink facilities in room only at small hut for very limited hours,vending machine empty,restaurant menu poor choice and over priced,staff rude,charged extra £125 for use of amenities that were no good to use or closed

title: poor
text: hotel it’s self needs a lot of up dating. I’ve just come back from there we went the 20th November 2023 to the 28th . Our room was dirty as we arrived it had make up in the sink and hair in the bed and toilet. We went to complain and there wasn’t a problem got moved straight away then the second room was still dirty and the bed had no sheets on. 3rd time lucky we got put in a lovely room !. On arrival had to pay £130 tax each which it said cheaper online before arrival it was ily meant to be £111 for 2 people. They then charged us an extra $2 per bag to put it in the luggage room. Staff were really helpful. The gym had no air conditioning so to dangerous to train. Overal the hotel was bad we paid £2,500 for 8 nights with no breakfast and had no royalty at all. Won’t be visiting again !!!!

title: Excellent customer service
text:
Thanks to Samae checkin agent at the hotel for making our trip memorable. We were celebrating a birthday and thanks to her we will return to stay there. Her attention to detail was amazing.
 Incredible customer service. Thank you

title: amazing place
text:
The Hotel has an excellent location, making it easy to get to most of the tourist attractions visited.
The room is small, but quite comfortable. The tilting bed is a very smart solution for being able to move around the room and watch TV comfortably.
The bathroom with its glass walls is quite peculiar. I missed the curtains in the room, to increase privacy.
The staff was very attentive and the restaurant is very practical. The outdoor tables make the place very beautiful.
It was worth staying at YOTEL.

title: TERRIBLE EXPERIENCE
text: I am super disappointed. We stay in the Manhattan regularly and especially now for a yearly conference at the Javitz. It was my first time at the Yotel. The shower handle was broken, the bed would not stay inclined, the room was so hot, we had to turn on the AC that never cooled the room and our room was cleaned and not replenished with the bare necessities of wash rags and toilet paper. There was no room to move us so we were stuck. The best part was leaving. Moisses at the front was super helpful in helping with our luggage and super apologetic and friendly.  I would have to reconsider ever staying here again.

title: Perfect
text: This hotel is perfect and in an appealing location. Amazing views.The breakfast is unbelievable and value for your money. The staff are so friendly, and we didn't have a problem the whole time we stayed there. The rooms are super cosy and toast up on a warm winters night. Will definitely be back

title: Excelente!
text:
Excelente hotel! Ubicación ideal para estar cerca de todo , tanto de times squeare y el theatre district como tambien de hudson yards , chelsea y el high line .

Atención muy buena ,habitaciones pequeñaas pero muy completas y cómodas. 
Wifi muy bueno , ideal para trabajar de manera remota sin problema. 
Recomiendo la terrraza del piso 4 en donde se ve el corazon de manhattan

title: would definitely recommend
text: excellent location 5 min to times square right next to hells kitchen , we walked everywhere apart from 9/11 memorial and south port ferry (statue of liberty) which we walked 5 min to metro , our room was fine a little worn around the edges , but cleaned every day a lovely view of the city and hudson river , really comfy bed which is exactly what i needed after exploring new york and every member of staff i came across was wonderfully friendly and helpful and i booked late check out for a very reasonable rate ,  would 100% stay again

title: Thanksgiving in NYC
text:
Booked 2 premium queens. 1 was decent size the other was very snug. Thankfully I slept in the bigger room. Hotel staff were very friendly and helpful. Self check-in was very easy to use. Hotel is in a great location, close enough to times square however away from the noise. Both rooms were cleaned daily. Had an issue with shower which was resolved within 10mins of reporting. Fab service. I would recommend this hotel if you are looking for a no thrill base with clean comfy bed to sleep in,
I would also note that the toilet is very exposed to the room so would suit people who are very comfortable with one another!

title: Terrible service from Yotel, highly disappointed
text:
Got to the hotel around 7pm was told There had been a flood on the floor we were staying and we had to move room, receptionist said we could change the following day if we didn’t like it. But the room was fine and we were happy to stay put. The following day we had been out all day and got back, to quickly get showered and changed the room key wouldn’t work. Please note you also had to swap lifts, so after 2 set of lifts and a corridor to get to your room. We were up and down took around 3 attempts up and down the lifts, taking around 30 mins. Reception didn’t really care our key wasn’t working. Anyway after it was sorted had around 10 mins to get ready and get to our dinner reservation. 

When we returned home around 11.30pm that night the same thing happened again. We were up and down 3 times? On the 2nd time we were told we had to move rooms as our room had been booked?! It was late we had been out all day and had already been inconvenienced. I downright refused as I felt it was totally inappropriate to ask this of us when we had already had enough issues with the
Room and hotel.

I asked who was the manager, no response from either staff member. Asked who can I complain to, no response from
Either staff member. Was given an email address which I emailed but haven’t even had a response. Didn’t even offer a free drink in their bar!

This happened again the next day and as you can imagine I was not happy. Absolutely disgusting service from Yotel and I will be taking it further. 

The facility fee is also a joke! I understand you have to pay it which we did and was fully aware of this, but none of the discount codes for these attractions worked, so we had to pay full
Price anyway!

I would definitely stay elsewhere if I was you.

title: Good location
text:
Hotel room was really clean and had a comfy bed which was great after hours of walking around NYC. It also had a window you could open which is great to get some air in to room rather than using AC all the time which us brits arent used to. Only problem for us was the size..it was really small and we didnt like how the bathroom and toilet is made of glass so little privacy only frosted/printed glass. It did look like a curtain may have been up previously as there was a rail but no curtain. Maid was really friendly and always refreshed the room to a good standard.
We found check in receptionists were not too welcoming and gave very little detail of how to find rooms, seemed more interested in making sure you paid taxes..you have to go up to 4th floor turn right and go up in another lift. Men on front desk (concierge?) Were really friendly and helpful. 
Hotel is in a good location for Times Square, Hudson Yard and Intreprid Museum.

title: Hotel is in decline
text:
1st stay was a very nice. Great location!  In walking distance to most broadway shows, the train station and much more.
2nd stay the hotel was in decline.  In need of maintenance. Included breakfast was mediocre.

title: Avoid If disabled or not going as a couple
text: Far too small,ice not available on every floor and was sent a wild goose chase for it. No space for your belongings so had to live out the cases! So room to swing a cat man it was horrible especially as friends maybe better for young folks and couples! Could see right inside the showers and her my friend pee and poop! Asked for a fridge had to chase it up! $43 a night resort fee for not a thing that benifits you!(well us) expensive for 2 cocktails $36 in a plastic cup and tasted vile. Very nice maid though. No one could understand us and some staff were lovely some were very rude! This is not good for disabled or visually impaired people so please do not consider it!(I am one of those people) nice views and good bed that’s about the plus side-will not be back there ever!!!

title: Great hotel in great location!
text:
Great hotel in a great location! 
Clean and I was very comfortable staying there for the week ☺️ everything you need in the room! 
And LOVED the reclining bed! 👏🏻
My only negative would be the water and ice machines that were supposed to be on each floor, many didn’t work or wouldn’t dispense properly so I went to 5 different floors for water!
That being said, I’d definitely recommend this hotel and for the price I paid too, one of the best affordable hotels in NYC!

title: Great stay in Manhattan. YOTEL
text:
We loved the place the hotel was fantastic, very nice and cleaned rooms, we read concerning comments about the room sizes, I can say we got what we chose, very convenient design, we could stream on TV what we want see from our computer, everything was very cleaned, City view, which we really appreciated, NY Skyline is beautiful.
Staff was very friendly and helpful, we were close to the major attractions we wanted,
We loved YOTEL
We will be back.
Great deals booking direct on YOTEL, and was really the best we found.
We will be back.

title: Perfect stay, great hotel ⭐️
text:
Lovely hotel, check in was easy, guys standing around were helpful.
The room was lovely, clean ,cosy and warm, we had the best sleep.
Room didn’t have a fridge or kettle but that didn’t matter as it had everything we needed.
We didn’t put our top up card out for housekeeping but they came every day and made our bed- cleaned our room and put fresh towels in. Thank you :) we stayed at this hotel to be near Times Square and other amenities, it didn’t disappoint, not even a 10 minute walk, perfect ;) we are from the Uk and first time in New York- would definitely stay again. We had a fantastic time ❤️ there was so much to see and do. Thank you all. You all deserve more than 5 stars ⭐️

title: Great hotel, great staff, perfect stay.
text:
We were a group of friends spending a weekend in the city.
We were well greeted by the staff when arrived, we checked-in on the kiosks, was seamless and fast.
Went up to our rooms, the rooms were well cleaned, I would say spotless and with a nice scent.
We were up on the 26th floor, great views of Empire State Building, that was a surprise.

Very friendly staff, in any contact we had were always warm and helpful.

We booked directly on their site, and was the best available deal, much better than booking with a third party, when we need help, they are there, which was not the same in other experiences when booked through a third party.

Will come back, thanks YOTEL

title: 1st Timers, No Complaints
text:
We stayed in Yotel 17/11/23-21/11/23 during our first time visiting NYC. I'll be honest given what we paid we really couldn't fault the hotel, the only reason it's not a 5/5 is there's a couple minor things that could be improved upon. First of all the location is fantastic, 10minutues walk from being in the heart of Times square, 20minutes from Central park and an easy walk from the subway station if you're travelling public transport from JFK like we did. We had room 1912, I requested a room with a city skyline view and as high as possible before we had to pay deluxe room prices and that's exactly what we got. Onto the room itself, an iron and a hairdryer were included and the room was clean, the bed we found comfy and loved you could turn it into a sofa with 1 push of a button, spacious shower and decent level of storage for a 4 day stay. The only things we felt let it down was the room was warm even with the air con on its lowest setting so we kept the window open, meaning you heard all the sirens of NY (however after walking 12miles a day it tended not to interrupt your sleep). Some of the finishing were a little worn e.g. bits of edging missing etc, and finally there was no refrigerator in the room. One thing that was disappointing was the advertised terrace never seemed to be open, not sure if we just kept missing it or not but the outdoor seating was always covered over.

The robot luggage storage facility was easy to use and the reception guys were not fussed about how long you left your luggage stored, which was helpful as we checked out at 11 and didn't need to head up to JFK until after 3. Also when it actually comes to checking in you can literally do it all yourself on one of the check in screens.

Overall a really great stay at Yotel, they delivered on my request, the location was us first timers was excellent and there were plenty of amenities within comfortable walking distance. We certainly wouldn't hesitate to rebook should the opportunity arise. For the British tourists my best comparison is it's a Premier Inn with frills.

title: Unhelpful staff. Good location.
text: Staff were really unhelpful. We was told we had a leak in our original room on arrival so put us in a similar room with a bunk. This however wasnt the issue. Our room key wouldnt work, this happened at least 5 times and counting and showed little guilt or sympathy with us. We had to go on two seperate lifts to get to our room just to fond out it didnt work to go back down. And on top of this they said we needed to pack our things and change rooms at 11pm after a night out. Wouldn’t reccommend. Location however is really good and no issue with the room once inside it.

title: you get what you pay for
text:
my room was pretty clean + not as bad like yeah was it a bit old? totally but that didn't really deter me. if anything i never had hot water in the morning due to everyone else using it LOL

also the wifi was kinda spotty for facetime and stuff but thats really it.

title: GREAT LOCATION
text: Great location.As per other reviews room compact although managed as hardly in the room. The reception staff were amazing as I needed help printing boarding passes. Big shout out to Edgar in the bar friendly and helpful member of staff.  If ever return to nyc will visit here again no problem.Thanks for a great stay!

title: Worst hotel ever
text:
This hotel was terrible for its price point. The shower was dirty with stains and boogers on the wall. The bed frames were peeling and old with dead skin in the edges. Their walls were damaged on every corner. It just felt dirty and uncomfortable during our entire stay.

Additionally, we asked if we can check out at 12PM since it said it was complimentary and the front desk person said yes but didn’t note what room we were in (even though I told her). The day we checked out, housekeeping knocked on our door to let us know check out was at 11AM. I had to go down to the front desk again to let them know so we wouldn’t get hit with unexpected fees. I do not recommend this spot as it was 400 a night and parking was 50 bucks per day. Stay somewhere else to protect your sanity and wallet.

title: City break New York
text: Pleasantly surprised at our room.It used it's space efficiently, room was quite small but didn't feel claustrophobic. First time usi ng yotel. Was impressed. Air conditioning was good, rooms very clean.

title: October in New York
text:
Can not think of one negative of this hotel!
Rooms are tiny but they are immaculately clean, utilise the small space super well, very comfortable. Staff were super friendly. Fantastic location, close to Times Square and Subway stations, plus CVS and Target were right across the road.

title: Not worth the money
text: Room had a hole in the corner by the desk. TV channels don’t match the TV guide. Wifi didn’t work. Thermostat was unresponsive at times. Good location. Service was good. Exterior looks nice but, inside feels old.

title: central of city
text: the hotel is located central of city .but the room is small and uncomfortable.its not for family tavellers .otherwise everypopint in central is step away from hotel .dining shoping etc.the mail bus setation is fust one block behind.

title: Late notice two night stag on NY
text:
Very nice but a little underwhelmed with equipment in the room.  some things not working.  And no coffee facilities in room.
I was there in winter to deck was too cold in my opinion.     would be great in the summer so i would go back in the summer.

title: never again
text: "cabin" not comfortable, no where for clothes to go, no shade in window, nothing to put ice in, no microwave or fridge, weak wifi, annoying check in service, elevator stops on an interim floor.  Worst part was the lack of response and inability to get a human being.

title: Great weekend
text:
Stayed here again with friends that were visiting, I book this hotel a lot when I want to stay in the city and not take the train back home at night. Location is perfect, 10 minutes walk to Times Square. Lots of places to eat nearby. A cvs in front and a wine store in the corner. And the view from the room is fabulous! Very clean and friendly staff.
Breakfast is the only thing I don’t really recommend….. too expensive and very few choices. There’s a lot of cheaper options very close.

title: The coolest hotel in NYC
text: The coolest hotel in NY. I love the easy iPad check-in process, the modern/tech/purple atmosphere, the rooftop bar (they have an awesome outdoor movie showing that I was sad to miss), and the welcoming staff. I met the general manager in the elevator and he was charming and gave us some restaurant recommendations. The rooms were clean, the beds are extremely comfortable, and the view from the corner room was awesome. I'm a repeat customer, and I highly recommend!!! Thanks, YOTEL!

title: Disappointing experience at Yotel New York
text:
I recently had a highly disappointing experience during my stay at Yotel New York, and I feel compelled to share my thoughts and concerns. Unfortunately, my expectations were far from met, and several aspects of the hotel's service left much to be desired. Here's a detailed review of my stay:

Cons:
1. Poor Customer Service: The staff at Yotel New York displayed a lack of empathy and understanding towards my situation. Despite explaining that I had a family emergency and needed to travel back to my city, they refused to accommodate my cancellation request. Their inflexibility and apparent disregard for my circumstances were deeply disheartening.

2. Excessive Charges: The hotel's approach to charging guests was disappointing. I requested an early check-in at 12pm, which is a fairly reasonable ask. However, instead of offering it as a courtesy, they insisted on charging me an exorbitant fee of $60. This felt like an opportunistic move, taking advantage of guests' needs and charging excessive amounts for basic services.

3. Misleading Advertising: I was left disillusioned upon seeing the room I was assigned. It was a far cry from the advertised descriptions and amenities. The room lacked the promised comfort and quality, leaving me questioning the hotel's commitment to providing accurate and transparent information to its guests. This false advertising is unacceptable and misleading to potential customers.

4. Lack of Flexibility: Yotel New York's rigid policies, particularly the non-refundable reservation policy, felt unfair and unaccommodating. While emergencies and unforeseen circumstances can arise, the hotel seemed unwilling to make exceptions or show any understanding towards guests in distress. This lack of flexibility left me feeling frustrated and undervalued as a guest.

5. Noise Issues: The hotel's location in a bustling area resulted in significant noise disturbances throughout my stay. The constant street traffic and noise from neighboring rooms made it difficult to relax and get a good night's sleep. The lack of soundproofing in the rooms was a major drawback, further adding to my overall dissatisfaction.

It's disappointing to have such a negative experience at a hotel that I had hoped would provide a comfortable and enjoyable stay. The issues I encountered, including the poor customer service, excessive charges, misleading advertising, inflexible policies, and noise problems, have left me with a lasting negative impression of Yotel New York.

I urge the hotel management to reevaluate their approach to customer service and consider the importance of empathy, flexibility, and transparency. It's crucial for the hotel to align its services with the expectations set by its advertising to avoid disappointing and frustrating guests in the future.

Based on my experience, I cannot recommend Yotel New York to fellow travelers, as there are certainly better options available that prioritize customer satisfaction and provide a more enjoyable stay.

title: they overcharged me
text: My reservation was in the name of Juan Manuel Martinez from the period Oct 30 to Nov 4, a few days ago I stayed at his hotel in room 825, I paid $215 USD upon check-in, everything was fine. When I checked out they charged me an additional $1,340 USD. They practically refunded my money and then charged me again but on my first payment that I made at check-in. This is already a fraud. I have sent emails to Jennyra Olivencia and newyork.MCMANAGERS@yotel.com and others and have not received a response. I need this situation to be endorsed now. I'm still waiting for this problem to be resolved. Thank you

title: Very expensive for low quality.
text: Although in pictures might look like a cool new hotel, the reality is that the furniture is already decadent. Felt like a cheap Motel instead. I wouldn't recommend it unless you really have to stay close to Times Square and is the cheapest option... but it is far from being cheap, it was really expensive.

title: Disappointing
text: I have stayed at this location multiple times to attend conferences at Javits. I was honestly shocked at how worn down the rooms were. It used to be a fun, comfortable stay. However, there appears to have been no upkeep of the hotel over the past year or so. I switched rooms as the adjustable bed was broken and the lights weren’t working. The new room had mold and the AC sensor was down, but it wasn’t worth switching again for the two night stay. Everywhere I looked there were stains, cracks and rips through both rooms. It was definitely not worth the money, and I’ll be staying elsewhere next year.

title: Staff response was nonexistent!
text: Room had black mold around the shower and the management did not care that the room was not set up for guests. After 14 attempts and going to a manager in person I was moved to another room at 8pm at night.

title: Great
text:
Great location...very clean ! Very near of busstation. Cool rooms ! Times Square was quite near.
Air condition worked perfectly. Also quite near of pier 88 where all the cruise ships leave.
I have been here earlier and will come again !

title: Buen hotel
text: Hotel muy bien situado para poder visitar NY sin problemas. Limpio. Personal muy amable, ayudándote en todo momento. El desayuno podría ser más variado, incluir algo de fruta o bollería en el desayuno básico (15$).

title: Muy buena calidad-precio.
text:
El colchón es muy comodo, el baño muy funcional y tiene todo lo que se pueda necesitar.

Como "pega" decir que la habitación es algo pequeña (como la mayoria en Nueva York) pero esta aprovechada al máximo; la cama se hace sofá para tener mas espacio. Lo vería un inconveniente en caso de llevar + 2 maletas como fue en nuestro caso.

title: Weekend Getaway
text: It was an okay stay. I expected more out of having an above average room. The queen corner room with ceiling to floor windows was not clean, I found clothing tags on the floor in plain site of previous customers. There was no shower curtain and the control panel for the air conditioning/heat did not work.

title: Great stay, perfekt location,
text: We stayed here 10 years ago. We got an free upgrade to a bigger room with jacuzzi on the balkony. I absolutely loved my stay here. I was worried because of all the bad reviews but I can't complain about anything. The staff was ever so nice and helpful, everything was clean, to store the luggage after check out only cost 2$ per luggage, that's a fair price, and the guys at the desk are so helpful with any questions. If I go to NY again I definitely come here again. Perfect location to get around easy

title: A bummer of a birthday trip
text: There were little knats crawling in the drain of both the sink and the shower in the bathroom. I did not request a handicap room but was given one anyway which i thought was odd. The carpet was sticky and there were no bedside trays in our room. Room service barged into our room in the morning without invitation and woke us up. There was also knocking at our door in the middle of the night which we did not appreciate. The vending machines were extremely over priced which we did not enjoy, but that was expected. Overall 4/10 stay for my birthday trip and we will definitely not be returning.

title: Disappointing and upset by hotels non actions.
text:
I never usually write bad reviews, but this one had to be done. Stayed 2nights in Yotel, room was basic and compact perfect for busy site seeing trip. Room could do with some TLC, plugs hanging off beside bed. Area was rough with a lot of homeless. My main issue…On the 2nd night we returned to the hotel to a large party ongoing in room across the way. Several people in one room. Weed Smoke filled the hallway and into our room, to the extent our clothes smelled for days until washed! The party Continued from 12-6am, in and out of room, shouting and fighting hitting walls. On several occasions I tried to ring reception and different extensions on hotel phone, reaching an automated system, held on line for someone to speak to but no one ever answered. We were afraid to leave room to get assistance with the aggressive nature outside in hall way. We got no sleep, which extremely hindered our full day of sightseeing the next day. In the morning we spoke to a staff member at the desk. He called security who stated because we did not report it on the night he could not do anything about it!! I explained how on several occasions both I and my sister who was 2 rooms down from us had tried to get help to no avail.
Our details were left for the manger to contact us. We did not hear from manger, we returned later to be told she was in a meeting, and given her card. We were informed she would contact us. I sent an email to her work email on the card. Detailing the full night we had. That was 6 days ago and still no reply!! I sent a reminder email. My sister was staying on for a further two nights after us and she experienced the same awful goings on 2rooms down from us,  she never received a call or anything from the hotel. We were extremely disappointed and upset that the hotel have not made any contact. The lack of sleep and being subjected to continuous weed smell and smoke into our room was awful. The noise level had to have been heard by other guests on other floors also. 
We will not be returning or recommending this hotel.

title: Last minute booking
text:
Good location for everything we wanted to do. 
Bed was very comfortable but bathroom needs updating as shower leaked. 
Great that they stored our suitcases once we checked out, so we could do some last minute sightseeing before our flight home. 
Only downside was that the corridors smelt of marijuana!

title: Hôtel à recommander
text: Je recommande cet hôtel. Bien sûr le tarif n'est pas donné mais on est à 15 min à pied du métro. Le personnel à l'accueil est aimable. Notre chambre au 20ème étage nous a donné toute satisfaction étant donné que nous n'y étions que pour dormir. Un remerciement spécial  aux 2 personnes qui sont au petit déjeuner à la cafétaria le long de la terrasse. Nous y avons pris nos 7 petits déjeuner pour un prix très correct pour New York.

title: Great Hotel, great price
text:
A small basic but very clean room, the staff are friendly and helpful. Breakfast at the Green Fig is great value too.
We spent 4 nights here and would 100% come back again.
Excellent location for walking or taking the subway all over New York

title: Great location, small rooms.
text: The location of the Yotel is great, but the rooms are small and when the bed doesn't move into a couch it becomes even smaller. There is not much common space if the weather is bad but if it's nice the outdoor patio is great to hang out.

title: Family trip to NYC
text: We have just returned home from a 5 night stay at Hotel Yotel and had a great stay. The hotel is in a great location 10/15 min walk from Times Square. The  subway is also a short walk away. The rooms weren't huge but certainly not tiny. The reclining bed is a great way to save space when getting ready. The shower was great and we had a fab view of the city. There wasn't a lot of storage but we knew this and it wasn't a problem for us. There is an iron which was handy. There was a smart TV in the room which you could link to home netflix etc.. The staff were friendly and always someone on hand to ask a question. They are clearly trying to make this a self serve hotel but not sure they are quite there yet e.g. self check in machines but still need to go to desk if you have multiple rooms booked which we did. The staff arranged a taxi for us back to JFK. It was a flat rate of $95 plus tip. ( be mindful they charged us an extra $10 for paying on card) We didn't eat at the hotel so can't comment on this but there is a fab diner called Westway diner 5 mins up the road for anyone looking for local recommendations 😀 overall we enjoyed our stay and would highly recommend for a budget hotel in NYC!

title: Not great for the money
text: I did not enjoy my stay here as I was charged for every little thing making My stay over $400 for one night. The location is not great, a block up and over would be a better location and closer to restaurants and things to do the room was very small, and felt like a hostel. There was no soundproofing so the room was very loud and the room has a lot of wear and tear. It did not feel fresh or new as this is advertised as a modern hotel,

title: Horrible. Dirty, broken and not even a duvet!!
text: I would never recommend it. 258$ of a property fee for a property that is dirty and old. My TV doesn’t work, my plug doesn’t work, my USB doesn’t work, they haven’t even provided me with a duvet, just a bed sheet. The fact that I booked with a third party that showed lovely pictures and when I arrived I found out that my room didn’t even seemed part of the same hotel in the pictures… horrendous but since it has been paid in advanced I have to stay for the rest of the week otherwise I would be out. I am honestly just crying in my room as I write this… STAY AWAY

My stay at this property was amazing. The room had a very nice view and it was clean. The staff was friendly and professional. I also felt safe at this location. My boyfriend and I loved it. Definitely coming back!

title: AMAZING view and convenient location
text: Really enjoyed our stay! Ended up getting upgraded to a corner suite on the top floor and the view was amazing! Really loved the lighting in the room. Good value for the price. I will say, judging by the size of a corner queen suite, I kind of shudder to think how tiny the normal rooms must be, but we enjoyed our upgrade and stay overall.

title: Ci tornerei volentieri
text: Mi sono trovata davvero benissimo. Personale in reception super educato e pronto sempre ad aiutarti. Camere pulite ( ogni mattina ti sistemano tutto), insonorizzate e con vista stupenda. Ottima anche come posizione, super centrale!

title: excelente
text: la ubicación es perfecta, y las cabinas tienen lo necesario para tu estancia, son muy bonitas y modernas, son muy coloridas y la temperatura muy agradable ni siquiera utilizamos calefaccion a pesar de estar muy frio en NY toda la semana,

title: In need of a serious round of preventive maintenance
text:
a great location near Javits, hobbled by “modern, labor saving ideas” like a luggage robot that’s, kiosks for check in that have never worked, but saved by a delightful staff who go out of the way
to help and make you feel welcome
 clean but small rooms even by nyc standards. not very convenient to subways. very convenient to Javits Center and Hudson Yards. Needs better maintenance of the physical property as many things are in “just ok” to poor condition.

title: Avoid the breakfast!!
text:
The overall experience was good and I would return.

Request a room on an upper floor and NOT facing 42nd Street to avoid excessive noise from car horns and sirens.

I would not recommend the breakfast, even if it was free. The Westway Diner is close by and very good.

title: Yotel yo good
text: Well positioned hotel with friendly accommodating staff. Room was clean breakfast well priced and enjoyable. We had a great view of the Empire State Building. Only down side was no tea/coffee in the room, but there was a grab and go cafe available.

title: Relatively cheap, location OK ... not as good as the photos
text: Room very worn (gouged woodwork, stained sink, missing room-divider curtain, electrical outlet/USB socket panel mounted upside down and loose, smoke detector - I think - covered with plastic bag: have photo), bed comfortable, lots of noise (people and plumbing) during the night, Wi-Fi unreliable and slow (cellular better!), concierge helpful.  Have to take two lifts to get to hotel rooms which is a faff.  Three blocks to nearest subway station (Port Authority Bus Terminal on 8th/42nd)

title: Great Service in a Great Location
text: Overall, the team at Yotel is great. Very helpful. The room was suitable for our needs because we really only needed it to sleep in. You are right near Times Square, but not in the thick of it. The cleaning service was inconsistent and the pillows a bit lumpy, but overall we were happy.

title: Just ok
text: Small rooms, unconventional check-in, elevator transfer on the 4th floor. There are better hotel options in the area that you should consider. There are no ice buckets in the rooms because, we’ll, the rooms are that small.

title: Covers all the basics. In dire need of upgrades
text: If you are looking for a place to crash, perhaps this will fit your bill. The price is enticing, but you also get what you pay for. There’s lack of privacy in the rooms (washroom is within a few feet from the bed with no full door) and the bedroom itself is starting to show its age (cracks in the wall and baseboards). Never got to see the robot (Yobot) in action because it malfunctioned. If you are going as a family I recommend looking elsewhere but this is fine if traveling solo.

title: NY Fun Trip
text: This is a bare-bones hotel--no amenities except hair dryer and ironing board. No coffee machine or extra blankets and pillows. Lighting is terrible and staff is not responsive to requests for help. The Yobot for storing luggage was nice, however.

title: Great location, clean room and helpful staff
text: We stayed for 5 days and spent most of our time out exploring and enjoying the city - which is why we chose this hotel - the location, which is great. Room was small (but most NYC rooms are) but perfectly formed. Very  Clean and the bed was very comfy and adjusted to make more room.Shower very good and full size shower and shampoo products provided . Front of hotel staff were very friendly and helpful when asked questions and booked a cab for us for return journey to airport. Breakfast is expensive so only used it once, cheaper to eat out. Only negative- Could not for the life of me figure out the coffee vending machine on level 4, gasping for a hot cup of something in the morning but not prepared to pay $22.50 just to get  in for breakfast to get a hot drink. If you want value for money and good location to walk to everything this is a good bet.

title: Gutes Konzept, hat aber schon bessere Zeiten gesehen
text:
Wir waren das dritte mal im Yotel, leider hat es spürbar nachgelassen. Früher gab es Kaffee und Muffins undman konnte auf die Terasse. Jetzt ist diese ausschließlich für das Restaurant und Frühstüjck kann man teuer kaaufen oder an einer Art Kiosk was kaufen. 
Die Zimmer sind inzwischen abgeschabt,zwischendurch mal streichen oder Kleinigkeiten reparieren hätte geholfen, denn dasHotelkonzept ist nach wie vor super.
Dass es anders geht sieht man im Yotel Boston - da waren wir kurz danach und das hatte noch einen guten Standard.
Noch ein Tipp: nicht den Yobot nutzen - den Roboter für die Koffer,der funktioniert nicht und das ganze hat uns bestimmt 2h gekostet die man in NY besser verbrinben kann

title: hotel queen
text: bed was not a queen size and the mattress was very soft , room was quite small and no privacy when on toilet  we was on the 25th floor and the view was great . also not far from the metro station and about a 15m walk to times square

title: YOTEL stay 10/23
text: When I arrived to YOTEL for my stay I noticed the bed was broken (this is why I stay at the hotel) and when I brought it up to the front desk 3 days in a row all they said was “sorry we’re completely booked you’ll have to come back” one night when I tried to talk to a woman at the front desk she gave me a lot of attitude like I paid $2000 for a room only to get a broken bed and I also asked if there was some type of discount I could get due to the broken bed and no available rooms seeing as it was the weekend of New York comic con and I FINALLY got the sweetest girl on Sunday who moved me into a different room

title: great stay
text: just back from 5 nights in yotel. could not fault this hotel. read reviews previous to our stay and wasn’t sure but the staff are so helpful our room was brilliant small but newyork hotels are all small. it was cleaned so well everyday fresh towels and always had hot water the bed was also very comfortable. the staff were so helpful when checking out got us a taxi to airport when we didn’t have one organised they couldn’t have done enough. as for safety there were always men on reception at night time felt very safe. would definitely stay again.

title: NYCC 23 Yotel Stay
text: The Stay was great for the most part.  Shower door shattering after my shower, not so much.  The front desk could've handled it better during check out instead of just waving the facility fee for 1 day,

title: Okay, but I wouldn’t stay here again
text: Definitely better hotels to select from so do your research and choose wisely. Hotel needs a revamp in general. Seems more concerned with charging you for all sorts of things rather than delivering quality to customers

title: Unforgettable.we loved everything. What an amazing trip.
text: Wonderful. The front staff is extremely helpful and kind they solved any problems or questions that we might have. Everything was very clean and in the center of the town. I will highly recommend this hotel. Best regards to all. I hope to return one day and if I do so I definitely stay at this hotel. Ana Sousa

title: Ideal for a city break
text: The hotel was very clean, comfortable and perfect for our trip. You had the option to check in/out yourself using the kiosks (plenty of staff on hand to help you) or use the staffed Mission Control. Everyone there was very pleasant and helpful and we really enjoyed our stay. Our view from our room impressive and we definitely felt part of NYC.

title: Expected Better
text:
Stayed with the family for one night. I expected a bit more from the room for the price. The furniture was a bit worn and there was visible dust grime in multiple spots, as well as mold in the shower. 

The bunk beds were great for the kids, and the beds were comfortable. Staff were attentive and helpful!

title: Excellent location!
text: Location is great for travel links and reaching key sights. The hotel is close to Times Square but far enough away that you’re not disturbed by the hustle and bustle. The room is quite basic but comfortable and suited our needs for a good nights sleep in a clean comfy room, it is quite small but that was fine for us. The view from our room was AMAZING to wake up to each day.

title: The true NYC experience - small and expensive
text: So the little capsule cabin was small, didn't even have a place for my suitcase, and was hard to navigate the shower/toilet with the limited space. Bed was comfortable and location was good. Basically, trying to be hip, technology-forward hostel-like vibes - if that's your thing, you might enjoy more than I did. I think I'd appreciate it more if it wasn't so expensive! Won't be going again or trying any of their other properties.

title: Great crash pad.
text: Hotel was great for what it was, just needed better cleaning of our shower, and our thermostat wasn't great. Loved how close to the subway we were, nice central location. Friendly staff, easily accessible and unsuspecting.

title: Very good hotel, great location at a very good price
text: The Yotel New York is a very good hotel with high level of services and has a great location. Very close to Time Square, Broadway shows and shopping areas. Next time, I will stay at the Yotel New York.

title: Not the best place to stay
text: We chose this hotel due to it's proximity to my sons apartment. we check in at the front desk due to self check units were down. Room was clean however very warm. We thought it was due to our arrive late. Next morning we woke up and it was 79 in the room. Check front desk late morning to let them know they said they would send someone up. We left the hotel before noon and was not back to around 11 pm NOTHING HAD BEEN DONE and the room was 80.. We were tired from site seeing and had to make to calls to get some to get someone up to look at it. It was over 45 mins before the young man came up and reset the unit and it took another 1 to cool down enough to sleep. Also had requested extra towels and wash clothes that never arrived. We will probably stay here again ONLY because it's a five min. walk to sons apartment. I would recommend by passing if you don't need this neighbor hood.

title: Give it a Try
text: Upon entering the hotel,  you're greeted by at least a handful of friendly staff that are there to assist you with thy automated check in system.  When you get up to your hotel, it is clean, bright & must importantly: quiet.  The only downsides of this hotel were: 1. There no outlets by either side of the bed so you literally have to keep getting up to check on your phone if it's plugged in.  2. No mini fridge. They offer these paper buckets with plastic lining,  but it's useless because the ice melted within 15, 20 mins.  But overall it is a great hotel; everything was within walkingdistance.  I would visit again for sure.

title: Worst Hotel to stay in NYC
text: If you want to spend a lot of money for a little small dirty room experience, rude staff and full/queen bed for what you think is a queen bed this is the hotel for you. New Yorkers working in a hotel is exactly what you expect, might as well been a “showtime” show in a train as a hotel experience. Hotel staff does not upkeep and will default to not cleaning because the hotel is old. They may also run in on you opening the door on you as you sleep. Horrible experience less than 0/100 would recommend to anyone

title: Yotel
text:
Yousef Ushantha your men to go over there! Excellent service !! We stayed there 9 night and the whole stay was a blast! Thanks yotel, greetings!

Fyi: the walk to the time square is only 10 minutes ;)

title: Lovely stay in NYC
text: I recently stayed at this hotel in NYC on my own and it was very pleasant. From the service to the rooms everything was perfect. The staff especially were so helpful when I needed recommendations for food places as I got given a piece of paper with places on so I knew where was best to go. As well the day I was leaving they sorted out a taxi for me to the airport and gave me the advice to get one early as it would be extra busy that day. The rooftop bar was great as well, great drink options and again very approachable and helpful staff, a lovely waiter who had served me the night before had recognised me the next night so took his time to say hello again, very good customer service! The room was just as I expected it to be, loved the open plan aspect of it and the bed was very comfy. Great for location as well as most things were in walking distance especially Times Square! Overall a great stay and I’ll definitely be back in the near future!

title: Fair place if you just want live in central Manhattan
text: The room was not clean. Some of the stains I can even swipe myself easily. Besides, the sink is clogged up. Every floors have sign for water dispenser / ice maker, but only specific floors have the machine (and, many of them were broken). YOBOT looks really cool, but it is extremely hard to get a space to put your luggage when check out. It is full nearly all time and you may need to pay extra bucks to leave the luggage with the staff. All in all I won't recommend it except for the location.

title: Small room - great service!
text:
Good location for visiting Hells Kitchen and the Javits Center. Good price/quality.

The room was very small but the service was huge. Yotel staff is very welcoming and helpful. Special thanks to Yousef!

title: Like an older cruise ship,
text: Perfectly fine New York hotel that felt like it was in need of some upgrades. Small rooms are well designed, but maybe could use some refresh. Things like ice machines were not working on many floors, and on the Internet-promoted main fourth floor there wasn’t a customer service option to address needs (nor an open bar for guests at night). Hotel staff seemed nice and attentive.Pleasant surprise: the rainshower showerhead was very nice.

title: Good experience
text: Very well situated for my needs- 8 minutes walking to the Javits Center and 15 minutes walking to Time Square. Small room but slept well and very clean. The staff was awesome and always available. A bit strange that we have to change elevators to go to the rooms.

title: breve visita a NYC
text: hotel moderno..centrale dentro all edificio c e un ristorante con una bella terrazza ..un bar x colazione.. la camera non grandissima ma pulita .. divertente il letto che si allunga.. personale gentile e disponibile..beccato che per sciopero aereo perso una notte che non ci rimborseranni..

title: Good enough
text: It is just about good enough. One missing point is breakfast. Choices are limited. It could be better. Yotel charged two dollers to keep luggage before you check in. They only take cash. It was not great experience.

title: Wonderful stay!
text: I have been to 5star hotels all over the globe but my stay at the Yotel surpasses all so far.  The service is world class. Rooms are spacious for NYC. LOCATION LOCATION LOCATION. Such a convenient location for both walkable activities and easy access to subways to navigate the city. Need a bite to eat, there a great deli across the street open 24/7. Ask for Chris, he makes the best chicken caesar wrap. Highly recommend staying here if you need to be in the NYC area.

title: Good location
text: Good location ,checkin easy via automated checkin.Room compact and clean but no privacy from sink area to bedroom,curtain track in place but no curtain in situ lacking privacy.Lots of restaurants and bars nearby.Would recommend staying here good location slightly away from main Times Square.

title: Trop cher
text: Bien situé à qlq 30 min de Time square. Comptoir/ Réception riquiqui pour un hôtel de 699 chambres. Chambres très étroites. Linge correcte. Ascenseurs disponibles et en nombre suffisant.Garde bagages payant. Coût exorbitant mais c'est Manhattan. Ne mérite pas plus que 3 étoiles.A ce tarif je n'y retournerai point.

title: Só indicado para jovens e gente descolada
text: A localização é ótima , recepção excelente, ótimo café da manhã, mas........ os quartos são uma decepção, tem tudo que precisa, mas nada é bom: a cama é dobrável, o cheiro desagradável, banheiro muito pequeno, enfim é um Hotel para jovens, mochileiros e gente descolada, o que não é meu caso. Minha avaliação é de que vale a pena para a garotada, se você é melhor idade melhor não ir.

title: Décevant
text: Chambres sentant l’humidité à notre arrivée, toutes nos affaires étaient humide dans nos valises, trace d’infiltration sur les murs, propreté à revoir ( trace d’eau dans la douche, poussière sur le meubles…..), mobilier de mauvais qualité avec beaucoup d’éclat, aucune insonorisation avec l’extérieur dans un quartier très bruyant, lit très petit et pas très confortable. Hôtel pas très bien desservi par les transports en commun. Extrêmement déçu du rapport qualité prix

title: Be prepared for basic service and rooms
text: Yotel is very literally a bed for the night. The rooms are very basic with an orthopaedic style bed that folds out at the flick of a switch. On my first night, straight off a flight from London, I was woken at around 5am by a relentless whining sound. It was the elevator. I asked to be moved and was given - a room on the other side of the same elevator. Then had to explain that I wanted a room AWAY from the elevator. Finally, got some peace. No great choice at breakfast - again, basic. But service was efficient. Rooftop bar nice enough and had a tasty ribs dish. But just be aware this is a very automated hotel. Check-in and out at a computer screen and if you leave your bags after check-out, a machine grabs and dumps them. Nobody seemed to have gone for that option. Also, for older folks, this is a very young hotel. It's for twenty-somethings who were backpacking and youth hosteling five years before.

title: Viajes de novios
text:
Los trabajadores de Recepcion no saben nada de nada español. Me tuvieron que ayudar otros trabajadores que se dedican a subir maletas. En concreto yousef. Un tío muy competente, dispuesto a ayudarte en cualquier cosa y muy servicial. 

La habitación pequeña, y olía a pie. No estaba limpia… mucho lío para subir, hay que hacer cambios de ascensor y cansa mucho los cambios. 

Hotel a 10 min de time square,  relativamente bien situado. 

Recalcar que yousef es un trabajador de 10, me ayudó en todo, me acompaño a comprar una tarjeta frente por frente para así poder pagar las tasas del hotel. 
Un tío que debería subir de puesto. Esa persona tiene futuro. Un trabajador nato.

Gracias por la estancia, nos la hicistes muy fácil y divertida nuestra primera vez en eeuu.

Saludos!!!

title: Disappointed ☹️
text: Hi although some positive areas, 4 day holiday spoiled as we were allocated room 403 on first floor. OMG do not take any rooms on this floor unless you like loud music and wish to stay up late. We were up 7am to start our day came back about 10pm so ready for sleep. Our room was sandwiched between the outside terrace a glass door, no window and an event room that provides entertainment. Asked to be moved the next day told no it was full. We could also hear what next door were listening to on the tv. As there are so many other hotels to choose from I will not be back.

title: Lovely Hotel and Location
text:
Reading some of the reviews I was a little concern as a solo traveller to my surprise absolutely beautiful stay, the staff were amazing nothing was to much for them to do, my housekeeper maintained my room everyday absolutely spotless 21st floor (thank you), beautiful roof terrace to relax and unwind I agree a few things slightly were and tear. My only disappointment was the BREACKFAST!!!!! NOT value for money at all your choices are very limited for $24 dollars all inclusive, it would be nice to have more than one cereal choice, maybe bacon or turkey rashers, nice size cooked sausages, grill tomatoes and mushrooms.

Thank you all definitely will return.

title: Wow.. just WOW!!
text: Hotels pretty and amazing. The view i had from the 17th floor WOW! Staff is very friendly and helpful. Cleaners do a very good job. Normally this hotel is unfortunately out of my price range but i had a good deal. If i am able to i will DEF. Stay here again!

title: Will definitely visit again
text:
Really enjoyed my stay! I was in New York for 5 nights with a friend and the room was clean, comfortable and spacious. Location was fantastic, Times Square is only a few minutes away. Bryant Park and Grand Central are about 15 mins walk. 
The staff are friendly, helpful and easy to approach. Always able to help with queries and housekeeping are fab! 
We were on the 14th floor with great views being a corner unit. 
The rooftop is lovely, service there is great. Food is really good.
They will look after luggage after you check out for $2 per item and arrange an airport transfer for $82 fare. 
I would definitely stay here again!

title: Igiene scarsa

title: Great Hotel, Great Location, Great staff
text:
We were a bit apprehensive before our stay at Yotel after reading some mixed reviews prior to our trip to New York.
However our worries were totally unfounded. Our stay was very enjoyable indeed. 
We stayed in a 'premium queen' cabin. Whilst fairly small it was perfect for a four night stay, the bed was extremely comfortable, (room was tidy and bed sheets replaced every day) with a shower room, toilet, wash basin, iron & ironing board, hairdryer, large tv, bedside desk with four charging USB points. 
We had read that the bed extended via a button and when it was fully extended there was no room to walk around the end of the bed. This is NOT true, there was plenty of room for you to comforatbly walk past should the need arise in the night. 
After a hectic day sightseeing around the City, the rooftop bar and lounge on the 4th floor was the perfect venue to unwind and relax before bed. There was a small but decent choice of snacks, meals & desserts to choose from for a reasonable price. 
The staff were excellent from the check in guys on duty in the lobby to the waiting on staff in the bar & lounge. 
There was a small kiosk (also on level 4) where you could grab a coffee and a pastry before heading out for the day. 
We didnt use the robot with regards to our luggage storage on our departure day but for a fee of just $2 per bag, the staff lablled up and stored our luggage for us until our taxi to the airport picked us up.
This was another service the guys on reception sorted for us, they booked us a taxi for a flat fee of $85, this may sound a bit high but our fee from the airport to the hotel (with the familiar yellow taxis) was just over $100 including toll fees and tip. 
The location was really good, with Times Square being just under a mile away. For any able bodied person this was a 10-15 minute walk.
With my mobility not good at all and my wife not a fan of the subway, I downloaded an app called My Transit and this proved to be an invaluable tool for getting around the City by bus, just find the route for your desired location, get on at the recommended bus stop, all within 25 yards of the hotel entrance and scan your phone (if you have a google pay etc) or your 
credit/debit card and get across the City for the equivalent of 89p. 

All in all we would definitley recommend a stay at the Yotel and would like to thank all the staff for their help and kindness.

title: Not worth it
text: The hotel is like an Ibis but charging like Shangri la. It doesn’t worth the bang for the buck. Relatively clean, good restaurant with a terrace in the forth floor. The area is not good, too many homeless people and drugged. One thing that really disappointed is the fact that I spent thousands of dollars staying in the hotel and to leave my 2 bags to be picked up couple of minutes later they charged “2 dollars” per bag. First time ever you I’ve experienced something like this

title: No estuvieron a la altura de las circunstancias
text:
Les voy a contar mi experiencia. Viajamos en familia, teníamos dos habitaciones dobles. El último día, salimos muy pronto para irnos de excursión a Whashington y regresamos sobre las 21.30 horas, muy cansados y con ganas de ducharnos y descansar. Pues bien, resulta que esas misma mañana (sobre las 8 de la mañana) una enorme grúa que estaba en el edificio contiguo al hotel, se incendió y se desplomó una parte sobre nuestro hotel. Cuando llegamos al hotel por la noche y sin que el personal del hotel HUBIERA HECHO LA MÁS MÍNIMA GESTIÓN para localizarnos por teléfono durante todo el día, nos dijeron:
1. Que debíamos evacuar nuestras habitaciones urgentemente, porque había riesgo por la caída de la grúa
2. Que DEBÍAMOS BUSCARNOS un hotel
¡No podíamos creerlo! Nos vimos por las calles céntricas de Nueva York a la desesperada, paseando cuatro maletas, buscando un hotel para poder dormir.....
EL final de la historia es que encontramos uno, el cuarto en nuestra búsqueda.
Nadie de YOTEL se preocupó por nosotros (por supuesto ninguna indemnización), así que tengo muy claro dos cosas: que vamos a regresar a Nueva York algún día y que NUNCA regresaremos a este hotel por su gestión sobre la incidencia que padecimos

title: BEST HOTEL STAY IN NYC EVER
text: I will never stay at another hotel in NYC. This hotel was the best stay I have ever had at the most affordable. The room was spotless, clean, futuristic, great lighting, and the staff was extremely professional. The ambiance of the hotel is so chill. The food and coffee in the lobby was also really good and affordable. I could go on and on but you have to experience it yourself...

title: An ok hotel
text:
The good -
Location not bad but it isn’t Times Square. 
Very clean. 
Concierge (loads of info and very helpful)
Beds are very comfortable 

The bad -
The Lack of privacy in the room. Just why they decided on an open plan bedroom bathroom is beyond me. 
No working TV in our room. We asked twice for it to be looked into and twice they came in and failed to fix it (no communication on what the issue was ????)

title: Happy Holiday
text: Amazing and amazing stay …..All the staff specially Mr Stephen is very very helpful not only to me but I noticed him helping everyone…..Keep it up Stephen…..Excellent room cleaning by Mili very pleasant women to talk with…

title: Just...meh
text:
The hotel is showing signs of aging and it doesn't seem like they are keeping in top of repairs. Not worth the price. Can get better deal at another place. My room was run down. The ice machine was boarded up. My air conditioning unit didn't work and they "didn't have any other rooms". The shower had mildew and had been cleaned. But it's too the point where they just need to overhaul the rooms. It's your going to charge these prices you should be offering a better level of service. 

The only positive?

title: Good hotel
text: Good hotel and price for the location. Our room was clean and exactly like the picture, small and cozy. We hab a beautiful view of the city!The staff was nice too. We enjoyed our stay and we would definitely go back!

title: Clean, but that’s about as good as it gets.
text:
I’ll start with the good, it was clean and the bed was very comfortable. Furthermore the location is nice and central, with a 15/20mins walk to Times Square. That’s about where it ends I’m afraid. 

Whilst I’m sure some could argue it’s a budget hotel, at nearly $2000 for 5 nights I’d beg to differ. 

We know that Yotels business is in small rooms, so the size was fine with us. But immediately upon walking in you could tell it was in a state of disrepair. Paint peeling, fixtures and fittings loose or damaged.

Then there was our particular rooms location. Just a hallway and some thin walls between us and a night club, which wasn’t very welcome after a long flight. 

Then there was the air con. It genuinely set off the sound warning on my Apple Watch, telling me that prolonged exposure to would damage my hearing. The silver lining being that this did indeed drown out the aforementioned night club. 

To top this off, we had issues when a friend left his bag in our room. The key was faulty, and they refused to make another for him. I had to travel across New York to give him mine. 

Finally, they seem to have a bit of an issue with anti social behaviour in the hotel. Either overly drunk people or kids running up and down the halls at night added to our frustration.

title: Overall nice stay.
text: The staff were very helpful and efficient from the moment I arrived until I checked out. Housekeeping also did a good job even under the circumstances that my cabin had old permanent stains that couldn’t be removed. The rooms are as they look on the website so there’s no false advertising there, although the quality of the towels could be better.

title: 2nd time visiting - work required before I return
text:
2nd time staying at Yotel midtown (previously Feb 18) and it doesn't appear that any work has been done during that time. The location of this hotel is great and only a stone's throw away from Times Square and other attractions and it has lots of great shops/restaurants within walking distance. 

Rooms were starting to show their age with chipped paint, marked walls and ripped bed surrounds and the issue of the corridors smelling like weed is still ever present. 

We stayed in a corner room rather than a cabin this time and the upgrade felt worth it, more room for cases/shopping and being able to walk around the room made it feel a lot bigger. The added bonus of a fridge was great as easy to stock from the grocery store across the road. 

All of the staff we dealt with here were great and happy to help but as mentioned I think the management now needs to turn their attention to room renovation so they don't get left behind.

title: Value for money.
text: Great location and happy we stayed at Yotel. We just wanted a base and a place to sleep as we spent all day out. This is not an incredible hotel by any means but we didn't pay top $$$ for our 3 nights stay.  So if you're realistic with your needs and your budget, it is not a bad choice.
