title: Filthy, dirty, and Old rooms.
text: Room was incredibly dirty. We have photos to prove it. We didn’t even dare shower or use the towels. I would NOT recommend this hotel. 4th floor was very cool and nothing like guest rooms. Thank God it was only one night. It Looked NOTHING like website pictures.

title: If it ain’t broke don’t fix it.
text: These rooms remind me of the bauhaus movement. These are not rooms designed for humans. These are machines for living. However, these rooms are not designed with care or forethought like the architects of the 20th century. The sink is too shallow to hold your hands underneath the faucet. There is no fridge, which, for $300 a night, should be a given - I was unable to save my takeout for the next day. The trendy purple lighting is grating and cheesy and can’t be toggled unless you’re at the terminal. The curtains that go down at the push of a button are not intuitive (the button to shift them is on the other side of the room) and were not functional and necessitated a visit from the front desk. Because they couldn’t close all the way, I slept poorly due to the light of the city streaming in through the window. The rounded, austere aesthetic isn’t pleasant to look at and lacks all humanity. These rooms were designed for simplicity and ease of use, but they only go to prove that if if it ain’t broke, don’t fix it. Sometimes being able to tug on a curtain to close it, or turn off a light physically, or having a traditional sink, isn’t only faster, but they’re more intuitive and offer more control. The cute-sy branding of “Mission Control” and other Yotel monikers for the hideous in-room phone makes it difficult to decipher who I’m calling. I want the front desk/concierge. Who is Mission Control? I knew this place wasn’t going to be to my liking when I walked in to find that I have to check in at a kiosk. After a day of using kiosks at the airport, kiosks for the subway, kiosks for everything, it would have been nice to interact with a human being. The lobby was packed with people and offered little to no wiggle room to get around. You can’t even take the elevator to your floor as you would in most hotels. You have to take it to floor 4 and transfer to another elevator to get to your “cabins.” I was rolling my eyes the whole time. The shower was mislabeled - it needed to be on the cold side to get hot water and the hot side to get cold water. I’m a young millennial and I hate to think how older generations fare at these hotels.

title: Never again
text: I went 10 years ago and it was a much better expérience at this Time that the reason i booked this Time but very unhappy this Time.  The gave us a room on 8th floor overloooking thé terrace on 8th floor where there was a private évent very noisy until very late.  No coffee machine, shower do not drain and phone was out of service.

title: Great Location
text: Hotel is right in the heart of New York City within walking distance to almost all areas of interest. We had such a good time at bars and other eateries in the area. Plus, Central Park and a short cruise on the Hudson River was part of our trip adventures and we actually walk to these areas to avoid the traffic drama in the area.

title: Give it a try
text: The rooms are very small with hardly any storage, but the comfy bed makes up for it, we enjoyed our stay on the 20th floor great views and an amazing location.  Not quite sure what we gained with the nightly room charge but I understand why they have it.  The staff were all very friendly and helpful.  Will definitely stay there again due to how close it was to everything

title: Many pleasant suprises
text:
Solo room; had a double bed comfortable. Room was quiet with a great view. Great location.
Room was showing a little wear, however nothing concerning. Overall exceeded my expectations. Fill service hotel

title: Great location!
text: The location was great as we could walk safely to most places. The luggage robot wasn’t working so that was a pain. We had the corner room and the view was worth the few issues we had. There were issues without booking and we had to cancel a reservation which we couldn’t do online. The guys in the lobby were very helpful. We didn’t use the stuff on the fourth floor.

title: NON CI TORNEREI
text:
Il primo giorno ho avuto una stanza diversa e il giorno seguente ho dovuto cambiare stanza, dopo un viaggio lungo non ho trovato comodo questa cosa
Non mi è piaciuto il limite della colazione, l'unica cosa dolce da poter mangiare erano i pan cake e tutte le bevande erano a pagamento, esclusa l'acqua, non comprese nel prezzo di $ 20.00 a persona.
Inoltre non ho per nulla gradito dover pagare, oltretutto accettavano solo contanti, $ 12.00 per il deposito bagagli che solitamente è gratuito in tutti gli alberghi, lo stesso staff che ha preso i soldi per i bagagli mi ha proposto il transfer per l'aeroporto JFK al costo di $ 75.00 compreso di fee, pedaaggi etc garantendo il pagamento con carta, peccato che il driver non solo a fatto la strada esterna senza pedaggi (1.45h di viaggio) ma per il pagamento con carta aha aggiunto delle tasse, insomma il totaale è stato circa di $ 90.00
In stanza avevo problemi ad aprire e chiudere la finestra e l'aria condizionata non funzionava, allego foto

title: Ruin my trip - there are tons of decent hotels in this area that’s better than this one
text:
Zero star if I could do.

Hidden fee for everything including any luggage stored
Poorly maintained too with odor and broken components
Rude staff that I cannot imagine 

There are many decent hotels in this area at all level, with better location, way better room and service.

title: good comfortable
text: good comfortable, bedroom is open with the washroom no privacy and there’s a lot of noise during the night with beeps and construction - but bed was comfortable, nice view, looks new which is nice. there was no ice bag in the ice machine and the machine for water had problems

title: Vacaciones de Verano
text:
· Recepción: Un trato genial y profesionalidad. Fácil chec-in chek-out mediante ordenadores (elegible)

· Habitación: El baño, para mi un poco estrecho, y la ducha solo había un grifo, pero suficiente para descansar, ya que pasas horas fuera del hotel viendo la ciudad. 

· Disponibilidad de transporte por si el traslado al aeropuerto fallase por alguna razón. (No fue mi caso, pero un buen punto en tener en cuenta) 

· Cafetería y Restaurante: simpatía y buen ambiente, sobre todo en los dos trabajadores que estaban en la cafetería (ya que íbamos más que al restaurante)

· Ubicación Hotel: Para mí, un buen sitio  ya que teníamos todo planificado desde ahí. Junto con parada de autobús que estaba girando la calle y te dejaba cerca (M42)

title: Trip with my son
text:
Great hotel, good position near the times square and subway Port Authority.
Not so far to visit all attraction.
The personnel of the check in and out shall be speak other languages (ie: French) It will very well.

title: Would return…4/5
text:
We enjoyed our room and the view! Brought my 10 year old and we had a great time. She liked the adjustable bed and the terrace for dessert. 
The staff was friendly. 
In general, there were no frills or extras included in the room, but good for what we needed!

title: Cool acomodation
text:
Very good location very close to Time Square. Comfortable room and friendly staff. The hotel has wonderful views.
It is very close to the Bus stop and well-comunicated by metro. 
I would recomend it and I would use it again when I go back to NY

title: BEST HOTEL in Manhattan! Thank you Marcelino and Chris!
text: Marcelino DeJesus, Chris Martinez and Angelika Klusek  have been assisting me during a difficult time and my stay here has been amazing! I am so thankful for how helpful, understanding and compassionate they have been in helping me make sure my stay here in comfortable being alone going through a separation! I want to extend a HUGE thank you to MARCELINO for all of his hard work, Chris for his help with moving my room and Angelika for making sure my room was well cleaned and taken care of! The staff here is incredible at accommodating to their customers and will be here for a while! 10/10 recommend

title: Low compensation
text: There was hair all over my room. They put me in an accessible room that I did not ask for. I couldn’t change the settings n the TV. There was a dead bug on one of the towels. I took pictures and told the staff about it. All they did was refund the service fee. I don’t think that was fair with all that happened.

title: Small yet efficient
text: Visiting New York on my own for the first time, I was looking for a small room with the bare minimum (bed, toilet and space for bags). Not only did Yotel provided that, but also the view was amazing on the city. Very comfy!

title: Okay for the price
text: The reason I chose this hotel was because of the price/location. It was close to bus stops and to the subway with a little walking. The room was average, feels like the shower could use a deep clean on the edges and the toilet seat was discolored feels like it’s time to replace that. You can see some water damage on the ceilings, but the bed was comfy and wifi was excellent. Also, housekeeping will come by if you want.

title: Excellent staff
text: I have stayed here a couple of times. Stephen at the reception, remembers ny room preferences and always obliges. Raheim from housekeeping never says no to any of my requests. Since i find it difficult to stay away from home and have to most of the times, due to my job, raheim and stephen are always there to make me feel at home and not homesick. Raheim caters to the smallest of things that i may need during my stay. Thank you Stephen and Raheim for making my stay at yotel comfortable. God bless you both.

title: Good location. Room feels weary Watch out hidden charges such as facility fee
text: Good location close to Time Square and a few other tourist hot spots. Our room feels a bit weary. Bed head, wash basin and shower a bit weary. The mini fridge is very noisy. Room is clean though. Watch out hidden charges such as facility fee. Will definitely choose a different hotel next time.

title: Never again
text:
We had to pay $300 extra for taxes (7 nights and 2 person) and the views to the Empire State Building was terrible.
At first the staff gave to us a room with no views to te Empire State Building, but we booked a room with views. Then, they changed to us and the new room had a views to a 2% of the building??
Terrible.

title: Just Don’t
text: We initially checked in to room 1238 and it was in a disgusting state with stains on the walls, carpet and bed sheets, cracks in walls, some kind of build up under the sink, rips in the bed, bathroom lights not working, and holes in the wall, so we asked for a second room. They put us in room 1826. Same story in that one - worse, even. There were stains on the bed sheets, walls, and carpets. Mold lined the shower and the air vents were CAKED in dust. There were rips in the bed and holes in the wall. The employees were all very rude to us throughout the room switch that we were scared to ask for another. We had to brace it and stay since we didn’t have the money to find another hotel to stay with such late notice. They also messed up our reservation so they had us checking out a day earlier than what we booked. They didn’t offer any kind of solution so we had to scramble to make plans to figure out what to do. I do NOT recommend ever staying here!

title: Très bon service

The room was clean. They have a nice patio and the cocktails were good. It wasn't busy so we didn't need reservations. You can leave you luggage in storage but you have to use a robot that is SLOW, we waited in line almost 15 min to drop off our bags. The ice/water machine on our floor didn't work and the restaurant downstairs would not give us water without dining with them. The bathroom has no counter space and the shower lacks a shelf and doesn't have a door which I dislike.

title: Cute room in great location

title: Anniversary & Birthday Trip
text: My husband and I stayed at Yotel for a few days and we enjoyed our stay. The room was cleaned and relaxing, food was enjoyable, and location was very close to everywhere we wanted to go. Great experience overall.

title: AMAZING

title: Pleasantly surprised

title: Not too clean

title: Surpassed All Expectations.
text: I expected that as a modern self-sevice hotel, I would get there and have to sort myself out.  Having not stayed at one of these before, but based on negative experiences with similar establishments, I was fully prepared for more of the same.  Instead, landing there late at night, I find a smiling hotel employee assisting someone else. He paused to greet me and say he'd be right with me.  Then, finishing with them, he walked over and said "Spanish, French, English?" to ascertain what language I spoke.  He then proceeded to sign me in on the kiosk system, then direct me what to do next.  It was VERY SIMPLE.   I would recommend this hotel to anyone needing a short-stay hotel with easy access to the centre of  Manhattan.

title: Great first time in NY

title: Cool Concept - Needs Upkeep
text:
My husband and I stayed at Yotel for 3 nights in July. We knew we weren’t going to be spending much time in a hotel, so we weren’t concerned with a large room. Accordingly, Yotel seemed like a great option as it is price-friendly and within walking distance to Time’s Square/ Broadway where we planned on taking in couple shows. 
We are avid cruisers so the small size of the room was not an issue as we’re used to small cabins. In fact, we really liked the layout of the room! It was a very functional space that cleverly utilized every nook. The retractable bed was a smart, space-saving touch and it was surprisingly comfortable. 

My qualm is the room just didn’t feel as clean as I would like. The chipping paint on the walls and the stains on some surfaces might just be optics. The mold around the base of the shower and dirt/ makeup smudges, however, are things that suggest inattention and rushed cleaning practices.  As a result, I felt unsure about the state of the bedding and towels, even though they appeared to be clean. 

These details might be less important to other guests, but it’s something to keep in mind if considering accommodation at Yotel.

That night I needed to find somewhere else to stay due to Yotel needing to be closed for safety reasons. The staff were very helpful and found me  an alternative place to stay. They also ordered a taxi for me and waited with me until it came. I was also given a phone number to call so that I could keep up to date on when they could open up again. title: 9 Day NYC Family (6)Holiday
text:
We arrived at the hotel(party of 6) at 9pm on the 17th, 21 hours late, after our connecting flight was changed. We emailed the hotel to advise this just in case.
Anyway we arrive at the hotel, only to be advised our rooms had been sold on, since we didn't turn up. "its like an aeroplane seat", said the male receptionist, if you don't turn up they will sell the seat again. Now thats not what we wanted to hear, after already missing a days holiday. We are also advised that they were fully booked up, and theres nothing they can do. We had booked flights and hotel thru BA, who also were uncontactable, and so after getting zero assistance from Hotel, even though we had booked for 9 nights, we found accommodation elsewhere for the night.

The following day, after contacting BA, we managed to get ours rooms back, although BA also had trouble getting assistance from Yotel.

Anyways once we got settled in, the rooms were more inviting and spacious that the previous nights IPOD rooms. 
We were expecting compact rooms, but to be fair, it was just what was required.
Smart TV was perfect with a multitude of channels, including HBO movies.
The rain shower and toiletries were perfect.
We were on floor 17, and all 3 rooms had nice views.
The rooms had smart electric  beds, that went to a relining mode(ours didn't work, but we never asked to get it fixed)
Although compact, theres enough space for storing suitcases, hanging up clothes, drawers for smaller items. 
Rooms came with an ironing board and iron, hair dryer and safe.
The beds were extremely comfortable, with ample pillows.

The rooms were valeted daily, and looked great, but looking closer at the fixtures and fittings, you could see they all needed slightly better deep cleaning. 
All in all the standard of the rooms was better than i was expecting, going by some past reviews.

The hotel entrance is manned by two receptionists and 3-4 concierge.Apart from the unhelpful first night, they could not be faulted and were courteous and helpful.

There is a nice meeting/dining/outside area on level 4.

Location is perfect. not to far from the craziness of times Sq, but far enough to not get bombarded by crowds when you leave the hotel.

We had 8 nights in there hotel, and although the rooms are compact, we would stay there again.

title: Innovation With Class
text:
Innovation does not have to out shine class, service and comfort. The Yotel Hotel in Manhattan’s West side covered it all. The trendy hotel is manned by friendly and professional guest service, and front area attendants. This crew repeatedly service consumers efficiently while working in a high traffic environment. Some team members went the extra mile to extend a smile and assuring tones of voice depicting the quality service offered. 

     The service extended far beyond the front desk as the trendy high tech themed hotel played upbeat music that draws you out to do more. More like explore the rooftop with stunning views, clean, fresh smelling fitness centers and dining and lounging areas, adding to the value of your experience. Finally, comfortable beds with a somewhat futuristic theme room  that allowed at a buttons touch, a fold up bed for added space in the room. Comfort, great amenities, location and hotel staff.

title: Not good for longer stays. Not worth the price. Overrated.
text: I found this hotel via British Airways holiday search, and then looked for reviews of this hotel and it looked cool on the pictures. It seemed modern and spacious on the photos, but when we first got through the door, we thought is a joke, as first thing after you open the door is a bed ^^ very small room, at least for Premium Queen. Small space between the bed and wall with ‘smart TV’ which wasn’t really smart, no apps whatsoever, couldn’t even connect your phone or tablet. After you passed a bed, you’ll find a sink and shower and a toilet with slide door, which by the way were really heave to operate (toilet one). Toilet was right next to the window, so we weren’t sure if we can be seen from the outside, which made us a bit uncomfortable, so we had to use blinds every time we used it, as door were awkward to open and close. On top on everything, you have to pay extra ‘facility fee’ for each night forty something dollars. I understood it was due to the terrace on the roof! Imagine my disappointment, when I found out it was on the fourth floor! The building goes up on to 27th floor I think. We stayed on the 20th. Also, the signage on every floor says there is a water and ice somewhere there, but turned out it’s only on odd floors, and the ice bags are never there. The really good thing about the place was really WiFi and location wasn’t bad. Maybe for one night is ok, but one week there was really disappointing.

title: Continued Comfort & Reliability
text:
We have been guests of Yotel for 10+ years. Our continued patronage tells you something that they are doing things right. The hotel is not opulent, it is fairly minimalist in aesthetic. It does however offer solid comfort and a multitude of positives.  Our observations that may assist you in deciding where to stay:

* Their rooms are extremely well designed. Very space efficient. Lots of hooks, shelves and flat surfaces for storage.
* The bedding is of high quality and very comfortable.
* Housekeeping does a good job. They keep your room clean, well stocked with towels and toiletries.
* The view from most rooms is generally obstruction free.
* Despite being 27 floors their 5 elevators are high speed.
* The hotel offers lots of amenities outside of your room.
* There is a coffee and pastry bar manned by the expert espresso maker Gi.
* There is a club where you can enjoy cabaret performances.
* The outdoor terrace bar/restaurant is very pleasant during the warm months.
* A full service breakfast for your breakfast needs.
* The gym is well equipped. 
* Mission Control (the front desk) plus all the bellmen at the front door are polite and helpful.
* The hotel is in an ideal location in Hells Kitchen.
* A ten minute walk to most of the subway lines in Times Square.
* An eight minute walk to The Port Authority Bus Terminal.
* A grocery store, pharmacy and bank directly across the street from the hotel.
* The neighbourhood is filled with cafes, delis, bars, restaurants and clubs. 

Suffice to say, Yotel works for us...

title: Be aware of the hidden charges
text:
Yotel NYC is situated in a good location. It is near to Times Square, Penn Station and the Port Authority bus terminal. There are plenty of places to eat close by and there is something for every palate. On Saturdays during the summer there is a farmer’s market just around the corner on 43rd Street. 
The breakfast in Yotel is not good. It is very overpriced and tea/coffee is charged for separately. 
Be very careful when if you are booking your hotel as you may be charged for facilities when you check in. In our case this charge was an extra $43 per night. We stayed 5 nights so this was a very expensive extra charge. This charge is meant to cover your Wi-Fi, smart tv and ice machines etc. The smart tv in our room was not working and it took 3 days to get it fixed. There is meant to be ice available on every floor and it is only available on some. 
The reception staff were not very helpful and were quite standoffish. In contrast, the staff in the foyer at the self checkin/out were very helpful. 
Overall I would stay in the same area and possibly the same hotel but I would be aware of the hotel’s many deficits.

title: Don’t waste your money with this place
text:
The room was very small. Absolutely no privacy with the bathroom/toilet isn’t in a separate room, just glass as dividers.
The extra charge you are made to pay when you arrive is a joke . If we wanted a tennis lesson we would choose to do so. I would of rather had to pay for the internet than pay the unjust charges.
Service was non existent. And when you did find someone they were very rude.To top it all off, when we checked out they charged our visa 2 amounts one was $1047 and $ 1407 . A mistake as they said when we noticed. It took nearly 2 full weeks of us chasing multiple times to be refunded, part was paid but the balance they just decided it wasn’t owed . Great ending to a holiday when you have spent all your money.

title: Great
text: Everything was safe and comfortable, have stayed before and would stay again. Thankful for the friendly staff and affordability, and for the late checkout option. Bed was comfortable and got great sleep, room was clean, great housekeeping and friendly staff.

title: Location is average, rooms are too warm
text: We traveled to NYC for a family trip as well as theater camp for my youngest. One of the rooms smelled so bad it could not be slept in requiring us to change rooms 3 times. Also, if you go in the summer prepare for your room to be hot when you get back. It only runs when people are in the room moving around.

title: YOTEL EXPERIENCE
text: The rooms were not clean. My friends had no AC in their room. They slept in a room at 30C+. The hotel switch their room the second night and guess what? The AC was not working either!! Not a great experience for us.

title: Good location to explore the city from
text: Rooms are pretty small and basic but they are clean and functional - if you are just looking for somewhere to sleep this hotel is a great and cost effective option. The location is very convenient for seeing all of the main tourist attractions and travelling around the city.

title: Review of Yotel NY
text: It’s far enough away from Times Square that you don’t have to go if you don’t want to but also close enough it’s a short walk - ideal for anyone. Rooms are clean and beds are comfortable. There are two elevators to get to your room, extra secure

title: Me encantó el concepto
text: Facil checkin y checkout, hotel muy limpio, area para connvivir. Habitación estilo cápsula, pero tiene el baño dentro y es bastante comodo para el tamaño. Tiene una gran ubicación y sin duda volveria.

title: Great Hotel For Your NY Stay
text: Conveniently located to Hell’a Kitchen. Just a few blocks from shows and Times Square. The staff was great and stay did not disappoint. We would definitely stay there again and would recommend to friends.

title: Small and Hot
text: The rooms are very small, not so clean and very hot and stuffy. I didn't get a good nights sleep my entire stay. The desk, sink and toilet had stains. The chairs in the cafe were also stained. I would not recommend staying at this hotel.

title: Great location
text: Great location and the view from thr corner queen room was gorgeous.  The cons were that my room was not ready on time and the air conditioning did not work and continued to break, leaving the room at 78 degrees

title: Should be less
text:
No thing to say more need to but in each Room kettle
And bed should be medical also Tv channels should have alot becouse you have a lot of people come stay in your Hotel dont feel them the in the home

title: Another great stay
text: Me and my friends spent the weekend at yotel and we had another great stay. Love how easy and fast is the check in and check out. This time we booked the family room and that gave us so much more space. The 2 rooms are connected and have a common space in between so it was perfect for our party. I love that the hotel is so close to Hell’s Kitchen with all the bars and restaurants and this time we even took advantage of the discounts that came with the facility fee. the restaurant was open for breakfast, but for the price they charge, the choices seemed very limited. Everything else was perfect!

title: Solo room fine for a single traveler
text: I don’t know what all the complaints on here are about. Maybe I was lucky?Yes my room was tiny but it was very clean, well equipped and everything worked. For a single traveller it was ideal but my room wouldn’t have been good for a couple. Situated in a converted location, quiet at night with no road noise on 21st floor. Fab views. Room was serviced every day and Mosis at the door was really helpful and cheery. No it didn’t have coffee in your room, but there are loads of places nearby. For me, it was absolutely fine.

title: Amazing stay at the YOTEL
text:
I enjoyed again my stay at the yotel this us and always be my prefered hotel!! I wanna give a special recognition to Stephen and Jenny u always make me feel welcome so appreciated! I will be back again soon and I will always refer friends and family to your hotel!!
Thanks again

title: A good stay
text:
The hotel is very well located and fine for a few days.

Our group consisted of 3 adult males, so at times the room (pod) felt a little crowded, but we knew this would probably be the case before we arrived due to the set up of the hotel.

We arrived late at night and the self check in didn't recognise our reservation, but thankfully there was a member of staff there to assist and all was fine!

The roof top bar was very nice with friendly staff and good service.

The room was cleaned daily, they arrived pretty early but were happy to come back later in the day if we weren't ready for them.

title: Excellent Customer Service
text: My stay at this hotel was an unforgettable experience. The combination of great value, impeccable service and attention to detail created a haven of indulgence and relaxation. I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone seeking a truly exceptional and memorable stay. I checked in with Elton and he was extremely helpful. It has set a new standard of excellence for me, and I cannot wait to return for another remarkable experience in the future.

title: Great location
text:
Right near Times Square! 5 minute walk. 
Small hotel but very modern and fun. Friendly vibe. 
Clean rooms but very small. They need repairs (safe, towel heater, electric bed, no hangers:(, no wine glasses, no ice bucket) 
Great terrace.

title: El Yotel de NY una decepcion
text:
Estuvimos en este hotel porque nos lo recomendaron unos amigos. La ubicacion fue lo unico destacable junto con la limpieza. Pero la habitación estaba destrozada, y descuidada y a pesar de haber dado dos veces aviso de que el lavabo goteaba bastante, no nos hicieron ni caso. Nos pasamos toda la semana con él estropeado. La luz del espejo y la de lectura de la cama funcionaban cuando querían y la fuerza de la ducha dejaba mucho que desear ( apenas tenia fuerza) y eso que estábamos en la planta 11 y habia hasta veintitantas plantas!!. 
El personal pasota e indiferente, salvo una persona que nos atendió fenomenal y fue agradable.
El chekout lo hicimos a las 11, gracias a que lo preguntamos porque te dejaban hacerlo a las 12 pero tenias que solicitarlo antes. Y con las maletas tuvimos suerte porque las dejamos en una maquina que habia alli en la recepción porque habia hueco, sino hubieramos tenido que pagar dos dolares mas por cada una para que nos las guardaran en otro lugar hasta qe salieramos con el transfer.
Se de lo que hablamos porque veníamos del Yotel de Boston y no había color, en este el personal fue muy profesional y simpáticos en especial Cindy y el hotel estaba cuidado y con mucho más nivel que el de NY. Una pena siendo de la misma cadena y cobrando un dineral!!

title: Yotel review
text: for $200 I expected a bigger room but it was clean & had a little view of NY, it was cute though. Had a nice full size mirror, 2 beds in the room I got which was odd, but overall I loved my experience

title: Worst Hotel Experience Ever
text: The room was not air conditioned. We asked several times for it to be fixed, as well as a malfunctioning  overhead light. The front-desk staff repeatedly said someone  would come up. No one did.  Finally on the 8th and final night we could take the unbearable heat no longer and we were moved to a cooler room. We also asked for a refrigerator for some medications that needed to be kept cool, and we would gladly have paid a rental fee for the refrigerator. Again, several times we were told we were "on the list"--but each time those refrigerators were given to other guests. We will never stay at a Yotel again, and we will tell everyone we know to steer clear. It was the worst hotel experience I have ever had.

title: Work trip
text: Room was very small, poorly lit, outlets loose and pulled away from the wall, elevator system was complicated, staff was not helpful. location was great in times square and it is a very short walk to the javits center

title: Fine but facilities charge is silly
text: We booked this hotel through an airline holiday package, thought it was good value for money for a 3-star hotel in a good location.  Then when you arrive, you get slapped with a facilities charge which is a complete rip off.  Just increase the price of the room by $20 per night if you really need to.  Don't even know what facilities we were paying for.  Wifi?  Should we have to pay for that?  Gym?  We didn't use/even know there was a gym?  Location?  That should be factored into how you price the rooms.  The lifts???  There are plenty of them so maybe!  When we checked in the person at the desk also tried to charge us double the facility charge - luckily I noticed and questioned this, but if we hadn't spoken English or hadn't understood, we would have just paid it.  The location is good for a Manhattan city break and the room was clean, if small and tired, so that's why I am giving 3/5.

title: Family NYC Vacation
text: Yotel was a great location to all NYC has to offer. The staff at Yotel were outstanding and helped our family with our first-time trip to NYC. The rooms were modern so great for teens! Yotel offers transportation to the airport which is a huge advantage!

title: New York trip
text: Excellent hotel with friendly and knowledgeable staff. Very central location and close to all of the great attractions. Hotel was clean and the rooftop terrace was beautiful with the best pasta dish I ever had

title: YOTEL
text: Very clean and affordable! Loved it. Staff very friendly. Room was a bit small then I expected but it was still perfect. I love the self check in experience on the kiosk. So easy and simple. Right in the area of TS

title: Excellent Stay Once Again
text: I've stayed at this Yotel twice now and thoroughly enjoyed it both times.  The rooms are small, but very efficient.  The beds are extra comfortable and the hotel is very quiet (other than typical city noises outside), making for a great night's sleep.  Superb rainforest shower and bed adjacent work station.  The outdoor terrace is very comfortable and the grab & go breakfast bar is wonderful.  If you're out all day, all you need is a comfortable, safe clean and quiet place to crash.  This place works for me!

title: Trés décevant
text: Quand nous sommes arrivés on nous a demandé de payer des taxes en plus soit au total 735 dollars!! Pour avoir droit à la wifi, la terrasse qui d'ailleurs pendant le séjour était privatisée la plupart du temps donc innaccessible. On m'a demandé 2 dollars pour stocker ma valise car trop grande! Les chambes sont petites, pas équipée et aucune intimité dans la salle de bain. Je ne recommande pas cet hôtel.

title: Yotel, very nice Fotos, not so nice reality.
text: Used, and in many details not perfect for a leisure stay. Needs renovation on many details. Maybe high frequency usage is the reason….One night could be o.k., for breakfast you better visit cafes around, Burgers on the terrasse were average, not perfect. Price/value rating only medium.

title: Dangerous Bunk Bed
text: Our stay here was great until my daughter broke her arm on the bunk bed. The bunk bed's ladder had grooves on it that were tough on bare feet. It was also positioned in a way that made it really hard to get in and out of the bed. Security reached out, but no one has responded to multiple communications about this incident. I'm concerned for the safety of other kids that stay there and, quite frankly, would have expected someone to reach out and compensate our stay or something to make up for losing a whole day of vacation, paying extra to move travel plans and get another hotel when we had to leave later, and for the giant medical bills we will now be facing.

title: Pure greed from this hotel
text: We've just left yotel New York. You think you're getting a reasonable rate until you arrive and they want an extra $43+ per night apparently for services like a handful of money off vouchers that nobody wants! There's no tea/coffee in the rooms, the free water/ice machine was broken on our floor, the TV kept losing signal and the electricity was well dodgy! You had to pull the plugs half out and wiggle them before they would work! The only thing that was half decent was the WiFi but certainly not $43 per night! We asked to put our cases in a room to hold for a couple of hours and you pay $2 per piece of luggage. They even wanted to charge for a small bag wedged on top of my case! Pure Greed! We learnt there are many hotels around New York that don't rip you off with this ridiculous fee, so  I would recommend looking at one of those!

title: Super 👍🏼
text: It was very cool and everybody was nice. the location is perfect. the room is spacious. life is very beautiful it is sometimes noisy the toilets are great. I recommend Yotel New York for all types of stays

title: The hotel needs sprucing up.
text: AC didn’t work until maintenance came up to reset it and we were charged for a view we didn’t receive. The cabins were very poor looking and looked dirty even if the towels smelled clean. Very happy to see pride support though!

title: Nice spot for a NYC vacation.
text: Friendly staff, cleanish room, very comfy memory foam mattress. Heated towel rack is a nice touch. Self-serve kiosk didn’t work for checking in my booking.com reservation but was easy to check in with staff. Only cons were one of the blinds was always down as its cord was missing, and the “SmartBed” features were either not working or non-existent. A bit annoying that you can’t return to a chilled room as the a/c only stays on when you’re in the room but makes sense in terms of energy efficiency. Would stay again.

title: Great location for exploring New York
text: Room small and basic but bed really comfortable, shower great and room really clean. No tea/ coffee making facilities or fridge in room and no ice available on our floor. Great location to base ourselves.

title: room needs to be upsate
text: I have been here before and can tell that the room i stayed was not in the best condition, The bunk bed has a protection railing that was worn out and shredded. The  second day i was there the AC stopped working properly. The hallway was much cooler than my room. I told the staff and it worked fine for a day. Did not bother calling again. There was a blind missing all that it was left was the blind catcher. ( there use to be 2 blinds)

title: Deceptive business practices. AVOID!
text:
Paid the published rate for the room weeks in advance only to be a slapped in the face by a ‘facility fee’ upon check-in which amounted to an extra 30%. There is no clear mention of these fees anywhere while booking. The pathetic perks used to rationalize the fee include ‘a free gift when you spend $50 at the local electronics store’. Absolute joke. Yotel should be ashamed of themselves.

Jorge will probably reply below saying that the perks save you money. They don’t. They’re a scam.

The room provided was tired and our floor was missing drinking water facilities. Find another hotel that doesn’t intentionally deceive customers.

title: Clean and Convenient Stay at Yotel
text: I stayed at Yotel Times Square at the end of May 2023 and had an overall wonderful experience. The location is perfect near the subway and attractions and also near lots of places to grab food. I would definitely stay here again.

title: Leisure,
text: It’ s a good location to rest, and be just next Time Square and next All the transports. You have many shops around thé hôtel And you can take a beer and Go to thé restaurants on few steps. It’s near thé hudson. A beautifull district

title: Beautiful place and outstanding service!
text:
This is my 2nd time in this property (after four years).
The place is beautiful and the service is top notch!
From the check-in to the room Elton made sure that everything was perfect. He was also very helpful in assisting to locate a good place for a drink!
Yotel will always be my fav place to stay in NY :-) 

Thanks again Elton!!

title: Quick last minute break
text: Amazing stay, staff we great, rooms clean central to all attractions. Great roof garden for food and drinks. Highly recommend we will be back, we had a early departure and they have a driver ready to take you to the airport (charged) but great when you have a very early departure

title: Clean and efficient
text: I loved being up on the 24th floor, such great views! My company placed us here for a company-wide event, most likely chosen for the price and for the location. I had dinner in the cafeteria/restaurant on the 1st night and it took a bit to get someone's attention, but once they noticed me, they were quite attentive and friendly.

title: Perfect with Bunkbeds!
text: We really appreciated the hotel having bunkbeds for our kids. The staff is very friendly and they were very helpful. The rooms could use a little touch ups (maybe not have rugs) but it as comfortable for our family.

title: Amazing Experience
text: I went as a birthday weekend & we had so much fun & it was a cool experience with the rooms , lighting & we just had so much fun knowing the city was 5-10 mins away from us. The hotel was just a fun way to enjoy ourselves !

title: do not stay in balcony suite, if you want to use the balcony hot tub, furniture, or at night
text: I sent texts to request cups and towels and no one ever came. The hot tub jets do not work and there were no outdoor cushions for the balcony suite, and there was only one operating outside light. Needless to say, I was extremely disappointed with my stay.

title: Close to NYC epicenter but peaceful
text: A goof place to stay when you travel alone. The cabins have a very interesting and appealing design. The bed is comfortable and with a good size. I enjoyed the view even though I was not in the top floors. Good shower, excellent wi-fi service.

title: Not Impressed, All about making money and not customer care
text:
This Hotel has forgotten how important customer care is, It’s all about making money whichever way they can 59$ for a 30 minute early check in 75$ for a 3 hour late check out scandalous. Yes the beds are comfortable but that’s it for the rooms, the shower area needs maintenance 
Overpriced and will not be stopping here again, 
Had to leave our luggage with concierge 2$ per bag the Robot or Yobot as they call it is free but you’ve got to get in early ( we wasn’t told this ) 
Cafe upstairs shuts at 2 bar doesn’t open until 5 can’t get a drink here between these times.
Check in 30 minutes early we arrived 59$ what there having a laugh
Late check out ( 3 hours I asked for ) $75 go whistle I’m not prepared to pay that scandalous extortionate charges.
Not forgetting the receptionist managed to block my debit card impatiently taking the Local Taxes and Fees so I couldn’t if I wanted to use my card at all.

title: What a dump - has not been maintained in a decade or more
text:
I checked in and the first room had no A/C, lights were busted, a set of window shades were missing. 

Got another room and the A/C was working but not great. I couldn’t sleep through the night due to heat of the room. The second room also smelled moldy and did not have enough light fixtures for the evening time.

If you use the in room phone to call downstairs you have to speak with some AI bot first that only reads you facts from the website. If you get the bot to let you talk to a human it is not a human on site. The service person will call maintenance at the hotel for you but they are not on site.

title: Loved it
text:
One of the best hotels I’ve been at, probably too good. Didn’t want to leave. The room was had good storage, smart tv so I you can play music or put your tv show on from your phone. And the view!!! 
They have an amazing outdoor bar and the location is really good if you just want to be able to walk around and feel the vibe of NYC. Thank you for a great stay!

title: More like a hostel
text: Having stayed here in the past the Yotel has really gone down hill!! It’s so shabby and dirty it’s more like a hostel in my opinion. Rooms are very rundown and tired they need to spend money fixing it up. For that they charge you get a very very basic room in an almost abandoned hotel such a shame.

title: TASAS TURISTICAS UN ABUSO
text: Me ha parecido un abuso el cobro de las tasas de 43.03$ por noche y habitación cuando lo normal es un 8,85% sobre el precio de la oferta. Compramos una oferta que incluia el vuelo y el hotel a un precio interesante y esta se vio incrementada por 250$ y cuando haces el check in no te explican que este coste adicional son las tasas, solo nos pidieron una tarjeta para pagar. La habitación era muy pequeña y la limpieza deficiente, ya que el sink estaba sucio. Una pena ya que la ubicación es muy buena. Creo que tienen que ser mas claros de cual va a ser el precio final incluyendo todos los costes. Yo buscaría otro hotel que sea mas honesto con el turista.

title: Au cœur de Hell’s Kitchen.
text:
L’hôtel est très bien situé dans le quartier de Hell’s Kitchen, il est proche de tout, notamment Times Square. 
La chambre est petite mais elle est tout à fait suffisante et bien agencée avec une vue imprenable sur la ville. Cependant, même si vous êtes dans une chambre haut placées les bruits des sirènes se font tout de même entendre.

title: Just enough ...
text:
It is not dirty but the carpet feels damp and seems dirty, as do certain parts of the room.
I didn't feel comfortable being barefoot in my own room
Great location for my business trip (went to a fair couple of blocks from the hotel).

title: Room was not acceptable
text: When arrived the tv didn’t work a bar appeared broken and burnt underneath the bed and the upholstering on the bed was badly ripped, did get a different room which also had a minor tear in the bedding but was barely noticeable tbf and was not offered any sort of compensation in relation to a meal or upgrade of room which was very disappointed with considering what poor shape the room was in

title: Vacation
text: Great location and hotel for the value. The staff working at the hotel were very friendly and helpful, we had a great experience. Only cons, my opinion, the bed mattress was very soft and made it difficult to sleep comfortably.

title: Disappointing
text: Amazing view and comfy bed overall but not worth the cost breakfast certainly wasn’t worth it just for the lack of choice and no fruit options but food was okay. Seem to cater more for outside visitors rather than hotel guests

title: One Week in New York
text: We want to stay in the center of New York and spend some time on hotel room, not in capsule room. Yotel was on the main street and loooking good. Some things wasnt really great (used rooms and equipment, noise of showering, thin walls...). Our price for stay was really overprices (2k for 7days) and no possibility of improvement room (receptionist says we have no outher room, but booking and web site tells the opposite). On every floor was signs about rooms and water machine, but we cant find any water machine. Really sad. Im not happy from reservation price for our stay on my card even after my payment! Its 5 days after our departure and I have still 2k USD reservation on card.

title: Customer Service Great
text:
Great customer service
had an issue with a website booking and the GM got back to me and my family and sorted the whole thing out for us with a lot of professionalism.

Will have to book with them directly next time I need a stay 10/10 customer service

title: Avoid, avoid, avoid!
text: Avoid at all costs. Arrived early on the day of my confirmed booking and was told my room wasn't ready yet, so I left my bags and came back at official check-in time.  Came back a few hours later to find that they had cancelled my booking and given it to somebody else. Multiple other groups in the queue at reception had also had their bookings cancelled at the last minute. Terrible attitude from reception staff who blamed it all on the 3rd party booking site and that it wasn't their problem.

title: Not safe
text:
Unfortunately, my stay was an overall disappointment. I checked in and went to my room, only to find another guest lying in bed. I had to then go back down to reception and tell them of the mix up and was given another room. This made me question the safety of the hotel and throughout my stay, I was worried I was going to enter my room with another guest in the room or my belongings stolen. The experience definitely ruined my stay here and the hotel could've done more to re-assure me this wouldn't happen again but it was treated nonchalantly as though it happens often.

My room also had a lot of wear and tear, with the sink handle coming off every time I used it.

If this situation hadn't happened I would recommend for a budget hotel with a great location, but the lack of safety just isn't worth it unfortunately. I would not recommend staying here as a result.

title: Muy buen Hotel
text: Es un hotel muy agradable, la ubicación es un 10/10, la habitación estaba muy limpia y es un hotel muy lindo, el personal es muy amable en especial Eiton nos atendió y fue de muy muy gran ayuda y servicial con nosotros, además de que sabia Español! Lo recomiendo

title: Comfy beds!
text:
Stayed here for 4 nights during a recent trip to New York and enjoyed it overall. We stayed in a premium queen room which was extremely small however had all you need for a short break, given that when in New York most of your time is spent out and about exploring.

The bed was extremely comfy and room was clean as were the public areas. The only issue we had with the room was that the QR code was burned into the TV which meant you could see it displayed when you were watching the TV.

The location is quite close to times square and also pier 83. There's at least a 10-15 minute walk to the nearest subway station.

Would stay here again!

title: The room was stinky, the toilet very nasty and the carpet smells like pee
text: Horrible never again. Wasted of money for the stinky room. The toilets was disgusting there was old yellow stains everywhere. The carpet smells like pee so bad couldn’t sleep with the smell. Never again.

title: Thanksgiving in New York
text: We stayed at Yotel New York Times Square for Thanksgiving in 2019. It is an excellent hotel in a convenient position. We could walk from the hotel to all areas of downtown New York. We particularly enjoyed watching  the  Macy’s Thanksgiving Parade on our visit. An excellent hotel with good facilities.

title: Well-kept hotel in a great location
text: A great hotel that I would always recommend for a first stay in New York. Super courteous cleaning ladies and nice hotel staff. The thought race is an absolute eye-catcher and invites you to relax with cool drinks. I have rarely slept as well as in the Yotel beds. The rooms are a bit noisy, but only when the side doors go to what you hear in your own room. Otherwise, it is a well-kept hotel that is great for traveling solo

title: Perfectly OK
text:
This is a 3 star hotel and it is exactly that. Was clean enough and relatively central. 

No kettle in the room, which would have been ok since there was a coffee machine that also gives hot water however the machine didn’t function properly. We asked the restaurant staff for assistance, they sent us to reception who refused to help because “it was the restaurants problem”.

Other than that one minor hiccup, it was as I said perfectly ok. You wouldn’t want to stay for very long or if you planned to spend much time in the room because it would get extremely claustrophobic, but not really an issue for a short break to NY.

title: Abgerockt, schrabblig, Enttäuschend!
text: Zum runden Geburtstag hab ich meinen Mann nach New York eingeladen und wollte ihn mit einem speziellen Zimmer überraschen. Ich habe mich von den fancy Bildern des Yotels blenden lassen. Ich habe extra noch ein Upgrade in ein First Class Corner Room für mehrere Hunderte Dollar gemacht und wirklich ordentlich für die 5 Nächte bezahlt. Was haben wir jetzt gerade bei unserer Ankunft angetroffen? Ein total abgerocktes, schrabbliges Zimmer, dass diesen Preis nicht wert ist. Die Möbel haben überall Schrammen sowie Brandlöcher und das Badezimmer wirkt wie ein Bahnhofsklo. Es hat in Bad keine Ablagemöglichkeiten, der Safe hat nur Platz für Dokumente und einen Fridge hats auch nicht. Ich bin so enttäuscht und echt traurig. Positiv ist die Lage und sauber ist es auch. Aber definitiv nicht diesen Preis wert und schon gar nicht First Class!

title: A Mess from Start to Finish
text: Teeny tiny even the 'queen' room. Dirty (hair on the shelf, B.O. smell in the 'bathroom' [in quotes because there really is no bathroom, it's a section of the room -- don't come with another person unless you are VERY close to one another], the headboard definitely hadn't been wiped down), old/broken down (multiple areas were discolored from age or just plain broken and cracking). The AC is regulated, which is fine, except that I'm shocked mold hadn't started to grow while I was out for the day. When I returned the bed, my clothes, everything felt damp like I was at a dingy seaside hotel. It's a great location, has a nice rooftop and restaurant, just don't ever get a room.

title: Excellent hotel.
text:
Great hotel and Great service from most of the crew. Clean and Great location.
 But the guy a the Cafe Bar was not friendly at all, reaching the point of being rude. Easy check in and check out. Excellent room service. I will stay there again. Second time in a Yotel Hotel.

title: Charged additional facility fee but no hot water and the bottle water
text:
Charged additional facility fee but no provide hot water and the bottle water. We even do not know what we can use when paid the facility fee. 
The pillow has some back dots and the bed is not good(very hard).

title: Thanks
text: Excellent location! Excellent support for the team. Good decoration and  concept. Good rate in comparison with the hotels in the area. I’m very grateful for the experience. Thank yo for the support and the service.

title: Great Central Hotel
text:
Stayed here in December 2022, lovely hotel, close to Time Square and the subway to upper and lower Manhattan. Friendly and helpful staff, clean and tidy. We stayed on the 19th floor which we found a guest was smoking really strong weed, which was coming under the door into our room, so that wasn’t pleasant.
My brother-in-law was involved in an incident and need medical attention, when we returned from the hospital, we asked if he could change rooms so someone could stay with him on the night, and they done so with no issues, they also done a welfare check on him the next day, which we really appreciated. Thank You so much.

title: Everything we needed
text: This was perfect for a business trip to the Javits Center. Close to so many stores, restaurants, etc. We loved the luggage storage robot. It allowed us to walk around luggage free after checkout. Room was quiet despite being in a busy area.

title: Good value
text: Exploring NYC, just need a  clean place to rest and take a shower. Small rooms but like all Manhattan. Good value for the price paid. Rooms would need a touch, wood chips, painted surfaces, dust in the hidden spots..

title: Goede ligging om de stad te verkennen
text: Dit hotel heeft een perfecte ligging. 10 min lopen naar tiime square en metrostations dichtbij voor de belangrijkste lijnen. Het meeste kun je zelf regelen zoals in en uitschenken. Ook een prima ontbijt af te halen of een simpel ontbijtbuffet. Heerlijke bedden. Wel kleine kamers, wat verouderd maar wel schoon en alles werkt prima.

title: Yotel was a life saver!
text: My fam and I were in a bind. We had a confirmed room with a late arrival at the Edison Hotel and they still gave our room away. I headed to the Yotel at 4am and was greeted by Elten, the night manager. Elten went out of his way to get us into a room right then and was extremely accommodating. Elten is a class act and a tremendous asset to the Yotel organization.

title: Decent rooms, quite affordable for NY
text:
The rooms are not so big, but the bed can be put in an upright position as a couch so this gives a lot of room. It was clean, well maintained and also the wat every area was designed made it practical. 
I did not have any breakfast at the restaurant on the 4th floor, which is not from the hotel. They offer breakfast but what I saw it was way too expensive for what you get. Walk a couple minutes and you have a good bagel instead at various places.

title: Simple, easy, cheap
text: Great value for the price. I didn't need anything fancy so this fit perfectly. Check in was slightly annoying but the room was all that I needed. The option to buy some commonly used items was useful but seemed a bit overpriced. Room was clean.

title: Great hotel for the Javits Conventions
text: I wanted a hotel that had a reasonable price, clean and in walking distance of the Javits. This is definitely it. The rooms were NYC small but it had everything I needed and it was clean. The bed was really comfortable and I love the way the back went up to prop you up to watch tv and relax after a day walking the Javits.

title: Dirty room way too expensive
text: My room was filthy and after tax it was close to $300. I’m so disappointed and I will not go back. This is not a hotel it is a MOTEL. I will not come back. The shower was clogged the woodwork was falling apart. And the room smelled like feet.

title: Horrible service and dirty rooms
text:
Horrible service, room had stains everywhere was disgusting.
They lied to me and charge me a fee for something they never offered. I have contact the “customer service” and they completely ignored me. 

NEVER AGAIN with this hotel chain.

title: Disappointing, dirty rooms.
text: Checked in to attend a conference; rooms booked by my employer, likely because of price. But I found others staying at larger, more upscale locations for less $$/night.  I found my room to be dirty and stained, and the compact, uber-modern layout was actually not really functional at all.

title: Great Location for a Basic Hotel
text: Already a bit long in the tooth, this hotel has a convenient theater location. It takes some getting used to. There is no refrigerator in the room, an essential in my mind. It is packed with people and very busy. The room, a Jr. King Suite, was large and comfortable, if a bit odd in shape and features. The lighting in the room is poor. The bed is a bit softer than I would prefer. The staff is friendly and helpful but most things here are do-it-yourself.

title: Great location for "tourist" spots
text: Paid extra and stayed on 26th floor, there's two lifts, one to bar area then other to the actual rooms.  Convenient location to all "tourist" sites plus the Hudson ferries.  Bathroom open plan although toilet and shower do have a sliding glass door.  Bedroom very comfortable, housekeeping very good too.

title: Great stay
text:
This was another great stay with friends, easy check-in, very clean rooms, fast internet, the reception which they call Mission Control have a very nice team, very friendly and helpful, Stephen is the guy to go.
Bed was very comfortable, shower had great pressure, is like a rain shower which I loved.
Is definitely my place to go in NY, very good value for money, I booked on their site, which had the best offer and conditions, I always do my reservations on the site of the hotel, my experiences with other sites, there is always a problem, and when you need them, they just say, tak to the hotel!! Useless.
Looking forward to my next visit.

title: good price, ok room, bad tech
text: When we arrived, their network was down. We ended up waiting in line more than an hour to check in for a hotel the touted it's quick, easy checkin. Wifi was down the first night, not good enough to stream or watch tv (google tv or similar is what they use) the rest of the week. Room was clean. Bed was fine. Energy saver kept turning the lights off while we were in the bathroom/shower. Only one wall plug in the room kept any usb charger in well enough not to fall out of the wall. The built in usb charge port on the wall damaged by fitbit so don't use those here. Coffee dispenser charged for coffees it never dispensed. Room was well soundproofed, so sleep was ok. But all the tech constantly had issues.

title: Look Elsewhere
text:
This was a repeat visit from 2013. The hotel is fundamentally the same but dated, tired and broken. 
Pros: luggage can be checked in early and kept after checkout in a secure location. Location is excellent. Close to subway and restaurants. Excellent linens and comfy bed!
Cons: internet was down for over 24 hours. Limited than no internet on the 4th floor. No connectivity on the 27th floor. No ice except on the 12th floor. This is ridiculous for a hotel of this size to have one functioning ice machine. The other two available had water only! Our room was extremely hot until we were able to change to a different room by the third night. Bath towels looked ragged. Toiletries were ok. 
I’m hesitant to recommend this hotel unless it’s a fabulous deal to anyone.

title: What a Waste of a Night filled with derkness and stress
text: Everything in the room was broken including the lights so it was dark and couldn’t see. We called every hour to send someone up and they kept promising. 7 hours went by and it was sleep time. No manager on duty, non responses to emails to manager to resolve situation or give any credits which staff is not allowed to.

title: Fabulously located but watch the hidden taxes…
text:
Hotel is in a great location. Rooms are 3 star clean and room is starting to look tired compared to others in this star rating. Stickers regarding the Yotel channel should be removed as these services are no longer on offer and misleading. The coffee booth on 4th floor is great but closes early but coffee and pastries are lovely along with fantastic service. Lots of positives and a few negatives for us:
Positives: location, pastries on 4th from coffee bar which had excellent service. Room has a comfy electric bed- one of the best mattresses! Nice products- shampoo etc in room, plenty hot water when having a shower along with option of late check out was also good. 
Negatives: carpet in room rather dirty- needs a shampoo. Hidden taxes and hidden fees. Having a restaurant that offers a wider range of food- it was a bit limited. Coffee machine very expensive and no option to have sugar or milk added. As a dust allergy sufferer, the a/c vents need a good clean. Any time it went on it made me sneeze and also at certain times of the day smelt cigarette smoke, so had to turn it off. Automated check in doesn’t work too well and automated check out makes it look like you were getting billed for taxes twice. Also no kettle in room which disappointing.

title: Base for sightseeing
text: This worked ok as a base/bed for the night. Lack of coffee facility room was an issue for us and some of the features of the room didn’t work. Very minimal storage for clothes. We managed but wouldn’t have wanted to stay longer than the 4 nights

title: Great Location, Small Rooms, High Rate
text: The location and general quality of the hotel and room were very good. The size of the room was small, particularly when compared to the high rate. If you only need a bed and location is important and you can live with the rate this hotel is fine.

title: Inconvenient
text: After a long day of work it was hard to navigate the hotel. With self check in and elevators being confusing as well, was new to me. It wasn’t a great sleep because I also received a pod room which I didn’t expect, made sleeping not so comfortable-  I should have done more research on the hotel beforehand.

title: Good but still waiting on my deposit money!!
text:
Me and my partner stayed here for 5 nights towards the end of March. Great location and although the room was small it was normal for NYC.

We were charged the facility fee and deposit. Bear in mind it’s been over a month I have still not received my deposit money back which was 250 dollars. I have contacted Yotel customer services twice now and have been told it’s “processing”. 

So even though I did enjoy the stay at this hotel, the communication and lack of answers for my large amount of money would stop me from booking again.

title: Perfect accommodations for a night in NYC! Thanks!!!
text: The staff was incredibly helpful! I was in a rush- they couldn’t have done more to accommodate me.  I asked their names for a good review.  Jennelle, Nenny, Ahmed, and Moses. Clean, cool, awesome! TY!

title: Highly recommended
text:
Lovely hotel, not much space in the room, but it done the job. Staff very friendly and food was nice. Location was perfect and easy to get to from JFK, using trains and subway. Highly recommend. 
Would definitely use Yotels in other cities if available

title: Stayed at Yotel while visiting NYU, view nice! Needs more cleaning!
text: Yotel- - Location was good. View from room was good. Room needs more cleaning. Even the remote control was dirty/dusty (which I never physically touch them in hotels, always use a plastic bag).  Carpet in the hallway was dirty. The bed was comfortable.…….………………………………………………………………………………………………………………………………………….

title: Great for most, not everybody
text: Small rooms, super-comfy bed, and other than not having an in-room coffeemaker or other quick-sustenance-in-the-room appliances, has all the bells and whistles. Chair was not so comfortable for sitting at the desk but it was fine for the short periods of time I needed it to keep up with communications. You could get a contact high walking down the hallway, but the room was well-kept-up and did not smell. I kept a window open --- noise doesn't really bother me --- but it did occur to me that this would not be a safe situation for a small child because the window opened at the bottom, leaving a clear path to the sidewalk below, no bars or screen to slow the tots down.

title: Great location and clean room
text: The room was bright and clean with a great view. There was a good supply of towels and linen and you couldn’t hear other guests when in your room. It felt like a little sanctuary away from the hustle and bustle

title: Not great
text:
Lots of waiting around on arrival as rooms not ready. Online check was not working either. Helpful staff however. Rooms are small but very comfortable. That said the Wifi was a disaster, I couldn't work which was a major issue ( it hasn't been working all day) and annoyingly all the connectors and lugs next to the bed where the desk is also don't work. I've posting this review via my personal mobile phone...
It's not cheap here either, and I'm not sure the value is good really. 
Decent breakfast and staff on sale on 4th floor. 
Overall, disappointing and problems that just should not be problems...I won't be back!

title: Cruise Ship Cabin in Hell's Kitchen
text: Quirky tomorrowland experience at the western edge of the theater district.  The room was starting to show signs of wear, but still functional.  Good value, clean and comfortable, felt safe; friendly, helpful staff.

title: Never again
text: We had a family connected room and it was tiny. The room was so small that they have the beds recline so that you could step around them. When the beds were fully extended, you couldn’t really move. But the worst part was the bathrooms. The bathrooms were completely open in about 2 feet from the bed. The doors to the toilet didn’t even open or close.

title: Yotel Times Square April 2023
text: Friendly staff. Maids were great. Penthouse is a little too expensive. I would stay at Yotel again but not the penthouse. Not too far from Times Square although probably a little further than most hotels (located in the Times Square area)

title: LOVE LOVE LOVE
text: I will definitely be back this weekend for my birthday the room was beautiful I will be booking the suite next time!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!🎉🎉🎉🎉🎉🎉🎉

title: Everything was good except the air conditioning.
text: Location was great, value for money was good. The water pressure in the showers was great. Cool vibe, just too hot in our room at night and they were never able to fix our air conditioning even though we communicated this problem several ways and they said someone would come by to fix it.

title: Like a way overpriced hostel
text: It was like staying in a super-overpriced hostel. I stayed in room 2638, and it was so tired and dingy — and obvious that corners had been cut to save money (but under the auspices of having a chic, industrial vibe). Paint everywhere in hotel and room (including on furniture) was peeling, and the handle on the faucet was broken. Some of the elevators were out of service, and eveb the up/down lights on some of the elevators were broken and didn’t light up when you pressed them. The room was relatively clean but floor felt grimy. The shower door was only a half door (so you couldn’t close the shower), and there was a huge gap above the bathroom door (again, part of the “modern, industrial design,” but in practice it meant absolutely zero privacy). There is no refrigerator or coffee maker in the room. And no complimentary coffee in the morning — just an overpriced and understaffed coffee stand. There is supposed to be an ice maker on every floor, but the one on our floor was broken, and I was instructed that only floors 8 and 9 had working ice makers. I am used to the tiny size of NYC hotel rooms, but at $500 (!) a night, I expect everything to be in good shape. The whole hotel was shabby. Staff are polite enough but there is hardly anyone around, and they certainly do nothing to add to the experience. They all seemed a bit tired and overworked.  The luggage robot is a silly gimmick and requires staff to help people figure out how to use it. That space would have been better utilized as a traditional luggage storage area. Only upsides: nice view from my room, beds were comfortable, good water pressure. That’s why I am giving it two stars instead of one.

title: Small, clean & comfortable.
text:
Lovely hotel. Easy to navigate NYC from and to the cruise terminal. Small rooms but ample for few night stay. Clean & comfy. I get that privacy is minimal for some couples/friends as bathroom is quite open. 
Staff at main desk are so helpful and sorted out a transfer to airport and left luggage.
Stayed before cruise and when British Airways cancelled my flight home choose to stay there again.
Would recommend👍

title: Don’t do it
text: Wayyyyyyyy too small. My room was also dirty and I was not given a blanket. Literally just a sheet. I got there and there was pee in my toilet and hair all over the floor, shower, and bed. I was only here for business so I did not book this hotel. I went and spent $1500 on another hotel down the street and I was happier the rest of my trip. Go stay at Towneplace suites by Marriott Manhattan. This place was 3 times bigger with full kitchens. I felt like I was in a prison here that smelled like a moldy kids camp. I haven’t gotten sleep paralysis in years and I got it for the first time here in forever here lol

title: Fab!
text:
Comfy, clean beds, fluffy towels and lovely staff. Hotel is in an amazing location, we slept so well. Agree with others parts of hotel are tired and need a refurb but staff are helpful and friendly, we didn't hear a peep from above or next door to us in the hotel. Kids loved it. Communal areas and lobby are lovely and have a great vibe. Grab & Go breakfast was great but wouldn't recommend the restaurant breakfast - very limited choice and very expensive!
All in all really great experience- also recommend car service to JFK - good price no difference to what we paid yellow cab and pre-booked through staff. 
Would stay here again and got a great deal through BA holidays.

title: Great facilities, lovely staff and cosy room
text:
Great value for money, small cosy rooms. Staff are very helpful and friendly, dining facilities on site - lovely breakfast. 
If like us you are looking for somewhere to sleep and shower then this is perfect as we spent majority of our time in NY on the move. If we were looking at spending more time in the hotel we would have definitely looked at upgrading to a larger room. 
Air con worked perfect and the Yobot - stores your luggage - is very cool as never seen this those of storage before and worked perfect on our last day. 
Thank you

title: Good location
text: The location is the best thing. It’s away from the noise of Tines Square. Sone nice delis and diners nearby. Carlitos Pizza & The Westway Diner. Not much left of the old Hells Kitchen neighbourhood and the area looks like most of midtown now. Close to Circle Line and USS Intrepid, Madame Tussaud’s. Rooms are very small. We had 3 teens in a room and they found the bathroom layout not very private. The staff are very friendly and so helpful. Room was clean after 5 nights though the Pod style started to get a little claustrophobic. Would be fine for a shorter stay. Anyway it’s New York and you didn’t come here to hang out in your room. Area can be a bit noisy with the Lincoln Tunnel / Port Authority Ave construction work nearby but brought ear plugs and slept sound. Overall not a bad place to stay at all.

title: Not near Times Square
text: Dingy room, noisy guests, tiny room, located in Hell's Kitchen, not Times Square. Service was good, the terrace is nice, but not enough to make up for the run down rooms. I can't recommend this property.

title: Best location. Safe and accessible
text: Not too far from the center and located at the quieter side so ideal for those who prefer to stay away from the craziness of NYC. Few blocks away from restaurants and Times Square. Best value for money and staff was friendly and accommodating. They can also help booking rental car for airport transfer.

title: Perfect for a family of 4/5 with older children/teens.
text: Fantastic location to use as a base to explore Manhattan. Staff were so welcoming and went above and beyond to provide great customer service! Family connected room worked perfectly for two adults and two teens. Great food and drink too which wasn't part of our decision process when choosing a hotel but it was a lovely bonus!

title: Top
text: Very nice hotel in the hearth of new york manhatann. It is like a soace shuttle. Very modern and young. Nice breakfast with muffin and good position to discover all importantnplace in the coty centre of ny

title: Fabulous stay for a decent price!
text: We love Yotel and continue to choose it every time we go into the city. For the price it is extremely comfortable and clean. Plus it has a purple aesthetic which is very much in line with my vibe. The beds are SO COMFY!

title: Amazing staff, clean and great price
text:
Prior to the trip, we had seen a couple of negative reviews of this hotel so we were a bit hesitant but went off the fact that it was recommended to us by British Airways Holidays.

We were BLOWN AWAY with everything in this hotel. Firstly the check in process is very easy to follow where you check yourself in using a tablet/screen. Staff were on hand to help if needed. 

The rooms are clean and have what you need to bunker down from a busy day exploring the city. Select beds recline to allow more space when you’re not sleeping. Not a complaint, more of an informal that the rooms are on the small side but they are cosy and have enough room to store luggage. The shower was incredible, great temperatures and water pressure. 

Recommend a room looking out to the river but am sure that over views of the city are equally nice. 

The staff for the hotel are soo friendly, helpful and just generally really nice people. They helped us store our luggage in a cool robotic controlled storage system AND they organised a car to take a group of 5 adults and luggage to the airport for and incredible price - major thanks to them for that! 

There is a bar and restaurant too. There isn’t a kettle in the room if you want tea or coffee in the morning but there is a hot drinks vending machine next to a cold vending machine on Level 4 (where the dining area is)

The area surrounding the hotel could be potentially seen as a bit rough but this isn’t to do with the hotel at all. This is more of a heads up. CVS pharmacy across the road for snacks, drinks and anything else you may need. Then it’s roughly a 10 min walk straight to Times Square and a metro station to get everywhere.

All in all, hotel and staff are brilliant, surrounding area a bit rough but quiet to escape the hub bub of TS but not being too far from it either.

Highly recommend, please ignore the negative reviews!

title: It was fine.
text: The description said I had a view of the Empire State Building. We did not. Rooms were your standard tiny NY hotel room size. The toilet, though… it was a glass door with a huge gap so you heard… everything when someone was using the restroom. Glass walls for the shower, too, and it was right next to the bed, so there was zero privacy.

title: Will not honor booked room type or provide refund
text:
Booked 3 nights through TMobile travel, confirmed in queen with overhead bunk. On the way to the hotel, called to confirm the room and was told it was a queen no bunk. Hotel staff was rude indicating that's what I booked. Discussed at check in, showing the confirmation on my phone that clearly said queen with bunk, but hotel said no bunk room available so we ended up in a queen with no bunk. i.e. We paid for a room with 2 beds, but got one bed.  

After multiple calls to TMobile travel, they indicated it would take 24 hours to do anything. Went back to the front desk and was told that I was out of luck, room was prepaid and they wouldn't do anything about it. After additional discussion, front desk said they may have a bunk room later that day but nothing was clean yet. Come back later. I wasn't happy but seemed there wasn't anything I could do, so returned to my room. 

About 15 minutes after I got back to the room, we heard the lightest tapping sound and my daughter asked if that was at our door. I didn't think so, but got up to go check and before I could take a step, housekeeping entered the room. No idea why, no calling out "housekeeping" etc. We packed and went back to the front desk, letting them know what had occurred and that we were checking out. They agreed to refund the resort fee (or whatever the extraneous fees were called) but said the room fee was paid to the company I booked it through, so they couldn't refund. 

After several calls to TMobile travel, they indicate that the hotel has agreed to a 15% refund and they can't do anything more. The whole mess ended up taking up most of a day of our trip between calls to TMobile, discussions with the hotel front desk and finding/booking/checking into a new hotel. 

Also of note, the bathroom is open concept. Shower has some privacy film and mostly blocks the view of the toilet but there's nothing to cut toilet sound. 

Lots of technology in the hotel but much of it broken ... vending, phones, etc. Lots of better options within Times Square that are closer and cheaper.

title: Awful
text: Terrible stay. Bed was comfortable but did not fold up. Big issue. Heated towel rack did not work. TV did not work corrrctly. WiFi kept failing. Hotel staff offered discount off future stay. NO! Compensate me for the current stay. I’m not returning. Ever. And will let colleagues know to never use this hotel..any of them.

title: Great location and value.
text:
We returned for another stay at Yotel. Great location in NY. Rooms are small but perfectly arranged to make use of the space so we didn’t feel cramped. It’s worth paying the extra for the room with a view which is a floor to ceiling window. Helpful and friendly staff.
We booked through British airways and for a great deal.

title: Amazing stay!!
text: The rooms were very nice and clean. The staff was also very friendly. I took the opportunity to see a show at green room 42 which was a very nice feature that the hotel has. Definitely would stay again!

title: Séjour Yotel
text: Dans l'ensemble, c'était très bien, il n'y a pas de cafetière dans la chambre et ça pourrait manquer mais au 4e il y a le petit café qui en fait du très bon mais il faut le payer.
