La vue est incroyable, le lit super confortable, c'est petit par contre.  Il y aurait aussi besoin de raffraichir la peinture et un peu aussi dans la douche.  Je pense personnellement que les tapis ne devraient plus couvrir les sols des hôtel.  Mais c'est un opinion personnel.  Il faut penser que l'hôtel est situé à quelques minutes de Time square, donc le bruit est omniprésent même la nuit.

title: I won’t be staying again
text:
Incredibly dirty part of the city, very gross.

In room wifi was essentially useless so I had to work in common areas; I have never had this experience. I was told it was the weather, the hotel was busy, and the city has a lot of people so the wifi wasn’t working well. I just looked at the guy trying to sell me this garbage and he cowered knowing he was just making up excuses for the shortcomings of the hotel.

TV had horrible signal with several channels not working.

Not even worth staying here if you get a deal on one of the cheap hotel booking websites.

title: Great stay at Yotel Times Square!!
text: I loved staying at this hotel!! We stayed for a full week; the room was super confortable and the space was very organised, it felt very roomy for NYC. The location is excellent - 10min walk until Times Square, close to lots of restaurants and stores. Overall a great place to rest at after a day of exploring the city.

title: Super cool modern hotel near Times Square!!
text:
The stay at Yotel was one of the best parts of our visit to New York City! Its super central location together with a very comfy room made our trip extremely enjoyable and it was easier to maximize the time we had. 
The room had such a modern feel and it was super practical, even for a party of 3! 
I will be dreaming about the room view even after going back!

title: Awesome hotel in NYC - 100% recommend!
text: We stayed at Yotel for our 1st visit to New York City and had a great experience. The hotel is super modern, practical and really well located nese Times Square. We had a super comfy bed that turned into a sofa so we could really maximize the room space. There are also a bunch of nice restaurants nearby. We will definetly be staying here again!!

title: MOLD, RUDENESS & FILTH!!
text: I was already disgusted by the utter filth, lack of maintenance and the rudeness of the staff but the biggest issue was the mold.   The room smelled so bad.  Despite my complaints and concerns, nothing was done.  So I took it upon myself to look further.   Pulling back the furniture neer the fan in the room revealed rediculoyse amount of mold.   NEVER STAYING THERE AGAI!

title: Hotel near Times Square
text: NIce hotel near to Times Square (10 min to walk) but the food and drinks are to expencive for what you get. Noice from outside (cars en trucks hunking the hole day long) could be a problem for yuo. The people are verry helpfull and very nice to you.

title: Avoid this place
text:
No service ( room was not serviced during the stay nor the bed done when checking in).
Room in poor condition, mattress exhausted,….
No coffee anywhere before 7 am
There are better places for that price,

title: Excelente ubicación, muy buen servicio y limpio
text: EXCELENTE HOTEL!! Muy buena ubicación, muy limpio las habitaciones tiene muy bella vista y sobre todo excelente servicio, la atención por parte del personal excelente y nos gusto que estaba el metro muy cerca

title: Yotel - Times Sq New York
text: Good Hotel close to Times Sq, very friendly and helpful staff, cleanliness of the rooms and maid service was excellent. My room was looking a bit tired, with some worn areas, the Wi-Fi quality wasn’t the best, had breakfast in the restaurant which was nice although could have had a better selection. Snack bar was good too

title: Bad
text: Rooms was too small. Ac didn’t work, phone didn’t work. Rude front desk if asking for a new room key. I would never stay here again. And will not recommend this place or any of my friends and families

title: Perfect hotel
text: Perfect hotel clean tidy fantastic beds amazing shower hotel as a whole fantastic only downfall not enough hangers staff very friendly had everything from shampoo conditioner shower gel hairdryer iron safe Tv would highly recommended.

title: Pros and Cons
text:
We stayed in this hotel for 4 nights/5 days. 

Check in was fine on the machine but it doesn't tell you what floor your room is on. I asked one of the staff on the 4th floor and he just pointed to where the elevators are, when I explained I don't know what floor we need to go to he just said the same, not really helpful. 

The room was quiet small and it was a struggle at times, you can't fully open the door if the bed is down and with 2 large suitcases there was limited storage, I am glad I brought coathangers. 

Their was no fridge in the room and no ice machine on our floor. So felt like we kept buying water/juice and ended up going to waste, the cold water from the sink was not cold at all. 

Found the staff on mission control really unhelpful. I asked about late check out and he just said do it online, asked about the fee and he said it will tell me online.

I was really worried about staying here after we had booked it due to many reviews mentioning extra or hidden fees. When we checked in our resort fee was 172 dollars which was what our tour operator had told us and then 200 dollars refundable deposit. When checking out the machine brought up the 172 dollars again, I spoke to the man and he told me to go to mission control. I spoke to a woman who was the most unhelpful person I've spoken to in a hotel, I explained I've paid the fees and when checking out its bringing them up again. She said I've not paid the fees yet, I had when I checked in with money coming out of my account, and it was a holding charge. Again I explained the money has left my account when I checked in. She said it was fine and that I had checked out, I had to ask her what to do with the key card and she eventually took them. I then asked about the refundable deposit and she said it would be refunded within a few days. I did receive this later that day however I ended up with a random 1.44 charge on my bank and I have no idea why.

You can hear quiet a lot in the rooms. If the person above you is having a shower you will hear the water running down your room, can hear people's doors getting closed etc. We didn't really adjust to the time difference so we were up early anyway but it was hard to get an unbroken sleep.

The location for the hotel itself is the massive bonus. 10 min walk from times square, round the corner from Broadway, 10 mins from the piers and 10 from central park. 

It's a shame as the hotel is in a really great location but there is a few small things that could be done to make this a much better hotel.

title: LA MEJOR OPCION EN NY
text:
UN GRAN HOTEL, SUPER BIEN UBICADO Y CON UN GRAN SERVICIO. 
Tiene todo lo que necesitas, y es super cómodo.
El personal es muy bueno y siempre atentos. Las habitaciones son muy buenas y tienen todo lo que uno quiere. Super bueno para recorrer todo, porque esta en el medio de la ciudad y al alcance de todo.

title: OK for a night or two
text: The best thing about this hotel is the staff - they were all great! The location is good too, very close to Times Square and the subway. We were there for a whole week and it was just too long, as the rooms are so tiny and there is no space to properly unpack your suitcase. The bathroom is literally in the bedroom, with only glass walls to isolate the shower so no privacy if one of you needs the loo. I guess the room may be OK for one person on their own but just not big enough for a couple to stay comfortably for any length of time.

title: Super stay at the Yotel of Times Square
text: Being alone and with several pieces of luggage, I was immediately taken care of upon arrival, the staff was always present if needed to answer my questions. The room was superb, with a magnificent view and the comfort of the bed just incredible. Moreover, the hotel is super well located, just next to Times Square, Amazing !

title: Yotel Times Square needs Love
text: Was excellent a few years ago. It has aged and many services have disappeared. Bed mechanism was broken restricting the already small space. No hot water after 10 A .M. or late at night. Shower regulator broken. Room was not done during our 3 night stay. Not recommended for older people. On top of the room charge + State tax of 14,75 % + occupancy tax + Javit tax (for N.Y. Development), Yotel charges a facility fee of 37,50 $ per day + state taxes. A reminder when all this adds up to price quoted on first page of reservation.

title: Great stay!
text:
Great location, very convenient being about 10-20mins from most attractions or the subway. 

Rooms were clean and functional, quite high tech and lots of shelving. Bed was very comfortable and shower/bathroom facility was also very modern. Not very much storage for long haul visitors (we are from the UK so had a weeks worth of warm clothes with us!) but we didn’t mind living from our case as we were using the room as a base to be out and about all day.

Baggage storage Yobot is very cool (and I imagine very exciting for kids)! 

We were aware of the tax requirement which is put on hold when you check in, but not withdrawn until you check out, however, it is worth noting there is also a $350 deposit fee which we felt was quite steep, although, you yet this back at check out.

title: Perfect for location and great quality
text: Booked this through a BA package as the reviews looked good. Situated on 10th Ave it's only a few avenues away from Times Square, walking along 42nd Street with the Theatres, restaurants etc, and Bryant Park / Public Library. Also a few blocks from Penn station to the south and restaurant row to the north. An easy walk to the Highline also. Opposite is a CVS with a very good selection, and round the corner from that is the Broadway Deli and Cafe which is excellent for breakfast or brunch before heading out for the day. The room was compact but well planned out, shower is excellent, plenty of light in room from large window, the bed was extremely comfortable and as it adjusts to a seating position it leaves more floor space when not sleeping.

title: Colchones impresionantes!
text: Las mejores camas que he tenido en un hotel. Mejor que en casa. El hotel es moderno y las habitaciones pequeñas pero bien equipadas. La ducha es una maravilla. El personal amable y siempre dispuesto a ayudar. Bien situado.

title: Great Hotel
text: This is a great hotel and I truly enjoy my stays here.  The rooms are very clean and well appointed; it has both a restaurant and a gym.  Conveniently located off Times Square and accessible to Broadway shows with buses and subways close at hand.  But the real gold here lies in the exceptional staff – concierges, housekeeping, bellmen and management are always kind, caring , friendly and ready to go the extra mile.  They are the heart of the hotel and make staying here a pleasure.

title: Cool hotel
text: Cool hotel, kitschy vibes, great location. We stayed in the king suite so it was a great treat to see all the sky scraping views of the city. We enjoyed the purple decor and the bathroom was very big and tub had a view.

title: Good overall
text: A few things in our room weren't working upon our arrival which was disappointing considering we paid for the VIP King Suite. Other than that, the room was very clean and comfortable, the food we had at the bar was delicious, and the overall experience was something I'd definitely do again.

title: Communication is Key
text:
I encountered an issue during my stay which seemed to result from poor communication among the staff. Initially, I faced a problem with the TV in my first room, which was not functioning. However, an employee promptly upgraded my room to resolve the issue. I was thrilled and thought, They care!" Unfortunately, the phone in my upgraded room was also not working, and despite reporting it three times, it was never fixed. Apart from having to either call the switchboard from my cell or come down 26 floors, my phone died and a family member couldn't reach me and a wellness check had to initiated.

To add to my inconvenience, I had to change rooms again as I was downgraded during my two-night extension. This experience has left me dissatisfied with the hotel's services, and I have decided to request another hotel for my upcoming business trip to New York.

It is crucial for hotels to ensure that their guests have a comfortable and hassle-free stay. I hope that the management takes necessary steps to improve their communication and address the issues faced by their guests promptly.

title: 👍🏻 muy recomendable
text: Súper recomendable , la ubicación no me agrada mucho pero de todas maneras volveré pronto , la limpieza estaba muy bien , mi habitación era 1825 y tenía una linda vista , no estaba enterada que tenia gym ni tampoco desayuno ni tampoco terraza pero para la próxima ya lo sé , necesitaría más información de todo , la próxima semana volveré!

title: BUENA estuvimos 10 dias y quizas es mucho para esa ciudad no por las activivades sino porque es muy costoso
text:
buen servicio, amables, algunos empleados hablan español
falta practividad para ofrecer ayuda, con información de la ciudad, excursiones, actividades, lo que ofrece el Hotel,  etc
Falta FRIGOBAR  en las habitaciones por si compras algo para beber/comer no hay lugar donde guardar
el WIFI no es muy estable, podrian ocuparse mas de ese tema.

el espacio es pequeño aunque suficiente

title: Lots of problems with room
text: Not a great experience with the room.  Motorized bed was broken (didn’t raise). no instructions for lowering motorized blind - turned out to be near the bed, which is convenient, but not intuitive given it was in the opposite corner of the room from the window - a simple label or sticker would have helped. Tv guide was blank.  No plugs on nightstands.  No blackout shade on window for privacy - only shade is translucent.  Toilet and shower are right next to window - felt like I was on display at night with lights on.

title: Would Not Stay Here Again
text: Poor Quality in terms of soft products. Employees the saving grace for this trip. The taxes added on made this a lot more expensive. Breakfast was very poor quality.  Wireless poor and inconsistent. Checked out and wished I have chosen somewhere else

title: Great stay
text: Loved this hotel. It was very clean and cool looking. Fast elevators. A Walgreens across the street/food truck near by. Restaurant in the building along with a great vending machine selection. 10/10 would recommend.

title: Great trip -  check cab prices at JFK
text:
Please check cab prices before you land at JFK. Charged $200 as had nothing to compare to when asked for a quote. Should be $84!! 

Amazing hotel, great staff - very good facilities. Toilet in same room as bedroom so be prepared! 
Good location - about 20min walk to Times Square. 
Allow you to store luggage for the day and organise taxi home with legit company!!

title: Easy for new visitor to NYC
text: I find NYC intimidating and it still is but this hotel really was easy to use and just a little confusing for someone who stays in conventional hotels most of the time.  I paid for this trip myself as a career venture and I am happy there was a yotel nearby.

title: Pay for what you get
text: Overall had a good stay. Check in and check out was quick and easy. Room had everything we needed with a lovely view although on the morning of check out there was no hot water and no time to get this seen to before we had to leave. Around 2am of our last night we woke up to a strong smell of cannabis in the room - we weren’t going to get out of bed and go downstairs at this time to report this. Was a shame the outdoor terrace was closed during stay (tables and chairs covered up) as it looked lovely with great views. On checking out we tried to store our bags using the yobot but apparently this was full. A staff member came out and took hold of our bags before saying it would be $4 cash only. We had no cash and asked if we could pay when we collected the bags and the man said no. We were stood right next to a sign that said this gratuity fee was SUGGESTED. We challenged this and the man said the suggested gratuity was to store bags with the yobot (how do you tip a robot/machine??) and for him to store our bags it was a mandatory $4 fee. He then pointed us to an ATM which charged us $6.55 for exchange fees when withdrawing cash (despite using a travel card) so it ended up costing us $10 to store our bags although this is advertised as a complimentary service by the hotel. Having to provide a tip was not the point, it was the fact it quite clearly says this is suggested but the man insisted it was mandatory. Was a shame that happened as we had enjoyed our stay and that put a bit of a downer on the experience.

title: It was Okay
text: Hallway carpeting was way overdue for replacement.  Kinda gross.  Inadequate Ice machine availability.  Only 2 floors out of 30 floors had Ice machines.  Ice buckets not in room.  They were only available at front desk and were made of cardboard and so Ice melted immediately.

title: Xmas  and newyear in yotel
text: The room is small. But it did us. Very clean. Bed is very comfy. We went for 10 nights. Xmas and New year. We loved it. Staff are brill. People on front desk very helpful. They booked our taxi for our home journey. Restaurant lovely and food gr8. Only complaint is they should get rid of that 400 tax on arrival. Would love to go back. Excellent

title: Good experience
text: Stayed overnight for a concert. Close to lots of stuff, easy to check in and out. Nice that they’ll hold your luggage for you if you arrive before it’s time to check in. Room was cool with a comfortable bed and nice shower. The A/C didn’t seem to get as cool as I wanted it to, though. One luggage check guy was rude but the other was really nice.

title: Stay at Yotel in NYC
text: It was a good stay. Hotel rooms had everything you needed. Location was great. Service was not as good as desired. It is hard to get information about the hotel both before checking in and being checked in. But would stay again.

title: Needs renovation
text:
Location is good, near Time Square.
Our tiny room needed renovation, paint gets off the wall, no more curtains.
The so called queen size bed was much smaller than actual queen size.
140$ fees to pay at check out for 5 nights ! There were the New York city tax for like 40$ and then 100$ for obscure fees I still don't understand.

title: Mediocre at best
text: Had to switch rooms immediately after getting there, the first one had broken furniture, cigarette burn marks (despite being a smoke free hotel) and questionable stains on the bedding. Rather than just politely moving us we had to stand there after the staff rudely told us we had to wait for the first room to be looked at, as if questioning us. The second room was ok but generally very run down. While common at most places, the destination fee is truly unjustified as most of the hotel’s amenities were roped off or closed. The luggage storage robot is cool but a gimmick, it broke in the middle of trying to store our bags for the day and we had to wait for the staff to fix it. New York has so many hotel options, skip this one.

title: Perfect room for a solo traveler!
text: I loved my Solo room at Yotel. It had everything I needed, but in a very compact space with a nice view of the surrounding streets. It's walkable for pretty much any public transportation you're using (NJ Transit, Subway, or MTA buses) and the staff was friendly. I recommend the pear salad if you visit the restaurant!

title: Great location
text:
Stayed here for wife's 30th birthday for 5 nights. We stayed in room 2106, room was bigger than expected. A lot of people mentioned rooms in New York being small, but even with the bed being fully down, there was still plenty of space to move about. Staff were very helpful in checking in and out. The robot was full at check out, so hotel looked after our cases at $2 a bag as we had a late flight. The hotel is in a great location and is very close to subway stations, times square and the harbor, but far enough away that get a decent night sleep. Bed was comfortable and both slept quite well, room had ironing board, iron, safe and hairdryer only thing missing was tea making facilities. 
Room is a bit tired but it wasn't a big deal to us and didn't affect our stay.
I would recommend this hotel to anyone travelling to New York and if we returned would happily stay here again

title: Uncomfortable and Disappointing
text: As I was taking my teenage son to NYC for the first time I Booked what I thought was a cool, trendy and fun hotel.  How wrong I was.  Nothing worked in the penthouse top dollar suite. The bed was crazy uncomfortable. Reception staff that could not care less. I regret my decision and will book a standard hotel next time.

title: Yotel, NYC
text: Decent and clean space for a short stay. Located in the city, close to metro station makes it a convenient location for connectivity. Breakfast was basic. Staff is good. Decent fitness center. Good WiFi connectivity n average rooms. Rooms are more like cabins with extendable sofa cum bed.

title: Good place to stay if attending Green Room 42 late shows
text: Miss the personal touch of a real hotel check-in.  Room smelled of stale cigarette smoke though I believe it is a non-smoking hotel.  Bed was very comfortable and pillows were excellent.  Definitely on the small size but the skyline views are nice on the higher floors.

title: ABSOUTELY LOVED IT!
text:
First, let me start with the amazing staff, Stefan, Jennene, Stephen and Jenny.  Every encounter was pleasant and they took the initiative, always offering ice or help in some way we didn't expect.  We made the mistake of not checking the Javits Center conventions prior to booking, and we had a heck of a time finding anything for less than $500/night.  Recommend paying for a high floor, we were put at the top, and the views were great.  The bed was very comfortable and for 2 adults, this room was adequate in size for our luggage and ourselves.  The hotel was booked solid full, and yet we didn't feel crowded in any way.  There is a fabulous food truck right outside, and we had breakfast at the hotel restaurant and it was reasonably priced and very good.  Back in the day, I would never have even walked in Hell's Kitchen, so I was happily surprised at the great Chelsea-like vibe from the 1990's I felt while roaming around in this part of Manhattan.  It is easy to get a cab using Curb, and we were able to walk from the hotel to Rockefeller, although it was about 1.5 miles.  

I have never seen Manhattan so crowded, we went December 6-10 2023 and it was so insane I'll never do it again at that time of year.  I was disoriented by the sheer size of the crowds, and it was way too hectic and not really fun for us.  I worked at McGraw-Hill when it was at 45 Rock, and there was just no way to orient myself to enjoy visiting that area with the crowds being what they were.  I might try again later in December, but I urge people to check what conventions are in town before making plans.  There were 4 or 5 big ones at Javits, and it ruined our experience with so many people in the City at the same time.  Christmas time used to be fun there, but I don't recommend it anymore.  It was just easier to stay in our little Hell's Kitchen 'hood  by the Yotel.  We found great local bars and restaurants, and found no reason to leave that area once we explored it.  The Yotel was clean, quiet, and we liked it.  You will notice an aroma of marijuana, but we smelled it everywhere in the City, since recreational has been legalized.  Still beats the smell of cigarettes, and I'm sure it will be regulated for smoke in the same way down the line, but for now, expect it to be everywhere because it is.  We paid a lot more for the room given supply and demand, but it met our needs in every way.

One important thing, I read some reviews of people not liking the shower set up.  Yeah, well, don't share a room with your children and expect privacy in the bathroom, it's just not set up that way.  Find a different place to stay if you need total toilet and shower privacy, it worked fine for us and was not unlike other places we've stayed that are not in NYC, like The Vibe.

title: Once Quirky, now needs work.
text: The size of the rooms was okay when everything works.  Sadly, not the case during my recent visit.  The bed doesn't work, the wi-fi was slow and the towel bar didn't work.  These little things make a big difference when you are staying in an"efficiency cabin" at the Yotel.

title: Great weekend getaway
text: The hotel has a good atmosphere.  Rooms are small, but efficient.  My room was in need of a refresh, but was clean, and functional.  Bed was comfortable.  Not a lot of storage space, but it was fine for a solo traveller for 2 nights.

title: New York march 2023
text: Stayed in new york 1-5th for 4 nights the hotel was funky and a nice hotel, however certain limitations happened such as the hotel not mentioning the 368 hotel charges this includes the security deposit which we get back and the other city taxes. Although we got the money back after check out it was still disappointing as it was so much money for some as some other hotels dont hold so much 100 usd would have been more suitable, just seems alot, and this was money to use while on vacation in the city. The hotel also didn't not mention the others such as fees and the discounts on museums and other places which would have been useful.  Futhermore the room was small and was nice but the shower and toilet made it a little exposed with it being in the bedroom also I could see the shower curtain was missing which would of included a little more dignity and privacy. There was also mold on the platform by the window which is a little dangerous and the shower leaked onto the floor. The hotel seems a little expensive for what you get and just seems like daylight robbery. However this is new york and that is the price probably however the room was cute and cozy and I did have a nice stay, staff where friendly and approachable and where happy to help just wish more would of been explained before hand such as city taxes and security deposit such as the taxes should be included on the hotel booking so a person knows where they are financially while visiting the big apple.

title: Perfect!
text: Perfect location and perfect vibe. This hotel is aimed for travelers that love a nice vibes hotel. The ambient mood lighting throughout was a nice touch. A hotel like no other, was not plain or boring. Was a very fun vibe. I always felt very cozy and safe with the staff and location. .5 miles from times square and right outside is the mta bus stop which takes you to times square! Would most definitely stay here again! 10/10

title: HIDDEN CHARGES
text:
Booked through online BA package so everything all paid. When it came to checking in I had to pay an ADDITIONAL charge called a “resort” charge $172!!!!(dont get that in Europe) I was fuming. I didn’t intend to use any of their facilities. 
Also charged to store my bags at then hotel (don’t get that in Europe!) our keys weren’t working either and had to run down to reception 4x on my birthday trying to get it fixed and the hotel staff couldn’t bother to get up and come and look they just kept giving me a new key. Just read the fine print. 
NYC is unnecessarily overpriced and if you’re okay with the above you’ll be fine. But if you’re like me and have already spent a lot getting here to find out the above you’ll be unhappy. Also the waiter in the restaurant for breakfast took a tip without me confirming, she just didn’t give us any money back when we paid for the bill. How lovely? 
Only thing I’d say is location is ideal (7min walk to Times Square and the view.

title: Excellent
text: After booking and reading some reviews I was a bit nervous about going, but it was absolutely brilliant very clean staff very friendly and helpful. The location was brilliant and there was a brilliant Irish bar across the way Walters cottage definitely recommend it there was 8 off us all together the only downside we didn’t no it was $450 deposit upfront but get 250 back would definitely stay again

title: Just ok
text: The room was fine and pretty much what I was expecting. I was NOT happy with no hot water on the day of checkout with non of the staff understanding this despite contacting room services. Otherwise the hotel is fine and serves its purpose

title: rubbish hotel total rip off dont use
text: arrived late at knight first thing i was asked for was my credit card for any damage we did  im 59 wife 60  i rest my case hotel room was smaller than my  garage first room after a shower the toilet was water logged they moved us after 2 knights the second room bed did not work   window did not shut had to put towels on it to keep the draft  out  said the guy was going to sort it never did  then took money from my card for things i never used dont use this hotel  please be aware total robing place

title: Wonderfully Unexpected
text: The corner room and view was really cool. And the bar, restaurant and entertainment was unexpected! Staff was friendly and professional. Had stayed in other hotels in the city but YOTEL has a different vibe.

title: Great vibe and location.
text: the hotel is in a great location, so much nearby. The hotel has a great vibe and everything on hand little coffee shop bakery with a a very friendly guy who loves premiership football. Nice bar. Great service and everything is super efficient. The room is tiny bed super comfortable although bathroom arrangement far too intimate for my liking and when you take a shower whole room becomes super foggy. Wonderful view quiet enough to sleep although New York’s traffic loves to blow its horns. I would stay again but would choose a bigger room.

title: Great place for the price!
text: Looking for a weekend getaway in the city. This is perfect, the rooms are great! Small but great! The reclining bed was so comfortable. You’ll be roaming the city most of the day so this is perfect!!.

title: Comfortable place and great location
text: We really enjoyed our stay! Very comfortable and fantastic location. TV only offers cable, we didn’t see any streaming services available, unfortunately. Small downside though to the other great amenities.

title: Average
text:
The hotel room was comfortable and cleaned everyday, but it’s really needs updating. The bathroom door didn’t shut and the room was tired. The restaurant was nice the food was good but the breakfast was basic and expensive.
The check in was slow , the lady was too busy blowing kisses to someone on her phone.

Overall it’s a stage but ok for a short stay.

title: A pleasure, as always! Don’t hesitate in staying here!
text:
It was great to be back at the Yotel! Kind and knowledgeable reception staff, cool rooms, comfy beds, and very fun rooftop bar with delicious drinks! Oh, and I love the shampoo and shower gel in the bathroom. 

I stayed in a corner queen this time, with a view of the Hudson River and Manhattan skyline — one of the best views I’ve had in a NYC hotel. 

A pleasure as always, thank you YOTEL!

title: Average location, bad room
text:
if you have the chance in the room draw it's OK otherwise good luck...
Staff is unfriendly, barely bothered when reporting a problem.
Otherwise the location is pretty OK and the bed (when it works) is great

title: Exactly what you need!
text:
This hotel is great. Came over for my partners birthday. The hotel is a great location and the room we had room number 1526 was just what we needed. 
The room isn’t filled with luxurious items, its filled with a bed, a shower toilet and tv. They’re not the largest but the two of us had no issues. 
It felt central, close to bars shops and restaurants!
Only negatives were there was no water or ice machine on our floor, and the bar that’s in the hotel was slightly overpriced.
Would I stay here again if visiting New York? Yes we would.

title: Highly recommend
text: Staff were extremely helpful with travel and tourism information. Rooms were cleaned daily to a high standard. We stayed in the queen sweet on the 14th floor with a corner view and the views were amazing. 8 minute walk to Times Square and able to catch a taxi from right outside the door. Rooms had a thermostat so could change the temperature which was really good. Would highly recommend staying here as we thoroughly enjoyed it.

title: Value for money
text: Ok first off let's address the elephant in the room. The so called facility charges. We paid  216 dollars extra charge for 5 nights which I think includes a small amount in taxes. For this you get the use of a gym, free WiFi and discounts on some local business and some sightseeing and entertainment. I used the Gym once, the WiFi seemed ro work very well and we disnr use any of the discounts available. Doesn't seem like much of a deal, but I look at it another way, it's more of a top up on the very cheap rates we paid for the room, which still works out pretty fair as hotel rates are very expensive in Manhattan in general and compared to other hotels it still.works out much cheaper plus most hotels have a resort fee too,so it's not like you can get away with it elsewhere. So anyway moving on. Self check in was a breeze, and there was a member of staff on hand ro help out if needed. Room wasn't the biggest but it was fine, a lot of people.in the reviews complaining that the rooms are small in the reviews which makes me think they've never been to Rome or Paris just to name two cities where rooms are generally much smaller for exorbitant prices. Room was clean, with a nice flat-screen TV a small table and wash basin and a fabulous view of the Hudson River. The shower was good and I didn't have any problems with hot water either I'm the morning or at night. The shower and toilet are stain glassed you can't really see anything from the room but you can hear, so I guess this won't suit everyone, it will depend who you travel with. The only thing about the room that isn't great is you can hear your neighbors, pray for some quiet people next door or I recommend taking ear plugs. Only on the first night did we have some issues the couple next door had music on quite loud till the early hours, however i had earplugs so didnt suffer too much, the rest of the time i had no problems. The staff are very nice and always willing to help or give advice, a big thumbs up to them. I didn't have breakfast there so can't comment, I did buy a couple of coffees from the Korean gentleman on the 4th floor and they were very good. The Hotel is about 10 minutes from time Square on foot and 18 mins from Penn Station. Very much walkable. Overall if your on a budget and want to stay somewhere  central I would recommend this hotel without hesitation. Very good experience.

title: Going downhill
text: Need updates. Things are falling apart, shower was broken, no was cloths to wash my face. Room was the tiniest yet. Didn’t really interact with the staff. Couldn’t eat at green leaf for breakfast with minimal gluten free options if any at all.

title: New York top a patto che sia  NO yotel!
text: New York è straordinaria, il periodo di Natale è magica, sicuramente ritorneremo ma per quanto riguarda l'alloggio ovviamente NON sarà yotel! oltre la somma già pagata a prezzi esagerati, loro al momento del check out scalano altri 40 dollari di tasse al giorno! si proprio così al momento del check out perchè poi si riparte!! avoja a chiamare scrivere email non risolverete un bel nulla purtroppo. E non voglio nemmeno commentare la stanza piccolissima.. lo schienale del letto che dovrebbe alzarsi ma non funzionava.

title: New York top a patto che sia  NO yotel!
text: New York è straordinaria, il periodo di Natale è davvero magico, ritorneremo sicuramente ma per quanto riguarda l'alloggio prossima volta a questi prezzi esagerati andremo sicuramente  da un'altra parte, e come se non bastasse oltre la bella somma da pagare mettete in conto anche 40 dollari in più di tasse al giorno che scalano al momento del check out, infatti una volta partiti ciao ciao soldi, avoja a chiamare scrivere email!

title: Bien mais ya mieux
text: Hôtel bien situé dans le quartier de Hell’s Kitchen avec vue sur l’Hudson River et plusieurs Déli en bas de l’hôtel, ouverts dès 6h du matin pour prendre un petit déjeuner à l’américaine . Chambre petite mais agréable. Situé à 15 mn à pied de Time Square et donc accès direct à plusieurs lignes de Métro. Cet hôtel ressemble un peu à une petite usine vous y serez anonyme tout le long de votre séjour sauf bien sûr le premier jour de votre arrivée pour l’enregistrement . Le seul problème a été qu’il n’y avait pas de mini frigo comme on peut en trouver dans certains hôtels, pour au moins, y mettre de l’eau et la garder fraîche. C’est pas du luxe ….Le prix était abordable pour 6 nuits fin août mais j’aurais été déçue si j’avais dépensé plus surtout pour la qualité de service. Il y’a quand même mieux à New York….di vous êtes cinéphiles, je suis tombée nez à nez sur l’Actors Studio juste la rue parallèle à l’hôtel

title: Fun experience
text: We loved the YOTEL from the check in, the robot holding our bags and the easy and fun experience. Parking was easy and discounted. The check out was a breeze it was near everything we wanted to do.  The view from our room was phenomenal. I highly recommend it.

title: The best!!!
text: Housekeeping/security were the best at there job!! Very cool place to stay and also very quiet and cozy!! Everyone was very attentitive to everything and were always there to help. Best part was our room view

title: Great location but hotel just ok
text: Hotel was just ok. Check-in staff were really helpful and friendly. Booked us a taxi for our return flight. However the hotel could have been better. The shower pressure was not existent and the doors were really heavy so every time they slammed shut giving me a really restless nights sleep. The Aircon didn’t work either so had to have the windows open as the room was really warm and stuffy. Having said that it’s in a really good location for Times Square and all the attractions nearby.

title: Super séjour à Yotel
text: J’ai apprécié mon super séjour dans cet hôtel, j’avais lu maintes et maintes fois les avis, j’ai décidé de faire ma propre expérience, les avis sont parfois très durs par rapport au mien : j’ai adoré cet hôtel. Étant seule, j’avais un genre de cabine, c’était sympa et ce fut largement suffisant. Bien situé et lieu propre, légèrement excentré de Times Square, c’est reposant (5 min). Je recommandes cet hôtel dont le prix est très attrayant.

title: Very rude staff
text: Would not recommend this hotel, lobby staff were very rude and unhelpful. If you want your luggage stored upon leaving get there really early as the SUGGESTED fee they have decided upon is enforced mandatory otherwise they won’t hold your luggage.

title: Needs Updating!
text: We booked 4 nights at this Yotel after having a great experience at Yotel in Boston. While at Yotel Times Square, we stayed in family connected rooms. Both rooms were dingy and needed updating, as well as hot and difficult to cool. The ambient lighting and another light did not work in one of the rooms. One room did not have a curtain to separate the sleeping area from the bathroom area…the other room had a curtain but it had several stains on it. Neither room had working beds (beds are supposed to move to sitting position at the press of a button). In one of the rooms, with the bed unable to move, we could not enter without sliding our bodies against the door and corner of the bed. Overall the room and facility were not comfortable…updating and maintenance definitely needed!

title: The absolute worst
text:
I would rate zero stars if i could. First of all - the front desk staff were extremely rude upon arrival. Took about 35 minutes for them to check me in. She had an attitude with me the entire time like i was bothering her. The hold up? She had no reason. All she did was type on the computer and wouldnt tell me why. We had the family connect rooms on the 11th floor. We were told when making the reservation that there were more beds than there actually was. They told me 5 and there was 3. We had 2 adults and 4 kids with us. No big deal we will make due but when i called to asked them about it - they told me i should have canceled 24 hours prior to get a full refund and there was nothing they can do. Ok fine. We left for a show and dinner. 

Upon return - our kids did not let us in the connection door. Locked out. Went down to speak to fesk because the hall phone doesnt work - all had an attitude. Maintenance had issues opening then our keys didnt work for the room door again. Waited again. Finally got in and had a better look at the room. Toilets didnt flush. There was hair and booby pins in the shower and carpet. Absolute discust. Bugs hair no plumbing and the ac didnt work. It was a hotbox in both rooms. Door to bathroom didnt slide and curtain in the other was brown stained. Windows on bottom of wall opened up to fall 11 stories fo cement. Not safe with children. We decided to leave the hotel. Went to speak to the front desk again - told them an issue. Attitude once again. Then comes the manager who i knew was going to be an issue right when we made eye contact. He was rude and quite frankly should not be in the customer service industry. He only wanted to give us 50% back at first and had zero excuse for the experience we just had. With more complaints he finally said we can have a full refund. 
DO NOT WASTE YOUR TIME AND MONEY IN THIS DUMP!!!!

title: Old and tired
text:
The hotel is in need of a serious renovation, everywhere in the room, things were broken and tired. We had cold showers for 2 of the mornings of our stay, we did ask someone to take a look at this but nobody came up to the room. 

The luggage storage system is a farce, free to store via the robot however when this is full, you have to pay a “suggested donation” of USD 2 per bag. We only had USD 4 on us and wanted to store 2 small suit cases and a rucksack. The grey haired man in reception was incredibly rude and told us it’s not his problem and it’s not a suggested donation, told us to bring back the other USD 2 when we picked our bags up, a real sour end to the trip.

We have stayed in other Yotels in London and this location really lets the brand down and not good value for money, spend the extra USD 50 per night and stay at a nicer and newer hotel.

title: Sour end to an average stay
text:
Sour end to an average stay. The only good thing about this Yotel is the location. We booked Yotel after previously having a great stay at the Yotel in Amsterdam and Paris. 

The Yotel in Times Square is dreadful. Nothing in the room worked bed, tv, hot water and AC. 

The staff are unbelievably rude and the worst part was the check out on Monday morning and the problem storing our bags. Approximately 20 people in the lobby being charged $2 per bag. After many of the groups telling staff that this states it is a suggested charge the staff would not allow anybody to store a bag free of charge. 

Staff members were even directing clients who didn’t have cash on them to local cash machines!! Absolutely disgraceful. They also charge per bag and not per family.  I over heard one family complaint about having to pay over $30. 

Completely let down as well as every other guest this morning.

title: BEWARE additional taxes
text:
Hotel Room OK 
Very hot 
Good location and views
BUT approx £340 additional taxes for 1room for 3 nights……. Seems very excessive especially when no additional facilities. BEWARE
Aware that I needed to pay some additional taxes but not worth it.

title: Yotel Late Valentine’s Day Plans
text: Took a trip with my girlfriend to NYC and decided to stay at Yotel for the view from the Corner Queen Room. View was amazing. Bathroom was nice with a cool monsoon shower. Bed was super comfy. TV wasn’t great, couldn’t access streaming platforms like netflix which is pretty common in most hotels now. Also the ambient lighting behind the tv didn’t seem to have a way to change the colors like seen in the pictures of the rooms. Overall, very nice hotel and I would book again.

title: New York Holiday
text: Really enjoyed YOTEL. Clean and comfortable rooms, friendly staff and great location. We really enjoyed it and defiantly got our moneys worth. 10 minute walk from Times Square. Would recommend to all and defiantly will be returning if we can.

title: BAD CUSTOMER SERVICE
text: Please do not stay at YOTEL IN NEW YORK they have bad CSR. I checked in on 2/10/23 & checked out 2/12/23. When I first checked in the front desk person was rude as hell and was supposed to only charge my cc card $301.95 and my friend cc $250.00.  They charged everything on my cc the total amount of $451.95 plus.  They charge my cc the next day $250.00. I called the hotel to speak with a manger and I was told a manager was not on DUTY and that someone will call me back up until I still haven't received a call back. I called again today, and they hung -up on me and I have yet to speak with a manager.  The hotel from HELL!!!1

title: Tax bill
text: Beware when checking in that you ask about taxes as we were hit with a $187 bill for 3 nights on leaving after paying for the trip months before, also the shower and toilet are both next to the bed as in the same room.

title: Great hotel!
text: I loved staying at Yotel and will absolutely stay there again! The room I stayed in was small, but perfect for 1 person  or an intimate couple! Great location, very clean, and nice staff! My view was exactly what I was hoping for.

title: My Yotel Times Square Valentine Day Stay
text: I was NOT happy at all, everything went wrong. I will be calling to speak with a representative. I tried to make my girlfriend Valentine's day extra special but so much was missing from what I originally required from the broken door handle that slides the bathroom door open, the lights not working and had to call in to get it replaced,  not having the different lights options, I also booked from a month in advance and I had a note requesting the highest floor possible. Out of 27 floors I was only placed on level 14. I was soooo disappointed! This was not worth nearly $500 for that 1 DAY! Even trying to use the self check in feature it froze half way, I couldn't register to start getting money back off each stay that was also a mess. Lastly I had to go downstairs and REQUEST a fridge and wait for it to be delivered.

title: Don’t bother staying.
text: Everything was a mess - from checking in to literal piles of dirt in my room. The kiosks didn’t work. The shower door did not fully close leaving my entire bathroom wet. The toilet was leaking. My TV’s streaming services didn’t work. The bed didn’t work. As someone who works in hospitality and has been in this industry for 9 years, I can confidently say this is the worst hotel experience I have ever had. I truly believed after the peak of Covid, corporations saw that putting in the extra effort to maintain cleanliness within their business was the new basic expectations; that is NOT true for Yotel. I don’t know how long Jorge Tito has been the general manager of this establishment, but he either needs to be on property, making sure his team is doing what is supposed to be done or find someone who actually cares about this establishment.

title: Disappointed
text: Sadly the hotel has gone downhill since the pandemic.  It is looking tired and there have been no updates.  Unfortunately, we had multiple disturbances over the 4 night stay and felt very uncomfortable with the "party" atmosphere that permeated all areas of the hotel.  The smell of pot was ongoing and services were affected.  I would hesitate to stay here again which is disappointing as the location near the Javitz center was perfect.

title: Average stay
text: Staff was super friendly, however hair was in the shower and vending machines I saw were out of order. Thermostat also kept reading offline so it could not be adjusted. Bed was very comfortable though.

title: extremely dissapointed
text: The staff was great but the room we had was unbearable with heat and they couldnt seem to fix the problem...  The staff did their best to help us but just oculdnt fix it.  I was so sick and it ruined my trip as we were there to do wedding dress shopping for my daughter

title: Not Like The Reviews on TikTok
text: Had to be switched rooms due to the first being uncleaned ( shower and sink dirty) , went to my second room there were other people belongings still in the room & bathroom still dirty. Don’t recommend!

title: This was not what it cracks itself up to be.
text:
Not happy with this place! I was excited for this place, it had a good location!
Firstly, just the general stuff, staff is below average, kind of act dismissive. This is definitely for a younger crowd, walls are thin so i was often woken up by the 12, 2 and 5am crowd coming back from nights out. Bed was incredibly uncomfortable, could not sleep, and I'm not fancy! I've slept on couches better. Check out tablet gave me an error code and the staff person just said i could leave which was weird. Also never told about all their extra stuff, i.e. a bar, a yobot, the gym. Didn't know where any of that stuff was.
Here's specific details of my check in.
But i got there at 11pm, go to my room and right off the bat the bed is broken. I try to call the front desk, the phone doesn't work. I have to go to the lobby (which requires two elevators) and the person was quite rude and dismissive. He gives me a new room and when i get there, (i KNOW this is probably stupid but for me, it's now midnight, I'm exhausted) the light switch is this small box under the TV instead of just a normal switch like my first room. I can't figure out how to work this one, the lights are flashing like I'm in a rave, they are very dim, it only illuminates around the tv! I go downstairs and the guy is dealing with someone else (who seemed to also be having a problem) but he sees me and says "are you done?" I said "I'm sorry, can i change, the light situation is confusing and its just staying purple" and he frustratingly says "well the maintenence guy is coming" as if he already told me but he never said that and then asks for my room number (so clearly he didn't send someone. Maintenance comes and the guy just says that's as bright as it goes...you're not the only one to complain.

I wish i had just gone with a simpler hotel. This was not what it cracks itself up to be.

title: Perfect location for a hotel in NYC.
text: Very welcoming and the location is perfect for a trip around NYC.  Beds were very clean and the room was worth the money I paid for. I didn’t even need to leave the hotel for food because the breakfast that they had was just what I needed. It’s a great hotel and it was very nice and would recommend to everyone.

title: AMAZING
text: Loved my stay here with my girlfriend, the room was amazing with a great view. Great hospitality from all the staff and the check in process was nice easy and quick. I was very pleased by the breakfast especially that I find myself never satisfactory with hotel breakfasts. Very good stay!

title: YOBOT
text:
great weekend with friends.
room cleaned, people very nice and friendly, room attendant was so friendly.
YOBOT is really cool.
we will be back.
wonderful mattress, perfect shower. 
the people at reception were very nice, the guys who take care of the luggage were not helpful at all, look they are doing a favor to you.

title: alarm disaster
text: you should refund the night that the alarm went off. it went of from 3-5.  This is the second time Ive stayed at hotel when an alarm went off.  Do better.  Also a lot of things are broken.  the ice machine, the sink leaked.  etc

title: Feb 6th - 8th 2023
text: Room was great, check-in, check-out service was not up to par.  I just wrote all the issues in the body of the survey, so I do not feel like I need to retype it here just to get to 200 characters.  I can spell out all the check out problems - credit card machine down, told they would take care of an adjustment I was told to do at checkout, but they did not, now I need to spend extra tome calling in to have someone do what they said they would take care of.  Great location for my business trip, but not great customer service at checkout.

title: Hotel Falling Apart!
text: This is in no way reflective of the staff who were great; but the hotel is falling apart. I had the worst nights sleep ever in a hotel. Cold, loud noises coming from fans, sockets not working, socket coming out of the walls, no hangers, condensation on windows. Staff were quick to move me but the rooms have big issues!

title: Black mold
text: Black mold in showers. Dirt all over desk. Dried on stuff all in the sink. It made me grossed out to think about what else could be hiding in the room. I’ve never left a review for a hotel before but this one I had to. Also was surprised the shower and toilet are beside your bed with just a glass stall around.

title: Awful
text: One thing after another was either not working or actively terrible. Line at check in because the self-service kiosk was out of order. Room was so-so, pretty small with minimal amenities. The ice machines were also out of order. Bags for ice were missing. I had to use a trash can to get ice. We were awakened at 2am by a fire alarm which was a false alarm. Then again at 3am, then again at 4am. Staff was having difficulty turning off the false alarm. We had children with us and this was the worst experience I have EVER had at ANY hotel. Full stop. I am still recovering from the lack of sleep.

title: NYC es único, aunque el hotel no acompañe
text:
Ubicado en la 10a con la 42, a 10min a pie de Times Sq, es uno de sus principales fuertes. También se tardan 10-15min al Hudson Yards (rascacielos The Edge).

El precio es desproporcionado, sobre todo si tenemos en cuenta la maravillosa tasa extra que te cobran en todos los hoteles de Manhattan y que nunca detallan al hacer la reserva (en nuesteo caso fueron casi 300€ extra).

Tuvimos que cambiar de habitación dos veces nada más llegar. En la primera no funcionaba la caja fuerte y en la segunda no había calefacción. En la 3a habitación quedaba claro que el hotel necesita una renovación urgente, o una inversión fuerte a nivel mantenimiento, pero ya no teníamos más ganas de cambiar.

No recomiendo, bajo ningún concepto, ir al Green Room 42, la discoteca que hay en la 4a planta. Los precios son insultantes (200$ por 4h de fiesta en nochevieja) y luego es bebida horrible + sitio cutre + camareros odiando su vida y deseando que te vayas.

Ojalá algún día vuelva a NYC, pero será a otro hotel.

loved this hotel! the staff are so kind and welcoming, nothing is a problem and they’re always available too help. the location is brilliant as it’s not too close to times square that you’re involved in the craziness but it’s also a nice walking distance. the robotic storing system was very cool too watch and also super easy too use! i the rooms are spacious and beautifully designed, i was very lucky too have a great view from my window. would definitely stay here again!!

title: Centrale e da consigliare solo sr a stanze ai piani alti
text: Ottima posizione. Stanze piccolissime quasi come capsule giapponesi. Se si ha la fortuna di avere stanze ai piani alti bisogna baciare a terra. Colazione scarsa e di bassa qualità. Centralissimo...va rimodernato

title: Nice stay in a comfortable room
text: The hotel was nice, the restaurant looked nice as week, but I couldn’t enjoy all the services offered and for what I paid for ! I was quite disappointed about the resort fees and the amount took for the key deposit

title: NRF Conf.
text: Great Location and helpful staff. I stayed for 5 days, and the housekeeping team worked around my schedule. The rooms were small, so it was tight to work but I made it work. close enough to Time Square but far enough aways to get away from the crowds. Walking distance to the Convention Center.

title: Bof...
text: l' équipe de l' accueil qui s' occupe des arrivées est tout simplement mauvaise . Je n'ai jamais vue des personnes aussi fourbes et peu agréable ! Le reste se tient . Le personnel du bar est top. L emplacement est très bien !

title: Dirty rooms, not kept up.
text: My boyfriend and I stayed here for two nights on a weekend to enjoy New York. We were disappointed in how dated the rooms looked, with no care for maintenance. There was a gross stain on our couch, and also there was no shower fan, so when you took a shower the steam went through the flimsy glass bathroom door and made the entire room damp. No temperature control, and the room was kept freezing in January. This was made worse by the cheap thin bedsheets.

title: Never again
text: Rooms had water damage at least that’s what I was told why my room wasn’t available. The comp rooms were horrible both of them had issues, ( cold water, beds didn’t work, lights didn’t work and the beds were doubles instead of queens. Worse stay I’ve ever had in New York

title: Could be really great
text:
I genuinely think it's a nice hotel with all the essentials, except 2 major things:
1- No hot water in the morning!? I've never seen that anywhere else sorry...
2- The broadband is soooo terrible I could not do any work at the hotel....

title: Yotel: amazing place in this amazing city
text:
It was a great stay! The staff  was really welcoming and the rooms were always very clean and comfortable and the view was breathtaking! We had a great breakfast on the hotel restaurant and a delicious coffee on the bar. All of this amazing experience right in the heart of Times Square :)

Mónica Lopes and family

title: Fine for a week
text: My partner and I stayed at Yotel for a week in June. We checked ourselves in at the kiosk which was straightforward and easy to do, and printed our own room keys. I was a bit nervous about being charged resort fees after reading several other reviews, and had prepared to refuse this, however was pleased to see that there were no additional charges to our invoice, other than a $200 holding fee which was refunded to us at the end of our stay. We had a standard room, the view was ok, the room had a bit of wear and tear but that is to be expected but otherwise was generally clean. Bathroom area also fine, although the door slides across and is not sealed so you won't get any privacy, this was fine for us but may not be desirable for others. The room was quite small, but we had no issues with the bed controls that allowed you more space. We did have an issue with our air conditioning unit when we first  arrived, and as temperatures were around 30 degrees at the time this was a bit of an issue. We actually ended up chatting to somebody in the lift who had the same issue, he let us know that a maintenance worker had come and fixed his, and oddly enough said maintenance worker got in the lift with us shortly after. He very helpfully came up to our room within half an hour and reset our air conditioning. Ice machines didn't work on all floors, however our helpful lift friend also let us know which floors had ice, and which ones had bags for ice. I wouldn't recommend eating/drinking in the hotel, the bar had a good vibe but if you're doing your best to budget there are plenty of other places in NY to grab a drink or something to eat that won't cost you your life savings. There's also a liquor store one street over from the hotel, where you can pick up a bottle of wine for around $10 and take it back to your room to enjoy. There is nothing extravagant about staying at Yotel but as far as hotels go I would recommend. Definitely not the worst place you can stay, and essentially you're only really there to sleep and shower.

title: Not Quite What We Were Expecting
text: This is a millennial hotel, not for middle-aged to older individuals in my opinion.  The rooms do have lights and a television however if you try to use them both concurrently the lights will flicker and turn off at times.  If you turn your TV off then the lights will come back on.  While this could be a fun game it can sometimes become frustrating.  If you get a corner room the view is pretty nice as you are surrounded by glass, but if you shower in this room your floor to ceiling windows will fog up and block your nice view for the night that you paid extra to have.  We had a good experience storing our bags with the Yobot, but this could definitely go south in many ways at no fault of your own.  Fortunately, hotel management had the foresight to implement a mission control service which allows you to store you bags with a human if you choose, but there is a cost to do this so make sure you bring 5$ incase the free service of Yobot becomes disrupted.

title: Sisters trip to New York
text: We took a sisters trip to see New York it was a great hotel and a great spot to walk and see the sites and Ubered some sites because of the hour and would definitely recommend it to friends and would definitely book again

title: Great overall
text: The location is perfect, it’s near so many bars and restaurants that are not even more than 1 block away. It was maybe a 7 minute walk to Times Square and maybe a 25 min walk to Central Park. The staff was so friendly and even upgrade our room to get a better view of the city which was so spectacular. Definitely will be staying here again!

title: Extremely unprofessional and unhelpful staff
text:
DO NOT do business with them. Really horrible experience here. We arrived before check-in time, so stored our bags there because we had tickets to an event. When we returned around midnight, we were told they could not retrieve our bags because it was past 11pm. We had been told NOTHING about an 11pm deadline for picking up our bags. The manager was standing right there the whole time with the keys but refused to give us our bags, despite this being a mistake on THEIR PART. 

They told us we would have to wait until 7am to retrieve our bags. When I asked what can be done, they told us “if you want, you can report the person who took your bags and did not tell you the 11pm deadline.” I asked them what good would that do. We needed to get our bags to get our clothing and other toiletries. 

We were getting upset because this was clearly a problem on THEIR part, and the manager CLEARLY had a way to resolve this, but REFUSED, even though we had paid hundreds of dollars in advance for this reservation. 

The manager was really unprofessional and said he was “going to start talking to us in his native tongue.” 

We had to get the police involved and even when the police arrived they refused to give the police our bags because they were trying to uphold their “policy” rather than use their brains. 

Finally, after the very nice police officers had talked to them for several minutes, they gave the officers our bags. 

We canceled our reservation on the spot, booked with another hotel and left. 

I have never had to deal with such unhelpful staff. They deliberately made this a difficult situation for us for NO REASON. We just wanted to retrieve our bags and check into the hotel room we paid hundreds of dollars for. It is not our fault that their staff is disorganized and did not give us the correct information. These people really have questionable morals. DO NOT, I repeat, DO NOT do business with these people.

title: Perfect for a Quick NY Overnight
text: We stayed one night at the Yotel Times Square the week after Christmas. It was perfect for what we needed which was a centrally located, clean place to sleep. If we had been staying longer or had more luggage, I think the room size would have been a problem but for one night it was perfect. We really enjoyed the adjustable bed to sit up and watch a movie and the ability to change the lighting color of the backlight behind the tv was kitschy and fun, if a little unnecessary. The check in process at the kiosk was quick and painless. Overall, we really loved it and would stay again.

title: Don’t stay
text:
The size of the room is fine. The problem is everything else. The room we stayed in was really shabby with marks on almost all the surfaces and furniture and chips in the paint. There was yellow staining on the toilet seat and thick layers of limescale in the shower. There is meant to be a privacy curtain for the bathroom area but this was missing.
The ‘resort fee’ is extortionate! I don’t mind paying extra for hotel amenities but in this case the hotel was below standard. They Front door of the hotel was broken, the outdoor area and bar was closed due to the season/weather and the luggage bot was broken. We even got told we had to pay for our luggage storage (how is this not Part of the resort fee??) I didn’t use the gym so basically got charged over $40 a night for wifi. Disgusting! 
There is no coffee making facilities in the room although the coffee at the cafe was good. 
The walls are very thin so you can hear your neighbours going in and out and when they use the shower. 
The best thing about this hotel was the view from the room and checking out.

title: Céntrico y relación calidad precio buena
text:
Esta muy céntrico,la atención de la recepción muy buena,la limpieza no tan buena,no nos hicieron la habitación aunk luego la hicieron al decírselo,habitación tipo camarote de barco,moderna pero pequeña,los pasillos un frío polar parecía Narnia,el bar restaurante caro pero no está mal,atención buena,decoración muy chula,la vista genial con los rascacielos.
Está bastante bien.
La comida mejor en otro sitio,un poco cara.

title: Hotel to avoid
text: my worst experience in NYC, room very small, old aspect, sheets holed, random hot water in the shower, very noisy, the door fo the room seems in cardboard, no complementary coffee, poor services, I really not recommend this hotel, too cheap for money requested.

title: NRF Visit
text:
was good but not exceptional !

The location of the Hotel was very good within walking distance of many attractions,
but far enough from the infernal bustle of this beautiful New York City ! Really enjoyed my stay in NY

title: Not the best option
text: It has a good vibe upon entering and the shared spaces were nice. I had the tiniest room (only option available). The bed was not made (sheets and blanket folded on the bed but not made). The window was drafty, heater was very loud and constantly woke me up and the blanket was extremely thin. I asked for another blanket 5 times and never received so I ended up buying my own blanket. The mattress was lumpy and you sank down into it. Pillows were great and the showerhead and handheld were nice. I never had an issue with hot water or my towel warmer (but the shower towels are TINY). There is not a lot of space in these rooms but it is workable. I would not stay here again.

title: perfect
text: Yotel is very modern and an easy check in process. I used a family connected room and I loved the ambient lighting in both. Very comfy beds and I would reccomend this hotel to my friends and others. 10/10

title: Comfortable and practical!
text: Great location, easy and affordable parking. Room is practical and comfortable. Loved the small details like the soap, shampoo and lotion provided and not just a small bottle. Iron in reach w an accessible outlet.  Bed was comfy and can adjust if want a slight higher and to create space in room. Overall good stay!

title: Not recommended for more than a night
text: I didn’t enjoy my stay! I get the idea behind the yotel as a place to take a quick shower and nap during a long layover but if someone is staying for more than a day then there should atleast be a different more comfortable option made available! No microwave in the entire hotel for us to warm up food!

title: Loved This Place !
text: Honestly was a good stay overall! everyone is super nice and helpful! rooms were beautiful too and easy to find ! i definitely will be using yotel again in in a few weeks ! such an amazing hotel honestly!

title: Great stay at the Yotel NYC!
text: I stayed at the Yotel this past December with friends and loved my experience. The location was perfect, very close to Times Square, and many resturaunts. The room was clean, and everyone was very friendly. However, I tried to store my carry on during the day at the reception, and I was told the bellman could help me. When I approached the bellman, specifically the man with 2 earrings, he told me immediately there was a fee of $2 per carry-on. However, on the wall above the Yobot computer, it stated that the $2 was suggested, not a mandatory fee. I felt intimidated, and felt as though I was being scammed. Other than that, it was a perfect stay!! I highly recommend it!

title: It was good for a 2 day busy trip in NYC
text: It was an average hotel. The location was great, within walking distance to time square! Parking garage is literally right next to it. We did have to pay to park in this garage. The hotel checking in process was very easy! I was hesitant when reading reviews about this, but there is 24/7 front desk staff at the hotel for any concerns and it was very easy. The hotel itself is yes small, but it’s NYC and a fair price. The room looked like it’s been lived in, definitely not the most amazing room ever, but clean enough to stay for 2 nights in the city. Great view, showers were good, bed was extremely comfy. There is 2 elevators to get to the actual lobby/hotel. The technology in this hotel is run down, so don’t expect what is advertised. I will warn.. you are paying for a resort fee, but the resort is closed during “off season”… the outside deck was closed… and you could not go out. Decent hotel.. I’ve of course stayed in nicer but it’s decent for NYC.

title: PERFECT LOCATION BUT AVERAGE SERVICE
text:
Comfortable and very well located. 
Some employees are not very professional and unpleasant, its better working with a smile and  some empathy. 
There is no sense in paying 2USD/piece to leave your luggage after check out because lockers are full ( which is always by the way )

title: Great stay
text: The room was extremely clean and the mattress was super comfy. The  location was perfect for our purpose to catch a Broadway show. There was no divider for the  bathroom so be sure you are really comfortable with your guest.

title: Had issues
text:
We checked in near midnight and we were surprised to find that $50 dollars per night for accidentals was to be taken from our account which was refundable at the end of stay and $40+ dollars per night for the resort fee - non refundable which I found to be overpriced. The website does inform of this but it’s not clear that it’s per night and not per stay. I’m lucky I had $360 in my account as others may not be in that position. 
I have stayed in Yotel Boston, Edinburgh and Glasgow so I’m aware of the standard of rooms prior to arrival.
We unpacked and settled to sleep after a long flight from the UK. 
On waking up we noticed the bed did not recline or work into the seated position. There was no curtain to divide the toilet area for privacy which was apparently taken away for Covid reasons!! The shower cubical was not frosted glass so no privacy at all for showering and very little for using the toilet. There was no plug top on the wash hand basin and surfaces were cracked/Brocken mouldy. Surely some privacy in the shower is a basic requirement even for the closest of couples or families. We were offered a room swap however after unpacking we had a busy schedule for a short trip in NYC so had no time to re pack and accepted a small refund. 
On check out we checked our cases into the secure room controlled by a robot and on our return there was no trace of them and staff had no clue where they were and suspected them stolen, after a long investigation 1 was found within the room under a different PIN number from what I had input and the 2nd was in another part of the hotel and no one could offer any explanation why it had been moved or handled from a secure self service area. We had no idea if someone had been through our bags prior to catching our flight. The lost bag contained my wife’s anti rejection medication so we were clearly deeply worried at the time. During this we found the female manager not to be interested in any way, very rude and unhelpful. She barely took time to speak to us or even have eye contact. On finding the bags we had missed the chance to catch the public transport as planned and feared missing our flight home so we arranged a private car from the hotel which with any undesirables of customer relations you would expect the manager to offer payment of this as an apology however this was not offered and when queried it was refused. The manager eventually handed me a piece of paper without explanation showing a $40 refund but no apology or explanation. Out taxi was $100 due to the good driving and local knowledge of the driver to just catch our flight.  I still don’t know why our bags were moved or by whom!

title: Lovely hotel,with lovely views
text:
British Airways gave me this hotel when I booked a hotel and flight package.when I arrived in the evening I was taken to the Reception desk where they booked me in and told me about the hotel and where my room was.Also gave me a map of the area too.
Lovely room on the 25th floor looking towards the Hudson River.Very lovely room clean and spacious and everything I needed.I loved all the toiletries.Wi-Fi was good.I loved the electronic bed which was very comfortable.Tv was good.Cleaned everyday like the rest of the place.
I walked everywhere and so close to Times Square and the Hudson River.
Staff were helpful and friendly,Doormen booked taxis for me.
Breakfast was lovely especially the Wild Mushroom Omelette with potatoes and peppers mixed in.All clean and tidy.
Lovely views from my room.Definitely going to stay here again.
I stayed here for 14 nights.

title: Family Friendly Hotel
text: Check in was fast and easy. We were beyond surprised by the connecting family rooms. Very spacious. Friendly staff in the lobby. Clean rooms. We loved everything about this hotel. Location was great. 5 minute walk to Time Square.

title: Great place
text: Very affordable and quick to check into your room. Very clean. They have a bunch of other stuff inside the Yotel such as a diner and entertainment at the bar. The room was really nice and cozy and enjoyed my stay.

title: Hot and smelled like weed
text: While the connected family rooms were really cool, the thermostats were broken and the air was stale and warm.  Sleeping was really difficult because it was so hot. The curtain was missing as the room divider between the bedroom and bathroom, the door to the toilet was nearly impossible to close in the kids' room, but worst of all was that we could smell weed ALL THE TIME. It seemed like someone was smoking in another room, and their air was pumping into ours.  Really tough visit with our 9 and 12 year olds.

title: Does the job.
text:
The hotel is in a great location, close to everything but far enough away to get a good rest/get away from it all. The hotel was cleaned well and towels replaced daily. Hotel staff are friendly and helpful. View from the queen room is great (see photo) and the bed is really comfortable. 

The hotel is a little worn but nothing too bad. If you are travelling with someone else be aware that the toilet is basically in the same room and there is no sound proofing at all, so be comfortable with who you’re travelling with! I would say a negative is that there are no tea and coffee facilities in the room, this would really be a great addition after a long day of exploring. 

Overall I would say this hotel is good and you get what you pay for, and realistically you’re never in the hotel anyway if you’re exploring the city!

title: Worth a stay!
text: This is the second time I’ve stayed here. I like the location because we can walk to the highline. I feel 100% safe in this area and it’s only a few streets off a great area with lots of restaurants. Hotel is clean and basic but a great deal for the price.

title: Disappointed
text:
This is an update from my 2013 review, is also as long as the OG one so if you want a TLDR version go the bottom.

I’ll start with their best part, their staff, they are great, accommodating and always willing to help.

However…time and covid has hit hard this hotel, I have traveled a lot since 2013 and maybe I take for granted some things this hotel don’t have. 

So back then there was a common place where they had a microwave, fridge and a coffee machine (for free), all of that is gone, I assume because of COVID, so what do you get instead? Nothing, you can ask for a mini fridge for your room and if they have one available they can lend it to you for free, but the minimalistic design of the rooms make you bump into it every now and then (hence the reason why there was a common place…) If you want to heat something you are out of luck. By the way avoid the coffee machine at the 4th floor… the worst coffee I have ever tasted, it shouldn’t even called a coffee machine, I hope that maybe it was broken and I didn’t know… I can’t believe they charge you for that…, on the bright side, the coffee at grab and go is great!

I get the minimalistic concept but I would taken into account having a space for a coffee machine, microwave and a mini fridge since the common place is not a thing anymore.

The lack of those amenities is not the end of the world but should be considered if you are traveling on a budget or you are with a baby and need to heat milk or need to store cold stuff like insulin.

Rooms need a little update as it’s age is clearly shown on the bed and the tables on the side, also I would change the toilet seat when it start to look like a public bathroom…

Do I recommend Yotel? Well if your trip is for less than 3 nights sure is conveniently located but for longer trips I can’t recommend Yotel as I did 10 years ago when there are other alternatives that offers free breakfast and/or have the coffee machine/microwave/fridge combo and are at the same price range, also the lack of space can be an issue if you are staying longer than a weekend of if you pack a lot of stuff.

TLDR: This is not the same Yotel I enjoyed so much 10 years ago, there are better alternatives elsewhere.

PS: Did I mentioned that their WiFi sucks?

title: Great hotel for family
text: Connected room with secure interior corridor allowed our two teens and eight year old their own space and we could leave our door open so they could reach us easily. Super location. Staff was helpful and responsive. Would give five stars but the Google nest in kids room wasn't working. A great stay. We will be back !

title: Great location
text:
Great location 10min max walk to time square
Bed is very comfortable view from from 15th floor was amazing, hotel is fine the robot that stores your luggage was working, we have booked to stay again this Dec(23) staff friendly and helpful room was a queen with view 1515

title: Sad but true!
text: I stayed at the Yotel right after Christmas and as far as the rooms go they are small but are different and neat so that was fine.
