Only problem was the front desk had a problem with our reservation so they put us in two rooms that only slept 5 people when we had 6.  When I explained that it was a mistake on the hotels part he argued with me for over an hour that he wasn’t doing anything about it.  Even my reservation said 6 guests but he wouldn’t move us or anything.  There is no accountability for anything that The Yotel does therefore it did put a damper on our trip becauseI we were cramped in our rooms and needed one more bed.  I won’t ever stay there again. Also the location is a little further out of the city than I want to be.

title: A pleasant stay in Yotel
text:
Just back from a 5 night stay here and I am pleasantly surprised, after reading some reviews on here I was worried about staying at this hotel. In my opinion the self service check in was very handy and I preferred it than having to que at a desk to check in. We were on the highest floor and the view was amazing. The shower was luke warm in the morning but hot in the evening. The bed was brilliant and so comfy. Although the room is small there is space under the best where you can put your suitcase so it’s not in the way. The room was clean and the maids came everyday which was great. The location of this hotel is great in my opinion, just a short walk to Times Square, Central Park and other main tourist spots. There is a lot of noise from traffic outside but that didn’t bother us. And what do you expect your in New York!! 
My only complaint is about the venga machine on my floor that sold travel adapters, I paid 27 dollars for an adapter but the machine never gave me one! I was very disappointed so a warning to others not to use these machines!!! Other than that we had a very pleasant stay at YOTEL.

title: Room poor
text:
La chambre était dans un médiocre état 
Moisissures dans la douche
Fan de salle de bain non fonctionnelle 
Porte de salle de bain ne ferme pas jusqu'au plafond
Robinet brisé

title: Hôtel usé, zéro service
text:
C'était mon cinquième séjour depuis 2015 dans cet hôtel, ce sera le dernier. Deux chambres, trois nuits pour la fin d'année sur le site de l'hôtel, cela m'a coûté 3.000 €. A titre de comparaison, c'est le prix payé à l'hôtel Negresco, le palace de Nice, il y a un an. La comparaison s'arrête au tarif malheureusement.
Commençons par le positif : c'est (plutôt) bien placé, assez proche des quartiers touristiques sans y être collé : on peut donc y être au calme et accéder au métro ou a de nombreux lieux à pieds en 15 à 20 mn. Le style de l'hôtel se veut moderne, peinture blanche et néons mauves, ça fait la blague.
Pour le reste, nous avons été de déconvenue en déconvenue. Avant le confinement, il y avait du staff au 4ème étage pour assister ou au moins dire bonjour et souhaiter la bienvenue. Là, plus personne. On fait son check-in soi-même. A ce prix-là, c'est mesquin. Je ne travaille pas là, ce n'est théoriquement pas à moi de faire ma propre clé de chambre !
La chambre, parlons-en : nous avions les 1632 et 1837 si ma mémoire est bonne. Les deux avaient en commun des peintures usées, des fissures, des accrocs sur les meubles. Dans l'absolu ce n'est pas grave; mais au prix de la nuit c'est totalement inacceptable. 
La literie de la chambre 1837 était totalement usée, avec un matelas qui avait littéralement un trou, un gros creux. Résultat: j'ai très mal dormi, et plusieurs jours après j'ai toujours un torticolis. Honteux. Et comme dit plus haut, comme il n'y a personne à qui parler, impossible de demander une solution à quiconque.
Pour terminer, le tuyau de douche avait une fuite. Il n'y a rien à sauver dans cet hôtel, surtout pour le prix.

title: not my best stay
text: The hotel room was terrible. The shower had cold water and the blanket was not comfortable. The door to the toilet even stuck and was difficult to open. I would not recommend this hotel room to anyone.

title: The hotel experience, finally modernized and perfected!
text: I absolutely LOVED this hotel. I loved the fact that everything is automatized and efficient and I absolutely ADORED how the hotel offers early checkin and late checkout for a very reasonable fee. I'va always thought that one way the hotel industry could evolve would be to offer earlier checkin and late checkout (for a fee upon availability, of course), and Yotel is doing it wonderfully!!! This is a hotel model I hope to see expand everywhere. I absolutely loved this hotel and I will keep coming back!

title: Chaotic and no hot water in morning
text: Very chaotic check in, got there at the same time as a bus of tourists who kept cutting in front of me. People staffing the kiosks were clearly overwhelmed and not very helpful. The kiosk had an error when I was making my card so they sent me over to the front desk and had to wait in yet another line. Kept getting woken up by noisy guests having conversations in the hall which can happen in any hotel, but the walls are clearly poorly insulated against noise. I’m a super heavy sleeper too! At least the bed was nice. Absolute dealbreaker was no hot water in the morning in shower or sink… but it was hot for my shower the night before. So I took a cold shower. Overall would not recommend….

title: Time for a refurb.
text: Rooms not as advertised, finishes abused and tired. The missing curtains in rooms remove all sense of privacy. The bed did not convert to couch and took up all floor space making it difficult  to maneuver.

title: Got the job done but felt overpriced
text: Stayed here for a last minute booking over the holidays after my original plans fell through due to airline troubles. This hotel got the job done and was clean and safe, but i don’t think I’d stay here again unless it was significantly cheaper than other options. Location is very far west, far from the subway, and walking alone at night from 42nd Street was a bit creepy. The room was definitely worse for the west, and the almost $40 per night amenity fee paid for - I’m not sure what, since there were very few amenities. This property met my last minute needs but I’d consider other options first for future trips.

title: Mediocre
text: On entering the hotel, you must check yourself in on a digital screen. Nobody to assist you if required. From there, try to find your room without assistance. Firstly, you have to get in a lift and go to the lobby on the fourth floor. Then, you have to get out and change lift to go to your floor. The first two numbers of your room number is the floor you're on and the second two are the room number. To activate the second lift, you must scan your key card. All of this, without being told how to get to your room, is hard to work out. The rooms are small but clean. Bed is comfortable. Shower only and toilet/sink. No partition between bedroom and WC area. Let's hope nobody makes a smell! You can open the window. We could smell marijuana coming from some rooms, so the window was helpful. There is a hair dryer in the room and TV. Staff are unhelpful when you eventually find someone. Good location and only a few mins walk to times sq.

title: Not bad, showers are the best part.
text: Nice place, staff are friendly. Good location. Showers are the best, although when there are a lot of guest the hot water is a problem. The pictures of the rooms are a little deceiving but not a bad hotel overall.

title: Billing cheater.
text: Management is non-responsive and refuses to credit a double billing. There is no easy way to talk to anyone there that has responsibility for fixing a billing error even though they had verbally OK'd it on site.

title: room flooded
text:
I booked fo ra suite to stay with my kids and as all suites were flooded they give me 2 small standard rooms and I paid the price for 1 suite
I could not spend time together with my kids big problems with the luggage because clothes were all together and we were in 2 different rooms
Rooms were not very clean while beds were really comfortable 
YOBOT to leave your luggage amazing

title: Nice Hotel
text: All was fine but the attention to my claim of missing bag arrived to deaf ears. Tha administration should took action with this matter, it totally affected my impression about the hotel and its administration.

title: Very good hotel. Best quality for your money at only 5 minutes from Time Square
text: We spend 3 nights and can´t find anything wrong to say. Clean, perfect location to visit New York at a good price. The staff is very nice and helpful. I recommend this hotel when you come to New York.

title: Our perfect honeymoon
text: Our stay at the Yotel, New York was absolutely brilliant. The room was clean and comfortable. Ample room for two not small people! The bed was super comfortable and everything worked as it should. The room was cleaned daily, fresh towels, fresh sheets and always clean and tidy. Could not of asked for a better location. Only a 6-8 minute walk to Times Square, 4 minute walk to the Hudson River and on the crosstown main bus routes stopping right outside. Amazing. We hopefully will be back!!!!

title: Great Value and location
text: Great room…had queen with city view…but it is starting to show its age. Several room options/components were missing or not working. Still clean room with a modern efficient design. Location centrally located to Times Square an close to Intrepid Museum and Hudson Yards.

title: 50th Birthday Celebration
text:
The hotel was booked for us by a travel company and is not the sort of hotel we would usually book.  The check in system is lazy and does not have that personal touch of a reception desk.

The staff were rude and unfriendly when asked for assistance.

The rooms themselves were small and pokey with an awkward bathroom in that there is no privacy, the bed was like something you’d find in a hospital , it was certainly not a 4-star hotel as it was graded.

The location of the hotel is the only positive experience from our stay, it is close to Times Square and the main transport links.

Would NOT recommend staying here.

title: You get what you pay for
text:
We stayed for 2 nights during christmas. They helped us with check-in and checkout processes. We booked the skyline room and asked to be on the high floor. The view from the hotel was nice but partially blocked by another tall building in front the hotel. The room had nice amenities and reclining bed was really comfortable. The housekeeping was as expected as well. Overall the room was good.

The location is the best. The hotel is close to Times Square and Port Authority subway stations. You can get anywhere you want in couple minutes.

Only one bad experience was we asked to pay 6$ for storage of 1 luggage and 2 backpacks the day we were leaving. I would expect it to be free for the hotel guests. The luggage robot was working and it was free. However it was full and we had to pay extra for storage. They also charge for early check in.

TLDR: You get what you pay for. Any extras, you’ll pay for them.

title: Great location - ideal for solo travel
text: Lovely hotel. Rooms are small but clean and cosy, with really nice views if you book the Skyline view rooms. 4/5 for cleanliness because, while the room was always left immaculate by the housekeeping team, there are some signs of wear around the bathroom utilities and the walls in the hotel corridors are a bit grubby - probably only noticeable because they’re painted white! If you’re travelling in winter the roof terrace will not be open, which was disappointing but didn’t have much of an impact in my overall stay. Also, the hot water broke down for 2 days towards the end of my week stay, and I felt staff could have sent an email to guests informing them of this. But overall, this hotel was in a great location and the price was really attractive - would definitely consider staying again!

title: Looks cool online, falls short
text: Broken hairdryer, buttons on the bed didn’t work, no smart tv in basically 2023 in a hotel that boasts “high tech” so we couldn’t even watch Netflix or stream our phones. Heater or whatever was next to our bed was so loud. No way to call concierge so we had to use our phones and call the main hotel number. No fridge or water bottles. Lights were cool though I guess!

title: Fun and memorable experience
text:
[booked Yotel thru airBnB so wasn't quite sure what I'd get. Because there were five of Us, reasonably priced options in Manhattan are limited. Yotel had the option for 5 for about $300 per night before tax.
They overcome the fire hazard law by assigning two rooms as one. The rooms are at the end of a hall and have a cool feature: they provide an ante-room which can be used by the key for either of the rooms and both room keys work on either room. So entrance, then door on either side.
The rooms are European styled, small but with plenty of amenities. The queen bed operates as an electric futon and can be rolled up during the day. The lighting is ample. The shower has a wide shower head, hot water and good pressure providing an exhilarating experience. There are also euro-style towel warmers note:on/off switch on base).
Bathroom has a nice wide vanity. We had plenty of room for everything and to get ready.
Though modest and snug, the room is laid out well and makes staying there easy. It's actually kind of cool how the tv stand doubles as shelving for keys and change, etc. there were 4 ush ports and two 110v outlets.

I was totally satisfied with every aspect of the rooms, but for more finicky people: they are a little dated and worn-not unclean-just ready for a makeover. The charge port stations were loose and made it especially difficult to charge with the 110 block. The doors slam hard-a dampener would be nice. The toilet doors are part of the shower wall, so there's never total privacy in that room.
Beyond the room: The hotel is located close enough by foot to Times Square or Bryant park.
The subway entrance is just on 8th avenue. The area is not noisy or congested. The hotel provides a bar -which seemed always open and a restaurant-which was open a lot. There is a coffee shop open until 2-Their coffee and service is good, but it's fairly expensive.
Otherwise, the only coffee (or l'm assuming ted) is provided via a vending machine in the lobby - it was okay. There are not many dining options in the near block. We walked to Westway Diner for late Breakfast. There is a full grocery store across the street. The hotel lifts are incredibly efficient-which is always nice.
Otherwise, it was fun friendly, modern and inviting. There were a host of guests from around the world world, which was cool. I would def stay there again.

title: Dumb
text: Experience coulda been way better. I couldn’t even plug a playstation in at the least. Its either the google chrome cast or nothing. The wifi dnt even work. My clothes got flooded and my privacy was invaded. Even if the whole floor flooded and I wasnt there you should have informed me!

title: Lo Amé!
text: Muy Buen hotel. Excelente ubicación! La habitación me encantó! En piso bajo aún con gran vista a los rascacielos de upper Manhattan. Calefacción 10, cama y almohadas 10, ambientación 10, baño 10, agua caliente 10, amenities de baño 10. Nos encantó la habitación realmente. En el 4to piso hay un restaurante (no lo utilizamos). También hay mesas con hermosas vistas para llevar comida comprada afuera… o del café que también hay en el 4to piso. El servicio de limpieza es un 10 también ! La seguridad nos pareció muy bien, se accede a los ascensores con la tarjeta de ingreso a la habitación. La zona también muy segura. A 6 cuadras de Times Square aprox. Y a 4 cuadras de la Estación Port Authority que tiene conexión con todo! El precio es el “promedio” para la ubicación .. o sea, caro. Pero el servicio y la ubicación valieron la pena! Vuelvo seguro !

title: Nasty
text: The room was absolutely disgusting. The shower had someone’s hair in it, the bed was full of dust. The cleanliness over all the room was horrible .  It was a freezing cold night and the heater was not working and there was no hot water

title: Decent but not as nice as Boston location. The valet wasn’t really valet and was kind of difficult.
text: The valet wasn’t actually valet and was difficult to deal with, couldn’t get anything from car at any point. The room was decent but had no added amenities and the bed was broken to make it move. Had a good time and the price was better than a lot of other places

title: Average stay
text: Room was missing curtains, floors and units scratched, small room and limited space for clothing and suitcases, no fridge for drinks or food, location was great and staff were very helpful and well mannered

title: Over priced and underwelming
text: Definitely will not go again way over priced for its value. Location was reasonably close to bus and train. Yobot was always full and ground staff asks for fee for luggage storage. Room was tiny with the restroom being a stall within the bedroom so you can see hear smell everything. Some elevators were not working so had long lines.

title: Nice room, but no SmartTV or Soundproofing
text: The room itself was exactly as described, the bed is great. However, the soundproofing advertised was non existent, so anyone walking past talking could be heard, and the traffic outside was pretty loud. Then one night I wanted to use the smart tv only to discover that it’s not a smart tv at all and didn’t have any features other than a handful of basic channels.

title: Great experience
text: Very comfortable and amazing concept of a hotel. Traveling around always my first choice. Very easy with check-ins/check-outs. Inside a lot of offers, from coffee and restaurant to places for work. Very clean and cleaned up every day (which I almost forgot that could happen)

title: Rooms not as pictured.
text: Good location, 10 minutes to Times Square. Overpriced for quality. Rooms are not as advertised, old and worn. Broken items have not replaced overtime. Bed was comfortable, but I would not stay at Yotel again.

title: Ignorant Staff
text:
Staff were extremely rude and ignorant at the front desk. Claimed I didn’t have a reservation, which I did, and which I proved. As a young women the staff talked down to me, including the manager who ignored my distress. Have been in contact with Jorge Tito the head manager who has equally been as unhelpful. Avoid this hotel. 

Hotel looked extremely messy. I have been a loyal yotel customer for years. This yotel did not live up to standards and has encourage me to book elsewhere from now on.

title: Excellent hotel room - best bed I’ve slept in!
text:
The best bed I’ve ever slept in - so comfy and much needed after hours walking around NYC.
The room was lovely. Yes it’s small compared to some hotel rooms but it had everything we needed (and We literally only slept in the room, the rest of the time we were out exploring the city).  The cleanlines
The shower was amazing too.  Only thing missing from the room was tea/coffee making facilities.
Great views from the room - we could see the Empire State. 
We didn’t meet many staff but those we did were all polite and helpful.
I would return tomorrow to this hotel! It was fab. 
Only one negative (not even a negative really) and that was that the luggage robot wasn’t working on our last day but hotel stored our bags at a cost of 2 dollars a bag.

title: Okay stay
text: Trash in room upon arrival, bathroom smelled like urine, bathtub was dirty, bed was worn down in the middle, most concerning was when we came back to the room our door was left open- after we had put a do not disturb sign on the door while we were away for the day, staff was notified- nothing was done to rectify the situation. View was amazing that’s the only redeeming quality in our stay but wouldn’t recommend this hotel

title: Too much noise
text: Hotel was soso, the location is ok, but not the best, and the noise was too much. You can hear everything, we barely sleep. The only thing that we like it was the breakfast next in the coffee shop. Rooms needs to be clean better, also they are very small.

title: Great Location - Mediocre Hotel
text: For the price of a very small room at YOTEL, I was underwhelmed. The location is great if you are interested in Times Square, Hell's Kitchen, and Hudson Yard. The room itself had a broken towel warming rack and a missing handle on the inside of the bathroom sliding door making it very difficult to open or close, I reported both broken items to staff via their text system, but no one replied or fixed either. The main revolving doors to the hotel entrance were broken throughout my entire trip and they were having issues with both the elevators and fire alarm system, this led to a 21-flight walk down the stairs to exit the building one morning. The YOBOT for luggage was full at the end of my trip so I didn't get to use that. I've spent considerably less money at other hotels in the same neighborhood that were in much better condition, such as the Staypineapple, citizenM, and CIVILIAN.

title: Open mind
text:
Muito intuitivo e extremamente moderno.
Conforto, limpeza e segurança em alta.
Muito central para passear a pé em time’s square. 10 minutos a pé até lá. Fica a 5m de todos os transportes, turísticos ou urbanos.
Vista fabulosa! 
Ambiente jovem.
Recomendo.

title: Fab Yotel
text: Booked with Hay's travel agent for new york.  Our hotel closed and they moved us to Yotel.  Was initially worried over Yotel reviews on here.  Could not have been more wrong.  We self checked in, lots of helpful staff on reception, friendly and happy to help.   Our room on 16th floor.  There was lots of lifts and they were super quick.  Our room, not huge, but clean and had everything we needed.  Slept so well in the beds, it was super comfy.   No noise from the busy traffic on the streets below.  The showers were hot and powerful, loved those showers.  Our cleaner was amazing.  Room was like brand new, everyday we came back.  Fresh linen and the room was spotless.  To be honest after doing 30,000 steps most days in NY it was lovely just to come back to a clean, warm room and watch TV, and rest our legs.  We had small issue with yapping dog in room opposite.  But after mentioning security, kept an eye on it.   Great area, loads of nice local deli's and bars nearby.   Would not hesitate to stay again.  Tourist tax taken on checking in, but nothing else, unlike other hotels.  A great base, lovely staff in foyer area, always friendly and helpful.  Thanks for a fabulous experience in New York City, loved every minute 🥰🥰🥰

title: Deceiving, overwhelmed Staff, no more then one person can fit in a standard room.
text:
- Staff rude and overwhelmed
-unaccommodating
- Picture's deceiving 
- Chaotic check in
- Air filter disgusting
- Smaller then a cruise ship room
I would highly suggest spending a little more and moving to another place.

title: Good location, cold 🚿 showers!
text: Good location, you can walk to most of the  touristic places, soft mattresses. Small rooms. You can get better hotel nearby for the price you pay. 3 days in a row when you up after 9 get ready for cold showers as they must use some sharing water boiler. Tired to call reception IMPOSSIBLE. Always a queue and no staff. Great housekeeping tho.

title: Nice hotel, helpful staff
text: Great hotel with modern design - contactless check-in and out but helpful staff always on hand. Great value for money - cheapest decent hotel near enough to midtown- we walked everywhere, saw a lot of midtown and it was always a simple walk back to the hotel, easy to find.

title: Almost no human interaction, no one interested in helping you with any issues in your stay at the hotel.
text: Almost no human interaction, no one interested in helping you with any issues in your stay at the hotel. Be careful with the parking garage. Room was relatively clean. Location is good, Just no assistance

title: Great stay at YOTEL
text:
Location is great, close to Times Square and several main attractions. The view was very nice!
The room was clean, with good facilities and the bed is really comfortable. 
The hotel is perfect for a stay in New York.

title: recommended hotel
text: Excellent experience on the 24th floor of this hotel. Very clean and comfortable room and common areas and very friendly and helpful staff. Very central and well located to take any kind of public transportation. A special thanks to Jorge Tito, the general manager of the hotel for his proximity to the guests.

title: Yotel need to step it up
text: Its looks as if they are neglecting on maintenance in the rooms. You can see wear and tear on the wall and carpet.  All they need to do is fresh paint maybe replace carpets if damaged. A/C was also not working when I checked in.  They had to actually install a part after I arrived.

title: The rooms were very clean and comfortable.  The staff friendliness and being located in such a central place makes yotel
text: Amazing experience on the 27th floor of this awesome hotel! Thanks so much Jorge Tito the GM and all the team for making us feel at home 🙏. The rooms were very clean and comfortable.  The staff friendliness and being located in such a central place makes yotel great but the room views made the experience unforgettable!

title: Good hotel but check the small print
text: Decent location, small but clean rooms. No longer offer complimentary tea, coffee etc. The facilities fee is excessive for use of the wi-fi which is basically what you're paying for. Unless of course you intend on using the gym.

title: Margarida Silva
text: Very good staff helped us in everything we needed but the quality of the hotel and their services for the price I paid wasnt enough. Should be in mind the price you demand for the conditions that you give

title: Not worth the $
text: Unhappy with the condition of the room. Shower leaks onto the floor using up towels. Toilet was dirty. Something brown wiped onto wall that wasn't cleaned. Carpet also seemed dirty. Had to put sheets and blankets on the bunk beds when we arrived. Had to move desk to find power outlets. TV shows wrong date (Nov 4th every day) and the interactive guide doesn’t display any channel/program data. Poorly presented rooms with doors missing from TV enclosure, underside of bunk has random paint splotches when painting the walls. Instructions for wall safe were ripped off and the only help we were given was to look at those instructions - not helpful. Overall it looks and feels run down.  Majority of staff was great.

title: Outrageous
text: The room isn’t a bad size if you’re only using it to sleep, shower & use the bathroom. Majority of the time my husband and I were out sightseeing and at restaurants so it didn’t bother us. Upon arrival our sink was flooded with brown particles and we called guest service, they fixed it within 20 mins . Met housekeeping in the hallway and they are super nice . When reading reviews before staying I noticed a lot of people got hit with hidden fees and YES I WAS ONE. NEVER AGAIN. For 2 nights , we paid around $1.2k which included a $60 fee for early check in? Yikes. What flabbergasted me the most is after checking out , I was hit with ANOTHER bill for $1,188 for fees?! Seriously. I’ve been trying to contact them directly and it’s useless. So I’m taking the problem to the bank because honestly it’s unfair to not be disclosed that you’re going to be charged for amenities we didn’t use one bit and outrageous fees.  Should’ve stayed somewhere else .

title: memory for life
text:
Everything was great in New York and the hotel was good and at the right spot.
The staff was very friendly and helped me out a lot. and gave some good tips for sight seeing.
Room was not so big but i was clean with a good service

title: New York
text: Quite basic rooms but bed was totally amazing after long days sightseeing. Hot shower very welcoming. Location good though suffering with pains it was at times not close enough.. but that’s not fault of hotel

title: Le pire service de conciergerie!
text:
Service conciergerie horrible.
Allant fumer une cigarette dehors, j’ai oublié ma clef de chambre. Mon partenaire étant sorti, j’ai demandé à refaire une clef. N’étant pas inscrit sur la réservation, ils ont refusé, pour question de sécurité, de me refaire une seconde clef. J étais sans téléphone et argent, j ai eu beau leur dire que j’étais client, de m’accompagner à la chambre pour me laisser juste prendre mon téléphone pour appeler mon partenaire, ils ont refusé toutes les solutions que j’ai proposé. J’ai attendu 2 heures dans le Lobby, au froid, à peine habillé. Ils ont pas cherché à contacter mon partenaire et m’ont menacé de me virer dehors si je continuais à réclamer mon téléphone. 
J’ai jamais vu un service de conciergerie aussi désagréable et incompétent.

title: Don’t stay here
text:
Most awful place I’ve ever stayed. First room was falling to pieces. The bed and sheets were dirty and tatty. The air con vent was filthy, the wall was hanging off, the safe was broken with wires hanging out, the shower tray was stained, the mirror lights weren’t working and the wall had mould. Complained and moved rooms told us that they would refund the resort fees as a goodwill gesture. New room was just as bad air con not working and safe locked shut. On check out they refused to refund the resort fees and said that they hadn’t said that. The manager was very rude and eventually agreed to refund 2 nights. Also considering the hotel says non smoking most of the hotel smelt of cigarettes and whilst stood in the rooftop bar somebody flicked a cigarette out of the window that almost hit me. 
This room hotel was far from the premium hotel described and the pictures aren’t accurate if the quality of the rooms

title: Mitigé
text: Expérience plutot bien sur place. 50 dollars de dépot en garanti par nuit passée débités du compte mais on nous promet de nous rembourser après le check out. 2 mois et demi après et après 3 relances, toujours pas de remboursement. D où une très grosse déception. Cela est il déjà arrivé à qqn? Comment peut on récupérer notre argent?

title: Holmes review
text: This yotel is good and staff on reception when you arrive and throughout our stay we're exceptional, but the refreshments team were too busy chatting to each other and walking round ,the pods were qurkie and modern

title: If you want actual Customer Service, please stay somewhere else
text:
My stay at the Yotel was less than satisfactory based on 2 different things. I reserved a room and I needed a second room, a few days into my stay. I approached the Front Desk around 2-3am to make this reservation. The agent on duty proceeded to tell me I can make a reservation online. I stated that even though I was standing right here in front of him, I still had to make a reservation online? and he said yes. Where is the customer service in that? There was no line or anyone else in the lobby at that time so I don't see how it would be such a hassle.
I made my reservation (in my room from my cell phone) and went down to check in at 1:58pm the next day from the self-service kiosk. The kiosk stated "If I check in BEFORE 2pm, it is a $60 early check in fee. If I check in AFTER 2pm, it is free". So I decided to wait 2 minutes. I went to the front desk and asked the agent there if there were any bigger rooms available for upgrade and she let me know that there was, for a fee.  (at this point it is 2:15pm-ish because the only agent at the desk was helping another group check in and she came up 15 mins later.) I stated that was fine. I asked if I could go ahead and check in. She said if i were to check in BEFORE 3pm, that it would be a $60 early check in fee. I pointed to the kiosks and said that if it was after 2pm, it should be free (because that is literally what the self-serve kiosk stated). She stated "well maybe you booked a different reservation style that lets you check in early, i don't know". I BOOKED DIRECTLY THROUGH THE YOTEL WEBSITE. So i just took my debit card and ID, and checked in from the Kiosk without a fee. 
How does the front desk agent not know how the kiosk works? or not even attempting to rectify the situation by AT LEAST verifying if i'm correct and checking the kiosk herself? 
I am highly disappointed in the customer service of this establishment and will never stay again. I did not feel welcomed at all your staff treats hotel guests terribly.

title: So, So
text: Great location, very quiet but rooms are too small even for 1 person.  Shop around for better room size.    The hotel lobby was not very friendly.  Not too much action within the hotel.  Hotel decor was moderate to boring.  Looked cheap.

title: small rooms but good location
text: a hotel with a good concept, however the staff in charge of the luggage was lousy, super rude, especially a guy with earrings in his two ears, I asked for help requesting that I could use a luggage carrier, he only told me in a very rude way that he didn't and that He didn't care because they could only use them and at that moment there was no one

title: Not worth the high cost
text: The room was very expensive but the hotel hallway and room smelled badly of cigarette smoke (staff did nothing when reported). The advertised Yobot was broken. The front door was broken and closed off. The hotel is a real hike from the subway and transit along desolate, empty long avenue blocks. The mechanical lower bunk bed in our room didn't function correctly, it was stuck in bed mode.

title: Meh
text: OK stay for couple of days if just sleeping and showering, rooms extremely small, lower your expectations if booking here and don't pay attention to the adverts on YouTube as its nothing like it. Terrace is open seasonal and service is lacking across the whole hotel.

title: Yotel Review
text: We booked our stay in Yotel 2.5 years ago through third party and we have just got to finally use our stay! We booked Yotel as we had stayed in 2 others before,, Yotel is a great location for exploring all over New York, and close to Times Square. We had a cabin with a view of the skyline and could see Empire State building from our small window, I thing there are rooms with much better view! We were really only in our room to sleep so we new Yotel was perfect for us, the rooms as small but we knew that from other Yotels, some people might now realise that, but was perfect for us. Bed was very comfortable and we slept well, didn’t hear or get woken by any noise from corridor or other rooms, which is normally an issue for me. Overall great stay and would go back again

title: Very good experience
text:
We were on a weekend and we decided to stay close to Times Square, but not very close, this was
A Perfect choice.
Check-in very easy on the kiosks, went up and as we bought a corner queen, was amazing, I recommend this room, if you want to have a great feeling of the NY Manhattan Skyline, here is the place and this is the room. no words.
We decided to extend, and Nicole, and Stephen made it very easy.
Nice terrace to have a drink.
Location is the best.
Thanks Nicole, Jenny, Stephen and Amanda from housekeeper, she came to us to ask if everything was fine, good touch from housekeeping.

title: Fantastic stay with warm staff and practical facilities
text:
Was a fantastic stay.
We were a group of friends, easy check-in on the kiosks, then we had to change the departure dates and we went to reception, which they call mission control, fantastic people, Nicole, Jenny and Stephen all great and warm and also funny.
Expedia made a mistake with our reservations and they fixed all, I will never book again with third parties, always go direct to the hotel, when you need anything, they don’t give you a s……. The guys at the hotel cleaned everything.
Thank Yotel team.
Rooms were very practical and with great views of the city.
My next visit will be in January and will be direct with the hotel.
I tell you, great value for money YOTEL

title: Great choice for friend gather
text:
We were 5, we booked a family room, great choice, in reality they gave us two rooms with a main door, we had a corridor and two bathrooms, great value for money.
Clean rooms, friendly staff, good wifi connections, easy to access, close to Times Square, Hudson Yards, all the vibes, restaurants and bars around Hells Kitchen, than you pay this facility, but they gave you a huge variety of places where you redeem discounts, you pay $40.00 per day, but we redeem much more daily.
We will be back again.
Our place in NY.
Thanks Stephen you rock man.
Thanks YOTEL

title: Option for one night
text: The hotel is basically an economical option to spend a single day; I think that more days it would be uncomfortable because the room is quite small, I think that the bathroom does not offer total privacy, especially if you have to use the toilet, lol I think that the others will hear what you are doing hahaha

title: Brilliant hotel
text: Excellent service brilliant hotel clean friendly and nice place to stay, very close to Times Square and lots around to do, highly recommend this hotel to anyone wanting to stay in New York, thank you.

title: Scammers
text:
Where do is start rooms super small. No privacy to use the bathroom. The biggest thing was not till I arrived home in the UK . After checking my back account two payments taken out if my account of nearly £1700 from the card details i had to check in with Tried calling the hotel with no success. No one speak to about this on the phone . Despite numerous times . Had to contact my bank to try to resolve this issue.  
Be warned ⚠️

title: Valor alto pelo que oferecem
text:
A localização é ótima, perto da times square. O quarto é pequeno, como a maioria de NY. Estava bem limpo e organizado. Várias coisas que falaram que tinham e/ou eram diferencial não estavam funcionado: o famoso robô de malas não estava funcionando (mas os atendentes foram rápidos para guardar - paga 2 dólares por mala), o sistema de checkin pelos auto atendimentos ficava dando divergência de valores, no andar do nosso quarto estava sem a máquina de água e gelo que faltam que tinha. Vimos na internet que a taxa de resort incluía café e muffin mas não tinha nada disso, tudo era pago. Mesmo que Tem poucos funcionários e os que tem não estão dispostos a ajudar. 
Pelo valor da taxa de resort que cobram não tem benefício nenhum, pelo menos para deixar as malas deveria ser gratuito, mas eles cobram absolutamente tudo mesmo com taxa de resort super alta.

title: Holiday
text: Hotel was adequate for what you need, rooms small but that’s ok! Easy to find your way around from this hotel, views were amazing! Would have preferred a wee fridge and coffee maker in the room but Starbucks was close so not a problem

title: Nice, modern hotel
text: Yotel is a nice modern hotel not far from Times Square. Everything looked new. The bed was excellent so we had a good night sleep. Our room was small, but it contained all we needed. The only drawback was that you have little privacy in the bathroom.

title: Dont waste your money
text: These guys are gathering money on people who just want to experience NYC on a budget. They are not worth it please. Find another hotel. The room was barely clean, the service wasn’t great, I’m pretty sure the had bed bugs. We took pictures.

title: Excellent base for a NY visit
text:
Great hotel in a great location. The rooms were not massive but were clean and comfortable with great views (we were on the 20th floor). The shower was fantastic! We didn't use the breakfast facilities as we wanted to experience the New York diner breakfast, but as we passed it looked quite basic. The bar and terrace looked great but again, we didn't use them.
Located about 10 minutes walk from Times Square it made a great base for a week exploring NY as a lot of the sites and the hop-on tour bus are close by. 
All staff were very friendly and helpful.
Would definitely go back/use other Yotels.

title: Great trip
text:
For a budget Hotel we were very impressed 
Firstly the Cabins (rooms) are very clean, Great rainfall shower, every thing you need, safe, hairdryer, iron, lovely shower gel and body lotion. Friendly staff who were always helpful. But the best thing of all is the bed... after walking all around NY the most amazing bed we ever slept in, button pressed up and down bed sooo comfortable. Location was also very good, nice warm bar and great breakfast.

title: A Pleasant time
text: The room has a cozy feel to it. The room is a little small so there is no mini fridge or coffee pot. I only stay a night so I was good with out them. I would go back to Yotel again when I have the chance.

title: Great hotel for a short break
text: Very pleased with this hotel. Its a budget hotel but definitely not budget quality. Check in was fine, we didn't use the auto check in as we were tired after a long flight but receptionist was very helpful and got us checked in speedily. Our room was fine and spotlessly clean. TV worked fine. We had a problem with safe but maintenance chap was up in a jiffy and sorted it out for us . The bed was so comfortable, best hotel bed ever. Qe had breakfast at the hotel. It was OK. Have had better but fact that we didn't have to walk blocks to find a restaurant early in the morning compensated. Roof top bar area was busy most evenings. My only criticism is that the hotel doesn't supply tea or coffee and kettles in the rooms. Also no mini bars, hence my 4 star rating  If I could submit 4.5 rating then I would have.  There is however a cafe where you can buy beverages so I guess you could always go there for morning coffee if your that desperate. Shower very efficient. Would I stay here agsin? Yes I would

title: Short NYC Break
text: This hotel is situated in the heart of Hells Kitchen and is central to all the attractions in Manhattan and within walking distance to the Metro station. Staff in the lobby are so eager to help and advise you. The room/cabin is functional and the bed was really comfortable. Overall we enjoyed our stay and would definitely stay here again

title: Great location. Innovative setting
text: Small rooms, but very efficiently designed, the bed retracts into a couch, clean, nice shower. Well lit, great views from the windows, we could see the Hudson from our room!!! Cool check-in experience. Great location.

title: Cheap option, but not a wise choice
text:
We had some option sorted out for this trip by the travel agency
I decided to go with yotel as it was the second to last cheapest option but I also knew the Yotel firm from my travel in Amsterdam. Needless to say the Amsterdam one beat this 10:0
We had issues in the cabin, our day of arrival saw us with no body shower cream because it was not refilled. Called 2 times the reception, nobody came. Went to the reception 2 times and the second time I had the girl rolling her eye (not because I was there but because nobody had came already to my cabin) che gave me 4 single use body shower container. The guy showed up after other 35 minutes from my second visit to the reception
luggage deposit was a paying option, which was not stated in any place in the reception and it was only payable by cash. No cash? no worries we have an atm which charges you just 3.50$ to withdraw.
Service room was very poor
Closet room was almost inexistent (we had to live with our 4 luggage around a very small room, it was very hard to move around)
wifi was decent, but had lot of hickups and was not very fast

title: Still waiting for invoice after 24 hours
text:
I stayed at this location as it was very close to a conference I was attending.  The "cabins" are small but for one person it is manageable.  The "mission control" employees are very friendly and helpful and will assist if you need help with self check in/check out.   If you need your invoice for business you may want to ask for a printed copy if it is available.  I checked out over 24 hours ago and haven't received the email with the invoice.  I received a text message last night with a link to the invoice but it brought me to a website and not my invoice.  You will receive a text after check in to use for any assistance you made need during your stay but once you check out, you can no longer request assistance like I attempted to do regarding the invoice.  There is a parking garage next door but at this time the elevators are not working so you need to carry your luggage up the entrance ramp and go around the block to the Yotel entrance.  
The employees were very friendly and can assist with any questions and did apologize for the elevators not working.  I believe they are working to eventually offer valet parking.

title: Cool Concept but has Seen Better Days
text: The concept is cool, but it has seen better days.  The hotel needs maintenance and or an updating.  The thermostat fell off the wall twice, there was a drape rod and no drape.  Blinds had an issue as well.  Lots of chipped paint and scuffed walls.

title: Super séjour à NY
text:
On a passé un super séjour au yotel. Oui en effet l hôtel n est pas donné mais tout est cher à New York. L hôtel est super bien placé proche Times square et hells kitchen. Plein de restos à proximité. Les chambres sont petites mais propres
 avec ménage fait tous les jours. On n pas été embête par le bruit de la rue et par nos voisins. Service de bagagerie à l hôtel, 2 dollars pour la journée par bagage très pratique.

title: Beautiful cute hotel
text: It’s small but it’s perfect, a nice comfy bed, a nice decent bathroom and a beautiful view.  We went to a few Broadway shows and the distance was excellent found many restaurants, nice bars.  I felt safe.

title: NEEDS IMPROVEMENTS
text: Bring frabrese with you to help with the stench of marijuana. You will be awakened every morning at 7am by the sound of jack hammers due to neighboring construction even saturdays and sundays. No room service and no coffee machines in rooms. No hand held shower attachment in the shower..

title: Everything was great except for staff.
text: Staff caught with us when asking for a pillow. Then when we left we asked for a cart and the guy was rolling his eyes and sighing the entire time. We were nice to him. He just did not have the patience for this job.

title: Good location but rooms with small problems
text: The room had problems with the bed, safe and lighting. We asked for repair or support a few times, and only with some insistence we were able to move to a new room - which also had some problems, but it worked. It's also quite busy, which makes it difficult to sleep and rest if you're staying in the rooms next to the elevator.

title: Perfetto!
text:
Situato in posizione strategica, ad una decina di minuti a piedi da Time  Square. La camera è piccola ma non piccolissima, c’è posto per ogni cosa, ci sono persino asse e ferro da stiro! Nel bagno c’è una bella doccia spaziosa con un soffione grande. Tutto molto pulito e con una bella vista panoramica. Cambio biancheria giornaliera. Ci sono i check in point nella hall ma c’è anche un desk per il check in tradizionale e il personale è gentile e disponibile. 
Personalmente ho trovato un buon rapporto qualità-prezzo.  Se dovessi tornare a New York alloggerei nuovamente al YOTEL

title: Quick Review.
text: YOTEL-NY is average overall—we stayed there after staying at the Washington DC location. It doesn’t quite measure up to what I expected as a second experience with YOTEL. Things were a little worn and not in the best condition. Also lacked some of the flair the DC location has.

title: Yotel
text: I loved the place when I went with my daughter years ago. Now that I’m older, I found the room too small and I couldn’t get the AC to work and the ice machine was broken. I’d stay there again but not with my husband.

title: You will give a free past to the employees of this hotel...
text:
The best of this hotel is the bad attitude of their employees, that you get to understand after a couple of hours in the hotel. That's right. Upon arrival we got our room from the automated front desk (I like that, since being a millennial, I hate to deal with people for this tasks. Got up to the tiny room (also, no problem with that, love that from NYC - missing the Hudson hotel :/). Suddenly I start to notice: The bed can't convert into a sofa, so is extended 8a feature I was expecting to use in the room, since I was going to stay for10 days). I though, "well that's ok, ill use the common areas featured in the webpage, ill try that later". Then I notice that que curtains that separate the bathroom from the room are non existent, all of the furniture have bad wear, the TV mount is missing a part, so all cables are exposed, the "use to be" a screen in the mirror is no more and the sink is clogged. So I decided to go do to found a person, which I did in a thing called "mission control". She was, what I thought rude, but I notice that she had a speech memorized. She was willing to switch my room, but instantly I notice that there was nothing she could do since the all the hotel is like that. I told her to send someone to check the room, which she did. A "trying to be helpful" guy came up, I was nice to him, since I understood they probably had to deal with each check in like this. So basically he told me the motor on the bed "are broken since covid", he unclogged the sink and that was it. I stay there, util I needed to put my valuables on the safe, and THE SAFE DID NOT WORK EITHER. So the maintenance guy, brought another safe and in 5 minutes he unscrews the old one, and put a new one. 

So, since I was thirsty, I want to my floor for water and ice; you guess. No water and Ice, the machine is broken one EVEY FLOOR. There is just 2 working on the entire building. So  at night, I went to work to the "public areas" featured in the hotel webpage. Yeah, as you were thinking, I got lectured by this rude lady "this is a private property, this terrace is not part of the hotel, so you need to go to your room and work there" (here I did got mad, and try to book another hotel, with no luck). In my room I found out that the WIFI is useless, and the front desk (or Mission Control) won't help, they will tell you a number to call (the internet company, know, I know) and they will tell you "there is a lot of guests using the wifi, ill try to reset it). As you may know, that will not help at all, so I decided to stop waisting my time, go to sleep and go to a we work the next day. 

While being there for 10 days 1 elevator was broken, the sky lobby was under construction (I hope maintaining it), the robot that guard your suitcase was broken, the hotel was dirty (elevator with trash), and my room had mold in the shower. 

In 2022 I do not recommend Yotel, the once shiny and modern tower hotel. Perhaps they will remodel and make it great again.

IMPORTANT: The hotel is not in time square.

title: Expected More
text: For a VIP Suite, the bed was extremely uncomfortable, I woke up every hour. No amenities inside our room, etc ice bucket, coffee maker. No room service. There for mostly work so it was not a great place to come back to.

title: Recommended for your next stay in NYC
text:
Good location very close to Times Square, Hudson Yards, Hells Kitchen and much of midtown.

Very friendly staff. Clean accommodation. Some maintenance could be improved as our shower door was faulty and not repaired after reporting. Rooms are tiny but space is of a premium in NYC so totally expected. 

Breakfast in the restaurant was delicious everytime with a nice selection of choices and again friendly staff. A good place to stay when in NYC.

title: Brilliant location and hotel
text: Stayed here for 5 days. The rooms are compact but have everything you need for a short stay. The room itself was clean and tidy with housekeeping every day replacing towels if needed. The bed partly folds to allow more space and is very comfortable. Check in was super easy and a $200 deposit was taken which we knew about beforehand. The outside bar area was nice and spacious. Check out was done in seconds, we didn't use luggage storage so can't comment. The location is a couple of blocks from time square so excellent for getting around. Overall cannot fault it

title: Some problems
text: An average hotel with a good location, but otherwise not surprising. With some infrastructure problems (terrible wifi for example) and disorganization regarding reservations. Theres a $100 tax they didnt return me yet!

title: Amazing Hotel
text: Super great hotel! It’s in the perfect spot  of the city! If I’m ever back in NYC I will definitely be staying here again. I’m looking forward to stay at other Yotel’s around the world. 10/10 would recommend!!

title: Dana Inon
text: i want to thank Nicol and Lizet on their gtreat atitude and hospitality. They were very kind and plesent they made my stay very comfortable and answer every issue with calm. defently will be back next summer !!

title: Great time in NY
text: Great location, Clean rooms, easy checking in, nice terrace, rooms are small but this is NY, and we new about it. the fee called facility fee, comes with great discounts on several attractions, we paid $35 a day, but we benefited more than $100 per day. YOTEL is my new place in NY, great value for money. Jenny is awesome, Steve in the lobby is so nice and efficient, he is the guy to go.

title: Mixed experience
text: Great location for Times Square with a good view from the room. Shower good. Rooms very small with no wardrobe - had to move suitcase to move anywhere around the room. Went to the terrace bar and the prices were very high, $13 for a bottle of beer. Left to go elsewhere after one round to a bar nearby which was selling beer at $6.

title: Awful place
text: My room was water damaged and moldy, I sneezed constantly. Health hazard stay away. The place is run down and in disrepair. The location is noisy. The place needs renovation, it’s not a good place for your health

title: Great Hotel
text: Great hotel.staff were friendly and helpful.cafe was really good to have for morning tea and pastries. Brilliant location great to get to the Hudson. Or the tube round the corner. We were glad we chose to stay here. Rooms are compact but your in NYC so not in room too much so doesn't matter.

title: WORST HOTEL EVER
text: it is not worth to even talk about this hotel, will not recomment this to anybody, no manager, nobody pays attention to customers, cannot leave luggage at hotel. only one vending machine in the whole hotel and is almost empty all the time.

title: DO NOT STAY HERE - THEY WILL STEAL YOUR MONEY
text: DO NOT STAY HERE UNDER ANY CIRCUMSTANCES - THEY HAVE STOLEN MY MONEY. After pre-paying for a room and occurring no more costs throughout my stay, I was charged over £800 without explanation. YOTEL have been ignoring my calls, emails and communication and I have yet to be refunded nearly 2 months later. AVOID - THIEVES

title: Terrible
text: I was told that I would only have to pay 525 for a 2 night stay, I get there to check in and I was a bit early so on their self service kiosk it says $60 early check in fee and then when the kiosk accepted my card but didn’t let me check in I had to go to the front desk where the price magically increased to $120 for early check in. After my visit I go to the kiosk for self check out where my bill is nearly $800 for random fees they never tell you about. NEVER staying there again

title: Everything you need, nothing that you don’t
text: Yotel was in the perfect location and just right for the price. It was a bit intimidating to go to a hotel with self service kiosks, but we found check in easy and there was a desk if you needed help. Rooms were clean (they could’ve been a bit cleaner) but comfortable and cozy. Only basic necessities were provided which probably helped keep the price of the room down. The location was wonderful, only a few blocks from Times Square. Definitely not a traditional hotel experience but it was a safe, clean, and easy place to sleep!

title: Big, big thanks to Laura in Green Fig!
text: This is our third stay at Yotel—very convenient location and friendly staff,  Laura in Green Fig gave us so much good information and great tips about things to do, places to eat, etc.  She is a wonderful ambassador for Yotel.  We will definitely return to Yotel just to see Laura!

title: yotel for work
text: check in was okay. staff member hovered over me as i used the kiosk, as if i was a child.  that was the most annoying thing about this stay. mission control team pretty helpful. dinner options limited and pretty pricey, even with inflation.

title: Great location poor maintenance
text:
The location is perfect, you have lots of things in walking distance, near hell's kitchen and the piers. Just ask for a good room with a working AC unit. 
There are no fridges or microwaves, in each floor there is ice and water though

title: Overrated / far from metro
text:
Hôtel réservé sur voyageprivé 400€ la nuit au lieu de 200€ indiqué sur place… incompréhensible ! L’hôtel est trop cher pour les maigres prestations proposées. De plus les photos ne sont pas réalistes, par exemple il y a plus de rideaux dans les chambres… niveau intimité c’est pas genial. Le meuble TV était viellissant et poussiéreux et les fils TV apparaissent et laissent un effet de vétusté. Il est plutôt bien situé mais pas pratique en famille ou avec beaucoup de bagages car pas proche du metro. Attention laisser ses valises apres le checkin coute 2$…

L’insonorisation n’est pas superbe et les portes des chambres claques 2222/2223 . La vue est belle, l’hôtel fait le job, car en général a NYC on ne reste pas à l’hôtel

title: Oct 21-24
text: Very good value for your dollar. Rooms are small, but that is expected for the area, and they include all you might need. Great ambiance and décor throughout. Would 100% stay again and recommend to others.

title: UNFULFILLED PROMISES AND RUDE STAFF = MISERABLE EXPERIENCE
text:
The staff consistently failed to deliver promised services and were surly and unapologetic for their failures.
  
--I called ahead to make sure the bag check would be available when I left at 6am – but the bag check was not available as promised.  (The surly attendant said he would not take any bags until 7am.) 
  
-- The parking was not available as promised.  (The attendant didn’t care that the hotel said there was parking.) 
 
-- The elevator from the parking lot to the hotel lobby was out of service, and the attendant said it had been out of service for a month.  Be prepared to schlep your bag up the steep ramp and down the street and around the corner to get to the hotel.
  
-- The automated wake-up attendant was out of service so I called the front desk (silly name: “Mission Control”) to order a wake-up call.  The next morning the wake-up call was 30 minutes late.
 
-- I was in NYC to participate in a charity bike ride, so I called ahead and was told there was no problem bringing my bike into my room.  Leaving that morning, the guard in the lobby yelled at me for having my bicycle, and was rude and abusive.  He did offer to kiss one of my body parts, but I did not take him up on the offer.

-- No decaf in the café, and the espresso machine was out of order.  Really?  No decaf?  How difficult is it to do get that right?

This was not my first stay at this hotel, but it will be my last.  Difficult to find words to describe how awful the staff was, and how bad an experience I had at the Yotel – Times Square.

title: Would probably swipe left
text:
To start the check in experience is not great. You have to literally wait until 3pm on the dot to check in. 1 second earlier and it will charge you $60. For a hotel that is so “hip” you would think you could just check in if a room was ready. 

2. The wifi was not fast and didn’t really work well. It would work one minute and completely not work the next.

3. This hotel at one time was probably really great, clean, new, and tidy. However in 2022 that is not what was experienced. Things were broken, ruined, ripped, and out of service. 

To name a few, the water and ice machine on our floor were out of service. The bag area where you can store bags was out of service and not working. The elevator was ringing loudly for an entire night with only one elevator working causing back ups with lines for the elevator. The bed frame was ripped and torn up and looked rather mangy. The bathroom was not truly clean it looked just wiped down —with stains from over the years. Also the bathroom shower leaks out the glass sliding door creating a puddle and soaked floor towel, which was super dangerous since the floor was super slippery. 

A few positives of the hotel: 

The monsoon shower. The water pressure and dumping of water felt amazing after being out all day exploring. 

The bed was really comfortable and had the ability to adjust the head placement. 

The location is a couple blocks from Times Square and was very walkable. 

Overall I would probably never stay here again. The price was not worth the amenities or experience. I’d look elsewhere to book.

title: A great choice in NYC
text: My check in was problematic until I went to Mission Control where the woman checking me in was fantastic!  The room was clean and well laid out.  The shower was WONDERFUL. I will definitely stay here again.

title: Not that good for us but depends on what you are looking for
text:
Staff were really good but:
Bathroom smelt like armpits. Bed incline did not work. Bedsheets weren't changed. Water machine didn't work. Vending machines did not accept cash or my card. Charging for hot water. The list goes on

title: Great!
text:
This hotel has a funky lobby with black feature wall, robotic luggage storage, fluorescent light tubes and hi-tech kiosks for checking in.

The food in the restaurant was delicious. The room was quirky and comfortable. It is not often that you find a clean hotel in NYC and most importantly the staff were friendly ... from reception to housekeeping, security to the restaurant and bar.

Yotel is doing something right as this is the second hotel that I have tried and found it most enjoyable.

title: WORST HOTEL EVER! BEWARE
text:
STAY AWAY!! This is the worst hotel I’ve ever been to in my 42years. The staff are unfriendly and rude as well as incompetent. They quoted me one price on the phone then when I arrived increased the prices every night to almost double on the weekend. 
They lost one of my parcels.
The hotel was FILTHY. It’s dingy and gross for a lack of a better word. Shower is a hot mess with a curtain that doesn’t hold back the water so spills everywhere.
There is NOTHING at the hotel to make you feel at home. No room service, no concierge, no staff to bring anything to your room, won’t hold luggage. It’s bare bones. It’s a HOSTEL not a hotel.
They charged the wrong credit card and after two weeks I’m still trying to get someone to help resolve it. There is ZERO customer service. No one cares. This is by far the worst place I’ve ever visited.
BEWARE!! It looks pretty online but it’s FILTHY!!

title: Convenient, safe, comfortable beds
text: We stayed for a long weekend NYC Adventure. The hotel was convenient and felt safe. The rooms beds were comfortable. Some of the light fixtures were broken (light on bathroom mirror would not turn off). We struggled to get bedding/blankets for the bunk beds (they only had sheets when we got in) despite communicating directly with the staff. However, we barely needed to be in the room and we loved our trip.

title: Subpar, some of the staff were fab, the ones that weren’t were in 2022 Unacceptable
text: Fun, leisure, a personal vacay, treating myself to some self care. U work damn hard for my money make over 6 figures dont look like I do by choice and live seeing how ppl treat me based on bias/prejudice

title: Excellent place
text: The rooms are comfortable, clean, the location of the hotel is ideal and it offers multiple services. It would be great to see functional luggage storage and ice and water machines on each floor. Enjoy your stay.

title: Lack of integrated systems.
text: I was so unhappy that your front desk, phone reservation system, and online reservation system are not integrated. Its as if I was dealing with three separate companies.  The discount that was promised if I made a return visit (which I did one week later) was not able to be honored over the phone. The reason I used the phone is because the website was having issues. And then the front desk could not help either. I felt I was taken advantage of. Also, there was only one ice machine working for all 24 floors. The one on 9th was broken and dirty.

title: Rude, indifferent staff
text: Staff could not be bothered to assist with check-in, bags, or every basic question I asked. The restaurant staff was particularly awful. Why on earth would this place charge extra money for early check-in even one minute before the reservation begins?

title: The hotel was ok. It was a place to sleep.
text: I will not stay here ever again. The room wasn’t what I expected. It was a lot smaller than it portrayed in photos. The room smelt like mold and there was a family of cockroaches. The bright side of our stay is the mattress. It was comfortable and we did get some decent sleep.

title: Left lots to be desired…hidden fees
text: First room had cigarette burns. Both had peeling paint throughout. Throughout the hotel baseboards and peeling paint were all over. The Yobot for luggage hood wasn’t available. Had to pay an additional $50 at a nail salon to hold luggage, which should have been a free service at the Yotel.

title: Great hotel but air didn’t work.
text: Service was great, very clean, but the air didn’t work, they tried fixing it, that didn’t work. Check in process was great, gentleman that checked me in went above and beyond. The bed was very comfy and room was clean.

title: Amazing stay!!!
text: Great staff, great location and wonderful rooms! 2 great places to eat near by Obao and lily's craft and kitchen. Rooms are cozy and perfect for short or long visits, close to everything you need in NYC

title: Excellent choice in NYC
text: This will always be my to go hotel in the city! I just love the vibe! Check in and check out at the kiosks are a breeze! So easy and there’s always someone there to help I needed. This time we reserved an Empire State Building view room and oh man! The view is breathtaking! And I love the location, close to everything and such a cool neighborhood! 100 recommend

title: Fails at the basics of being a hotel
text:
There are three experiences I had for the first time at the Yotel in Times Square after several decades of staying at hotels all around the world:

1. Our party of conference speakers, all staying at the hotel, getting barked out of the lobby by the security guard while waiting for the rest of the party to join us downstairs.

2. Being told there are parts of the lobby you can’t sit in as a guest. (There’s a doctor’s waiting from style bench behind a beaded curtain that you’re allowed to use.)

3. Being told they can’t hold your bags after check out (“the yo bot is broken.”)

And that’s not to mention that the first room we were in had mold damage from the shower and the second room had a shower that barely worked. We told the front desk about the low water pressure every day of our stay and it remained the same throughout.

I would highly suggest you book a different hotel for your stay in New York.

title: Spend an extra $40
text: There’s a reason it’s 400 of 500 in NYC. Cozy=tiny. Modern=stark.  Vibe=a kitschy statue in the lobby. The electronic check-in was great. Except if you have one question or need, there’s one customer service desk for the entire hotel. I actually would be ok with this hotel on a business trip where I didn’t have to do work in my room. Just say no if you’re 30+, not traveling solo or don’t have to be at this exact location. Gym has the regular stuff, but it seemed packed with 3 people in it. If you’ve been on a cruise, you’ve been in Yotel. Maybe it’s run by a cruise line? What’s nice? The westward view, room’s clean, the bed mechanical lift is pretty nice for watching TV (but soft for sleeping). Not great-minuscule bathroom & sink, noise (I like city noise, but if you don’t…), couldn’t get the room cool, work desk is smaller & harder than an elementary school, super speed WI-FI was super slow in my experience (1 Mbps on a Google speed check)

title: I’m not sure if I would stay here again…
text:
The room was nice when we came in, we had no idea we were going to get a jacuzzi so that was pretty sweet however there were barely any lights for outside, some of the light switches didn’t work for inside the room. Our friends noticed when they were taking the extra sheets.. they found some stains on the sheets and it wasn’t ordinary food stains … *** it was *** stains - after that I felt super disgusted. It was late when we got back but in the morning when I told them about the room (we had already checked out) they said you should have mentioned it that night and we would have cleaned stripped everything we can’t help you now (which i guess is understandable)

Was the room cool - yes
Was it clean - for the most part

title: Slow, intermittant wifi, loud interruptions to conference
text: Attending a GREAT conference here. Unfortunately, the hotel doesn't seem to have mastered even the basics. in the middle of a presentation someone started drilling and fixing something in the room next door, the suuuuper slow wifi cut out frequently, nowhere to put garbage following meals, very awkward event space creating a gulf between presenters and audience...sigh.

title: Da rivedere
text:
Unico punto scarso del mio viaggio a new York è stato l'hotel.
Colpa mia che ho chiesto all'agenzia un hotel meno costoso di quello proposto, ma purtroppo la differenza si vede.
Camere piccole e non proprio pulitissime.
Alcuni servizi al cliente sono guasti e non c'è alcuna alternativa, per esempio hanno una stanza automatica per il deposito bagagli, ma questa siccome ha il robot che sistema le valigie rotto ti mandano a pagamento verso negozi che effettuano il servizio. Hanno una macchina che gornisce acqua e ghiaccio per il piano delle camere guasta anche quella.

title: Pretty Bad
text: The service was horrible. We did not enjoy at all! Our first class suite had no AC and the staff wanted to downgrated us without a refund. Seriously, I was really despointed. Try a different Hotel… cause this one is not clean ans the staff dont help.

title: I wouldn't go back here ever.
text: Front desk people at check in was not friendly, that was a definite red flag.  Security at front wasn't helpful nor are they friendly, they just sit there looking at you when you enter each time at the hotel and that wasn't hospitable when you enter a hotel.  I say hi to them and they just look at you.I had my luggage near the exit door and the security told me i was blocking the door so I went outside, I wasn't blocking it at front and they still stare at you if you still did something wrong.  They seemed pompous for just wearing a suit. The rooms are small, my bathroom toilet smelled terrible and the odor never went away.  Housekeeping opened my door while I even had a do not disturb sign along with calling front desk to not have housekeeping during my stay.  They also came to visit me an hour after I called front desk to not have housekeeping so I don't know what was communicated.  I did not get my final receipt from the hotel for both of my rooms I reserved and purchased. I was never asked if I wanted one during check-out. The check out person was named Jenny and she wouldn't help me with the other hotel final receipt bill for the other room since it was under my friends name but I paid for it along with leaving my credit card for incidentals for that room too so all I wanted to know is if I got billed for unnecessary charges. She told me for my friend to get the hotel receipt although I purchased the room under my credit card. Now I hope to not expect extra charges from both of these hotel rooms I purchased during my stay.  I wouldn't go back here again, the rooms are very small for two people along with your luggages so good luck with space.  You could hear people talking in the hallway so if you want peace and quiet, don't come here.  I had to call security twice for the people making noise in the hallway.  The first time calling, they never answered the phone.  Also, good luck trying to call front desk or they call it "mission control" because they never answer the phone.  Also after checking out, they would not store your luggage which were ski bag size so I just left and hopped on an earlier flight since I did not know where to put my luggage.

title: Great place to stay, if you don't have to check baggage.
text: The positives: the location was good, the room was clean (although it does need some updating). Had a room with a terrace and it was nice to go out and get some fresh air. The staff we met were all great. Now for bad: Biggest issue was the Yobot was not working, so that meant no baggage storage on the day of checkout (might be permanently broken as previous reviews mention the same thing). The only option was a link to a website called luggage hero, where you find another place to store your baggage and pay by the piece and hour. So now you have to carry/wheel your luggage throughout NYC to a place to store it, if you plan on spending the day in the city after checking out. This to me is a major inconvenience and one of the reasons I will not stay here again. There were also some minor annoyances. The elevator in the parking garage right next to the hotel was broken (again might be permanently broken as previous reviews mention the same thing). I know it's not the Yotel's fault, but not fun to have to carry/wheel your luggage uphill on the winding driveway into the garage. If you use the self service kiosk for check-in, they have blank hotel keys that you hold up to a device to program for your room. Several of the kiosks were empty, so had to grab some from another one. Then we had issues with our room key working in one specific elevator, where it would not let us select our floor. So we had to avoid that elevator and wait for another one. Despite those issues, if the Yotel had a permanent baggage storage location (not the Yobot), I would consider staying there again. Without it, definitely not.

title: Coolest Hotel I Ever Been To!!!!
text: I've been using this hotel for over 6 years and I have never had a bad experience. Nice place to stay for the money and it's literally right around the corner from Times Square. This hotel literally runs itself BUT if you do need a person to talk to about any issues, they are right there and on the job!

title: Fine but not really worth it
text: You’re better booking somewhere else. Impossible to find staff, and when you do find them they’re not really that helpful (booking taxis, offering alternatives to the luggage robot storage that breaks and takes days to fix, for example). Coffee shop on site is average with not a lot of options. Didn’t see the restaurant open any of our time there either. Aircon broke two days in in the middle of the night and we had to wait at least half an hour for someone to come up and fix it. No separation between the bedroom and bathroom areas. Honestly you’re better spending the money elsewhere.

title: Great place!
text: Had a wonderful time being here during New York Comic Con. The location was a great spot to get to from the con and hotel, without felling tired. I really want to come back here the next time NYCC is around.

title: If you want an overpriced room without amenities this is for you
text: There isn't an air vent for the shower. These room will have mold. There isn't a fan in the bathroom that is in the bedroom so you smell everything. There are cracks in the walls. The TV does show the TV guide, the chrome cast doesn't work, TV is too small, nasty carpet, no microwave or fridge. The food and drinks are over priced for such small portions. It's very loud in the rooms even being on the 21st floor. If you watch too many videos the wifi will kick you off.

title: Decent Location and Price
text: Lobby is starting to look a little trashed and needs a refresh.  Our heated towel rack in the room wasn't working and the luggage storage option was inoperable.  Also, the elevator to the parking garage is still down from last year.  But its a good rate and location for our needs and I love that I never need to bring toiletries.  The shower is better than five star hotels.

title: Review of YOTEL TIMES SQUARE
text: Location is great. Views were great. Inside of the rooms were a different story. The pictures online definitely fooled me. Always check the AC/Heat, Shower Pressure, if you have a Mini Fridge and Sink

title: Tolle Lage, leider Kreditkartenabbuchungen ohne Erlaubnis und Rückmeldung
text:
Die Lage des Hotels ist super, wir konnten den Check in an einem Schalter selbst durchführen. Ich habe das Hotel vor der Reise vollständig bezahlt, bei der Ankunft musste eine Kaution mit der Kreditkarte von 300$ hinterlegt werden, was völlig normal ist. Wir hatten dort einen schönen und guten Aufenthalt. 

Bei dem Check Out lief ebenfalls alles reibungslos. Am Flughafen habe ich dann eine Nachricht von meinem Kreditkartenunternehmen erhalten, dass mir ca. 1.400$ von Yotel New York abgezogen wurde. Ich habe bereits alles bezahlt und auch im Hotel nichts verzehrt, außerdem hatte das Hotel lediglich die Kreditkarte für die Kaution. Das bedeutet, dass sie selbstständig einfach einen Betrag, ohne jeglichen Nachweis und Einwilligung von mir abgezogen haben. Zwei Tage später habe ich dann einen erneuten Umsatz von ca 1.600$ abgezogen bekommen.Ich habe mich bereits am ersten Tag schriftlich an das Hotel gewendet, hier habe ich die Nachricht erhalten, dass ihnen keinerlei Buchungen vorliegen. Nun habe ich weitere E-Mails an das Hotel geschrieben und erhalte seit 4 Tagen keinerlei Rückmeldung.

Wir hatten einen sehr guten Aufenthalt, nur leider kann ich aus diesen Gründen das Hotel nicht empfehlen.

title: Nah
text:
The room showed its age and customer service was pretty much non existent. Not entirely sure what’s the purpose of having a staff member at the reception hall if they don’t want to take questions from customers and try be helpful. 
Will not recommend

title: Great Location/Clean / Comfortable Beds
text: Great location, (CVS directly across street - liquor store next door) Very clean, shower is fantastic.  The bed was very comfortable.  Didn't get an opportunity to use the terrace or restaurant.  The lighting is terrible.  Very hard to even put make up on.

title: Not a great hotel for a family
text:
I stayed at the Yotel New York Time Square on a trip to the city with my four-year-old son. First the good, he really enjoyed the bunk beds in the room, and the windows that opened a crack so he could watch and hear traffic on 42nd Street below. Also, the staff was nice and gave us a late check out when he needed to nap.

But the good didn't outweigh the many disappointing things about this property. First, there is no food service that opens before 7am. I know some young children sleep in but not mine — nor do I frankly — and 7am is much too late for breakfast on any day except Sunday, and at a hotel in the middle of Midtown. Second, what food service there was was completely not geared towards families. There was no children's menu at the restaurant, nor staples like mac n cheese or chicken tenders.
