I get that children are not their primary audience but to not even have the option was very disappointing.

Also, the room was, how to put this, well worn. It was clean and appointed perfectly adequately but that was about it. Also, the rooms lack either a fridge — would have been great for breakfast before 7am — or a kettle in the rooms?

I won't be staying at the Yotel again, with or without my son.

title: September at Yotel
text: For a great mid-town location, small and clean room with comfortable lounging areas Yotel is a very good place to stay.  The beds are very comfortable.  One should plan to eat somewhere else.  It's quite modern with not much personal service.

title: Clean hotel, great location
text: Good value for money - close to Times Square and subway, easy to find. Functional layout. Would recommend. Had trouble checking in at the kiosk. Clerk helped us check in. Check out was a breeze. Would recommend and would come back.

title: Love this hotel!
text:
I have stayed here multiple times and my experience is always so so lovely. I am obsessed with how easy and quick the check-in is on the self-service monitors/i-pads. Before staying at this hotel, I always spent a very long time waiting to check-in at busy and overcrowded receptions/lobbies, but the YOTEL experience is speedy and seamless. There was a manager that welcomed us as well, who made us feel very welcome.

As usual, the room was sparkling clean and the bed is like sleeping in a cloud. The view from the 24th floor was spectacular (Empire state building in clear view). The shower is awesome, and the shampoo and conditioner are quality products (not the usual cheap products!). There is an ironing board and hair dryer available for use. 

The location is great as well - a couple of blocks from Times Square, subways. 

We also had a great time on the rooftop! We had drinks and snacks there.

title: Terrible. Small, dirty, loud, overpricedd
text: Terrible. Small. So small. Mold and flies everywhere. Got a full sized bed even though we paid for a queen. It was so expensive. I couldnt believe how small and terrible the hotel was for the price. Should have paid a little more for an actual hotel room, not a moldy closet!

title: NEVER COME TO THIS HOTEL
text:
Its only good looking.
The service is horrible and poor.
They dont have any amenities. 
They called me at 10.20 pm to leave the hotel when I extended my stady one day more. 
Nobody helps with luggage. 
Definitively, I never come back.

title: We wouldn’t book it again.
text: Room was old and partly dirty, also way too warm. Stuff at reception wasn’t very helpful or friendly. Coffee at the espresso bar and location were nice, but all in all overpriced and not worth the money.

title: Cool space
text: Very convenient location, easy walk to Times Square and other attractions are short distances.  Shower experience was awesome.  Target, cvs and several restaurants are very close by.  We always felt safe.

title: Nice hotel
text: Very nice hotel close to subway and about 10 minutes walking to Time Square. Clean and quiet and friendly staff. I would recommend it and I will definately use it again next time we stop or go to New York.

title: Yotel 2022
text:
The hotel is in a great location, and the rooms are cosy but definitely work for couples or solo travellers. The housekeeping team are excellent and friendly, was lovely to see them every morning. 

But don’t go expecting everything to work. The luggage robot was broken (?) so we couldn’t store luggage, and paid to check in early or else stand around NYC with suitcases for 3 hours. The curtains have been removed from the bathrooms, so there is now no sense of privacy. Don’t travel with anyone you’re not extremely comfortable with! The ice machine on our floor was broken, one of the restaurants was closed for dinners.

title: Gone are the glory days
text: Have stayed here many times I over the years but last two were a disappointment. So many things not working. Safe, towel warmer, no way to get ice except by the glass full. Additional costs for everything. No luggage storage available. Breakfast cafe was great. Needs a refresh.

title: Terrible experience
text: Awful experience. Never coming back, service was rude, hotel was old and dirty. No sign for broken elevator from parking garage, there is no care for people with disabilities, website didn’t have any information about it.

title: Would stay again!
text: We loved the location and ease of use of Yotel. The room was clean and the layout made full use of the smaller space, which is the be expected in the city. Needing to use a room key to access the elevator that went to the rooms made it feel more secure. Would recommend to others!

title: Yotel Times Square
text: Great location located near very many places to shop and eat.We could literally walk to many restaurants and eat in a matter of minutes. The hotel is located near many popular sites as well. We liked that it wasn't a big time mainstream hotel. The smallness made it more suitable for us as we enjoyed the peacefulness of the terrace,or chilling in the bar.

title: NYC YOTEL GOOD LOCATION
text:
The location is probably the best thing about this Hotel . On 10th avenue between 41st and 42nd Street,  its a short walk away from times sq , and down to the river. From Jfk to there by cab in traffic and 50 mins to 1 hrs  , get a yellow taxi cab at the entrance , charge a flat rate plus cabbies encourage a tip .  Hotel itself is well worn , carpets , bed , TV all need a make over , room is small but comfortable for two , toilet and shower are in the room with modesty glass concealing the user . 
Storage space is an issue , no wardrobe just a few hangers and 2 draws beneath . Some more cubbies spaces dotted around the room , you get shampoo,  shower\ body wash , safe provided , check in was a bit of an issue as our reservation had somehow been cancelled,  but we sorted it with Mission Control . i.e  the 1 girl on at reception.  Lifts /elevators to the rooms start at lobby going from lobby to 4th floor were you get out and go round the corner to a second set of lifts that give you to the desired floor , you need your room key to access this lift . Also if your in or around the lobby or just outside be prepared for the destinct smell of weed , it's constant around the area and walking along the street . Check out was dropping of the cards and waiting for the security deposit to be refunded which normally  takes a few working days , also be aware of a tourist tax when checking in somewhere around 200 dollars  mark. Didn't see that 1 coming .

title: Hôtel en manque d’entretien
text:
Hôtel particulier , très particulier ( LGBT)Pas dérangeant , 
chambre très petite manque d’entretien 
Vue sympa avec le Rooftop 
Manque de services de manière générale :
Bagagerie 
Machine à glaçon et eau indisponible aux étages 
Check in très difficile 
Aucune communication de la part de la réception 
Plus de distance par rapport à Times Square compter 1 kms plutôt que 700 mètres 
Quartier sympa

title: It's going downhill
text: I have previously given this hotel good reviews, but based on this stay, I would have to say there are issues that need fixing.  Wear and tear is starting to show.  According to the Mission Control staff, there was only one working ice machine for the entire hotel, which was 11 floors below mine.  There wasn't even an ice bucket in the room if I decided to make the 11 floor trek.  Also no refrigerators available.  The outlets and USB ports next to the bed were actually coming out of the wall and also didn't work.  My room was shorted wash cloths one day and not cleaned another day in spite of me being out until late afternoon.  I approached a Mission Control person with a simple question about check out and was treated quite rudely.  My "view" consisted of a construction site and an abandoned building.  I have had better experiences here before and expected a better for the money.

title: Don’t bother
text:
Checked in, lady the desk was uninterested.  Had to pay $300+ in taxes which she couldn’t be bothered to explain when we asked why.  When asked for ID, the lady asked my partner if  “he” had ID, while I was stood there, didn’t ask me directly.

Advertised with a big luggage storing robot, which when we asked to store our luggage we were told no and had to use a paid luggage storing service across the road.  Pointless.

Dusty room, panel’s missing from the TV unit, mirror light was knackered.

Shower was nice though.

Didn’t expect The Ritz but put a bit of effort in at least.

title: Vibe ótima!
text: Hotel muito bom, apesar de ser enorme e ter um fluxo forte de pessoas entrando e saindo, funciona perfeitamente bem. Não tem muito atendimento, a recepção é pequena, o check in é rápido, e você se vira com as suas malas. Se você vai ficar sozinho, se prepare porque os apartamentos individuais são SUPER pequenos, praticamente só cabe você, a sua mala não tem como ficar aberta no chão por exemplo. Mas tendo em vista que se passa o dia inteiro na rua, atende. A cama é confortável, os quartos são limpos,  chuveiro bom. Tem um barzinho no 4º andar com uma vibe super descolada, com algumas comidinhas, drinks e cerveja. Ah sim, e a localização é ótima. Muito perto da Times Square, fácil acesso a transporte público. Eu amei o hotel. A única coisa ruim é que se você chega antes do seu horário de check in ou seu voo é muito mais tarde e você tem que fazer check out cedo, não tem local pra deixar suas malas, você tem que procurar e pagar um "luggage hero" . A dica é: do outro lado da rua do hotel, entre a 41st e 40nd Street, tem um salão de beleza que presta esse serviço de "luggage hero", bem fácil de achar. A experiência no Yotel foi ótima!

title: estafan con la liberación del pago de habitación
text:
Hotel no cumple con el compromiso de liberación de pago por costos de habitación por noche. 
Realice mi check out el 18/07/2022, donde se me indicó que en el plazo de 7-10 días se liberaría el pago en mi tarjeta de crédito. 
Solicité  mediante e-mail en reiteradas ocasiones la devolución de mi dinero, incluso ellos mismos del hotel me dieron plazo de respuesta para el dio 30 de agosto, pero hasta el presente (29/09) no he recibido respuesta ni la devolución de mi dinero.

HOTEL NO CONFIABLE, POR ENDE NO RECOMENDABLE.

title: Decent hotel near times square
text: Smaller rooms, but manageable and good view. Everything was very clean, you need to request housekeeping by hanging the sign on your door, it seems otherwise they don't automatically clean. Check in kiosks were broken so there was a bit of a wait for check in and check out.

title: Good hotel but poor communications
text: Got double billed. We tried to call and leave messages but no one answered the phones even though they rang forever. We were never able to make contact until we physically arrived at the hotel and spoke to the desk clerk who assured us our room was still available.

title: Eher ein Hostel als ein Hotel
text:
Fangen wir mit dem guten an: Die Lage ist gut, die Betten komfortabel und die Duschen heiß.

Die Zimmer sind aber klein und laut. Selbst bei ausgeschalteter Klimaanlage röhrt die Lüftung. 

Management und Housekeeping aber sind unterirdisch. Die Rezeption chronisch unterbesetzt mit langen Schlangen. Zimmer wurden sauber gemacht oder nicht.

Die Lagerung von Gepäck nach dem auschecken „technisch“ nicht möglich. Eine Alternative wurde nicht gesucht. Dein Problem Gast. Für 20 $ konnte ich es dann 600 m weiter deponieren.

Nein das muss man nicht haben. Für mich ein lausiger geführtes Hostel!

title: Too many broken things
text: Electrical outlets wasn't working properly, ice machine broken on both floors I checked, couldn't check in bags when I left. Ruined my last day there having to drag around my bags. I wouldn't recommend this place.

title: Tratamento ruim.
text: my experience at Yotel was bad from the reception until one day I had to stay in the hotel's Roof top space and I was forced to leave, until today without understanding the employees were stupid.  As far as I know the service charge includes water, there was a water machine on the floors but it was broken.  Bathroom exhaustion is bad.

title: Room smelled awful
text: The room smelled really bad, like sweaty socks, but the staff refused to switch me to another room. They sent housekeeping staff, who agreed it smelled bad, dumped half a bottle of scented cleaning solution on the carpet, and left, which didn't solve the problem.

title: too spartan for the price
text:
almost an hostel, i would never book this hotel again, service, quality poor. 
Yobot brocken and the susbtitution of the service was not offered. Another absur thing was that i had to prepare the bed by myself! The lining was poor in quality too.

title: Just fine
text: I paid for a suite and it was fine. For almost $900 a night, I would stay elsewhere. They were not able to check my bag a few hours before  because they were full. Then when trying to check in, the kiosk did not work and I needed to wait in line. Room was clean but nothing exciting.

title: Peu mieux faire
text: L'hôtel est bien placé et correct mais les taxes "surprises" à l'arrivée le rendent très chers par rapport à la qualité et le service proposé. Dommage car cela pourrait être une adresse recommandable si les taxes étaient revues à la baisse, si l'information était clairement donné pour ces taxes. Il faudrait également qu'une bagagerie gratuite soit proposée.

title: Buen hotel
text:
Muy buen hotel, bien ubicado (no tan cerca de los subte, pero considerando lo que se camina en Nueva York, 10 min a pie, no es nada grave). 
Los empleados excelentes, muy atentos, y muchos hablan español.
El bar y restaurante, muy completos, y buena atención. 
La habitación siempre limpia, cómoda, un poco chica, pero como la mayoría de los hoteles de esta categoría. 
Volvería y lo recomiendo.

title: Image over quality
text: I don't mind a small room, but the image they're trying to convey shouldn't come at the expense of cleanliness and quality.  This place was more like a dorm room than a hotel. The place was dirty - hairs, wine stains, mold in the bathroom.  The place was worn-out with beaten up table and trim and non-functioning outlet.  And it was noisy - like sleeping in a hallway, noisy.

title: Okayish I suppose
text:
Everything was okay!!
The check in was a little confusing with no help.
The room was tiny but that’s obvious, just felt well worn and used though. Don’t think I could have stayed more that 2/3 nights!!
Bed was super comfy! 
Locations decent but I think you can get much nicer and better for a little more money and it would be worth it!

title: Great service great location
text: Located in the heart of Times Square, Yotel was in walking distance to theater district, Rockefeller Plaza, St Pat’s Cathedral and short Uber Rides to Central Park and The Edge. Check-in and Check-out were super easy and the concierge was very helpful. Very pleased with our stay and recommend Yotel

title: Our Go-to Midtown Place
text: Great staff, from check-in to check out.  Love the Terrace for drinks and food, as well as the servers.  Great vibe., and on-site theater as well!  Neighborhood, our go to area for restaurants, pubs, etc. (PS- We used to live in this area, and it has only gotten better!

title: Yotel is NICE!
text: The hotel is very futuristic with the cabins and modern rooms that are meant to be like a pod. The bed is unbelievable, so comfortable. The rooms are small, so the bed pulls up so that you can sit comfortably in the room. The shower is a little too see through for us, so we bought some dollar tree suction cups and a black shower curtain. Perfect! The shower is amazing. There is so much water pressure and the shower head is the size of a large plate. Heaven. Location is perfect. CVS across the street. Walk to Times Square and the subway. Tons of restaurants around. No refrigerator, but we bought a disposable ice cooler. Bonus: the robot worked!!! We were pleasantly surprised!

title: 5 giorni a NYC
text: Sorge in un punto davvero strategico! Check in e out molto flessibili. Pulizia camere discreta. Peccato non avere la colazione inclusa ma questo accomuna la maggior parte degli alberghi a nyc che abbiamo visto. Rapporto qualità prezzo 6/10

title: It was good
text: Great location and a lot of places to see the bar was good, I enjoy the drinks and the service was great as well would recommend this place to anyone so they can enjoy the same experience that I had as well

title: Neat little place to stay
text: Neat little hotel just off Times Square easy access to and from the Lincoln tunnel. Clean and friendly hotel and staff. Check in kiosk are easy to use  and great for convience. Restaurant in the had really great food.

title: Great location
text: The location is perfect and the rooftop terrace with bar restaurant is incredible. Overall, I was very happy staying here. The ice machines did not work on any floor except the 9th so that was frustrating but overall, it was a good stay.

title: NYC visit
text: Great location for walking to many sights. Room was fine for my daughter and I. Good price for staying in NYC. Was noisy at night but I guess that’s to be expected in the middle of a city. Staff was friendly and available.

title: Never Again!
text:
We have stayed at Yotel NYC many times and usually have had a good experience. We’ve even introduced multiple friends to its location and fun atmosphere. However, after this last day we will not be returning.
   It was my birthday weekend and to make it special my husband booked the VIP suite for its amenities such as large private patio with furniture and hot tub.
We had checked in and unpacked and everything in the room seemed fine. There was significant fire damage to one of the large planters outside and many of the plants used for privacy we’re missing. The patio furniture was missing its cushions,  but we figured we could call the front desk and inquire later that day.
   That first night upon returning from dinner around 10 PM we entered our room and turned on the lights and all they did was strobe on and off continuously. This happened in the bathroom, bedroom and main seating area. We called down to the front desk and they sent someone right up. The maintenance person said it would take about 20 minutes so we went downstairs to have a cocktail at the bar. 
   Returning about a half hour later the maintenance person said he was unable to fix the issue. He had turned off the electricity to the lights but we could still use any of the outlets or they could move us to a different room. He said they could most likely fix this in the morning, so we figured we’re going to bed anyway, we don’t need the lights and we would wait and keep the room.
   The next day I checked in with the front desk to see if there was an ETA for the maintenance crew and the front desk knew nothing of the issue. Again, they said they would send someone up to take care of it. We went about our day and when we got back they were still working on the light issue but for the most part had fixed it. Excellent!
   Knowing that we would be using the hot tub that day and sitting on the patio furniture I decided to fill the hot tub and we checked with the front desk about cushions for the patio furniture. They said they no longer had the cushions. What? Excuse me? Why still have the furniture there if it can’t be used.
   Once the hot tub was filled I followed the directions to turn on the jets and they did not start. Once again, we checked in with the front desk and they told us that they had turned the hot tubs off at the beginning of the month. We were quite disgruntled considering we had purposely booked the room because it advertised hot tubs from May through September. No one had told us we could not use the hot tub when we checked and the room was still at its full rate. How can you advertise it amenities and charge for them but not have them available.
   And the final straw for us was during our last night when around midnight we were awoken by knocking on the door. There was a front desk person and a large security person asking if they could come into the room. After my husband had a chance to put on clothing we let them in and they said that they thought we had checked out earlier in the day and didn’t know why we were there. "Nope. We leave tomorrow." They turned around and left with no apology for waking us.
   Upon checking out there was no inquiry to our stay and no apology for any of the disruptions or lacking amenities and no offering of a discount. What has happened to customer service in the post-Covid era. As stated, we will never return to Yotel NYC.

title: Top location
text: We used this hotel as a base for a week exploring Manhattan. Great location near Times Square and while the rooms are small, they are well designed. Cool and buzzy vibe, different from the more traditional hotel and suitable for someone who wants something a bit different

title: Nice place but expensive.  $40 Resort Fee
text: The room was small but well laid out.  It had hooks, and a tray for bed, lots of cubbies for odds and ends.  All together a nice room but no chair and no refrigerator.  The ice machine was broken and the safe didn’t work.  Instead I had to tape it closed.  The bed was comfortable and the AC worked well.  The $40 restore fee was a ripoff and the terrace did not appear to be a common space but a space with a sign “please wait to be seated “.

title: Good Location
text: Hotel is in a great location for visiting NYC, but it has definitely seen better days. Had a fantastic view from our queen cabin room w/ a view, but the construction of the room could need some renovation as the outlet cover pulled out of the wall anytime you unplugged anything, and the caulking around the sink was peeling off. The room was small as expected, but was very clean and modern. Perfect for someone looking just for a place to sleep while visiting the city.

title: New York trip
text: Good room, great location, perfect for Times Square, Central Park, MSG and Penn station - just annoyed/waiting for unknown hotel charges to be refunded to my debit card after originally paying in full for Yotel New York with BA holidays.

title: Good position in city
text: Great hotel in an excellent location in the city. 5 mins time square. Clean rooms. Good facilities and helpful staff. Lifts fast. Cafe restaurant on 4th floor is nice but not owned by the yotel. Good Italian coffee and nice outdoor seating with views of skyscrapers

title: Review
text: Really liked it here. Good spot. Great location. Great people. Would stay again. Will be back probably this year as we really enjoyed staying at this Yotel. First time and we will for sure be booking again in the future.

title: Good location for a decent price
text: Great location, this is the biggest plus. Close to Times Square, big bus station, metro, lots of delis, bars and restaurants around. Our room was a bit small even though we didn't take the smallest available (Corner Queen). Bed also a bit small. In general it was fine for this price, nothing extraordinary but also not terrible. Next time I will probably pay a little bit more for a better hotel, but the location of this will be hard to beat.

title: No AC
text: Listen, I’ve stayed in lower quality places that still afforded me basic amenities. Here, however, the AC didn’t work they sent 2 guys to fix it over 2 days and it never worked. It was boiling. And I was never offered a room change or anything. They want to be a fancy hotel but yeah no privacy in the bathrooms, no blackout window shade, I’m pretty sure it must’ve been an old hospital room with the bed and strange old curtain frame still hung on the ceiling. There are better places for your money.

title: Air conditioning was broken!!!!
text: The air conditioner would not work and we could barely breathe! We had to open the window for ventilation, and no one responded to address the issue. Never again! I’m so disappointed in this hotel. Such a terrible experience!

title: Not a good hotel experience
text:
We were one week in this hotel, and the only good thing about this hotel is the location (very close to time squares). 

The hotel itself is not recommendable. The reception is not efficient for check in, the temperature is always freezing in the whole hotel (with no option to regulate the temperature in the room), and if you try to call 
the reception from the room, with luck they will pick the call with 5 minutes waiting. 

The bathroom of the room is absurd, you can't even close the door, so if you are not alone in the room, you can forget privacy, and all sounds and smell will be felt in the whole room.

Part of the staff is rude. One day at 8h30 one "engineer" (as he called himself) strongly knocked at the door to check if we had some leak in the room (???), saying it with an agressive attitude, without introducing himself. I had to ask if he was an employee, but he did not even say his name or apologizing for knocking at that hour. 

The hotel says they have self check in and the "yobot" for the luggage store, but both machines didnt work ever... people from the reception had to intervene.

In the check out date, at 10h the luggage storage was full... so honestly i suspect the capacity of the storage is not very good...

The bar has a nice terrace, but for 2 beers we paid 30 dollars...

In summary, i dont recommend staying at this hotel. There are better alternatives that are not so much more expensive.

To end, this hotel is rated with 4 stars. How can this be??? Analyzing the services and room dimensions, and the way staff treats you, it could be an university dorm.

title: At least the bed was good
text: Was glad to get early check in coming in from a red eye flight. The bed was comfortable. The view was amazing. Soaps/shampoo smelled really good. Now the downsides. Everything I looked forward to the most did not work. Rain shower did not, but thankfully handheld did. Just wish its holder had an adjustable height. No washcloth for shower either. Wear and tear between shower and toilet. The light effects did not work. Yobot was neat to look at, but since it sounds like it breaks a lot opted for LuggageHero instead. With the top sheet folded on top of the bed it felt unfinished. No blanket to be seen.

title: Des voleurs
text:
S’amuse à supprimer les avis négatifs sur google, bravo ! Je ne cesserai de poster mon avis qu’il vous plaise ou non, il faudrait commencer à assumer le vol que nous avons eu dans notre chambre, la médiocrité du personnel, l’hôtel n’a pas de caméra et en prime, le directeur nous a bloqué de whatsapp pour nous faire taire. Je posterai le même avis sur booking et tripadvisor. Vous vous êtes moqués de nous, vous nous avez ris au nez alors que, à cause de l’incompétence de votre sécurité, nous avons perdu pour 800€ de biens. A FUIR. 

De plus, en toute objectivité, leurs chambres sont usées, le robot sensé garder nos bagages tombe toujours en panne donc on ne redirige vers un service payant en dehors de l’hôtel.

title: Alles in allem zufrieden
text:
Das Personal ist sehr freundlich und hilfsbereit. Das Zimmer lag im 21. Stockwerk in einer Ecke, daher hatten wir eine sehr gute Aussicht. Leider ist das Zimmer sehr lärmig. Man hört die ganze Nacht den Verkehr und eine Baustelle neben an - obwohl die Fenster geschlossen sind!

Das Zimmer ist für zwei Personen gerade optimal. Das Frühstück war nicht inbegriffen, doch es hatte einen Kiosk mit Gebäcken und diversen Getränken. Diese waren lecker! Alles in allem waren wir zufrieden.

Das Hotel liegt sehr zentral, nur ca 5/10 Minuten zu Fuss vom TimesSquare entfernt. Auch U-Bahn und Busstationen sind in kürze erreichbar.

title: Comfiest bed I’ve ever slept in, in an ideal location
text: We came here for 3 nights. The hotel is basic but clean and exactly what you need for a weekend in New York. After a busy day walking more than ten miles, getting into that bed was like a dream. I’ve never slept on such a comfy mattress and for the first time ever, I wasn’t longing to to get home to my own bed. The hotel is located a ten minute walk from the subway and a 15 minute walk from Broadway. We had a view of the Hudson River from our room and that was a ten minUte walk in the opposite direction. I would definitely recommend this hotel if you are on a site seeing trip. However, we had a premium queen room and it was a bit small if you were to stay any longer than a week.

title: Do not book this hotel. Rooms are not worth it.
text: Do not book this hotel. Air conditioning did not work. Phones don't work. Rooms are the size of a small studio. We moved to 2 rooms. 1 room the lights kept shutting off. The phone didn't work. The qr code for ordering food doesn't work. The 2nd room we stayed in, the lighting was dark and the air conditioning didn't work. Save yourself the trouble.

title: Excellent Hotel
text: Great hotel and fantastic staff... Very clean and located very close to the best attractions.. We highly recommend it to all future visitors. We are looking forward to comeback to this amazing city and hotel.

title: Agosto y septiembre en YOTEL
text:
El hotel se encuentra en la entre la décima avenida y la calle 42, la de Times Square. Tiene buen acceso desde la estación de Port Authority, y caminar hasta “el centro” es totalmente viable.

El check-in se hace con unas tablets, y el proceso fue rápido e intuitivo. Nos cobraron $60 más de las tasas que quedaban pendientes por pagar en el hotel, y nos retuvieron $350 para un depósito, lo cual no me agradó. Cierto es que devolvieron rápidamente el dinero.

No investigamos mucho el hotel, pero tenía buen aspecto. Hacía bastante fresco en la recepción y el lobby (lo cual parece habitual en los espacios cerrados en Nueva York, tener el aire acondicionado a tope). Tampoco fuimos a la terraza, pero parecía chula.

En cuanto a la habitación, si bien ya había leído que no eran grandes, la seguí encontrando pequeña. Llevábamos dos maletas de cabina y una grande, y mi amiga y yo tuvimos que apañárnosla para colocarlas y poder caminar. La cama era muy cómoda. Eché en falta una neverita. El baño no ofrece intimidad en cuanto a sonidos. Las vistas desde la ventana eran increíbles. Puedo destacar la limpieza de la habitación.

Al hacer el check-out, dejamos las maletas con YOBOT. Tuvo que venir el técnico a arreglarlo, pero después de ello, funcionaba perfectamente. Dejar la maleta ahí es gratuito. Si no queda espacio, si nos dijeron que nos cobrarían. Asimismo, nos indicaron consignas para dejar nuestro equipaje.

En general, el hotel está bien. Creo que dos personas es el número ideal para estar agusto en la habitación. El precio es quizá algo elevado, pero teniendo en cuenta mi experiencia, volvería al hotel.

title: Nice hotel
text: If I went back to NY,  I would choose this hotel again! The location of the hotel is just great for exploring everything in the area. The subwas station is also nor far and it is still reatively quiet by New York standards.

title: It’s a no for me
text: Rooms very very little! I wouldn’t recommend for the price! The rooms are like you cruise ship room! I like the restaurant! The hostess manger is very professional! No ice machine or microwave you have to walk for everything!

title: awful staff members!!
text:
the idea is nice and the room is good value for money. but the staff are unfriendly, rude, blame you in their mistakes. DONT GO TO THE HOTEL IN NYC!!
the hotel is at least 15 walk from nearest subway station.

title: Unsatisfactory
text: Just overall was stressful checking in with no help. Then getting over charged $1600 between my friend and I! Dealing with my bank to let them know it’s not fraud….. while I’m supposed to be relaxing and unwinding! Then parking was absurd. Just a lot of things that did not go smoothly.

title: Don’t be fooled by ‘cheap’ prices
text: They add on an extra $35 ‘resort’ fee, which apparently includes wifi, a gym (that we was not even made aware of) and discounts for retailers that you will never use. It’s an absolute con, front desk staff have an attitude too. Rooms reminded my partner and I of a hospital room.

title: Nice hotel. The price is a bit too high for the experience in my opinion
text:
I would say. It's an ok hotel. Not five stars.
 The rooftop is nice and calm. Also the wifi works good. But.. turn side: the room is quite small and not super hygienic. 
They do give you shampoo and body wash and bodylotion etc.
But also I had a strange spot on my blankets and I saw that it stayed there for three days.. So they don't change the sheets very often. I think it's not a huge problem.. but it's not very super clean. ;)

title: Great hotel
text: O hotel é muito melhor do que eu esperava! Muito bem localizado, perto de tudo! Além de ter um rooftop sensacional, toda a experiência de hospedagem foi ótima. Gostei muito do robô para guardar as malas, realmente salvou a nossa vida.

title: My sanctuary in the city
text: Stayed in nyc for 5 days and chose this location for the fair price and very ideal location. When I got to my room the first night I could tell the layout, lights, and bed were very cozy, however my room was not 100% - most notably due to the bed positioning switch not functioning. I went down to the service desk and explained my room situation to the night supervisor, Jenny. She was very understanding and proactively worked to resolve all my concerns. She ended up providing a different room (with a better view IMO) and couldn’t have been happier with how she handled everything. Jenny continued to be a huge help throughout my stay and I couldn’t be more thankful for that. Also this place has super fast elevators and blackout curtains in the rooms which is very clutch. My nyc trip was no doubt heightened by staying here.

title: Style Over Substance
text: Set director from "A Clockwork Orange" styles a luxury Eastern European prison suite. 150 sq-foot "cabins" suitable for one occupant only. Upgrade to the upper floors if you can. Floor to ceiling windows. Still no upholstered chairs, no m-wave or mini-fridge. Frosted glass bathroom doors. Frosted glass bathroom WALLS in your room on lower floors

title: Unsanitary Room
text: The room looked absolutely disgusting. There were insects in the corners, there was unsealed creases in the walls, toliet smelt disgusting, shower had a weird stain on the flooring, sink was cracked, everything looked aged, the bed had tears and rips, the hotel room door sealing was broken on the bottom, the AC was dusty.

title: I don’t recommend
text: This hotel isn’t as cool as it thinks it is. The robot to store bags is more inconvenient than a person giving me a ticket to hold my bag. They seemed to have a wash cloth shortage because we had to ask for wash cloths 4 times. The rooms are so small and not well maintained. Go to a different hotel. This one is still learning.

title: Una estancia espectacular!
text: Ha sido un total acierto elegir este hotel, totalmente de diseño, la habitación chulísima y con unas vistas increíbles, un poco pequeña pero se supone que allí se va a ducharte y dormir... Y el rooftop es impresionante!! Además casi todos los empleados hablan español... RECOMENDABLE 100%!!!

title: Poor rooms
text: We had to be moved twice because our first room the ceiling drywall fell all over the bathroom shower… second room had lights not working and the AC was not cooling at all.  We had requested high floor and didn’t get no type of reimbursement at all.

title: Deceitful Confirmation Email
text: I made a reservation from the Yotel website and received a confirmation of my stay and an email that said there are no more instructions for check-in, that I will be able to enjoy my stay after I check in. When I got to the hotel I was given condescending and minimal assistance using the electronic check in computers. After this non-help, I was directed to the check in counter at which the concierge stated that I needed to include an additional $150 deposit upon check in. This was news to me. And my credit card had just been canceled. Despite having matching ID to the reservation and the (canceled) card in question, matching my ID. I was told there was nothing they could do to help except to have me request an authorization directly from my bank. And not just my bank, a personal banker. This seemed VERY SCAMMY. I ended up cancelling my reservation and leaving.

title: Expérience mitigée
text:
Le séjour en soi s'est bien passé. Le personnel a été arrangeant sur les horaires quand nous avons du changer de chambre en cours de séjour. La femme de service était très gentille. 
La vue est sympa. Les fenêtres bien insonorisées. Il y a la clim et la télévision.
 Le manque d'intimité, en revanche, en l'absence de rideau (une tringle et des crochets mais pas de rideau) entre la salle d'eau aux portes vitrées et la chambre, est moyen.
En revanche : le site mentionne noir sur blanc la possibilité de laisser les bagages à l'hôtel. Or, surprise lors du dernier jour, au moment de profiter de notre dernière journée sur place, on nous informe que non, ça n'est pas possible, que cela n'est pas marqué sur le site (c'est encore bel et bien écrit aujourd'hui), et que ça ne se fait plus. Une demi-journée à New York... sans pouvoir profiter. Sympa...

title: Great location. But do not use it if you have a suitcase with you.
text: The rooms are small but sufficient. It is well located. But the suitcase storage is non-existent to not workng well. So only use it if you are leaving when checking out. Do not expect them to store your sutcases for your day, as even the worst motels do.

title: Nice hotel
text:
Nice hotel, good location,easy walk to time square and theatre and restaurant.
subway very close. good ambiance and vibe, nice view, easy when you come by car from Lincoln tunnel, MPG parking in same building

title: great stay for money spent
text: get an updated room if possible  give yourself a minute to adjust to a different hotel experiences a great mexican restaurant 5 blocks away great margaritas  friendly greeter at entrance air conditioning unit a bit noisy at hotel

title: Really Good Hotel!!!
text:
I loved the hotel! Great location, super helpful staff, room has everything you need! And the terrace has a beautiful view, as well as great services! I want to go back!!!! 

I forgot my wallet at the hotel and the team is helping me in the best way possible to bring it back to Brazil!

title: Muy pequeña, ruidosa
text:
La ducha no tiene presión. En la calle hacia 30° y en la habitación, con los calefactores de toallas a tope, que no se podían apagar. No hay escobilla de WC
La cama es muy cómoda, pero no hay ni un armario, solo baldas y dos cajones. Falta nevera. La limpieza de la habitación se hace muy tarde. Cuando se duchan en la habitación de al lado es como si lo tuvieras encima.
El metro más cercano está a 900 mts
Las ventanas no se pueden abrir

Las persianas no tapan la luz

Al llegar, te cobran 41 eu de tasa por cada noche. Aparte de lo que ya has pagado
Para dos personas ES MUY PEQUEÑA, porque no hay ni sitio para dejar las maletas

title: Cool hotel, great staff
text:
Yotel is trendy and cool. Rooms are small, but so well laid out that it doesn't feel cramped. The bed is probably the best I've ever experienced in a hotel. So soft and comfortable it is impossible not to have a great sleep. Monsoon shower is also great.

This is Yotel's original property, so it is showing its age. The first room we checked into had a few things out of order: bed wasn't closing and two lights didn't work. However, upon talking to the Mission Control team we were promptly moved to another room, with a better view, in which everything worked properly. Mission Control team was always helpful and friendly, ready to help with anything we needed.

Yobot was finally working after many months, however it broke down again on the last night of our stay. So don't count on it to store your luggage.

Overall, it's a very good hotel for the price, even with the pricey facility fee. It's comfortable, in a great location and the staff are great.

title: Great hotel!!

title: No AC and no customer service
text: AC was broken the entire time, no ice or water, no customer service, dead bird at the restaurant, dirty sheets. Front desk not responsive at all and rude. No one knows if there’s room service or housekeeping.

title: Avoid this place: rude staff and no storage room
text: Terrible experience. The place has 100+ rooms and storage for 10 (TEN!) suitcases. Luggage store room is first come first served, but only 10 spots are available to use. As a consequence, people were confused in the lobby and the staff said they “should be thankful that this place offers 10 spots, most places don’t have it”. I wonder which majority of 200 dollar hotels do not offer a place to secure your luggage before check in/after check out for a couple of hours. I strongly recommend avoiding this hotel.

title: Facility fee
text:
Apart from the fiscal and transparency implications to it, I find it aberrant to not disclose / apply the real price of lodging at a hotel to (potential) customers when they book through tourist operators and the like.
We visited the Yotel and were charged with this facility fee upon arrival. 
We had no clue about it or its height, and were simply made to pay it without any explanation whatsoever about the facilities we would get or could make use of in return, or any extra coverage that the fee would provide.
As far as i can see, there is nothing you obtain in return because all of the in-hotel facilities you get access to are the ones that are announced when you make your reservation, only to find out that their availability depends entirely upon paying this facility fee.
And it is not a symbolic fee (like a tourist or a city tax). No; it is a heavy surcharge.
After paying it, you are not exempt from paying tips either: the bar/restaurant personnel and the housekeepers/cleaners still expect those to come from you.
Nor does it allow you making use of regular, completely basic, hotel items like a kettle to boil water in your room: no way of getting one. I found this extremely disappointing and even indecent.
It seems that the facility fee offers discounts in some shops and stores in the surroundings, but we were not informed about this either. Moreover, this is no reason to charge a facility fee in a mandatory fashion. If customers want to enjoy this kind of benefits, it should be optional. Just like some will buy a City Pass and others don’t.
As for our room and the location / neatness of the hotel. This was all well / as expected. And that’s just how it should be: “what you see is what you get.”
Unfortunately, with the facility fee it is totally the opposite: it’s a bad practice in every way that you look at it.
If you want a no-frills hotel in a well-connected area, Yotel is certainly a recommendable option. However, its facility fee charging policy is not.

title: Yotel Notel
text:
Yotel is a No-tel - On check out - the bill we noticed service charges, strange as we had no amenities.

We did not use any services. infact were not able to! not sure they existed.

at check in 
was told the “Robot” Luggage storage was full, that we had to pay $$$ to use “storage” across the street or book an early check in!! Travelling with kids we agreed. How can a 4 star hotel not offer luggage storage? As we walked down the hall to our “cabin”  things looked very worn and my kids asked if people can smoke in hotels in NYC ( cigarette smell was STRONG) 

We were given a room that was musty, noisy and with a tv that did not  work. We unpacked and had to repack and go downstairs to ask move rooms. Our next room, tv also did not work. Called down and had to wait for repair and only basic tv stations worked - like in the 1980’s. We were told hotel had issues with Google Chromecast. So much for “early check in” and  futuristic ammenities. 

The kids went to get ice ( there was no “robot” to be seen bringing ice) the kids come back - no ice - our floors ice machine was broken. We call down, there are no ice buckets and NO ice machines working - only on floor 9 - in a hotel with 27 floors 
at floor 9 ( was a mess) we had to use plastic cups to get ice for the room. The towels felt like towels at a low end fitness centre, not a 4 star hotel. The soaps were in jars (like at a restroom) wondered how sanitary that was? Flooring felt and smelt like damp indoor outdoor carpet.

We have stayed at Citizen M - POD etc so used to contemporary rooms, but clean and comfortable rooms minus a constant smell of cigarettes. 

The wifi was sporadic at best, going off at night, having to relog on. The elevators were at times dark and stank like smoke? We booked the YOTEL for teens birthday and left early.

We travel often and always wanted to try Yotel, especially when in Europe. Maybe this experience is not typical but it made for a very uncomfortable stay in NYC.

title: Really good

title: Simple but works

title: Service could be better

title: Poor quality compared to price
text:
For the amount I paid for a night, I expected a lot more. Room was fine and clean, with a nice view, but the rest of the hotel grounds were on the nastier side. Overflowing trash bins, dirty carpeting. The wifi was also very poor, coming in and out through my stay. 

I'm also used to seeing hotels having hidden resort/facility fees, and this one was no exception. What set this instance apart is that there's no one around to tell you what it covers. Did I get a breakfast credit? Tourist tickets? I'll never know.

Last gripe is that early check-in costs $60. That's insane, especially when I'm the one checking myself in at the kiosk. It's like I paid you to make me do work haha. If I had not gotten in the city around 10AM, off a red eye, and it hadn't been sweltering July, I would've just waited til check in time but I was desperate. 

Overall, I just wish I'd spent that extra $60 getting a real hotel with an actual staff. Outside the location of the property and the decent sized rooms, I can't recommend this property.

title: Yotel is the coolest!
text: Seriously, Yotel is so fun and so cool! title: First Stay
text: Served as our homes base for exploring NYC. Convenient location. Safe. Clean. Friendly staff. Basic small rooms but plenty of space for two and provides for all basic needs.  World stay again for sure. Want to check out their other locations as well.

title: Almost Perfect - Would stay again
text: I'd read some reviews here after I'd booked this hotel and was starting to think I'd made a terrible mistake in that nothing would be working in my room!  I was relieved to that everything worked as it should!  The smart bed is a great feature and soooo comfortable!  I loved the lighting behind the TV.   The waterfall shower was amazing! I had a room with a 'river view' which was the least expensive and I was blown away by the lit up buildings at night - it was everything I wanted coming from the UK!  The room IS small, but I suppose it depends on what you are used to.  I'm used to small budget Travelodge rooms in the UK, so this is like a high end, luxury version of that for me!   Rooftop terrace was lovely. I stayed during the week, so I can't speak for the weekend, but I found it quiet almost everytime I went to it and always plenty of places to sit and enjoy a meal or coffee to start the day.  The only disappointment for me was the  lack of coffee making facilities in the room.  I had to go down and buy one on the 4th floor by the rooftop terrace, which was a pain, because I tend to drink my first coffee of the day in my pyjamas to wake up and THEN get showered, dressed etc!  The location was perfect - five minute walk to the subway and just a little further along is Times Square.  Also perfect for the Circle Line Harbour Tours as that is a five minute walk in the opposite direction.   Luckily I only had a backpack with me, so the luggage robot being out of order wasn't such an issue for me as it could be for a lot of travellers and it does seem that it's been out of service for months.    All in all, I would stay again and was more than happy with this hotel - they just need to iron out a couple of things and they would get more 'excellent' rating!

title: Great stay

title: Let Down
text: Everything I requested was not what I saw when I walked into my room. I’ve been to several hotels and this takes the cake as the worst one with the worst service. By the time I got back to my room I had to walk back downstairs and checkout. The service here is terrible, the rooms are not what they are advertised to be. It is a complete waste of money.

title: what a pity
text: i had been in this hotel 10 yrs ago and i was very satisfied with it. this year i came back to NYC and i did not think twice and booked it again. unfortunately only the location stayed the same. the level of maintenance is embarrassing as well as the caring for customers. some examples: curtains separating toilets from room have been removed (still rail is there) so there is a total lack of privacy (you can add in room 2318 the toilet glass door did not close…), basin and furniture worn out and dirty. the common areas are dirty, totally abandoned and with facilities not working. one night the terrace (the only cosy place) was completely unavailable due to private event, without even thinking of reserving at least some space to hotel guests… and on top the luggage service is not available… a basic service offered everywhere! i understand the magic robot is not working (i understood since months), but you can offer an “old” manual service with labels… the most told word from staff is ‘apologies’… maybe better to find solutions instead of apologising for everything… and on top we asked to talk to manager and he was just laughing at us saying all things not working are clearly stated on the website so if we did not like it we should have booked somewhere else. well, for sure i will do next time and i honestly would recommend anyone to look for an alternative solution. such a pity, a smart and nice hotel concept promising a great experience totally destroyed by the way this hotel is managed.

title: Yotel is Horrible
text:
I hate this hotel so much. It was dirty, nasty, the crew was not helpful at all.
There was no hot water, everything was way overpriced, they don’t allow you to check in until 10 and they make you check out at 11 and don’t even allow you to store your bags. It was cramped, dirty and smelly. I hope I never have the displeasure of staying at this point leave again.

title: Yotel New York
text:
The hotel itself is nice. The room was clean and orderly thanks to the housekeeping staff who was very helpful. I Will say the purple light that is showcased was broken. But, Jared from engineering came to our room and had it fixed within 30 minutes. The lightbulb had blown and he replaced it promptly. He was very nice and fixed the issue gladly. The mission control staff was very friendly and prompt as well they made sure everything was taken care of. The only downsides we found came from the room design itself. The bathroom was more of an open concept than I think most are used to. There is no actual wall between the shower or toilet and the rest of the room so sharing the room with someone could be a little bit awkward. One thing We didn’t know when booking is that Yotels seem to be independently owned and operated so some of the standard things you will see from yotel do not apply to each location. For example asking the yotel chat bot about late checkout will give you a different answer than mission control on location. So it would be best to just ask mission control at the location rather than yotel. 

There is no way to give multiple ratings so I can leave this here
Staff 5/5
Cleanliness 4/5
Location 3.5/5
Amenities 3.5/5
Value 4/5

Overall the hotel and stay was very good they had exceptional staff and were very friendly.

title: Such a disappointment
text: Don’t stay at this hotel.There is no service they just want you to book in by machine (if you are 2 minutes early they charge $60) they don’t tell you how to get to rooms (it takes two elevators).The rooms are so small the door hit the bed  . No light Tv was damaged with big black stain in screen covering six inches . Safe was broken . No tea or coffee making facilities as they want you to pay for theirs.They don’t store luggage as they only have a robot thing that’s has been broken for weeks so you are left to walk around Manhattan with your luggage. Position isn’t even that good, I have been to New York many times and this is definitely the worse hotel I have stated at . Very over priced for what you get which is nothing but a bed

title: Weekend Trip to NYC
text: Overall the Yotel experience has been great my last 3 visits. Comfortable rooms, great view. Only disappointment has been the towel warmer not working and not Being able to connect to thE SmartTV. I definitely will be returning

title: Bon hotel
text: Hôtel vieillissant ne disposant plus d’un service de dépose valise pis avons dû en louer un à notre charge à côté. Cependant l’hôtel reste bien situé et propre. La literie est confortable et la chambre dispose des équipements nécessaire

title: Not a great deal
text:
First — Just know upfront — they won’t store your luggage if you get there early or check out before you leave the city.  They said it’s because their little luggage robot thingy is broken (it’s been broken more than a year) and they say they have no way to store it.  I am not sure why a closet isn’t an option… but.  So your options are you can pay $59 for early check in or late check out, you can sit with your luggage (but there isn’t much seating because for most of seats and the lovely patio you have to buy something from their restaurant) or — they have a QR code for independent places that will store your luggage for a charge.  The closet place is across the street and $2 an hour excluding tip.  So budget extra $$ depending on how long you leave your bags.  (on their web page —under the description of their amazing luggage robot — it says their robot isn’t working but if you book third party or don’t read about the robot you wouldn’t know and other places on the website it lists bag storage as a service) Additionally — they have a $40 resort fee. This is not uncommon in NY but it usually comes with some small benefits.  Their benefits are things like discounts on squash lessons and eye glasses (who comes to NY to get glasses?!).  I am not sure why the resort fee instead isn’t a discount to the off site luggage storage or their restaurant— which would actually be useful. 
Service was not professional.  Guy monitoring check in kiosks had no idea what is going on.  The front desk person repeatedly called me “love” and the manager called me “dear”. This is not an appropriate way to refer to an adult and not professional.  They had looked at my reservation so I don’t know why they didn’t just use my name.   
The rooms are fine (that’s why the 2 stars).  Small — but that’s to be expected for NY.  But it’s a 4 star hotel with 2 star service.  Basically they don’t seem to be playing the long game.  They would rather use shrink-flation than have repeat customers.  Heed the reviews.   They have a low rating for a reason.  I stay in NY a lot.  You can do much better (room size, location, amenities, service) for the same price somewhere else.

title: Big city/small pad
text: If you are ok with everything you need in a small space I highly recommend Yotel NYC. Plenty of amenities in the Yotel. Only 3 blocks from Times Square.  Our room was Incredibly quite. Mission control is extremely helpful. Checking is pretty easy and I’m not that tech savvy. Wifi is very good. I will stay again

title: BIEN MAIS SANS PLUS
text:
L'arrivée et le départ se font sur tablette, le personnel à part 2 est vraiment moyen, ils font la tête, ne cherche pas à vous comprendre. J'ai eu des taxes de 337$ alors que mon agence les avait payées, c'est en cours de traitement pour un dédommagement, de plus des taxes pour des services qu'on n'utilisent pas (salle de sport, parking, spectacle, terrasse) c'est cher payé.
Pour le ménage je n'ai pas eu de problèmes même si le lit était fait en surface mais les draps étaient changés (certes pas tous les jours mais chez soit on ne les change pas non plus tous les jours) ainsi que les serviettes (grandes, petites, et toutes petites) tous les jours avec poubelles vidées. Sèche cheveux, savon main, douche, shampoing et après shampoing.
La chambre est petite mais fonctionnelle, par contre il est vrai peu de place pour les affaires, 2 tiroirs, 4 portes manteaux. Il y avait un table à repasser mais pas de frigidaire comme indiqué (sûrement pour les chambres plus chères) et au vue du prix des repas cela aurait été intéressant. Néanmoins tout le monde allait chercher son petit déj ou dîner et pouvait manger dans les chambres ou sur le site. Je n'ai pas profité de la terrasse qui était plutôt réservée pour le restaurant. La literie est super confortable.
L'hôtel par contre est très bien situé pour les sites : un bus à l'angle de la rue, le métro à 10 mns, Times Square et Brodway à 15 mns, supermarché à moins de 2 mns, Top of the Rock (20 à 30 mns), The Edge (à 10 mns).
Je n'ai pas rencontré de problèmes de nuisances sonores.
Dans l'ensemble bien mais sans plus s'il n'y avait pas autant de taxes pour des services inutilisés, mais comme partout, tout se paye.
Bon à savoir comme personne ne vous dit rien : prendre l'ascenseur jusqu'au 4 puis ensuite un autre pour monter dans les étages. Il y aurait aussi une salle pour laver le linge mais vu le dernier jour.

title: Terrible bed
text:
The bed is basically a fold out sofa bed because of the small room size. Both my husband and I ended up with back & leg pain (I’m not usually a back pain sufferer). We eventually slept up the other end, which was better. 
Room was very clean & modern, but as said, very small. The bathroom is essentially in the same room as the bed, separated by a glass door that doesn’t seal. Looks cool. Having to use the toilet while your husband is in the same room, not so cool. Even worse when he needs to use it! It’ll either make you closer as a couple, or break you!
Ice machine on the floor not working due to Covid, also no refrigerator.
Roof top terrace was great & food was tasty.

title: No-tel for Yotel
text: I've stayed @ Yotel in other cities and have been more than pleased. This was not one of those times. This was really not a good stay. Front Desk told me they could not give me the room I booked originally (4 person) but could only do 2 rooms next to each other (not what we wanted) and that the 2nd room would be comped. At that point I could've stayed at ANY hotel but wanted Yotel because they said they had the room for 4. We all came together and had to divided up with no warning and it started the trip off on a bad path. Lobby smelled horrible. Have to take multiple elevators to your room. Can't even call the front desk from the room. The sockets worked on and off, no fridge for leftovers or to keep anything cold. No idea machines except on FL 8 (Another guest had to tell me that). Stay here ? Never again!

title: Review of Yotel NYC
text: Overall average rate, price was good no enemities and service was slow. My biggest issue was no ice on any floor the ninth floor which  was supposed to have ice the machine was broke. Our iron was broke, but after calling the concierge, they did bring up another iron that worked, the only other issue was we were late for breakfast because of them bringing the iron up late.

title: As advertised
text: Very happy with our stay. The price was right, check in and check out was easy. The room was well-designed. Our “smart bed” was not smart (did not go up and down) so we had to squeeze past each other and plan our trips across the room. It was fine for a couple of nights, and too much trouble to change rooms. The restaurant, Green Fig, was tasty and well-priced. We loved that we could eat outdoors on the terrace.

title: Just a fancy youth hostel for young people
text:
This is nothing more than a fancy youth hostel. The front door was broken, the room to store your luggage was broken, the bed/sofa was broken…

Check in is all self done with a little computer pad. You need to fumble and navigate on how to make your own key cards and check yourself in. If you want to go check in at the front desk with a real person, the line was about 12 people deep. YIKES. 

The rooms are approximately 100 ft.²!! Because the bed was broken and never could fold up (as intended) you open your door and immediately trip over your bed. There was barely enough room for two normal size adults to open their luggage and just exist. 

There is no proper door the toilet, so you better like the person you’re with because you will smell and hear everything.

Since we were planning on storing our luggage for the day until we switched hotels, we inquired within. After navigating a robot telephone system from our room, we finally got a person who told us we need to pay for our own luggage storage and we need to go find the storage place called “luggage hero”. They couldn’t tell us where it was, but we just needed to “go look it up and go and pay for it and figure it out”. WOW.

To-go coffee from their bistro are four bucks each… luckily they were tasty & convenient… even though over priced.

One nice thing about this place is they have an outdoor area with a movie and dinner every night. However when we tried to get a table, they said they had no room for us and we were sent away. 

Needless to say we switched to a Hilton on West 57th after 1 night, where we had a nice sized room, a full staff of people at the front desk to check us in, and a bodega next-door with delicious $2 coffee in the morning.

title: Vacanza a New York
text: Hotel con una buona posizione. Purtroppo le camere, anche se dotate dei confort, sono veramente piccole e non c’è spazio nemmeno per aprire le valigie. Il letto da la possibilità di recuperare un po’ di spazio, in quanto dotato di un meccanismo che lo porta indietro. Buona la vista. In compenso, lo staff è stato davvero gentile e molto disponibile. Comprensivo sotto tutti i punti di vista.

title: Great Place For A Quick Get Away!!!
text: Great place to get away for a weekend stay in the heart in Midtown plenty of restaurants and entertainment choices. Just steps away Time Square and all Broadway Shows!!  You can’t go wrong with the Yotel for a weekend get away!!!

title: ANTS!
text: Room 824 was infested with ANTS. They were coming in from the Terrence and were all over the rooms or the room. It was very comfortable walking around, not pulling anything on the floor or sleeping thinking what if they got in the bed. Very disgusting and disappointing for the money spent on that room.

title: Yotel
text: I think it is ridiculous that for the price you pay you cannot leave your luggage in this hotel between checking out and leaving to the airport. We had to find a storage in town. The room was ok but not very special for the price you pay.

title: Esperaba más
text: Por el precio pagado, esperaba un poco más, la habitación es minima, casi no podíamos caminar, el baño dentro de la habitación pero abierto, cero intimidad de no ser por una cortina, la cama no se podía hacer sofa como decían para poder tener un poco mas de comodidad. Es un hotel muy grande, internet muy lento o directamente no funcionada y las luces por favor!!! no pueden poner luces normales y no esas luces de colores que aparentaban un hotel alojamiento? Caro para lo que ofrecen.

title: Awful Stay. NEVER AGAIN.
text: The Yobot storage was being repaired so there was no place to store  my luggage  before  my matinee.  They charged 59.00 to check-in  early.  A money grabbing  scam if I am being honest. The iron in the room spewed water on my shirt. I called for a new iron and it never get delivered.  The t.v was also problematic  as I couldn't  get clear reception  on the local network  channels. The other channels  weren't  optimal either.  I am a major  theater fan so I come to NYC on a regular  basis and this was my worst hotel stay in recent memory.I emailed  corporate and never received  any kind of response.  It will be a wintry day in hell before I stay in this hotel again.  Do better.

title: Outstanding Value.  Everything you need (except coffee)
text: I was looking for a one night crash pad.  When I Yotel was offered up as some sort of special promotion on one of the booking sites, I jumped on the price and location since previous reviews were very positive.  Check in was done at a kiosk.  The process was relatively intuitive, and next time I'm sure I will be able to move through it a bit more quickly.  I was really plased with the "cabin".  It is, indeed, very much the size and configuration of a cruise ship cabin.  Everything you need, and nothing you don't.  (Although a coffee maker would be nice.)  The bed is electrically operated to move from a recliner to the sleeping configuration.  The room was perfectly clean, and everything worked.  Unless you need to spend a lot of time in your hotel room, this is a great place to stay in the city.  I didn't get a chance to enjoy the terrace or the restaurant, but both looked very inviting.  My only complaint is that the mattress was crushed where people tend to sit, and I kept rolling into the divot all night.  Highly recommended and I'll be back.

title: Good Price, Amenities Sucked
text: I had issues with a/c and wifi which truly altered my entire stay. A/c was reset but still was not cold. Also the text assistance was a complete joke. Even when prompted to speak to the staff, it never got me connected. Such a let down

title: Yotel 2022
text: Great location, walking distance to Time Square & Port Authority.  Small room but sufficient.  Great shower and bath amenity.  Complimentary coffee & muffin no longer available.  Should considered providing in-room coffee maker.  Good view.

title: Fabulous hotel, Spectacular Views!
text: We had a corner view room which had the best views I have ever had when staying in NY.The room had floor to ceiling views on 2 sides and as we were 21st floor we had spectacular views. The price wasn't much more than rooms elsewhere with no view at all!!!! 10 mins walk to Times Square and 5 mins to 9th avenue restaurants. Lovely wonderful staff who went over and above to be helpful. I'm not even bothering with comparison websites for future visits. I'm just booking this hotel!

title: Amazing room and view
text: Friendly staff great room and worth every penny. We were cancelled from our original hotel, whilst on flight from uk. Arrived with nowhere to stay. Found Yotel and what a great find it was. Great location for Times Square, good places to each and close to the harbour.

title: DO NOT STAY AT THIS YOTEL
text:
Used to be good but now I rate it an F, while it’s a cute a
Unique place it is no where up to par. 
We booked when there was a special deal and it said we could change reservations until 48 hours before arrival, did not say we would loose the special rate. So we paid more for the room. 
When we arrived the AC was not working , attempted to get ot repaired via text , told to open window. It was over 90 degrees in NYC this weekend. Finally spoke with person who assured me it would be fixed when we returned few hours later. It was not. Again requested help at 1:27 AM they sent someone to the room he fiddled with something, said it was fixed, it was NOT. 
Earlier in the day 8 requested an ice bucket told , via text, to go to 4 th floor, no one on 4th floor all weekend. Requested ice at bar/restaurant said they could not give me ice and directed me to broken ice machines on floor 8, 9, 10….found working ice machine on 18th floor, but no ice bucket. Had a small cup. 
Meanwhile the room was getting dangerously hotter by the minute. 
NO HELP WAS OFFERED, NO ROOM CHANGE , just sent someone to room in the middle of the night and he did not repair. 
It’s a cute joke of a hotel for an outrageous price!

title: Cutre y caro
text: Habitaciones ínfimas, mobiliario descuidado, espacio para maletas inexistente y para la ropa, ridículo. El baño pegado a la cama sin separación de ningún tipo (bueno sí, el cristal de la mampara) intimidad nula. Caro para lo que ofrecen. Hay hoteles mucho mejores por el mismo precio, incluso mejor ubicados. La terraza muy chula sí, pero para tomarte una caña tenías que tener reserva anticipada. Lo que ya me pareció el colmo, fue el servicio de consigan de equipajes, presumen de ser un hotel moderno e inteligente, y el robot que tienen para guardar maletas, lleva meses estropeado. ¿Solución? Reservar mediante app y pagando claro, en un local cercano. Un sinsentido todo. Desde luego, no lo recomiendo para nada.

title: Not as magical as advertised
text:
Really did not live up to expectations, and did not provide services advertised.  

They were supposed to have a luggage storage system, and instead, do not have any luggage storage at all because their machine is out of order. Instead they recommend you use a 3rd party app to find a nail salon a block away and pay extra $,  shuffle luggage down the streets of new york again….

The guaranteed checkin at 3pm was not true and the check in machines weren’t working with a long line at front desk of other people with same problem.    I had asked a staff member when I had arrived (with my bags I had to store) at 10am, if check-in  would be possible at 3pm as advertised, and they confirmed yes.   It was not true.   If they were more honest they could have mentioned 3pm is not always guaranteed and I could have planned to return to hotel a little later.  

The room itself looked very nice.  
Some issues with the room:
The airconditioner did not cool enough (the hallways were cooler despite lowering the thermostat- and the duct was very dusty- the filter box on the wall of room was full of dust too. 

The room service app and code did not work, and the restaurant staff knew this, but the other hotel staff did not, and the staff had recommended it when asked.   (Also, Ice machine on level appeared permanently out of service, and no indicator on it of where to go to get ice).  

The in room netflix/streaming link did not work, so TV only had basic cable and the room guide channels were just an ad that would loop.  

We were given an ADA (handicap retrofitted room) and the bathroom is poorly converted so bathroom floor was always wet from the shower due to poorly designed floor dividers, and the bathroom door did not close properly. 

It was way too expensive for the many little things wrong that seemed to be left that way for some time.   It also isn’t very close to Times Square- its title-  on foot- being more that two blocks westerly. it is closer to the hudson river/hudson yards.  This is just notice for people who are attending something in times square, to know its a little farther away than its name might infer… 

The style of the place is beautiful, and the staff were very nice.  The restaurant deck is lovely.  The gym is small but nice.  The elevators work well. The view from the room was nice.  

I normally don’t write harsh reviews but i felt kind of ripped off, and victim of a bait and switch from what i saw online and what i got.

title: Excellent
text: We really enjoyed our stay, the room was great and the bed was so nice ,the reception from staff was warm and they always responded in a timely manner whenever we had any queries and requests. I would recommend this hotel to my friends and family the location is perfect

title: Bad experience
text:
Bad experience, service was too bad, automated services like check in, Yobot, etc.
Every time waiting at Mission  Control, lack of communication between or how can you explain 3 days asking for cleaning the room or for changing a towel?

title: Modernes Hotel in einer Toplage
text: Das Hotel liegt wirklich zentral, die Zimmer sind nicht riesig, aber vollkommend ausreichend für ein paar Tage in New York. Das Personal ist super freundlich und das Restaurant macht einen klasse Burger. Das Selfcheck In System spart viel Zeit. Zum Time Square braucht man 8 Minuten und zur Anlegestelle zu den Schiffen 5 Minuten. Vor dort kann man mit der Circle Line eine tolle Fahrt machen. Wenn man ein paar Dollar drauf zahlt bekommt man ein Zimmer mit Aussicht. Das habe ich getan und es hat sich gelohnt.

title: Terrible
text: Terrible. Not worth the money. Small. Expensive. Loud. Smelled like weed everywhere. The brunch spot had terrible service. The self serve crap was not fun and if you did need face to face help there was only one person at the front desk and then line was usually very long.

title: Cute but missing important details.
text: I wanted to love this hotel because the aesthetic is cute and the location good but it fell short as a practical place to stay for my kind of travel. No mini fridge or coffee in the room and no free bag storage on site (you are directed to use Luggage Hero which costs extra and you have to get to). Unfortunately the fun vibe didn’t outweigh these factors.

title: I love the Staff and the experience was very Dopr
text: I live the services of Julie Jimenez. She is the best and every thing was great. I stayed there, the rooms were clean with a great view. And we have the level four with a stunning terrace. I loved every time there!

title: Check in service
text:
They had available rooms but did not let us check in. They were asking for 50+$  for an early check in. 
We asked to leave our suitcases and again denied us that option. We had to go across the street to a beauty salon to have our suitcases stored.  Of course extra charge again. 
There was no available ice or water in the hotel or a coffee maker the room. 
The overall experience was horrible and I do not recommend visiting this hotel. There are plenty of other options in the city.

title: My expectations were incorrect when I first arrived
text: For a hotel in manhattan, this is not a bad place to stay. I have some issues with the noise being in the middle of the city but that is to be expected. It was clean, the AC was good, and the wifi kind of worked.

title: Not a great experience.
text: To many basic necessities missing from the room, caused this to be a dealbreaker.  But the beds were comfy, and it was relatively clean and the terrace was a nice experience.  Room looked very worn out and old, no ice bucket, no tea/coffee maker, no hot-water to get anywhere in the hotel to make your own, no fridge, no microwave, no counter tops in the bathroom to put your toiletries on. No storage facility to keep your luggage, so we paid $40 for an additional hour late checkout but our room keys kept not working - several times in our trip of 3 nights, which wastes our time in queuing up to get them fixed.

title: Décevant / non recommandable
text:
En plus du prix du séjour (via Perfect Stay) nous avons payés 260€ de taxes de séjours à l'hôtel pour deux pour une semaine lors de notre départ.
Du jamais vu. 
Sachant que nous avions déjà payés des taxes lors de nôtre réservation auprès de Perfect Stay via Veepee.
Pas très professionnel de la part de Perfect Stay qui n'a pas sur se montrer clair vis à vis de ce point.
Car autrement nous n'aurions pas choisi cet hôtel.
Nous avons donc payés 2 taxes de séjours, une durant la réservation et une à notre départ.

Une somme aussi élevée pour des draps changés à peine une fois en une semaine c'est difficilement acceptable.
Le service de chambre à fait son travail 3 jours sur 7, les 4 derniers jours nous avons du appeler tous les après-midi l'accueil pour qu'ils nous fassent monter des serviettes inchangés depuis la veille. 
A part faire le lit en surface rien n'était réellement fait. Même les poubelles n'était plus changées au fil des jours. Payer une taxe aussi élevée pour un service inexistant c'est honteux. 

De plus, nous avons été réveillés par le bruit d'une perceuse au milieu de la nuit .. assez stupéfiant car l'hôtel semblait assez calme la nuit.
La chambre est très petite, peu de rangement voir quasi pas. 
On entends facilement les voisins se doucher, un réel manque d'insonorisation. 

L'hôtel est à 5 min de Times Square ce qui est une bonne chose en terme de localisation. Un des rares points positifs. 

Les hôtesses à l'accueil sont disponibles , courtoises et s'efforcent de nous aider.

Pas de service bagages, ou alors à l'extérieur de l'hôtel et c'est payant.

Ayant séjourné en 2018 dans un autre hôtel vers Wall Street, il est facile de trouver mieux que le Yotel New York Hôtel. 

En résumé, nous ne recommandons pas cet hôtel.

title: Oplichters met geld
text: Deze partij vraagt je bij binnenkomst om creditcard, voor borg zeggen ze. Bij vertrek geven ze aan dat je het terugkrijgt en vervolgens hoor je nooit wat weer!! oplichters!! pas op! Wouden sleutel niet afgeven anders terwijl het een pakketreis was die geboekt was via prijsvrij

title: A fine stay in New York
text:
The perfect place to stay whilst on business in New York.The Yotel checks most boxes!
So convenient and I just love the way all the space is utilized! So clever. 
A third visit to this special hotel… I will be back!

title: Amazing Experience
text: One of my best experiences ever living in a hotel in New York. The manager Jorge Tito was a true gentleman and gave us all the support we needed during our stay in NYC. No words to describe such affection.

title: Amazing! Outstanding! Kind! What a crew💕!
text:
My husband and I absolutely loved the hotel! It’s the second time we are staying at Yotel, and turning to be our third! The cabins are great, the food is excellent, the Cree, oh - Lovely! Absolutely people driven! We had a problem with our flights and had to get back to the hotel. We just called the General Manager to help us out- Jorge💕, and he absolutely solved everything! He got our room ready, not only in NY, but also helped us with our staying in Miami, and all our luggage tracking. The receptionist, was so kind! Helped us indicating places where we could buy our “survival” kit! Such a great professional! 
The most amazing, beautiful experience we could ever have ! 
Truly, deeply recommend! You will be amazed !!

title: Ok
text: Good location, minimum contact with people, however size of room in photos are very deceiving. Very small for the price.  Also had no hot water for a shower. However, was very clean and house keeping was very attentive.

title: Just fine
text: Very disappointed they didn't have luggage storage for before/after Check In/Out.  They wanted to charge extra for early or late check in/out and very disappointed this was not made clear before time of booking.

title: Awful communication.
text: The communication at this hotel was awful. I originally was going to extend my stay because I liked the vibe. But there was no way I could after the way I was treated. My room felt like an oven and there was an issue with the air conditioner. I contacted them and was told I’d get help. One hour and 40 minutes . No assistance. Three phone calls. Spoke to the night time manager  and told him despite my night time sweat that I had to go to bed. He said he’d leave a note with the morning team so that I could talk and maybe get breakfast or something. Nothing. No note was given. Terrible experience for as much as was paid.

title: Fancy Food Show
