text: Horrible experience. I hated the place. And on top of everything you can not leave your luggage when your flight is at night. The hotel doesn’t even propose a solution. I had a bike I could park anywhere

title: Worn hotel.  Doable but avoid if you have the choice
text:
Stayed here three nights for a last-minute trip because it was part of a conference hotel block.  I knew the rooms were going to be small but that is no excuse for them being so old. The rooms are horribly worn-- the mini desk in my room had cigarette burns on it and on the walls.  They were sold out so nothing to move to the first night and it wasnt worth unpacking/repacking the second night.  On the third night the AC went off and when you call you end up talking to some outsourced location or simply ringing off the hook.  You can't even leave bags with the hotel at check out.  Their automated baggage storage robot is broken. 
Don't stay here if you have a better option.

title: ESTAFADORES !
text:
Veo que le está pasando a más gente, no devuelven la fianza que piden al llegar, en nuestro caso 700 euros por dos habitaciones. Al principio te dicen que tardarán 7 días en devolver el dinero, luego que entre 15 y 30 días y después dejan de contestar a los correos. 
No reservéis en este hotel.

title: Awful stay, AC never fixed, outdated & poor service
text: The location is the only reason why I gave this hotel an extra star. Check in was slow as their autonomous system was down and only one person manning the front desk. We arrived early and requested to pay the extra fee to check in early and understood that it’s based on availability, so we asked if we can leave our luggage to grab breakfast and return when their system was back up again. Was told their “robot” was down and we can walk a couple blocks to a luggage storage company that charges a fee. This is an unacceptable option, the least the hotel can offer is to pay for the storage fee since their service is inoperable. We booked a total of three separate rooms because these are micro units. You can become claustrophobic if there’s more than one person in the room since there’s no where to stand unless you had the smart bed in a seated position. There’s also no fridge or closet. The shower & toilet is also frosted glass so it’s difficult to share the room unless you’re very comfortable with your travel partner. What use to be modern has been worn down and an update is badly needed. The glass door did not shut so water leaked each time the shower was used. Stain and mold were found around the sink, missing/exposed wires around the mounted wall TV, etc. The social gathering place felt like it was more for a younger vibe. You need to access two separate elevators to reach your room. The view wasn’t bad and the windows do open for ventilation. I know only because my air con was not functioning and I reached out to the front desk on three occasions to ask for this to be fixed since it’s stuffy and hot, and every day (for the three days I was staying at the hotel), not one person came to fix the air con. This made my stay very uncomfortable. I would not return to this hotel as there are many other options available in NY.

title: Viajante solitária
text: The room was pretty clean and well prepared. The view was amazing. Every day the room was clean and well organized for the next night. Highly recommended and the staff were very nice and solved all issues.

title: Great Location; funky hotel
text: This was our second time at the Yotel. The location can't be beat. This time there were a few things we didn't like — the luggage storage was broken and we had to find a place to keep our bags after checkout, the room wasn't as clean as we like and it was a bit tattered. It would have been ery helpful to know we'd need to find our own place to lug our bags for storage. Also, we tried to get hot water for tea we had brought from home that we drink before bedtime and the hotwater machine in the lobby was broken. The kitchen refused to give us any hot water in mugs, which meant we didn't sleep as well as we could have. The breakfast menu had all egg items, which didn't work with my egg intolerance ... a little variety would be great. I hope the Yotel will get it's act together as we'd like to return for one of our very frequent trips to NYC.

title: Cool looking place but small details missing
text: I loved the design and aesthetic of the hotel and rooms but that meant it lacked a couple of details. My room wasn’t exactly like the picture in the sense it was missing the curtains to separate the bathroom area and I only had one set of pillows. Additionally the room was clearly a bit worn out (furniture chipping, stained, a bit of mildew in the shower etc.) One annoying thing was that only the ice machine on the 9th floor was working. On the other hand I really appreciated the towel warmer and the fact the beds could recline and such.

title: It looks better in photos.
text: The rooms were really beat up and the beds that are supposed to fold away are broken. We got charged $59.00 to check in early with a beat up room. I showed the front desk the photos of my room and emailed them to her but the manager never called me. Very dissatisfied.

title: Poor drinks
text:
The need to know how to make a strawberry daiquiri...
Tasted like moonshine with red colour...a hint of strawberries.
Too much new people at work without routine.
Seems there's no control.
Also you need to make a reservation on the rooftop even though you are a guest at the hotel.

title: The worst.
text: Terrible. Rooms are terrible, service is terrible. I've been trying to get my reciept for weeks and still don't have it. They don't care. Find anywhere else to stay in NY. This is the worst hotel I've stayed in.

title: Single bed is really for only one person
text: The room was good for the two nights that I stayed but is small. If you are wanting to stay longer and have a spouse, it will be harder to move around. I was on business, so the small space was not a problem, but if you are wanting to stay longer than a day or so, it will be difficult.

title: Worst Hotel I have EVER Stayed in
text: From the moment you walk in the front doors to the time you leave, you'll be made painfully aware that the staff here literally and actively do not care about their customers. Add to this the laughably small (closet size) rooms with no amenities, and it's baffling to understand how this hotel is still open. I've traveled all over the world and stayed in hundreds of hotels, and YOTEL has the distinction of being the absolute worst of them.

title: Truly just a place to sleep
text: Proximity to the Javits center is the only thing going for this place. I didn’t feel like my cabin was clean enough to unpack my bags. The CVS across the street was convenient. The whole experience felt impersonal. I couldn’t even store my bags after check out. Completely underwhelmed at this lackluster experience.

title: Not so modern
text: We stayed for 9 nights at the hotel. Although the Yotel was advertised as a modern hotel, the room looked old-fashioned with obvious signs of wear and tear, and overall not very clean. The automatic robot was out of service and the check-in check-out self-service machines were slow and confusing, plus the app did not work at all. The cabin walls and doors are thin and you can hear neighbours showering in the morning. We would recommend finding another hotel for the same price.

title: Broken
text: Nearly everything was broken. The adjuster on the bed, the sensor on the thermostat, the TV. There are also very few outlets in the rooms. All the checking kiosks were down, it took about 40 minutes to get checked in properly and that was from being first in line. The walls are also extremely thin, you can hear people doing the nasty in other rooms. It’s not as cool as social media makes it look, I’m really disappointed I spent almost $2000 on this waste

title: highly recommend
text: the hotel was very nice and clean. showers were great. view was even better. when making the reservations we requested highest view available, we were placed on the 17th floor with an alright view, called the front desk and asked if they had anything else and they moved us to the 25th floor!

title: Buen hotel y servicio
text: Esta muy bien ubicado cerca de Time Square. El hotel es moderno, su cuarto es pequeño pero muy comodo. El servicio de limpieza fue todos los días. Hay personal que hablan muy bien español e ingles. Los empleados que atienden su terrasa para desayuno son muy atentos, el desayuno es a la carta pocas opciones pero muy bueno y rápido. También ofrecen desayuno para llevar de forma rápida. Tiene una terrasa muy linda, con vista y espacio para ver películas hay aire libre.

title: Good location but not that cheap
text:
It's good if you're traveling solo. The bathroom is only a glass cabin so you will never have privacy so I don't recommend it if your traveling with someone else.
It is in a great location tho, just minutes away from Times Square and subway stations.

title: Ok
text: Room were small, couldn’t get a room with 2 beds in it, the self check in took too long. The lady at the front was nice and the hotel was easy to find. They had food carts outside, liquor store next to the hotel so if your solo or with your girl it a ok place to stay!

title: My 3 day weekend stay experience
text: I think for the price the room was okay. I didn’t find it really comfortable to use the bathroom with no door separating the bed. I also had tough time sleeping as AC would not stay on instead in the morning without me changing it, it would turn to heat. Not only that I asked for extra pillows and towels  more than once and never received them.

title: Fantastic
text:
Not our usual place to stay but we were really taken aback with the futuristic feel of the place, great rooms, very compact, they can be small so be qarned but ours was OK, 27th floor, good view of the city.
Our bed moved from sit up position to lay down, the shower and toilet was so well compact and well designed and there was a huge TV too ...safe in the room for valuables. 
The toiletries were fab, towels changed on a daily basis and the housekeeping ladies were lovely.
Food was great, expensive but that's New York these days unfortunately. 
A couple of shout outs....Laura in the Restaurant- what a lovely caring lady...she was fabulous....even though she called me a crispy critter lol!! After my tanning accident lol!! She'll be missed.

Nicole on reception,  well she's a complete STAR, Looked after us completely,  she's amazing and deserves all the good luck that comes her way, from the moment we arrived with our issues with our credit card to the day we left with issues with our transfer taxi  she helped and saw that our stay was as relaxed as can be, she put my mind at rest and any problems we had, she saw that it was sorted out quickly and efficiently. Nicole made my stay enjoyable,  I would have been completely stressed out of she hadn't have helped us. Nicole deserves an award for customer service, I'm a Manager in the UK and would love her on my team, so Yotel look after that lady, she's one in a million!!

title: Fantastic, as usual!
text:
What a fantastic hotel - I cannot recommend it enough!! This is a repeat stay for me and I am never disappointed. Fun atmosphere, cool vibes, young crowd. The modern, ipad check-in was easy and convenient. No need to wait in long reception lines. Room was clean and smelled nice. Awesome view of the city in the corner room. All the staff is incredibly professional and attentive. 

Finally, I recommend watching the “Drunk Shakespeare” show that they host in the hotel - it is hilarious. 

Thank you YOTEL for another awesome NYC visit.

title: Look no further!
text: Great location, clean room with a view. Everything you need for a fantastic NYC stay! The baggage robot was broken but the front desk crew were very helpful and suggested an affordable, close by alternative for us.  Make sure to see a show in The Green Room, Drunk Shakespeare had us in tears.

title: Good value for money in the heart of Manhattan
text: Overall good value for money in comparison to other hotels in the same area. The room was small but clean and storage places well organized. The location is perfect as few minutes away from the Javits Center (for Conferences), Times Sq & all the main tourist attractions. Safe to walk to at night.

title: Jennyra Olivencia (front desk) is great!
text: This is just an opportunity to give a huge shoutout to Jennyra Olivencia. During my stay there she made sure that everything I needed was taken care of. She went out of her way to assist at all hours — and followed up to — ensure any request was addressed thoroughly. Thank you, Jennyra. Because of you I was able to take care of business even on the weekend.

title: Beware of incorrect bookings on credit card!
text: My credit card was charged with two incorrect amounts of which I have not yet been totally refunded.Claiming that the credit card is only used for the security deposit of 100 Dollars which would be back on my account after two days, my credit card was charged with two much higher amounts. The yotel owes me 326,02 Dollars and doesn´t respond to my complaints. This is not acceptable.

title: Bon hôtel !
text:
Bon hôtel, très bon accueil ! A quelques pas de times square très bien placé .
Le lit juste top très confortable !
L entretien des chambres rien à dire c'est nickel !
Juste bémols les wc pas d intimité pas de porte .
Mais sinon je le conseil !!

title: Great location, terrible service
text: I stayed there for 4 nights. First of all, there is nowhere to store luggage until your room is ready. I had to go to an off-site vendor, and pay extra just to store luggage. I travel frequently and this is the first time I ever had this happened to me. The wi-fi was not working, the speed was under 25mbps which means slower then a pigeon! The hotel staff wasn't friendly at all (except to the guards in the lobby). The restaurant serves way over priced meals for what you get. Go to the corner and get a gyro form the street cart and you'll enjoy it much more!

title: רמה נמוכה
text: היינו , זוג , בYOTEL ניו יורק למשך 3 לילות בין 21-24/5/22 , החדר היה ממש קטן בקושי מצליחים להיכנס אין מקום למזוודות  , הגענו מאוחר בלילה , המזגן לא עבד והיה צורך לבקש עזרה מספר פעמים רב, לקח המון זמן עד שהטכנאי הגיע וסידר את זה , אין מקרר בחדר , השירותים ממש בתוך החדר עם הפרדה מאד לא טובה, המקום נמצאה על השדרה ה-10 רחוק יחסית מהרכבת התחתית ,ממש לא ממולץ

title: Great stay at YOTEL
text: I've been at YOTEL NYC in the past.  Great location, good value for money and the vibe/ambiance is amazing. Great terrace, with really good food but average drinks. Some of the rooms are showing their age and need a little bit of love, but are nonetheless very clean. Will be back !

title: Beat Up Hotel with Lousy Service
text: I checked in late at night and my key was not working twice. You have to take two elevators to get to your room from the front desk so needless to say, this was very annoying. My room had damaged walls and base boards. Not a big deal, but just want others to know. After I checked out, I never received my final bill/folio. I’ve now emailed their accounting office twice and still have not received. I would definitely not stay here again.

title: hôtel décevant ne mérite pas 4 étoiles
text:
Seul Point positif, hôtel bien situé 
Pas de réception, on s'enregistre seul, chambre exigue, le strict minimum
Lors du check out, pas de bagagerie, seulement un QR code à flasher et on nous explique même pas où aller mettre nos bagages (service payant)
Deux heures après avoir effectué le check out, je me suis aperçue que j'avais oublié une bague en or dans la chambre, je suis retournée à la réception, personnel très désagréable et malhonnête qui m'a dit évidemment  ne rien avoir trouvé.
Fuyez cet hôtel

title: Mother-Daughter Trip
text:
This was a decent hotel but nothing exceptional.  What I expected in size and functionality. 
Very soft bed - not for me but some would love it.  I liked that it was adjustable. 
Did love the rainfall shower head and water pressure. 
A bit further from Times Square than you think but not a big deal since you walk so much no matter where you go.

title: In den letzten 11 Jahren verschlechtert - Ein defektes Hotel
text:
Ich war kurz nach der Erlffnung schon mal in diesem Hotel. Damals gab es volle Punktzahl. 

Nun, 11 Jahre später war ich wieder da. Bin jedoch sehr enttäuscht. Es war sehr lärmig, was aber an anderen Gästen lag. Die Schiebetüren im Bad waren defekt. Das automatische Bett hatte auch Störungen. Der Seafe war auch kaputt, resp. hatte keine Batterien mehr und wurde trotz 2maliger Info nicht repariert. Die Decke wurde von der Putzfrau mitgenommen und zrotzbeschwerde kam keine neue. Der Fön war ebenfalls defekt, ebenso das Möbel, wo der Fernseher drin hängt. 
Der Roboter für die Gepäckaufbewahrung, ihr ahnt es schon, defekt. Eine alternative Gepäckaufbewahrung wird nicht angeboten und man muss teuer auf LuggageHero eine Alternative suchen. 
Ein Aufzug von der Lobby zum 4th Floor, meiste Zeit defekt.

title: Pleasant
text: Very efficient and contemporary room. Comfortable accommodations. Hotel is conveniently located to Times Square and all points mid-town Manhattan. Nice view of the city and the terrace restaurant provided a nice touch.

title: Terrible
text:
I booked 2 rooms for a bachelorette party & called to confirm the rooms would be next to each other.  When we checked in,  they were on opposite sides.  One of the rooms smelled like rancid fish & the AC was not working in the other room.   Amanda from housekeeping (I believe)  was extremely accommodating & helpful.   

I have stayed at Yotel in NYC before (about 7/8 years ago) and I was disappointed to see that the entire hotel has drastically changed.  The elevator from the parking garage was not working, requiring me to haul all my items up the ramp in 95° heat.  There were no bell hop racks to put my items on to help carry my items upstairs.   The lobby & 4th floor felt like there was no AC.  

I hope you can bring the hotel back to its glory,  but until then I will not recommend or not come back.

title: Convenient and cool
text: I was pleasantly surprised by the YOTEL.  I thought it might be a cheap gimicky place but it was not.  The room was small but complete, the climate control worked well.  The place is large and busy but not annoying and the elevators were fast.  The staff were all excellent.

title: Stinks of weed and hidden charges
text:
Decent hotel in a good location but our floor stunk of marijuana and it was pouring through our air con vent.

Also worth noting:

There’s still no area to leave baggage - you need to download an app and find a local facility at your own cost.

On arrival you need to pay a local tax of $41 a night and a deposit of $200. This wasn’t clear in our booking with British airways.

Lastly, on arriving home I found that Yotel had taken $500 from me with no indication or authorisation. Still trying to clear this up.

Staff miserable and unhelpful.

In short, if you can afford to pay more then go somewhere else.

title: Do not stay here
text: Our room was terrible. Run down and in disrepair. Very small space no streaming avail could not find avail network. Bathroom was growing mold. Upholstery on bed torn apart and dirty. No ice machine available except on the 9th floor we were on the 25th floor. No ice buckets provided just a large trash bag that you had to put in the only sink in the room so forget about using g a sink to wash your hands had to use the shower. I takes two elevators to access room floors

title: Cumplir un sueño
text: Hemos pasado unos días maravillosos en Nueva York, normal, en un expléndido hotel,y sobre todo con la ayuda de Nicole, la chica del hotel, una gran persona que nos ha hecho la vida más fácil. Gracias Nicole por todo.

title: Gran calidad humana y buen hotel
text:
Estuvimos cuatro noches, y el hotel tiene todo lo necesario con camas muy cómodas. Lo mejor sin dudarlo fue su personal, desde limpieza hasta recepción, sin poder olvidarnos de Nicole, una chica maravillosa que hizo que nuestra estancia fuera de 10, y que recomendemos este sitio cien por cien.
La calidad humana marca la diferencia.

title: Great expereince
text: We had a great stay at Yotel.  It was recommended by my sister as she has stayed here a couple of times before.  The staff were all super friendly, especially Serg at the check in counter, who was very professional and attentive and greeted us with such a friendly and kind attitude.  The bunk beds were super cool which worked well for our family, and the cabins were contemporary.  We will be back again!  Thanks Yotel.

title: Family Trip NEW YORK
text: Yotel NYC as a great location near time square. nice place to stay for a week-end. room need a refresh after covid closing. recommend that hotel for couples,and family with teenagers. great service and parking is under the hotel wich is perfect for Manhattan.

title: Staff ruim e sem lugar para guardar as malas
text: ESSE HOTEL NÃO TEM ARMAZENAMENTO DE BAGAGEM. Apesar das lindas fotos de um robô que guarda suas bagagens, isso não acontece. O robô está quebrado e o hotel não tem NEHUMA outra opção para guardar a mala na propriedade, nenhum quarto, cantinho, nada! Eles indicam um aplicativo que é pago por hora/bagagem, onde você deixa suas malas em estabelecimentos “voluntários” como restaurantes, lojas e mercearias. Ou seja, te forçam a ou ficar com sua mala ou confiar em um aplicativo e terceira pessoa para guardá-la em segurança. No que fomos questionar se não haveria nenhuma possibilidade de guardar as malas eles nos deram 2h a mais para o Check Out (que ainda não seria suficiente para o tempo que ainda tínhamos na cidade). Tentamos conversar com a gerente Jenny e ela não só não foi nenhum pouco amigável, como também usou essas duas horas de “late Check out” como um cala-boca. Insinuando que o hotel já estava fazendo mais do que a obrigação e nós que estávamos errados de querer um serviço que é comum em acomodações do mundo inteiro. Durante a hora de Check In e Check Out era possível ver diversos hóspedes largados com suas bagagens pelas áreas comuns do hotel por não terem onde deixar suas malas. Afinal, a regra de não armazenamento de bagagem também é válida para os hóspedes que chegam antes de ter seu quarto pronto. Entendo que o serviço do robô pode estar fora de funcionamento (no entanto, ao que a recepcionista deu a entender não é algo pontual e temporário, visto que desde pelo menos janeiro ele não funciona), no entanto é completamente SURREAL que o hotel não tenha nenhuma solução para dar essa comodidade ao cliente. Novamente: o serviço de armazenamento de bagagem é uma prática comum no mundo inteiro e é completamente improvável que um hotel que se faz com a imagem de “super moderno” não tenha.

title: Best hotel in NYC
text: I absolutely loved staying at yotel. The staff is amazing and friendly.  The manager Jorge will go our of his way to make guests feel welcome and taken care of. It's 5 star treatment through out your entire stay. The restaurant has amazing food I recommend the tacos.

title: Hotel
text:
Safe took 2 days to fix. No urgency to get this done considering we only stayed for 3 nights. 

Room was clean and ideal for the price we paid 

Arrived to hotel at 1300hrs. Was told I had to pay 50 dollars for early check in, I questioned what time IS check in and they advised 1330hrs. I therefore waited 30 minutes in order to save 50 dollars

title: great location and very hip hotel, the on premieres facilities were pretty good except lack of a luggage storage
text:
The hotel is a really cool setup with great amenities, nice location, easy accessibility etc 
Comfortable rooms for upto 2 folks
Would liked to see a luggage storage on premesis
Would highly recommend the same

title: Come rovinare tutto per un servizio essenziale!!
text: Metto 2 stelle grazie alla posizione e alla camera al 22 esimo piano con bella vista panoramica! Accoglienza ingresso inesistente ma veniamo alla cosa più grave uno paga più di 300 dollari a notte più cauzione, tassa ecc ok sei a New York! Ma possibile che un povero cristo che deve fare l ultimo giorno (diluviava e tirava vento) gli ultimi giri per poi essere prelevato appunto all' hotel per prendere l aeroporto non concedono il servizio bagagli?? Nemmeno appunto a pagamento!  Indecenti

title: Great experience and even better staff ⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️
text:
I enjoyed my initial experience so much that I ended up extending my stay. NYC YOTEL is so busy, yet NICOLE from the front desk was extremely positive, attentive and pleasant to interact with while sorting out my back to back stay.

The rooms are decent sized and very clean for this price point.. gym, hotel bar, eatery, staff… YOTEL really has everything I could ask for in a comfortable affordable (by nyc standards) stay. 

The only other thing I could say is that NICOLE and STEPHEN from the front lobby staff deserve a nice vacation.

Thank you for everything so far.
 
⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️

title: Great location, okay hotel
text: Room was very little. The bed was was comfy but too small for 2 grown up people. Shower/sink were not very hygienic. Location is great, near times square! Check out at 11am but there was no place to storage your bags, you can storage them nearby a few small stores but you have to pay for it. We didnt trust/want that so we went straight to the airport unfortunately.

title: Bom hotel
text:
Quartos pequenos porém funcionais, localização razoável (há diversos outros no mesmo patamar de preços mais próximos à Times Square). São necessários 2 elevadores para subir aos quartos (o primeiro leva ao quarto andar, e neste ficam os elevadores dos quartos).
Check-in e check-out possíveis de forma automática.

title: Tiny too hot room
text: Elevators didn’t work for part of the time, room was way too hot and no way to change the temperature, most uncomfortable bed I’ve slept on in a hotel, and the rooms are deceptively tiny. I would never stay at another Yotel.

title: Fine except the a/c
text: The room was great and clean, but to turn on cool air just didn’t switch over, it stayed hot in the room and I had to open a window and hear street noise in order to have some coolness in the temperature

title: If u just need place to crash that fine…
text:
Didn’t feel taken care of, plus no fridge … can’t approve guest from tel to come up have to go get them… 

Low on staff so took for ever to get some one on the tel… pressing 0 doesn’t get you front desk u have an annoying answering machine that prompts so many options before you can pick human.

title: Overpriced but good location
text: This Yotel is rather rundown and lacks many amenities. While the location was perfect for out trip, the intermittent air conditioning and smoke alarm problems made sleeping dificult. There was no onsite bag storage which is a pretty big bummer.

title: Great room for the price
text: Very efficient room and price/location was great. Room is starting to look a bit dated and might need a refresh soon. Great to have an adjustable bed and the shower was great. Would stay again depending on the rate.

title: Reasonable for the price
text: Compact room. Liked the window. Be careful in the shower. Slippery floor. Nothing to hold onto. Make sure the safe works before you unpack in case you want to switch rooms. Staff was helpful. Restaurant was good.

title: Very Convenient and very close to NY 'Supplier's Day Event at Javits Center
text:
I really enjoyed my stay@ Yotel, very convenient and very close to NY Supplier's Day and I will recommend Yotel to my friends & family.
the room was nice & clean and I liked the bed so much that you can converted to a sofa after you wake up. I love that they have different trash container for re-cycle paper vs. plastic.

title: Key features of Self Service Kiosk, App and Yobot not working.
text:
Automatic Self Service Kiosk check in did not work for me and the many people standing in front of me in a long line to have to deal with "mission control". Yotel App check in did also not work. I thought that these were supposed to be two of the key features of Yotel. Also, even though this was a crisis situation, only had on person working the mission control desk, where it looked like there was equipment for two staff. Check in took over 30 minutes which was not as advertised with Kiosks and Apps. Person working the desk was nice, however. Unfortunately she had to face rightfully disgruntled customers alone. Also Yobot was not working. Also, Con-Edison needed to shut off the water between midnight and 8 am for 10 block radius including hotel. I realize that this is out of Yotel control, but just icing on the cake.

If the Yotel actually did the things as advertised, I would recommend. Probably 4/5. Quick check in Kiosks did not work. Could not check in with App. Yobot not working. This makes Yotel worse than other hotels, because without these things working, they do not seem to have enough support staff to handle a crisis. If Yotel actually functioned as advertised I would readily recommend, but the check in experience was such a fiasco, that is unfortunately what I will most remember about Yotel.

title: Moldy Bathrooms and Broken AC
text: We experienced many many issues. The AC didn’t work, maintenance never came to fix it over the 3 days we were there. The shower was moldy, the curtain covering the bathroom was missing, appliances didn’t work. Also, when paying for a late checkout, our keys stopped working and we had to go down to the front desk twice to get the keys to start working again.

title: Yotel Times Square
text: Great hotel! Strongly recommend. Perfect location. Nice price. Has everything we need to feel at home, clean and with all it is needed. Staff very polite and always available. Good internet. Good restaurant.

title: Very good, could be better
text:
If you are young, this is your hotel!
I stood for 1O nights with my daughters and they loved it
The room is tiny. If you have lots of lugagge or clothes to hang, this is not for you!
Cleaning personal were the best! smilling, eficient. Negative points: you need a dhort walk to get to the closest uderground station. In the winter of late at night its not so good.
The room was dark.
10th street is not that great

For the rest, I recomend.
There is a Target and a supermarket across the street and a brand new wholefoods.
You will take 5/ 10 min to Times Square.

title: What was I thinking
text: The room online looked amazing I booked Thur booking.com paid in full two nights got there had to pay the $100 fee for deposit cool but my partner paid for the deposit i paid for the rm in advance only for her to be charged full room price as if i never paid for it.. at checkout the desk associate was amazing and helped us.. Our room was a queen with bunk the room by the top of the window had mold the shower was disgusting.. There were no wash cloths sink had hair in it.. the curtain that divides the room from the bathroom had blood stains disgusting

title: Hôtel minimaliste
text:
Hôtel propre et bien placé. C’est tout. 
Chambre petite ( je pense que c’est pareil dans bcp d’hôtel à NYC). Insonorisation 0 dans l’hôtel. 
On entendait quand les clients d’en haut prenait leur douche. Un bruit de canalisations vraiment désagréable. 

Aucune possibilité de laisser les bagages à l’hôtel avant de prendre l’avion. Il faut aller à  qqs mètres de l’hôtel et c’est payant. Avec de grosses valises et sous la grêle c’est pas pratique. Et l’hôtel ne réserve pas de taxi ou navettes pour l’aéroport.

title: Good location but Amazing Staff
text: Stayed here for 4 nights and I have to say it was an enjoyable experience. The location was great, rooms clean and comfortable but for me it was the staff who made my stay the most enjoyable. I needed some print outs and both Jenny and Lissette were so helpful. I have to say Jenny was the ideal person you need on reception. Helpful, friendly and most polite. Nothing was to much trouble. I will miss my late night chats. Thanks to the security team for the job they do. I will be back

title: SIN VERGÜENZAS Y ESTAFADORES
text: Nos pidieron que pagáramos las tasas de NY y además un depósito como es habitual, a la salida le preguntamos que cuando nos la abonarían y nos dijeron que tardaban unos días, cuál fue nuestra sorpresa, ese mismo día nos hicieron un cargo de 150 y tres días después otro mas de 150, en total con depósito y esos dos cargos 550 por la cara se han quedado, creo que por los comentarios no somos los únicos, UNOS SIN VERGÜENZAS, ya veremos si recuperamos algo

title: UBICACION & INCOMODIDAD
text: Hotel muy bien situado en la 10 Avd con la W42 en unos minutos en Times Square y Brodway, ideal para moverse por la zona de Midtwon e ir caminando o bien en metro a Dontown y Uptwon y/ o distritos colindantes. Ahora bien, el hotel es más bien cutrecillo...la habitación es mínima y el baño está dentro de la misma literalmente.. sólo una mampara lo separa de la habitación...no hay lugar para poner la maleta cómodamente y no ri,arte con ella o dar un traspiés...es todo muy reducido, la cama es cómoda ...se transforma en sofá mediante un pulsador y viceversa. El personal muy amable. Lo mejor la ubicación, cerca del nuevo barrio en construcción de Hudson Yards , El EDGE, High Line , VESSEL, lmercado Pequeña España...etc...el hotel ya muy castigado le hace falta una reforma...un poco cutre.... también comentar que a 1 hay un súper mercado muy bueno y una pizzería (CLAUDIO'S) te pides unas por iones y las tomas con un buen vino de las tiendas de licores que hay en la manzana del hote...el ascensor va directo al 4 planta si o sí, que es donde se ubica el restaurante y una terraza , hay que hacer trasbordo para las plantas superiores. No estuvo mal la experiencia, pero en caso de volver a la CITY no me alojaría en el mismo hotel.

title: Nothing like 4-5 years ago.
text: Stayed here 4-5 years ago and it was clean, modern, fun.  The building has fallen into terrible disrepair.  All of the furniture is broken, cigarette burns in the carpet, paint is peeling, really sad.  Worst of all the staff is totally burnt out, unhelpful, and unaccommodating.  Their silly luggage storage robot has been broken forever and rather making space to manually store luggage like any other hotel in an office, conference room, the basement... their recommendation is to store your luggage at a bogega around the corner (which is closed on Sundays and many other times)!!!  Not kidding.  Such a decline.  Stay away.

title: Smart Hotel
text:
Great Hotel – which needs a bit of a renovation soon
The room was exactly the way I pictured it and overall I loved it. I really appreciated the thinking behind it, the room was clearly designed as a hotel room, so you have a lot of outlets in the right places, some hangers a tray to eat in bed, a hair dryer and even an iron+board! This is where the renovation part comes in however – the furniture was quite used and some things didn’t work (properly, i.e. the iron, or the outlets next to the sink). I was also a bit disappointed that I couldn’t store my luggage there after check out but I think that was a temporary thing. I have to say however, that the view was amazing and the shower was the that I’ve had…I think ever! So I’d definitely come back (and hope that in the meantime, they keep it up).

title: New York business trip
text: A fun place to stay.  Easy access to the convention center and offices I needed to visit while there.  Good restaurants in the area.  Staff was helpful and answered all my questions.  Only problem, I did not receive the promised receipt for my stay.

title: DECEVANT NE VAUT PAS SES 4 ETOILES
text:
6 nuits dans cet hôtel
Points positifs, bien situé et bonne literie pour le reste passez votre chemin.
Une réception quasi inexistante, sauf pour enregistrer votre carte bleue. Aucun effort pour nous comprendre. Lors du check out, pas de bagagerie, seulement un QR code à flasher et débrouillez vous. Cerise sur le gâteau à notre retour en France un prélèvement de 223€ pour lequel nous n'avons pas été informé au moment du départ, pas de facture. Finalement nous réussissons à apprendre qu' il s'agit des frais de service 35$/jour!!!!! Ce montant n'était pas précisé par le voyagiste + les taxes de séjour. Bref un surcoût qui si nous avions été informés aurait sûrement modifié notre choix.

title: Coziest Stay that I have had
text: It’s was nice a quiet stay which I really like that you couldn’t really hear anything outside your room. Plus the staff was amazing! Everyone was so helpful. The room although it was small was very comfortable and perfect for two people.

title: Horrible
text: For a room for 1 night at 665$ for a king suite that nothing worked but 2 nights is a scam.Your basic hotel stuff was not in the room such as a refrigerator,microwave or coffee pot.Water was cold and the Wi-Fi was terrible.The staff are lazy and never came back to fix anything they said they would

title: Not what promised
text: Falsely advertised there was a dining area in the penthouse suite we booked. There was no where to eat. For the amount we paid this is unfair. No hot water whole stay and tv apps did not work. Additional there were bugs in the room. Would like a refund. Bed was terribly hard and we could not sleep. I am a hotelier and this is unacceptable.

title: Great Value in a Tiny Package
text: Yotel New York is in a fantastic location while visiting the city for a show at Madison Square Garden. Cabin is like being in a tiny house but comfortable and stylish. Food and drinks for both breakfast and dinner were amazing!

title: Prisvärt hotell centralt beläget
text:
Vi (jag och min partner) bodde på detta hotell under en vecka i april 2022 och vi känner oss over all väldigt nöjda. Rummet var mindre men det kändes inte så då det var mycket platseffektivt med många hyllor osv. Sängen kunde man även justera upp och ner vilket också gjorde att rummet blev större när man satte sängen i sittläge. Utsikten var också bra så man kände sig inte instängd och duschen hade jättebra tryck vilket uppskattades. Det läckte heller inte ut på golvet pga av de höga kanterna i duschen.  
Nacksidorna med hotellet var att de inte hade ett language room och så kunde det ta en stund att vänta på hissen på morgonen runt nio. Sedan var det inte heller jättefräscht men det var inget som var ett större störningsmoment. Jag hade lätt kunnat bo där igen.

title: Too basic for the price
text: The amenities they offer are not enough for the price. We stayed in the Queen room. No ice buckets in the room, no mini fridge. The bed would not go back to upright position. Overall room looked like it needed updating. The tv had a channel for the restaurant on premise but the QR code said “table not found” so we couldn’t order food. Towel warmer did not work. They do advertise what their bathrooms are like, but we weren’t expecting the sliding door not to fully close. You must be comfortable with whoever you’re with because they will hear you going to the bathroom. The whole hotel smelled like weed.

title: Great stay
text:
Great location and easy to get to everywhere in the heart of NY. 
Nice staff and very helpful, I definitely will stay in YOTEL my next visits. I would recommend this hotel for everyone that wants a really good experience in a different hotel concept.

title: Disappointing stay @ the NYC Yotel
text: I stayed in the London Yotel last summer and absolutely loved it so I specifically wanted to stay at the NYC location. Though I appreciated the early check in at 2:15pm, I found the rest of my stay ranging from underwhelming to disappointing. Upon arriving, I found the room was worn and dingy with scuff marks, tape residue, cracked grout and torn vinyl around the bed frame. The bedsheets and towels were clean so I decided to ignore the rest since we were only there one night and figured such issues would be present in the other rooms as well since this is not a newer property. This morning as we were preparing to check out, I was doing a final check of the room to make sure I didn’t leave anything behind when I dropped my phone on the floor. Bending down to pick it up, I saw a pile of trash under the bed presumably from a previous guest (bottle cap and fork were visible, but I didn’t look closer than that). Again I decided to not complain because we were checking out anyway and if they are thoroughly cleaning the rooms they should easily find it on their own. After check out, I asked to store my backpack as we planned to explore the city more for my birthday and go to a nice brunch where I didn’t want to bring in my travel bag. I was told that the property didnt offer storage and was referred to an external third party app that provided other storage options at an additional cost outside of the property. At booking, it did mention that the fancy robot that normally stores luggage was out of commission but not that the hotel didn’t offer luggage storage at all. This is not usually a speciality service as even the cheapest hostels will hold your luggage for you so you would think that they would have figured out a way to accommodate luggage storage at their hotel while the robot gets fixed. Had I know this, I would have booked elsewhere. I wish I chose better for my birthday trip and am now hesitant to stay with Yotel moving forward due to this wild inconsistency between properties.

title: The worst hotel I have ever been to
text: I wanted to stay here because it looked like a fun experience.  Basically it is a hotel claiming to be run by robots but none of the robots work so you're left dealing with the staff that dont know what they are doing.  It was insanely overpriced for what feels like a trip to a crappy amusement park where none of the rides work.

title: location location
text: I enjoyed my first time stay at YOTEL. It was the perfect location for my trip and I was extremely happy with the cleanliness of the overall place and room, the staff was very helpful and attentive to helping me at all times. I have several trips coming up to this area and will be staying here again.

title: High Price
text:
High price but good location. 
The check in process is a bit strange. The views from the room we had were amazing, though. This is a modern hotel with very small rooms. There's also not easy parking access, which was fine for us since we had taken the train in. Easy walk to Penn Station and Times Square.

title: fun and modern place
text:
excellent stay with friends.
we had a lot of fun, walking distance from all the places we want to visit in midtown, times square is two blocks away.
rooms were very clean, helping staff in the lobby was a nice touch.
great value for money.
my place in NY.

title: Best trip
text: This hotel was absolutely beautiful. Great service. Best trip. Food was amazing and staff was beyond nice. So many things to do in hotel, could stay in just the hotel rather than the city. Still a beautiful spot in the city with tons of stuff to do. 100000/10 would recommend

title: Wonderful
text:
We were a group of friends and we had a blast.
Great location, nearby everything, location is. So great .
Very clean rooms, staff is Warm and Nice, Jenny at reception is really a nice person.
We loved it and we will back soon

title: Great view
text:
Was in a party with friends and we had a great time.
The kiosk was easy to check in, rooms were spotless very warm staff the bar was nice , the ladies doing the rooms were really friendly, I definitely recommend

title: Great staycation
text: I stayed there with a couple of friends and the service was amazing. The staff was very nice and accommodating. The location was nice. The reams were always clean. The breakfast was great (I recommend getting the pancakes). Overall great experience and I will be coming back!

title: girls trip
text: I stayed here with a group of 3 friends. Very great location. Clean rooms and great customer services. Staff very friendly and accommodating to all. Felt very comfortable and safe in the very busy and crowded city. Overall had a great trip and great hotel.

title: phenomenal experience
text: i love Yotel. it was easy to check in, the staff was super light and friendly. I woll defiantly be staying here again. amazing service and great wifi!👍🏼 my whole friend group was here and it was amazing. everyone was so nice.

title: Fantastic stay
text:
I was at this hotel with friends for a weekend , was a great experience.
We checked in, very easy win the kiosks.
The room was very cleaned with a nice view , everything very practical.
Nice ladies at reception, Nicole was very friendly
Loved it, near everything in midtown.
We will be back

title: Very good located
text: Very good situated, in the heart of NY, very near by Times Square. Very friendly stuff and we had an astonishing view from our 15th room.  Compacted but very practical room. Also possible to have a delicious breakfast or go outside to have breakfast or lunch. Whenever we come back to NY we will be staying in this same place.

title: Décevant et loin des espérances
text:
Arrivée pour un séjour d’une semaine au 15/04, une impression de déception. Les automates pour el Check in ne fonctionnaient qu’épisodiquement et si vous faites un checkin avant 14:00 50$ de supplément.
Les chambres sont petites mais rien de surprenant dans les grandes villes. Toutefois le lit en mezzanine a la tête directement sur le climatiseur ce qui rend l’utilisation de celle ci impossible. La lumière du lit en mezzanine ne fonctionne pas. La porte coulissante nous a valu de prendre la roulette coulissante presque sur la tête…. Présence d’une planche à repasser et d’un fer, mais aucune bouilloire ce qui manque. Le coffre dans la chambre ne permet pas de ranger grand chose, au mieux une tablette ou deux mais en vertical.

title: Great break
text:
I was with a group of friends and we decided to stay here after having had a wonderful first stay.
First, I used their site to book Yotel.com, the best way to book.
Again, was really nice pleasant, easy check-in, I used the kiosk to check-in and was seamless.
the room was very clean, and with a great view of the city, I stayed in a Queen Corner Room was perfect.
I red previous comments about the size of the rooms, this one was very spacious and cozy.
This is my place to stay in NY, best conditions, as location, self-parking, very convenient, and as guest you have $14 discount.
Thanks Lissette, she was so sweet.
Will be back soon.

title: Il bagno si potrebbe migliorare
text:
Bella camera al 18esimo piano più o meno perché alcuni piani vengono saltati.
Prenotazione camera king vista angolare… eh si la vista così è stata! 
Accoglienza con calici di vino e benvenuto.
Gentili.
Pecca il bagno: braccetto della doccia rotto con acqua che perdeva ovunque…

title: A really rundown hotel with very few amenities and bad service
text:
Overall the room felt run down and weatherbeaten. Clearly designed with a futuristic theme from 1970s movies like Logan's run and Star Trek the motion picture, but chipped corners and peeling veneer revealed a cheaply built room that lacked most basic amenities.  Chromecast for the TV didn't work, there was no TV but local channels, so if you didn't have a device to watch things or listen to music on you were  out of luck. There was no clock  The pillows were small and lumpy and they took dirty towels but didn't replace them. I attempted to call the front desk but the phone didn't work. Every time I talked to the front desk in person they said they'd send someone right up and they never did. There was no in-room coffee and the vending machine in the lobby didn't work. They had a cafe but the line and the mornings took 10 to 20 minutes just to get beverages. 

Overall I've stayed in similarly priced hotels that had much better amenities, coffee in the room TVs that work, etc., And being worn down in New York is expected but not when you're in a future istic hotel that brands itself as a boutique stay. 

Fortunately the location makes up for a lot, but there's a lot of hotels at this location. I'll be staying at one of them next time.

title: Fine. It’s fine.
text: It worked and I got good sleep. The automation process is a little weird and didn’t make me feel welcome at all. The room co diction was a little beat up, but the bed was very comfortable and the shower was great. The terrace bar is a delight in the spring time. Contextually, it was a little far from my office and when I told my coworkers where I was staying they thought it was kind of shady. Will probably stay at courtyard, Wyndham, or Pineapple next trip.

title: worst hotel in new york
text: stayed for 7 nights with family carpets were filthy  shower was discusting mould all over the walls bedding never changed tv only worked when it feels like it no one answers the telephones 5 hours waiting for someone to come and fic the tv and shower in my opinion would never book here again

title: When technology is a disadvantager
text: From the check in process to the unavailability of staff to the accounting system to the room technology, everything wears wrong. I tried calling for hours after i checked im without luck. And even tried next day and still not able to

title: Don’t bother
text:
Let’s start with check-in:
We arrive and ask to store our luggage till check-in time. We’re told no the machine is broken (knew that from the website - but it also says they do have other limited storage available on site). The guy says we must check-in (an extra $50) and if we can’t check-in early, then they will take our bag. The lobby is shockingly full of people trying to navigate the kiosk (all still interacting with the reception and greeter - so “not having one” is proven to be pointless) and also being “forced” into checking in early. 
At this point it feels more like the “machine not working” is more of a ploy to pull more dollars out of its guests. 

I pay and we go up to our room. It’s kinda neat, very “Fifth Element” feeling if you’re familiar with that movie. We literally just drop off the bag and head out. So when we came back after 12 hours of walking around New York to find the actual mess of a hotel room we booked things went south fast. 

Onto the list of things that made a long stream of “seriously” and “is this real life?” Come out of my mouth over the next 30 minutes…
- Absolutely unable to find light switches that worked, used the ones in the bathroom and small bed reading lights 
- Two adults could not navigate the shower to get it to come out of anything but the hand help piece 
- The shower leaked water EVERYWHERE, the bathroom floor was basically flooded and leaked over to the carpet. After this realization it was clear all the water damage in the room
- There was no body wash in the shower soap dispenser, and all the dispensers were a little crusty (big ew) 
- The toilet door is see-through (being here with a new partner, this was not the experience we were ready to share yet)
- There are no plugs remotely close to the bed 
- There are no plugs by the desk 
- The phone to call house keeping or their “mission control” never dialed or connected to any of the lines listed 

People partied in their rooms across the hall and next to us from 2 AM to 6 AM. Zero sleep was had and the phones never connected to anyone at the hotel, even when we tried calling the main number directly. 

I asked for and still have not gotten a copy of my receipt.
